評論內容: A Shout out to michelle" Megan, gina kidney transplant department"👍

Last place I would want to be treated if I was dying , DR NICK SMITH , refused to treat me because “ I looked like a conservative “ this is absolutely outrageous considering I never discussed any politics will at this hospital , this is absolutely wrong , if he was the only doctor available and I was dying I’m sure he would let me die !!! 0 out of 10 stars !! Make your hospital better than this or just shut it all down !

I didn’t feel the need to write a review until today. I didn’t realize what a great hospital it  was until I was forced to go to another hospital. My father was taken by ambulance to John Hopkins Bayview despite us asking for him to be transported to Orleans street for care. At the Orleans street hospital the nurses and doctors were constantly in the room explaining what was going on with my father’s care. My father is bedridden and needs to be cleaned regularly and repositioned regularly. He was always clean and never once got a sore or even any redness after his two week stay. The hospital allows for a family member to stay the night with the patient and even has a family room with a refrigerator, ice machine and vending. The nurses are so friendly and always willing to help. Fast forward to his stay at Bayview. The complete opposite. He sat 32 hours in the ER waiting to get a bed to be admitted. He has a terrible pressure wound and another wound on his inside thigh from them putting an adult diaper on too tight. The nurses are rude. Every morning this week he has been soiled through the pads, all the bed sheets and covers and his gown. I asked to speak to the charge nurse, she never came. His room is full of medical trash laying on the floor. No where for a family member to sleep. My father has called us in the middle of the night to tell us he is soaked and he’s been pushing the call button for an hour and no one is coming. We have called and no one answered or they answer and say they will have the nurse call and then never return the call. I can go on and on.
Thank you Hopkins Orleans for providing exceptional care to your patients   But don’t ever go to the Bayview campus!
Is there a way to give more than five stars ? This hospital deserves it! This is the absolute best hospital in the whole United States!

I stayed with my sister at the Hospital following neurological brain surgery.  I couldn’t have been more impressed with the staff at the Hospital.  They were attentive, caring and thorough.   As a “guest” of the patient they were helpful and friendly and made sure that we were both as comfortable as possible.  I would always recommend having an advocate stay with a patient, and yet with this team it didn’t feel quite as necessary as other experiences.

My wife had a fever at 2am and called the doctor on call at JH. His suggestion was to go to the emergency room. We arrived at Johns Hopkins at 3am and sat in the waiting room until 7:30am. It is now 1pm and she is being discharged with no treatment.

My wife and I just had our baby here 2 weeks ago and the staff was so awesome. She had some complications during her c section and Dr. Vaught walked in like a dang superhero. The nurses, especially Nurse Aubrey, was so kind she even stopped by to visit us even though we weren't on her shift. Excellent staff. Thank you all!

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. I was treated with respect from the moment I walked through the door. I needed surgery in the Neuro department and spent a little over a week in the hospital. Every single staff member was caring, kind, compassionate, and professional. From the doctors all the way down to the janitors. If I need hospital care in the future I will definitely be returning to Hopkins. Seriously, I can’t say enough about how incredible the employees were.

They call and say my dad needs to come up here and be admitted for the 2nd time -because they can't figure out the correct meds after a liver transplant- they called at 11am, we arrived at 4:30 (We are long distance from thus hospital) they dont have a room ready.....seriously?!?! 5 and a half hours and yall couldnt get a room ready knowing you had an admission???? And then when I said something about why we have already waited the better part of an hour the clerk at admissions wanna get smart out of his mouth "it takes as long as it takes". When you come in off the bridge connected to the garage, the ladies at the info desk just keep talking amongst themselves and blatantly ignoring people who need to check in. This hospital is supposed to be of the best- IT IS NOT. They claim they try to make it as easy as possible and I claim thats a complete lie.

We had a wonderful surgeon, Dr Yang. His entire staff was most supportive and professional. Indeed everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. My biggest criticism is the PARKING, a real nightmare. After driving hours to receive excellent care the last thing you want to face is “black hole of Calcutta “ parking garage.
Watch Netflix!!! Take care of Maya!! DONT VISIT THIS HOSPITAL IF YOU WANT TO SEE YOUR CHILD AGAIN!!!!

Very unprofessional and they fire you over stupid stuff and won’t even give you a second chance ( if employed ) nor give you a verbal counsel or anything they will automatically terminate you for one mistake or in my case a “training issue”. I do not recommend this hospital at all. You’re better off going to a different hospital than here!!!
The staff is rude and don’t know how to speak to people. Not only that I sat in a waiting room from 11-6 in the morning and wasn’t seen.

Saved my brothers life. Top notch medical center for cutting edge research and medicine.  Cannot say enough positive things about all your organization does to improve the life of all by also training expert world renowned physicians.
The worst place ever. Very toxic work environment.
Worst hospital ever worst dialysis clinic in the country

recently spent eight days at Johns Hopkins Hospital, and I can honestly say it was the most exceptional hospital experience I’ve ever had. From the moment I arrived until the day I was discharged, every single person I encountered—nurses, technicians, and all staff—treated me with the utmost respect, compassion, and professionalism.

What stood out the most was how attentive and caring the entire team was. They consistently checked in on me, explained everything thoroughly, and made sure I was comfortable and informed every step of the way. It didn’t matter what department they were from—every staff member carried the same positive energy and commitment to patient care.

I’ve had experiences at other hospitals, including Meritus and Mercy, and there is truly no comparison. Johns Hopkins goes above and beyond. They set the gold standard in healthcare, and I would highly recommend them to anyone in need of serious medical care.

Great Motility specialist. Great nurses. Very unsafe and crowded ERs. Doctors do not listen to patients. Be wary of dog whistle words and possible bias. Bring an advocate.

Make sure the staff reads all allergies. I was given a chemical burn/rash reaction in June’25 bc ED staff failed to do so.
This is a place where students injure patients and hospitals charge outrageous prices for treatments that make you sicker. Stay away from this place
ERRORS CAUSING HEALTH-RELATED HARM. Misdiagnosis, incorrect treatment, surgical errors. Negligent doctors!

Incompetent and Negligent care at MICU and NCCU. NEGLIGENCE DURING TREATMENT. LACK OF QUALITY CARE AND ATTENTION. GIVING UNNECESSARY MEDICATIONS. POORLY EXECUTED SURGICAL PROCEDURES. DENYING PATIENTS NECESSARY TREATMENT

I am complaining about the nurse supervisor on Myah 9 floor. I called concerned about a friend of mines that called me crying and complaining that he had not received dinner or breakfast. He also complained that he could not get anyone to give him a blanket. He told me that the nurse constantly threating him that she was going to call security. I was on the phone with him and I heard her myself. She was very rude and condescending. The hospital is known for being very prestigious around the world and they definitely don't need staff like that to make people think otherwise. I will definitely be writing a complaint to the president of the hospital.

Recently I was in the emergency room with my son dealing with Crohn’s disease pain for 8 hours, they told me they were waiting to put him in a room and around 10 pm they called him in just to leave him in the hallway. In that same hallway I saw that they had room’s available still leaving my son in pain in a hallway like nothing. I then still waited 3 more hours in that hallway with my son with no one paying attention or even glancing his way to help in till I started complaining to the staff that they then wanted to show interest in him for just a bit then 6 more hours in the same hallway they send him home without sending his pain medication to our pharmacy just letting him leave in pain. Overall the worst experience I had!

Years ago I saw a doctor at John Hopkins.  He was rude and arrogant, but he also didn't get the diagnosis correct. This happens and he was a sample of 1.  Doctor's are human - medicine isn't perfect, and so I didn't hold it against the hospital.  About 4-5 years ago, I went to a different department.  Over the doctor's objection, the scheduler's sent me to Bayview, which cost significantly more and delayed the procedure.  They did not inform me of the extra time or cost.  My doctor even asked why I went to Bayview when she saw me.

When I challenged the extra cost and explained that my doctor wanted me to go to Howard county, which would have been cheaper and faster, they refused to take the "facility fee" off my bill.  I had an attorney argue the case for me and finally the bill appeared to be settled to my satisfaction.  Four years later (today), they sent me to collections.  Even now, if I go to JHU's billing, I don't see the offending fee and my bill looks zero'd out as it has for the last four years.  I don't know if they are incompetent or malicious.

For me the critical thing is that they delayed my care over my doctor's order and then attempted to charge me more for their role in the delay in providing me treatment.  The fact that they appear to have sent me to collections 4 years later for a zero balance bill is just the icing on the cake.

Edit: I have called this number three times.  I end up in a voicemail box that is not set up.  I've called what I thought was the main patient relations number and they informed me that there is no way to talk to patient relations for the entire John Hopkins network unless you go through the individual Bayview patient relations first.  So, because Bayview patient relations doesn't have a voicemail box, you can't get to anyone higher up that has any authority to fix these issues.  Very convenient.
I am very impressed with the people I encountered today at the hospital Everyone is polite and willing to help. Thank you!
Awesome so cool 😎 thank you for sharing and caring

I’m pregnant and told them there’s a possibility that I’m having a miscarriage. They had me in the emergency room for hours. I went to the 8th floor where the pregnant woman go and they denied me. I went to my gynecologist on the 6th floor and they denied me again. They said no walk-ins. I asked the lady at the desk if I can get prenatal care, and she gave me a card in my hand instead of making me an appointment. I’m sitting here crying.

They have the best Maternity and postpartum services. The staff is very nice with a good smile on their face. They will answer all your questions and the Nurses are too kind. We have delivered baby here and we are v satisfied with the hospitality, housekeeping, staff behavior and administration. Specially nurse Tia ( I hope I wrote her name right). 99% postpartum staff is excellent

Today was my first time in this hospital. My friends just had a baby girl and I was in a panic when I parked because I knew it would be a maze.  I walk it and I’m immediately greeted and given directions to the gift shop and Bloomberg. On the way, with my map in hand, I get lost. I was lost for 30 seconds before Paula asked me if I needed assistance. Paula walked me To the gift shop. The first one was closed so we walked To the other gift shop. I have anxiety issues and really didn’t need to be lost today.  To say I was grateful is an understatement. She explained that she was a doctor In the kids ER and she was on her break and needed to walk.  For her to walk me to where I needed to go…I’m forever grateful. I give 100% At work and it’s nice to see that John Hopkins’ employees do same. The security guard in Zayed prior to getting to the rooms.. she was kind and wonderful as well. 10/10 experience.
Liver Transplant Medication.

John hopkins is a horrible hospital.  I will never go back here to Do Anything... Theyre all about money and not actually helping paitents.. imgaine losing your job right after a procedure  and trying to get financial assistance only to be told you can't get help because your taking care of yourself?! All the while they send the bill to collections while your in the process of get the financial assistance.. Nothing in life is guaranteed but John hopkins Financial assistance is a SCAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sadly I've had to be here to visit many times, but not sadly because of the hospital though that's for sure. Their staff is so tactful and kind its unreal. They are good at handling sensitive experiences and seem to love involving family with their treatment. The nurses and doctors offer their compassion when they can and will go out of their way for you whenever possible. Understand that sometimes they have a lot to deal with at the time and physically can't do everything for you at the drop of a hat but they sure try and whenever they have an opportunity they are sure to make sure you are being cared for. Thank-you for everything you do.

I would like to sincerely thank Dr. Emily Li, our Anesthesiologist, and the entire Oculoplastic Surgery and Nursing Team at Johns Hopkins Hospital for the exceptional care they provided during my father's eyelid surgery.

From the surgery preparation to post-operative recovery, every member of the team demonstrated outstanding professionalism, compassion, and attention to detail.

Special thanks to our anesthesiologist, whose care and reassurance brought great peace of mind during a very sensitive time for our family.

We are deeply grateful for the expertise and kindness shown throughout this experience.

Thank you for your incredible work and dedication!

I loved this hospital back in 2006 , my son was a patient here and passed , they treated him very good. Now here it is 2025 i come here for prenatal care,/ delivered my son here by c-section. OB team is great loved them all they did great by me . But my over all experience with some of the staff mainly dietary , which is a reason i will never come back nor recommend this hospital to anyone. The lady who answers the phone is very nasty and rude to patients who call to order their food like us patients need any type of negative attitude when we dealing and focusing on the health issues we got going on already. She’s mean for no reason and to have someone like that representing your dietary team speaks a lot about the hospital it self . I was known as Mrs pittman when i use to come here with my son Rashad Pittman before he passed. I will never come back here after my son is well enough to go home. Let’s talk about postpartum unit 8th floor. I was treated horribly, i had a c- section done and gotten staples, you talking about pain, when i bath no one helped me dry my feet or put socks on, it hurt me so bad to try and bend over i had to moan and groan and cry while doing it, i had to change my own bed , they never changed my linen i had to call for sheets to change my own. my trash and linen bin was full. I complained to the nurses to everyone to the point they actually got a attitude with me because i was not letting their neglect slide. I was not getting my pressure meds when i was supposed to be getting them , they would skip a day at times. I praised this hospital to everyone, i was so happy to be at the hospital who took great care of my 1 year old son , i am so embarrassed to praise them and having to walk out in pain because i couldn’t take no more, i didn’t sign myself out i just called my fiancé and said i had enough, i was in tears in pain and they didn’t care all they wanted from me was the key that gets me on to other units smh never again. Nicu is alright with me ,

We are from Knoxville, TN and my wife had a stroke 2 years ago.  We came to Johns Hopkins last year for my wife to receive Non-Invasive Brain Stimulation (NIBS) from the Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R) center at Johns Hopkins.  The therapy worked well so we decided to come back this year.  Tomorrow is our last day of therapy.  We have been living in a hotel for the last three weeks.  Although it is very difficult to be away from home, our two visits to Johns Hopkins have been amazing!  First, I would like to recognize the ladies at the front desk when you check in.  They are always helpful and cheerful.  Millie, who does all the NIBS scheduling, is always there to help.  Next is Dr. Chao and Dr. Krasna.  They really care about my wife's condition and are always trying to help.  Last is the therapy staff.  They are amazing!! Daniel, Aara, Meredith, Nicole, Kristian, Erin, Leyna, Jacqueline, Megan, Elena and all the others who work in PM&R.  They are top notch!  Although it has been a difficult 2 years, Johns Hopkins will have a special place in our hearts.

Roland (Debbie's Husband)

don’t go here unless u want to wait hours for results on an xray. my friend has been admitted into the hospital after a fall which resulted in two broken fingers and every time there were any sort of update on the next steps, we would have to wait hours for a doctor to speak to us. we were admitted at 2ish in the morning, and it’s currently 8:44 am as i am writing this review.

Where to begin. From nurses and doctors having bad attitudes, being unfriendly, and telling you one thing then doing something completely different. Laziness.Nurses found it impossible to get medications on time or within a reasonable time. Not listening to my concerns. I was moved to 3 different rooms within the same unit. 2 rooms I did not have a bedside phone making food orders difficult as well as outside calls. One room was cockroach infested putting myself and my personal properties at risk. As well as the nurses refusing to enter my room due to fear of insects. Causing me to miss doses of medication all together or receiving medication as much as 1.5 hours late. I strongly recommend calling for medication early in attempt to receive it anywhere close to on time. Ask the cafe to read back your meal orders to have a better chance of accurately receiving what you ordered. I also strongly suggest taking notes including staff members names, detailed descriptions of interactions, and times and dates. I would not waste your time talking to senior patient experience representatives as they are rude and seem unbothered about patient concerns. While I was hospitalized I witnessed 3 separate patients leave against doctor's orders due to the disrespect and treatment from hospital staff. If possible do not come to john hopkins. Try Union Memorial or GBMC who both in my experience deserve a 5/5 for exceptionally friendly to patients. To be willing to listen and go above and beyond to make you comfortable and do there job properly. Also the hygiene and cleanliness of john hopkins is poor at best. Good luck to anyone who has no choice but to come to john hopkins bay view hospital.

A simple procedure felt like torture because they found it fit to have students operate on me without my consent. Don’t bother filing a complaint , they’ll make a ton of excuses and still send you a thousand dollar bill

This is a hostage service. My daughter has been stuck in this ER for 10 hours when it should have taken 1, disengaged drain from post surgery.  2 blood samples, two "triages".  I've observed other patients with much worse,  sitting in pain for 12 hours +.   It's been like this over a decade.  Wait indefinitely for merely adequate care or seek service elsewhere and risk exacerbated results.  And if that's not insulting enough,  the bill.  There are smaller less notable hospitals running circles HCJHH that clearly signify this place is broken, except to its stockholders.

If I could give a negative score, I would! I went here for 2 different surgeries and the first one they did something without my permission and the second one they caused a infection that could've been fatal! Think twice before coming here!

I had a procedure done that had to have samples sent to John Hopkins. I was told I would have results in 7-10 business days. I had an appointment with my doctor scheduled to go over these results. Well, my results did not come in 7-10 business days, so I had to cancel and reschedule my appointment with my provider so that I’d be able to discuss the results. I finally got a hold of the right department at John Hopkins after being given three different numbers. One person said it would take 14 days. So, I waited the 14 days and still no results. I called again and now they are saying it takes 4-5 weeks! Three different time frames given by the SAME department. I took days off work for my appointments with my provider that all were wasted due to not having results when I was told I would have them. Every staff member I spoke to at John Hopkins was short, rude, and hostile with me. This has been a huge disruption to my life and I am very disappointed by the lack of professionalism, the conflicting information, and inconsistency.

I had a wonderful experience, I was hospitalized for days and everyone was so nice and explaining everything so well. The nurses and doctors took very good care of me and made sure I was comfortable all the way through
Good experience so far after open heart surgery. Impressed with the Intensive Care Unit. Wonderful and caring nurses.
Very long wait. Arrived at the hospital at 1 PM, was still waiting to be seen by a DR. At 3AM
I'm the 1000th comment lol
PLEASE SOMEONE SEND THE CLEAN UP TEAM IN THE CAFETERIA THE TABLES ARE A MESS!!! HOW CAN WE EAT AND THE TABLES HAVE NOT BEEN CLEANED AND ITS NO WIPES IN THE PURELL CONTAINERS !!!  2/2/25
Love the staff & security parking attendants are all awesome folks!

I wish I could give a negative score. This hospital is absolutely disgusting from the nurses to the doctors. You should all be ashamed of the care you provide your patients. Unethical to say the least.

My grandma is currently at this hospital for numerous reasons, she got discharged from a different hospital prior to coming here with everything still wrong. She keeps raving about how great this hospital is, she has seen about 10 doctors now each for different reasons. She has gotten significantly better in just two days after being diagnosed with bad heart failure. This hospital is amazing and I will forever recommend it and I can’t thank the staff enough.

My father had a procedure done by John’s Hopkins and now he has a severe infection that has gone to his bloodstream he has been in our local ER for 5 days and they will not get him back in there they got their big money for the surgery now it feels like they are ok with just letting him die. After calling patient services and getting no help I ask for someone else that might be able to help me I was hung up on so looks like no one cares at John Hopkins about their patients on the dollars.After clearly stating I did not get anywhere calling patient services means you will only get a canned statement so I guess I will go the attorney route I hate doing this it’s why our health insurance cost so much but they are leaving me no choice.

My daughter has been in the ER since 9am sitting with heart palpitations and light headedness. The time now is 11.40pm. You sucks. No one ask nor give her any medication 💊  with pain scale of 10 nor talk about food. You need your ass sued.
Everyone is very helpful and pleasant from security personnel to doctors.   Rooms are clean, food is okay and nurses are very attentative.
Full of patients in ER waiting room without care, too long for waiting, we waiting for all night but nobody care about you

My loved one is currently in the ER and has been there for over 28 hours without seeing a doctor orbeing admitted. I very much understand triaging and that long waits are typical, but 28 hours is excessive to the extreme.  She was intially seen and they ran tests over 18 hours ago, but she's been waiting for a doctor to see her/review the results and either admit or discharge her ever since. In the meantime of those 18hrs, she was sent back to a waiting area. Just a short bit ago a nurse came out and said they'd forgotten entirely about my loved one and other patients and that they'd been about to clear them off the board! The fact that she still hasn't been seen by a doctor or admitted 18hrs after tests were drawn, and the staff FORGOT SHE WAS THERE is indicative of horrendous patient management. It's one thing to be busy, but it's another entirely to forget your patients are there and completely neglect their care.

Update. It took over 30 hours for her to been seen by a doctor.
These angels of mercy

From the ER to CCU
TOP NOTCH
Why would you charge an insurance company for three months for a treatment for a syndrome that your staff kept saying she was “faking” it. Do better.

Terrible ER staff while I was there. I came in for a head wound. Stayed for the Insulin treatment! All while my mother ended up dying thanks to the most cruel and soulless staff ever. Honestly I won’t shed a tear if these people end up going to prison. You lack any empathy and care. I couldn’t leave and check on my dying mother either. So for right now prepare for a massive lawsuit. For emotional distress you caused me.
Worst hospital ever. The nurse starting tickling my feet so weird . Never coming to this foul place again.

I went to this hospital January 2,2025 and I was there with my mother for 8 hours in those 8 hours there were no results the doctor didn’t do a scan that should have been done and because they didn’t do it my mother the next day went to a different hospital and she went into an emergency surgery because turn out her appendix was about to explode and could have exploded inside of her if you hadn't gone to another hospital so this hospital isn’t that trust worthy
My grandson and I went and they kept him calm and they are very nice.
Avoid at all costs. Used to be one of the best in the nation. It has gone way downhill.

this hospital is beyond disgusting and disappointing, the women doing triage and blood work were the only respectful and quick ones. on top of that the emergency waiting room smells like a mix of urine and cigarettes. the security are all extremely rude and disrespectful except maybe one or two. there was patients in the waiting room saying they’ve been waiting 10-15 hours which is BEYOND me. this hospital needs a lot of work and new staff that actually seem
to enjoy their jobs and not make people more miserable and sick than they already are. extremely disappointed.

went in for heart attack symptoms. night shift nurse and doctor had to be called over during a cardiovascular episode where my hands and jaw both locked up completely and the doctor made eye contact with me and walked away, before sending me back out to the waiting room immediately after for 6 hours to wait for my results, instead of monitoring me. wasn't a particularly busy night in their own words, they just suck at their jobs.

After four long and frustrating months of trying to secure an appointment for my son with Hopkins, I am compelled to express my extreme disappointment with the process and lack of communication.

Today, after speaking with a Concierge leader, I was informed that all the labs, patient charts, and medical records I submitted need to be translated into English. Why was this not communicated from the beginning? This critical information should have been made clear at the start of the process, not after months of back-and-forth.

To make matters worse, I was told that even if I provide the translated documents, it will take another 10 days to review them, followed by a six-month wait for an appointment. This is absolutely unacceptable, especially considering that my son is in pain and urgently needs medical attention.

What part of “my son is in pain” is not understood? At no point has there been any consideration for the patient’s suffering or urgency of care.

This experience has left me deeply disheartened and questioning the commitment of your institution to patient care. I urge you to reflect on this process and prioritize the needs of patients, especially those in pain, rather than subjecting families to unnecessary delays and poor communication.

Worst ever!! They need to clean house and bring new staff this includes the phone operators also, nurses and doctors who truly cares about there patients. How do you have people waiting in the ER for over 24 hours waiting on beds!!
What about Hippocratic Oath?!A solemn promise that doctors make to uphold the highest standards of care and integrity while serving their patients! I guess that went out the window. I'm only given a 1 star because it wouldn't allow me to post.

If I could give -0 I would people just don’t go there you better off staying home and die because just waiting you going to die anyway 4 hours with eye problem can’t see out my eye and still waiting I just left the whole hospital and staff needs a makeover with caring staff and compassionate workers  and not just ones that’s there for the money.
This hospital is the best ever. Dr Suskind is magnificent

Great doctors and nurses. I have been a patient at most hospitals in the City and the doctors at UCSF are by far the best, showing a genuine interest in your well-being. Highly recommend UCSF to anyone needing medical care.

Hopeless bureaucracy.    I am trying to schedule an appointment, and get transferred from department to department.   One department said they need more information, but did not even know what other information was needed, referring me back to my primary provider, who did not even know what this was about.   I have today already spoken to 4 people, and still am not at the right person.   The last call I was told to hold a moment, but then was transferred to someone's (I don't know who) voicemail.   I've had problems with them almost every time.  Much of my time and energy has been lost...to the detriment of my health and well being.   The whole customer service should be replaced by AI.   The heads of this thing should be fired and replaced by competent people.

They put me in a "hot room" and tried to cook me for 3 days knowing I was complaining of being drenched in sweat and overheated. They didnt order the proper imaging to be able to diagnose my injury.  They assigned me to the wrong department.  They didnt coordinate with the VA. They falsified my medical records in several clear instances.  They lied to me about what procedure I was being given.  They just used me to pad their wallets and provided no treatment for my injury.
Watch your loved one if admitted to the ICU ward. Do not leave your loved one alone with the drs. stay with them 24/7 especially if they are hospice classified

NEVER COME HERE FOR AN ER!
5 hours and had to leave eventually.
They are horrible. Dont go here if you are a women. Ucsf staff are horrible and wont care  about you they will send you away stating you have an ed or drug seeking.
They hung up on me twice after 'sending me to scheduling'

in the front office they were very rude especially that one bald asian guy he was really rude to my mom and he would be throw my moms stuff back and it seems that he doesn’t even like his job he's very rude

I visited the UCSF Neurology department in early 2024 and they ran every conceivable test possible for the next 8 months with ‘No Diagnosis’. They did find that I had heavy metal poisoning after making me take 3 separate test and ignoring, and not believing the results, without providing the suggested treatment. I even had to get an “out of network” Provider just to see their Movement Disorder Clinic as they wouldn’t refer me internally, again with no diagnosis given. There was an 8 month waiting list for an appointment and I could no longer afford the private, expensive health insurance so I never got to see them. Now after 1 1-2 years later and not caring about me, UCSF reported the heavy metal poisoning to “The Governor’s Office” who sent a local Detective to my home!!! I told them the poisoning came from long-term exposure from a rental house we were in and had been abandoned for years and was heavily sprayed with rat poison and had mold covered up by the cheap renovation, and they DID NOT BELIEVE ME! So UCSF made tens of thousands on tests, their #1 Neurology dept couldn’t give me a diagnosis, and there is no improvement in my health.
I was here for neurosurgery last week. In recovery nurses are great. Appreciate it.
Devaki Patel has demonstrated a lack of professionalism and competence.

I have went here for a couple years now to only be strung along by one of their neurologists. UCSF are OBSESSED with Lumbar punctures and think it's the answer to EVERYTHING. They refuse to tell you what they're testing for and the tests get more painful/invasive/expensive everytime. I have not been given an answer other than, "FND functional neurological disorder" and that he refuses to treat it until I do more and more tests for a POTENTIAL neurological problem.

This center will do nothing but waste your time, energy, and money. Do not take your loved ones here. UCSF is NOT what it used to be. They do not take your medical issues into accountance and will continue to do the testing that suits them. We are humans, not guinea pigs. When someone states and has medical proof they can't be shocked. That's means THEY CANT BE SHOCKED. No dose not mean, "no" at UCSF it means, "wait till the patient is ready to say yes to whatever we want"

Thanks to UCSF neurology and Dr Pierre Martin I no longer trust ANY doctors  and I'm not even 30. Please stay away from him and all UCSF doctors if you or your family ACTUALLY want help.

First time coming here for endoscopy. Waiting an hour an 20 minutes to be called in. Absolutely unacceptable. I usually go to PAMP in Palo Alto for this type of procedure. Never waited more than 10 minutes. I'd heard so much good things about UCSF and wanted to give it a try. Never again
Waited 6 hours in the ER with my friend and was still told the hospital was backed up and so was the ER, went to the nearby St Mary branch instead. Disappointing
everyone on the 10th floor is amazing took care of my grandpa amazingly ,staff is so friendly and caring best care  I have ever seen
Good care which speaks to the patient rather than arbitarily administering care.

This hospital was pivotal in saving my ability to walk and was amazing with the care and understanding I was allowed.  Being a visitor on vacation that became paralyzed from the shoulders down on my vacation was very intimidating.
The nurses and doctors were very helpful in teaching me how to walk again and educating me about my condition.
I truly believe my paralysis would have been permanent if it had happened at home in Kansas.
The longest waiting time I've ever experienced 😪. 5 plus hours in the er waiting room.crazy slow

My family is very grateful and thankful with the entire Liver Transplant team at UCSF. Brother Jose Jauregui [receiver) sister Margarita Jauregui [doner] had major liver transplant on April 12, 2024 and the Dr's and entire team did an amazing Job. Dr. Robert's (husband and wife both performed the surgery along with Dr. Cortes and other drs). Unbelievable, just one day after surgery, they are both up and walking. In ICU floor 13, they were under the care of amazing nurses. One, in particular that we are amazed with was Alexandra Adel, she is very dedicated and attentive. Her love and care makes every patients stay in ICU less painful and difficult. Want everyone to know that we notice and appreciate everything you guys have done for our family. God is great and Miracles do happen. This was his 2nd liver transplant for my brother. 1st one was 18 yrs ago. Thank you UCSF 🙏 they are expected to be here for 2 to 3 weeks. I feel at ease, since I know they will be in great hands.

UPDATE... Brother pasted away weeks after being released from UCSF.. 😢😢😢😢💔💔💔💔 advised to anyone getting transplants: please stay there as long as possible. He was told he was going to be there for 2 weeks and was dismissed 5 days after surgery.
Julie Aguillar is a wonderful nurse,  attentive, knowledgeable,  kind, patient,  through, attentive, and just darn good!!!! 1000 stars!!!

Waiting three hours to be admitted is ridiculous.
Wood not recommend having surgery here

I had a billing issue after being double charged. I was told I have an outstanding deductible and liable in a very rude tone and the patient representative disconnected me so I wasn't even able to fill out the survey around the services or lack there of they provided

My mother was admitted for over a week and her bathroom was hardly cleaned. Light bulbs blew out and requested the nurse to speak to facilities - it never happened. My mom was at fall risk and although her room was right across the nurse’s desk it took over 10 mins for someone to assist her to the bathroom she almost pissed herself!

Once she was discharged I reviewed her AVS and we were unable to locate her oncologist information. Called the general hospital phone number and was greeted by a rude lady on the phone. How could we possibly remember all the doctor’s name?! After leaving a voicemail I did not receive a call back until 4 days later which my mom was already admitted back into Stanford Hospital.

Radiation wait time was over an hour of our scheduled appointment.
UCSF Killed my father through a botched medical procedure.

They sent me home with a needle in my arm and still taped tightly.
I wish I could send a picture.

They drugged my dad and pushed him in to comfort care and tried to make him die alone I got lucky I caught him in time before he left. Drs would sneak in to the room and talk to my dad to convince him while he was wasn't fully aware of what is going on. My dad wanted comfort care the next day with his sister and his dog and me and brother. Instead they ambushed him and forced it suddenly. They did not respect my dad's wishes and now I'm gonna go the rest of my life wondering what he would have said to us on his last day that they stole from us.
Great neuro oncology department and infusion center.

Had an unexpected visit to the UCSF ER on Halloween night. You can imagine how busy it was. But everyone was organized cool calm collected and focused. It is easy to see why this is one of the best medical schools and hospitals in the country.  Thank you to everyone who took great care of me especially on floor six including Garry.  Victoria.  Roselle. Virginia.  Emily. Their caring service dedication and commitment is really truly unmatched. I felt safe and secure in best of hands.  This is where I would always send any family member.
Sloppy entrance security. Staff is not doing their job well.
Stands out from the competition.

9:15 Saturday September 14th, 2025.nurse Katya and Dr Christine made us feel so calm and seen. From the time we got here till discharge. This dynomite team( including supporting staff)  were absolutely amazing. Can’t say enough about Brookhaven
My strongest recommendation.

I wanted to extend my personal thanks and gratitude to all the staff at E. 68th Street location for the thorough and diligent care which you provided my late father over the years. You all helped him live longer than expected, through your thorough treatment and care for him.

Your staff supported my mother with timely information throughout his health crisis’ and you did everything you could to extend his life.

Your staff were always respectful when I would telephone to check in on him and I appreciate that very much.

You have a good organization and you are highly recommended as far as I’m concerned.

The front door security is ridiculous. Have a phone a card and a key in pocket. Asked me to take out everything and go through the machine twice. Then what’s the purpose of using that fancy looking machine? The line is super long and the staff don’t care!

Honestly, speaking about this hospital I try to apply here for over five maybe six years and yet I still haven’t got called back for it and I meet the qualifications for this job and I have my experience in Westchester County for me. I feel like these hospitals are very racist on who they hire or either that or they just very lazy and just hire anybody at like a lottery ticket That hospital was just disgusting. This has go to be the Best Hospital in the City it’s number one the Staff are great people and thier bedside manners are very professional and excellent The Nurses and Doctorscare very compassionate people they have the best interest in their patients only May G-d Bless them all
Absolutely terrible hospital, if I could give 0 stars I would.

I visited the hospital last Wed (August 27) for my cousin who transplant kidney. I stopped to get a pass at the information counter. a lady name did not look up and keep talking with cellphone. I gave my driver license as a ID and had waited over 5 Min fr. I thought hospital security system was so slow. I asked how long do I have to wait... then she told me "sorry" for delay. She was on the cell phone and forgot I was waiting. Then she gave me a pass to visit.
It is not good manners for private talking using with cell phone front of visitor who are standing and waiting

I'm beyond astonished and hopefully be able through film and or writing express my extraordinary experience.  Healing angels exist here or the chosen for the healing of others however you my relate to it but super high energy

My sister was taken to the ER by ambulance sent by her doctor.  She was convulsing, none of the doctors knew what had happened to her even though her doctors had given everything to the ambulance. She was told by one doctor that she would be observed for up to 16 hrs.  She was released at 1aM in the morning even though she was still convulsing. The aids were atrocious, the evening nurse has just as bad.  When she was release she was told she could drive home. They would not help her call an uber.

Was taken to the ER on August 20th with severe convulsions which I was told were spasms reaction to the meds my Dr administered at his office. My Dr called the ambulance. They came and I asked to go to Lenox Hill Hospital but I was taken to this poor excuse of a hospital. I was seen by several drs and was asked each time what was wrong with me.  I could hardly talk because my body would not stop convulsing. The original Dr that saw me told me that I was probably having a reaction to the injections that my neurologist gave me st his office. He stated that I needed to be observed for 4-18 hrs. I arrived at the hospital at approximately 3:30 pm. They refused to help me up go to the bathroom. My sister arrived and she stayed until around 10:40. When she left she was assured that I would stay overnight. Fast forward to 1 am. Another Dr came in and told me that I was being discharged because they could not find anything wrong me. I was still experiencing symptoms and had horrible nausea and a horrible migraine. I had to dress myself and they wouldn’t help me to get a ride. Since I was still experiencing spasms, I was unable to put my shoes on because they were heels. It was raining out and had to walk out barefoot and transport put me in a cab   I cannot believe that these horrible people call themselves drs. And in the condition I was in the Dr told me that I could drive myself home if I chose to do so.   This was the absolute worst experience of my life. I don’t believe that an abandoned animal would be treated in this manner. Shame on this establishment. There is so much more id like to say but hopefully people get my drift. God watch over anyone that has to go to this horrible place.
My brother was there, and he was treated very well. Medical staff did excellent work on his last days on this earth 🫡🙏I would like to thank you, Presbyterian Hospital.

My name is Vincenia H. I was a patient of this hospital back in early July and they saved my life. Even though I wasn't the best patient to deal with I would like to thank you for saving my life when I was transported from another hospital who was equipped to handle my situation.  I'm truly grateful for the staff and would recommend this hospital to anyone who has a life threatening situation cause these people get the job done.😊 Thank you and God Bless.

Leslie Kaufman was the most excellent doctor I’ve ever seen. She was phenomenal she had the best energy and was attentive. I felt so confident and comfortable with her despite the circumstances. I genuinely couldn’t thank her enough.

My father was critically ill, staff skilled doctor was so experience & satisfy you till all your question left empty.
Nurses & medical staff fully trained & clean and do all job as work-ship in this hospital.

Fabulous hospital recommend for all who needed.

Over 3 hours event for a doctor’s appointment is way too long, went w my father to see specialist for rem arthritis, it was recommended from another doctor as the best hospital, waiting for Xray took 1 hour alone, unacceptable, think twice before you go unless u have a whole day for an appointment

I was humiliated and threatened with security at Weill Cornell’s 8 North unit on Sunday, 07/06/2025 at 6:30 p.m. after using the restroom in my elderly father’s hospital room. I did not know that family members are not allowed to use the patient’s restroom. A nurse named Michelle (not assigned to my father) barged in without knocking and loudly scolded me while I was still on the toilet. I apologized immediately and explained I didn’t know—but instead of handling it privately, she stood there and continued yelling while I was in an extremely vulnerable position.

Honestly, I don’t have the talent to stay calm when someone opens the door while I’m sitting on a toilet and starts reprimanding me for something that clearly could have waited. When I raised this concern, the charge nurse on duty, Amy, responded, “What did you expect the nurse to do?” Wow. That’s not someone I would ever trust to lead a unit, let alone care for a loved one. Absolutely unacceptable.

They say they can call security if a patient’s family member gets loud—but who do we call when the nurse and charge nurse are the ones being loud, inappropriate, and lacking basic empathy?

This kind of treatment reflects a bigger problem. It’s no wonder others have shared similar experiences in their reviews. A hospital’s reputation should be earned by how it treats people—not just its ranking.

Went in to the ER and was treated beyond good. The doctors listened to everything I said, they constantly came to check up on me and the nurses were even greater.my wait wasn't long. I'm changing over to this hospital for everything. Being treated like an actual human being

I came here for pregnancy related matters and honestly the doctors, nurses, and reception staff were all wonderful! They gave me extra cookies when I was hungry, and covered me with blankets when I was cold. Would recommend!

Went to the ER because I had been feeling extreme fatigue, dizziness, nausea, and loss of appetite for over a month that had gotten worse (I lost 10 lbs). Although I have easy and visible veins, they missed and dripped blood all over me. After about 5 hours, they said my labs came back normal and that they were sending me home, even though something was clearly wrong with me. They didn’t even put me on an IV (which is one of the first things doctors do with fatigue). Luckily, I was able to go to my parents’ in Florida and got actual help from doctors there. Don’t go here unless you know what’s wrong with you, because they won’t figure it out either.

Came in with a family member. One week of illness. One day vomiting and black stool. 6 days of Nausea  and dizziness, chills,hot flashes and pain in side.  Couldn’t go to work. Dr says probably a virus.-maybe there’s a hemroid and she could check that.  I insisted on an mri but she would only consent to a cat scan and they came to give an x ray for procedural purposes.  I said no to the c ray and cat. Both are useless. The mri would show blood vessels in his side and organs. Leaving with fluids given and trying to get them to take a stool sample for analysis.  This is the second time I felt like the place has become mediocre.  Years here with my elderly parents I’ve never had complaints.  The one before this the same family member had a bacteria gone sepsis. They treated it but couldn’t identify the bacteria.  Never heard of this kind of thing.  How can you not take a sample and identify the bacteria.  Northshore has been slipping under too. Now I have to find a new hospital for my family.  I drive 2 hours for crappy care.
Rude and unprofessional security! Do they really think I come to the hospital for leisure and fun??

My 5-month old daughter was injured by the EEG technician, Junqi Zheng, and my MIL and I were verbally abused by her. Attached is a photo of the 0.5” scab on my daughter’s head where Junqi (the technician) scraped my daughter’s head so hard prior to placing the electrodes.

This is not the first time a complaint has been made about Junqi so I am frustrated that my family’s pain could have been avoided as it sounded like she should have been fired a long time ago. The fact that she knew nothing was going to be done about her poor performance is why I am writing this. I hope that no other family will be hurt by Junqi. She even said to me “go ahead, report me, here’s my ID. The camera isn’t on” (i.e the interaction wasn’t recorded so she knew she was safe). She is a drag on her team, patients and the Cornell network, and needs to be fired.

From the moment she walked in, she had a bad attitude. For example, she ROLLED HER EYES when I asked her two questions:
(1) how long the procedure would take, and
(2) whether she had to tie my baby’s hair in buns bc she was pulling so tight that it made her cry

At times, she was PURPOSELY HURTING my child. Junqi used a wooden Q-tip to separate my baby’s hair into sections and was scraping her scalp so hard with the wooden end that my baby was crying. She COULD HAVE USED THE SOFT COTTON SIDE to separate her hair into sections. She didn’t even have that much hair!

In addition, I asked her if we can use water instead of the suction to keep the tape on (the suction was making my baby cry even more) and she said “have you done this before” and I said “well we did a 1 hour EEG here at Cornell and they used water so was just wondering.” She ROLLED HER EYES and said “THAT WAS A DIFFERENT LOCATION.” Please note she COULD’VE SIMPLY LOWERED THE SUCTION LEVEL. The second technician did exactly that and explained that there are different suction levels. Why would you use the same suction level for an adult on a baby?!

When I asked for break because my baby was freaking out due to the pain caused by Junqi, leading my baby to scratch her face so hard it was bleeding, Junqi said “why are you here” and I said “well because she’s been having spasms”. Her response was “you can refuse EEG. You’re hurting baby”. I told her that I didn’t want to be there and wished my daughter was happy and healthy but that she was having spasms and she kept repeating “you can refuse EEG.” She thought this procedure was unnecessary, which is absurd and not her decision. And if anything, SHE had already hurt my baby creating a wound on my baby’s scalp.

This was the last straw and I told her if she was having a bad day, she should not take it out on her patients and that she didn’t have to be there. Her response was “ok it’s better for me to leave.”

Not only was my daughter injured, but Junqi wasted my time (I had to take off work to go to the EEG with my daughter) and many medical professionals time (from the NP to the nurses to the management team), her team’s time as her team member had to cover her patient, and 4 hours of my life as she did not complete the procedure and I had to wait that long for a new technician.

No actions were taken against this woman who hurt my child, no apology from her, and it is unclear whether she was provided training after this incident (i.e. use different suction levels based on patient’s age, don’t use a sharp wooden stick to separate a patients hair - use the soft side, don’t roll your eyes at patients, etc.)

I went to the hospital tonight. Was very bad stomach pains? A man came to try to draw my blood. He couldn't, because my veins is hard to find. So what did he do he? Left him with somebody else instead doing. What are you supposed to do for me? He went to somebody else. Never came back to see if I was okay. None of that so I got up and I left

Great doctor always take care and put 100% of her knowledge to help my daughter to feel better

While my brother went to get the car. I never had such a terrible scary experience. Never again. Disappointed 😞

No this hospital my family trusted for years .My mother went in got diagnosed with the flu and was overdosed by a nurse with her pain meds and this lead to my mother's passing 😢 bye the way they allowed the nurse to continue her care after the incident. I recently accompanied a client to Cornell, where I had the opportunity to observe the exceptional care provided by the staff. As a caregiver who frequently visits various hospitals, I was particularly impressed by the professionalism and warmth displayed by the team. My client was very pleased with the experience, and I would like to commend Ms. Antoinette in particular for her informative guidance on wound management. My wife was recently admitted in NYP for car-t cell transplant, and had an exceptional experience from start to finish. The facility was clean, well-organized, and efficient. The reception staff was friendly and made the check-in process seamless.

Her doctors were not only knowledgeable but also took the time to thoroughly explain my condition and treatment options. The nursing staff was incredibly kind, attentive, and made sure I was comfortable throughout my stay. I truly appreciated their patience and professionalism.
Oncologist Dr Mejia is an outstanding physician.

The hospital also maintained excellent hygiene and safety protocols, which made me feel secure during my visit. Overall, I’m extremely grateful for the outstanding care I received and would highly recommend NYP to anyone in need of medical attention.

This review is about the security process for visitors  .. it’s ridiculous for such a big hospital. A place with very good care from a range of medical services. No one wants to be in a situation to need it, but they try to make the stay as comfortable as possible. Special shout out to the team on 10-Central and 10-West for their wonderful care.

Building is comfortable.

Absolutely hate the 11th floor South team they are very inconsistent and inconsiderate.. they nurses in this unit are mediocre and they seemed as if they just went to school to collect a pay check and dont serve any definite purpose in this field . They lack the compassion and empathy it takes to complete this role & they treat your loved one and you as if you guys dont have a chance and its the end of the road . Marguerite Koch especially show a lack of care and attention to detail and comfort in my mothers state . On top of not getting the attention and level of care we deserve they continuously try and discharge and push my mother out to a different facility.. i wish i knew where to file a complaint and make my voice heard against this entire hospital. I hate them . And i honestly hate the people that work there . I pray when Marguerite parent is dying & fighting for their life that someone does them worse than what they did me and that by some grace of god that im there able to witness and watch the sadness and heartbreak in her eyes and look her in her face and show no remorse towards her situation no matter how bad her parent life is being affected .
Rude operator hung up on someone  when i had hard time speaking

Review for the Psychiatric E.R. It is important to know that this is nothing more than a holding cell. They can hold your loved one here against their will, or the requests of the family - for as long as they want. We brought a friend suffering from depression and they held him for 3 nights.  He voluntarily checked in and was stable/sane the entire time. They offered ZERO therapy or psychiatric services except offering benzos for panic attacks. The cost for holding our friend against his will for 3 days was nearly $20,000. The entire time we were begging to
have him released and Dr Benudis said she will release him when she feels like it. They never discussed a plan of discharge or would give us any metric on what it would take to to have him discharged until the last day. Their job is to lock up the patient as long as possible and extract as much money as possible while
providing no medical services. It’s a JAIL CELL. A horrible facility and truly terrible doctors I wouldn't wish this experience on my worst enemy. DR. Abigail Benudis was particularly terrible. One of the meanest and dismissive doctors I’ve ever spoken to. Incompetent and unavailable the entire time. Keep in mind they make the patient sign away their rights once they are admitted and we were LUCKY to get him out in 3 days. Most stay much longer or are transferred to the 3 week psych ward.

Dirtiest hospital EVER and that says alot considering ive had 23 Surgeries. Staff was too busy on their phones rather than find care for the patients at hand. Severely lacking in care and empathy. Waiting are was pushed an hour back more than once due to over booking or lapped schedules…
The ER is always overwhelmed.  They need to expand that ER drastically. That's why you get stuck in a hallway for hours and hours.

This place saves lives I can attest to that first hand . The ER is exceptional . Virtually no wait and they are very attentive. The oncology Dept. is a beast and will not dilly dally in regard to treatment and go full send  to combat the disease and get you relief. They are upfront and don’t pull punches. I fully recommend this hospital and like I stated before the E.R. Here  should represent the standard for all hospitals. I understand everyone’s experience is different due to different ailments but for the many times I have experienced their care they have been outstanding. If you are admitted the rooms and care provided by the staff is way above average compared to many other hospitals I have encountered. The only discrepancy I can say is the parking fees at the hospital valet. It is way over priced but they do give vouchers for admitted patients family for one vehicle while the person is admitted.

We had a midnight emergency (croup) when we first moved to the state. We took my 2 year old in to the ER, and they were so kind! They made her feel safe, our wait times were so short, and we were only in the building for 1.5hrs. They were also so understanding, and this is the first ER that took our medical history/medical allergies seriously. They were very very knowledgeable about our rare conditions as well which is something I’ve never seen in an ER setting! I was very impressed!
Very nice and much faster than other hospitals

ER service is horrible. We were admitted to the ER the night before. By 3:30am they were confident the patient needed to be admitted to the hospital for a room. But no beds. So it is now 6pm, still in the ER without a bed. Staff makes themselves incredibly sparse. At one point, the patient needed a vomit bag since he was admitted for vomitting yet none were given as stand-bys. I rushed to the desk where no one was there. A nurse came with her back turned to me, I had to ask “ma’am” three times before she turned. At this point, the patient was already projectile vomitting on the floor. They did clean it up though- by sopping it up with towels. No custodian mopping any time after. There was also a half full urine sample behind our bed from god knows who. Each doctor that comes every 5-6 hours or so says something different or treats us like brand new. No one addresses the bedside family, and prior to the projectile vomitting we hadn’t asked a thing from staff. The patient also has something highly contagious, but that isn’t stopping them from cramming the area bed to bed with patients. I hope the old couple sharing the curtained area with us is healthy enough to not be immunocompromised. Oh wait, they are old and currently in the ER. Horrible facilities, horrible staffing issues. I have seen staff sitting around on facebook messenger (the same nurse who couldn’t be bothered to be addressed until projectile vomitting was audible), as well as several staff members sitting and scrolling tiktok. I get that there is a ton of downtime between test results, but for god’s sake just make these people do their rounds and talk to their patients so that they don’t end up projectile vomitting all over the floor. Horrible, cynical place. You will go hours without anyone talking to you as the patient, never if you are at the bedside.
Trash hospital, I highly don't recommend

Medical staff are good buildings and signage are embarrassing bad looks run printed paper signs etc  also good luck actually getting to your appointment if you go into the  wrong entrance the staff won’t even know how to lead you

Being hospitalized in this hospital is being the worst experience of my life, for almost two weeks with prostatitis I have never been seen by a urologist, they removed the urinary catheter without an evaluation by the urologist of my prostate, so they had to drain my urine, the staff has no empathy with the pain... it was terrible, terrible, and to this day I still haven't seen the urologist even though I have an emergency with a urinary catheter, they postponed my appointment for next week. in September explain by this same way the horror that had been my days of hospitalization on the 7th floor of this place between September 7 and September 10 of the year and year

my complaint was attended by the lady Kelly McCabe but apparently she misinterpreted my discomforts, she in her report dated October 15 of the year in progress I put her on the way to what she calls pain management by the nurse involved, and it is the opposite even though I told her about it. repeatedly that the nurse that day did her job in the best way and managed the pain in the best way she could, my discomfort was with the 5 doctors who during that stay were in charge of my health, they decided to remove the urine catater without evaluating the prostate, having on my chart a CT abdomen an pelvis with contrast dated September 7 that said that my prostate was enlarged so it was evident that my prostate did not allow my urine to go down alone, in its report also sealla who refuses to take ibuprofen on September 9 obviously had to do it I have kidney failure 3A and that drug is contraindicated but the Drs did not sin that detail either, another point in their report says that it was I who said that I wanted to urinate without the totally false cater urine and proof of this was that all the nurses were asked to please place the permanent catarer urine and they told me that no that the Doctors specified that they were going to urinate without the cater urine and proof of it was that was that all the nurses asked to do not to urinate without the urine catering and that they were going to put it on the doctor's. I had to urinate by myself and after having a strong discussion with the Dr who was in charge was that I agreed to put back the urine catheter proof of this this my discussion with her that must be recorded by requesting an interpreter from Spanish to English, another important point and to finish the Drs who in the end are the ones who make the decisions withdrew the initial catarer without 1- evaluating and checking that the prostate was still inflamed which made it impossible for me to urinate for me. same and 2- had changed the antibiotic 3 times, that is, they were not even ready to see if the antibiotic was the one to verify whether or not they should remove the catheter in principle and then to the horror of the pain of removing the urine without wanting to put the urinary catheter back fixed as at the end I pass after me arguing with the Dr in charge that night I agree to put it back, and I repeat it was I who told her everything about it, then do not tell me about the nurses involved that they did their best work, my annoyance is with the origin of that horror that were the bad decisions of the medical staff that...

So, NYP responds, it's sorry my expectations weren't met.  If my review had been read by a Human Being and, NOT a COMPUTER responding to the ONE STAR, my written review would have been enough for NYP to know what the problem was and that its feedback department didn't need additional information. I left without making another appointment, but in extreme pain.  AVOID THIS PAIN PRACTICE LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!"

My experience with Doctor Ami P Vaidya, was a positive and great one. Very professional, explaining everything that needed to be done. Her staff would call and keep me updated on every step that needed to be taken care of. If I had  any questions they made sure I had answers to my questions. My 76 year old mother was just at this crap hospital. I'm not gonna get into detail about everything. Do not use this hospital. I beg you. The nurses are not professional and personally I think the doctors should not be practicing. There where so many things about why I feel this way. But I'm infuriated and I already reached out to a lawyer. That's how bad it is

This hospital and it's staff is extremely overrated especially the Surgery Department.

I sat in a patient room for over 2 hours. I went to the front desk to ask what is going on and was told that the doctor was called away for emergency surgery.

I came from NJ to see Dr. Afaneh. I asked to be reimbursed for my expenses and they refuse to reimburse me.

BEWARE!
My mother is currently admitted and is getting absolutely unacceptable care.

If your family or friends are not in the ICU and having delirium and are at risk of falling DO NOT go here. They do not listen to you or properly document incidents that occur. My mother had issues of climbing out of bed during the middle of the night then they refused to put a 1 on 1 with her or allow my father to stay over.

They only changed their attitude once we were RIGHT and she fell out of bed which is extremely dangerous.

In addition to this they forgot to put her medicine patch on TWICE after getting scans. Doctors who examined her were confused where it was it, this is a critical medication that they missed and allowed her not to have for 12+ hours.

We have been working with patient services and nothing is changing. The only part of the hospital that world class is the ICU.

I'll say the manager on the floor has stayed in close contact with us to ensure that after the third scan that her medicine is put back on correctly (which still should be standard care) and one of the day nurses Ahmed did all he was able to do for us.

Only other highlight was the day nurse Jessica on the 8th floor but the night nurses were not equipped support with someone like my mother and put that on my father who stayed over and wasn't even supposed to be there (they made an exception).

Wild to me that I have to continue to escalate to just get standard  care...
Worst experience! Had to wait more than 4 hours to see doctor

Poor staffing, poor empathy, no janitors, dirty rooms. Long time to get help once call bell is on. Would not recommend this place to my enemies! Not what I expected at all. Surgeons are good. Care after surgery is poor, mostly due to lack of staff! Please hire workers!!!!!
They wait time in the ER for an MRI is just out of control. Waiting for 15 hours and counting...

Update: My sister was hit by a car this past Friday and is pretty banged up. Her head hit the ground so hard it cracked her bicycle helmet!  The staff at this place didn't even have the common courtesy do a full body CT scan to check for internal injuries! They just scanned her head and one foot. They were supposed to keep her overnight for observation.  She was discharged and sent home after a few hours in the ER. Today, she discovered that her other foot is infected, the one that wasn't scanned. THIS IS WHY YOU CONDUCT A FULL BODY SCAN FOR COLLISION VICTIMS! You don't tell them that they have no internal injuries if you haven't properly checked for any! Crazy thing is that she requested that the ambulance not take her here.  Please be careful if you need to go here.
Read my prior review below. For further information.

This place is notorious for changing the rules as they go along.  Not to mention shady practices by its staff and the constant flow of misinformation. This is especially important if you are a person of color - and I speak from experience.  Please be vigilant if you are admitted here, and if by the grace of God you are allowed to have a visitor with you, make sure that they stay alert as well. Ask questions! Take the names of anyone who comes into contact with you or a loved one. Pay attention to your surroundings, and document everything!!!!

Went here for a seizure July 11th had a cat scan done which revealed that I had a brain infection and that it was what caused the seizure thanks to Dr Jensen with peds neurologist we saved me from almost dieing spent 5 weeks in the picu love them nurses and nurse assistant loved getting to meet y'all got medically cleared and moved to the 4th floor nurses there was nice helped me when I couldn't walk talk feed myself because of the seizure food service was great therapy was great I was told I would never walk again but thanks to ivy and sahra they got me back to standing and able to move my Left side great 4th floor nurses and doctors great ICU Crew if you have a kid who has seizures I recommend going here they are great at their job if you ever get to meet a nurse assistant called Kayla blonde hair she's nice she fed me like a little kid and I'm not a little kid I'm 17 but I'm glad that I was taken care of and told that it won't My fault I had to be there I will be back when I get my license to visit them because they deserve to know that they were there for me at my lowest and that thanks to them I'm alive and back to walking yh might have had to go to rehab in Greenville but All the work paid off.

This review is for the billing policies in the Breast Cancer Survivorship Program. The care I have received is excellent from Duke Hospital. I pay my co-pay, $80, and because the visit is made in a clinic at the hospital,  they bill me an additional $214. I feel this is above and beyond any billing expectations a person should receive.  There is not an option to go to another office that isn't in the hospital setting to avoid the added costs.  Unfortunately,  I will be seeking another Oncologist for my check-ups.

We took my daughter that was in a car wreck at 8 pm , it was 4 in the morning and she was not assigned a room . The personel were horrible and did not care for the people in the waiting room. It is very disappointing that we spend so much money I. This hospital thinking it is the best and it is the worse I have experienced in my life .

The only good part about visiting Duke is the man who works the grill station in the cafeteria. He truly enjoys his job, and it shows every single time I’ve been here. He greets everyone with a smile, keeps the energy positive, and cooks food to perfection. His attitude honestly makes a huge difference in an otherwise stressful environment.
