The trainee caused severe pain, and when I expressed discomfort, they ignored my distress and continued. The other staff member had to repeat the procedure, increasing my suffering.
Throughout the examination, both staff members engaged in casual conversation, treating me as if I were invisible. Their unprofessional behavior left me humiliated, disrespected, and emotionally distressed.
Food service does not care about sanitation they will sit your food on a full soil linen hamper and then expect you to eat it
Parking is atrocious! I have been sitting for nearly 10 minutes for valet parking as there are no spots in the garage.  There are about 12 cars ahead of me waiting for valet as well!

Hello-We consulted with the Cleveland Clinic regarding my Wife's chronic Lyme infection after searching for help locally in WV. After two rounds of doxycycline, we started thinking that we needed to look outside of the area. She received her first Lyme diagnoses from a rheumatologist along with a couple others on this visit including ankylosing spondylitis. She tested positive for Lyme and was prescribed two weeks of doxycycline. She continued to decline, saw many physicians, and was ultimately misdiagnosed with MS as well as fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome. This same neurologist who diagnosed her with MS later agreed that she did indeed have Lyme, and it had triggered her "MS" after a spinal tap, serology testing and MRI's that revealed Lyme and the Epstein Barr virus. We then decided to consult with the big guns in Ohio since now she had two diagnoses of Lyme and had tried two weeks of doxycycline but was still in rapid decline. We were being told if she was still having symptoms after two weeks of antibiotics, then it couldn't be Lyme. Growing desperate we called and spoke with a very nice lady at the Cleveland Clinic and were surprised to find out they would "treat" my Wife. I cannot tell you how excited we were to finally get some help with this terribly common, but seemingly invisible disease. We made the appointment with the infectious disease doctor Chris Kovacs Jr., drove to Cleveland, booked a room and tried to sleep anticipating that everything was finally going to "be OK". The next morning, we arrived for the appointment at 7:45 and were impressed with the Clinic's "Operation" until we got in front of their doctor Chris Kovacs Jr. who broke our hearts and wasted our time and money. After listening to her case for approximately five-six minutes, he informed us that "We don't have Lyme in WV and if she hadn't traveled to the northeast of the US then she hadn't been exposed to Lyme" as to which I replied, "I don't mean to be rude but, where do our dogs get it?" he then said that my Wife "definitely did NOT have Lyme" and suggested that maybe she needed more attention at home after asking my profession, which is sales. Chris Kovacs Jr. then refused any testing for Lyme or co-infections and we left his office in tears wondering what just happened. We traveled back to WV and by luck ran into someone whose Mother had Lyme but was misdiagnosed with ALS. She was treated by a local doctor and her "ALS" went into remission. I couldn't believe what I was hearing and we got in touch with that physician who is now semi-retired and after proper testing, she finally got a more appropriate treatment for Lyme. This brave doctor reported the positive serology results to the Kanawha County Health Department. Now she is "on file" as having positive Lyme serology results and we have received Lyme Brochures from the Health Department published by the CDC, Lyme book markers, and vinyl yard signs that read with the warning "Lyme lives here”. These were nice quality signs btw, if you are reading, please send more. I tacked ours up around the neighborhood. Apparently they track this sort of thing IF your doctor reports it through the proper non-insurance channels. She ended up getting treated with antibiotics including a PICC line with ceftriaxone. We are both very much still affected by Lyme today and if only our family physician had given my Wife $40-$50 dollars worth of antibiotics when she first presented, then maybe, just maybe I wouldn't be typing this at work right now. Any physician who denies Lyme can be a chronic infection should be ashamed of themselves for their lack of courage to help. They know the truth and Lyme needs to be given the credence that people deserve. It's a sad day when the insurance "front" tells you that "You don't have Lyme in WV". I'm surprised he didn't call it "Lymes". I would clearly give "0" stars if that was possible. Thank you for reading, I hope that this can help in some way as I've been meaning to write this for over a decade.

Don’t believe the hype! Very good ancillary services/support staff, less than effective and relatively average to low skilled physicians with way below average investigative skills and diagnosis acumen! For an institution that is supposed to be amongst the best in the country, and best in cardiac care for several years in a row, I was sorely disappointed. Either they are buying their rankings or the ranking publications are simply skipping over the EP section… Once you get past the bells and whistles, e.g. massive state of the heart facility, concierge like service for foreign patients, etc… you quickly realize that this hospital system is mostly like any other, except it does an incredible job at marketing both its past and current exceptional achievements. These achievements  are carried out by a very limited few. In other words exceptional/thorough docs are in short supply in this hospital, like in any other. They just do a great job of marketing and advertising the accomplishments of a very select few physicians, who are the exception and not the norm. Note, you will likely not have access to these exceptional physicians as they are in high demand. Instead You will be farmed out to much less proficient physicians who are no different than your average local specialist… I dealt with the cardiology department, specifically its electrophysiology section… The staff/ancillary medical team were awesome; however the Electrophysiologist I dealt with, was poorly organized, not thorough and contrary to what their cardiac appointment staff advertised, did not deal with highly complex arrhythmia diagnosis and curative treatment… His approach did not entail any in depth investigative processes, e.g. review of prior incident QRS morphology, review of clues provided by prior and current imagery, etc… He did exactly what the avg to below avg EPs I’ve seen so far, have all done: (1) Focused on the primary symptoms that suited his skill set and (2) ignored any acute symptoms that fell beyond his expertise, while heavily relying on the medications vs. investigating the root cause(s)… (3) failed to enlist the help of more experienced colleagues. He did not address the root causes of the disease regardless of its progression and instead preferred to settle on highly curated symptoms’ treatment, while hoping that acuity or worsening would not be immediate… This of course nearly ensures that down the line, once the disease process has worsened, I will be back for more acute and expansive services… What a revenue model… I strongly recommend that (A) you do extensive research and identify which physician(s) has the skillset that is required, to not just “treat” you but to actually cure you/find and tackle root cause(s) of your ailment before going to this hospital. And (B) ensure that this physician can actually see you/is available. (C) most important: Ensure that they are thorough, which is largely the exception. WHY? It takes time and work, for which they may not get a financial return. Otherwise, you are wasting your time and money. Just stick to your local specialist. Do not let the appointment staff randomly select a physician/specialist for you, based on availability. The physicians who have high availability generally tend to be the least effective/least thorough ones; hence their open schedules… Oh and their patient complaint process does not entail a conclusive resolution mechanism, as the clinical teams are not obliged to take corrective measures or communicate those measures to the patient… which leaves you wondering why come back to this hospital… Bottom line: Don’t believe the hype. Do your homework. If you are not getting satisfactory answers, e.g. booking agents tell you that “all EPs treat complex arrhythmias” and the one they suggest is really good, don’t believe them… Insist on the one whose name you found through research or who was recommended by another patient with ailments similar to yours and who’s received treatment here recently. If this is not a possibility, go somewhere else/don’t waste your time and money.
Having been to Johns Hopkins, Mayo, NYU, and the Cleveland Clinic, the Cleveland Clinic is far better than the others. My neurologist, brain surgeon, PAs, and nurses are incredible.

Well reading these reviews, it mirrors my experience. If I could leave a zero, I would. I fell for the thought this place was the best of the best. That I thought included quality care with good communication. I paid a premium price for trash services. Please do not waste your time, money or energy with this business. That is what it really is. Not a medical facility that actually cares about their patients.

I drove 4 hours for a procedure the doctor begged me to come back for because this is "the best", instead of getting this done locally. For the procedure, I was forgotten about twice, delaying this procedure over 2 hours and they even reset my locker code so I could not get my cloths to change and leave. The worker literally said, "Oh your still here? I thought you were long gone and reset the lockers". Once I got my cloths on, I came out to find my boyfriend in a dark waiting room; tv's were turned off (he had not idea where I was), all staff was gone and the janitor was cleaning the space. They closed that area down with not only a patient in the back, but a guest waiting with NO communication what's so ever. I did fill out their survey, hoping they'd reach back considering the situation. I have yet to get a response back from Cleveland about how they "forget about" patients.
I wish my experience ended there...it doesn't. Shortly after my first apt, I started a new medicine regiment this doctor prescribed. A couple days into this,  I received a very scary phone call from my pharmacy. He proceed to ask me how I was doing and specifically my heart/vascular system regarding the meds I was prescribed. Which was concerning as I am being seen for vascular issues causing GI issues post chemo treatment. I was given an anti-depressant that was suppose to "help my stomach muscles to stop over working" that has MAJOR side effects for vascular issues, including heart attacks. Which I was on the brink of going to the ER for chest pain. I have never had that kind of pain before. I also was informed that the "high cholesterol" meds he gave for helping bind food in my stomach do not play well together with the anti-depressant, causing further discomfort and issues to my GI system. The pharmacist was EXTREMELY confused and concerned what drugs I was prescribed and why I was given them. There are plenty of other options that could have been discussed prior to that combo (per pharmacists words). He then advised that I stop both meds right away and consultant a different medical professional.

Then to add more injury to insult, an MRA was ordered that ended up sharing exact opposite of what the doctor told me it would provide. Surprise surprise, it showed vascular problems, causing GI issues. The doctor then thought it was appropriate to send me a one line message on mychart. Completely ignoring these results went against what he previously said. I asked for a 5 minute phone chat right away as I can not get back into him in person till end of March to discuss meds and the results. I messaged Wednesday 2/26 morning and its now Monday 3/3 in the afternoon. No point of contact has been made besides some nurse Friday right before closing saying my message was received and the doctor would get back to me. I guess I am finally in line for a point of contact? There was no time frame or idea when any point of contact would be made. Wednesday 3/5 will be a week from my initial message. This doesn't even include any follow up on said meds are doing from initial apt over 2 weeks ago. Which is VERY concerning, considering what I learned from my pharmacist.
If I had that kind of fail/error/mess up/issue rate at my job, I would be FIRED! Why is is okay for these doctors to make choices on ones life with no consequences?!

Hospital is ran like a machine...albeit a well oiled one. Hospital fails in things that may fall outside of the purview of the machine's programming. For instance, a lot of the staff may seem attentive and responsive, but are prone to giving canned, rehearsed, or "safe" answers. Cleveland Clinic Hospitals seem to be turning more into a massive money churn, bed-turn philosophy recently which is sad because at its peak, (before they decided to buy up every failing hospital in the city) about a decade and a half ago, it was truly a great hospital. There's no other place I'd rather go to get heart surgery done (or a lot of other surgeries for that matter), but if you're dealing with something that they don't specialize in, or need a little bit more personalized care, I would look elsewhere.
Best treatment all the way around..caring and understanding.
The staff here is AMAZING. Everyone was super friendly and PROACTIVE. Dr. Wallace and her team are outstanding.

Except for the Neurosurgeon who saved my life, the Cleveland Clinic hospital is just for research. I was treated as a lab guinea pig! The Cleveland Clinic pays off the student loan debts for the clinical staff, after time of just "fair" or worst just poor & dismissive treatment of patients. Because I was often mistreated by physical therapists, nurses, or, doctors. Who acted like drones. [Cleveland Clinic has several campuses throughout Ohio. Pick one.]

The staff and Doctor Neka are amazing.  I was very happy with the result 😀.  I didn't have a appointment i walked in.  I did what for 5 hours but it clearly states that you my wait up to 8 hours..

I love Cleveland Clinic for listening, and thoroughness, when doctors in my local area wouldn't. It has always been worth the 3 hour drive when I need answers or a second opinion. Please never change

Homophobic people shouldn’t work at clinics.

I would not recommend Dr. Truong to anyone nor would I recommend Cleveland Clinic.  Her delay in care caused direct harm to a patient. My parents put their trust and my father’s life in her hands and with her negligent care she caused harm. My father has metastatic melanoma and had been referred to the Cleveland Clinic to Dr Truong in November 2024. He was supposed to start treatment in which the office failed to schedule. So we started to call the office and ask what the hold up was. By the time Dr Truong set up a telehealth appointment with my father it was in January. Keep in mind from November to January he had no treatment at all in which this allowed the cancer to spread.  Fast forward 2 weeks and still nothing had been ordered. My father was in a lot of pain so my mom took him to U of M ER in which they did CT scans and the cancer had spread significantly throughout his body since November. And I 100% blame Dr Truong for this. Her delay in care caused direct patient harm.  I do not recommend Dr Truong to anyone as she took an oath to care for her patients and failed miserably to do so. Now he will be getting his treatment at U of M and Columbus Ohio and all we can do is pray that her negligence doesn’t cost my father his life.

I used a wheelchair to get up to my family members room and parked it outside the room because the rooms were too small to wheel it in. Apparently “transport” took it thinking it wasn’t in use. It took an hour to get a new one up there and that was only after I asked to talk to the nurse manager. My family’s room was freezing with the air coming out of the vent by the window very cold. 🥶 Felt like the AC was on, not the heat. This was January 24th. When we asked the care staff in the room about it
they said, “Yeah, it’s always too cold or too hot.” BTW this was in the H building. Plus there were no blankets available! My family member was freezing. Finally, when it came time to leave we had used valet parking and when we went to leave they had misplaced my car. Somehow the wrong ticket got placed on my car because the stub I had did not match. It took an hour. This was my first time visiting anybody at the Cleveland clinic and thank goodness most of my friends and family go to MetroHealth.

Sandra in Administrative Services put a smile on my face by just being friendly and helpful- it just goes to show me the trademarked “World Class Care” doesn’t just pertain to the medical providers at the Cleveland Clinic.  Sandra, your parents should be proud because your kind heartedness is inspiring.  God bless you
-Mike Czup
I've been in  emergency for over 8 hours, The police officer was mean and rude to a young lady, the officer was very unprofessional

After wasting months of my sister's and her family's time; and, $$$ with another,inferior Cardiac group in WNY-(feeling like we were   going in "CIRCLES" with her care) -- WE decided to schedule an appointment for her at Cleveland Clinic- Cardiology. THIS appointment  was accomplished very quickly. I can't speak highly enough about their concern and caring attitudes; from the first PHONE contact with them; then at CC information desk, to radiology testing, to staff encounters, to etc, to Dr's visit! Very impressed with: the Dr's concern, the hour appointment, their careplan review and, agreed initiation of 2 new meds to strengthen the heart; AND, with their follow through appointment scheduling. The follow up list of next scheduled appointments at CC are: prebloodwork results will be done in NYS and faxed, then at CC: EKG at 10:30, Echo at 11:00, then Cardiology heart failure team appointment at 12:45pm, then appointment with EP team at 2:45 and, then lastly- follow up with 'her'Dr. at 4:00 to dicuss plan of care going forward. That's how it's done! Cleveland Clinic cares for: THEIR patient's, THEIR health issues and THEIR timely, appointment scheduling- 100%. They are 'an Advocate for the Patient'. Thank you for being a ROLE MODEL IN HEALTH CARE ❤️ Take notice of this CARING TEAM of health professionals.

My mother is a patient in building G. On the 8th floor. She’s killed several of these, and missed several more. They are running on the floor and going into the baseboards. A nurse was made aware. The emergency room has great doctors and medical staff. Once patients are moved to their floor, nursing assistants do not care for the patients as they should. Absolutely no family should have to change beds, conduct patient care, etc. when their loved one is in the place that is staffed with medical personnel to do that and the hospital still bill the patient. Absolutely massive hospital! They have care for everything. I am so glad there are many maps and directions throughout this hospital because it would be so easy to get lost if not. The doctors and nurses are super helpful and they seem to really care about what you have to say and how you feel. The wait for bloodwork was super quick, about 3 minutes total. Unfortunately I need to come back from another state in a couple weeks for more tests because of how booked they are that is the only downside of the whole Clinic but overall. They found that I have a rare condition that my local hospital should have found with all the tests they ran, but somehow they didn't. It took the Cleveland Clinic ONE TEST, JUST ONE to diagnose and find my problem. Now I am able to get surgery to help. I am so thankful for the doctors and nurses at this clinic. It has been a fantastic experience going here and I am so glad I walked away with answers because of them. 11/0 experience so far at the Cleveland Clinic! If you need care, I recommend them!

World class medical, circus class parking and access. Can be overwhelming because the campus is so large, but if you have something serious going on, this is the place to be. Both myself and my father have had serious health issues that were misdiagnosed at other hospitals, and the Cleveland clinic corrected us both.
Saved my life. Best hospital around. Dr. Prendes is the best head and neck surgeon around.

I was dropped off for a medical appointment by a vendor (not Cleveland clinc related) I was done with my appointment then a security person yelled even though she was 10 feet away from me  and asked what If I was waiting for a ride and before I could answer she said the person who dropped me off was mad at me for “ride hopping”. One of the best hospitals I've stayed at by far. The staff was super friendly, I was not only well taken care of but all my needs were met and I couldn't ask for a better support team and doctors. When you recognize #1 in Cleveland, it's not not Brown's, Cavs, Guardians, or the Rock and Roll museum; it's the CLEVELAND CLINIC. Established in 1921, the CLINIC has broaden beyond Euclid Avenue, beyond Greater Cleveland, Ohio, the United States. I have been a patient there for nearly 40 years. No matter where I reside, I'll make sure a Cleveland CLINIC is near me.

Professional transplant teams pre and post transplant. Knowledgeable, professional, friendly, clean from surgical staff to the janitorial staff they are all top notch employees that deserve our respect. Amazing facility.

This review isn’t regarding the care of the doctors, nurses, or other staff here at Cleveland Clinic. They are all excellent. This review is mainly about the accommodations for the families of pediatric patients here. My child had surgery that required a one-night stay for monitoring. We drove over an hour to be here at the Cleveland Clinic for this procedure and stay. They put us in a “room” that looks like an ER triage or quick care room. There is no pull out couch for parent(s) to sleep on. What is given was a small, torn up couch with zero space to accommodate one individual let alone two parents for an overnight stay. I’ve been to and stayed at many hospitals in the NE Ohio area with family members, and I’ve never seen anything like this before. This is supposed to be one of the world’s best hospitals. I am beginning to think that they purposely do this so patients’ families will purchase one of their overpriced hotel rooms for the night. I would have no issue with this if the patient wasn’t a 6 year old who needs her parents by her side.

They need to rethink how and where they situate families of pediatric patients. My daughter’s surgery and stay here will cost as much as a luxury vehicle. They need to do better than this.

Cleveland clinic is supposed to be the best of the best. I went here when I was younger and switched elsewhere because of how rude the doctors were and because they made us get bloodwork at the appointment instead of getting it beforehand to then discuss at the appointment. I came back for a second opinion this year and saw Dr Karen Murray. I brought up a rare condition I wanted to be tested for because doctors just could not figure out what was wrong with me. My mom had printed over 1,000 pages of my medical records and she didn't even glance at them and she didn't do an exam. She laughed at me and said I do not have said condition. She recommended a follow up with psychiatry. A few months later and I have a feeding tube due to her negligence. I saw another specialist who ordered more testing and the rare condition I couldn't possibly have was plain as day positive and requires surgery. My condition is complicated due to her unwillingness to listen. I would be embarrassed to be associated with her and would not recommend this doctor if my life depended on it.

The doctors passed my husband from department to department. They would run tests then state "we don't know why...." then instead of trying to figure it out just pass him along. His home RA doctor did attempt to message the doctors about the biopsies that should be done and all her messages went unanswered. For almost 2yrs we traveled, no real work up, no answers, unfilled promises, and being passed to other doctors all for nothing.

Our home doctors finally gave up on Cleveland and followed through with the biopsies and going to see a doctor at Northwestern to finally be properly treated. Thank you Northwestern for admitting him and finally doing what Cleveland Clinic lazily refused to follow through with. Do NOT come here if your home doctors are stumped on your mysterious illness.

My son has been in their care for THREE MONTHS and I'm very satisfied on how they been giving my son ALL THE TREATMENT that he NEEDS !!!! As a former patient who had surgery back in 2019 with Dr Dassel, it was a great experience overall. As a former employee I think Cleveland clinic/Cleveland clinic Childrens and Cleveland clinic Indian River, still have lots of work to do.

As a sibling.. my brother has had 3 recent surgeries 2 by Dr Rowse who is no longer at the clinic and is still having issues so he is needing to see someone in another state/hospital to fix what Dr Rowse couldn’t..  and recently seen Dr Vorster and what could have been a minor procedure turned into a nightmare for him and us as a family..

I gave 1 star instead of zero because the nurse who checked me in, took my bp, etc, was exceptional and very compassionate. There needs to be more people in this world like her, especially in the healthcare system. I travelled 3 hours for a 10 minute appointment with "Dr" Jamie Von Venberg. She was very insulting toward my doctor and physical therapists calling them "incompetent" in so many words. The only incompetent care giver is "Dr." Von Venberg. I would like to extend a "sincere thank you" to  Aydah Jaber ,ARPN.Cardiology for her care and guidace in my visit to the Clinic on November 1.

Cleveland Clinic is good for many specialties but behavioral sciences is not one of them. They are vastly inept. They don't have the staffing, and the staff they do have is extremely archaic. They are not for mental health, especially those suffering from ADHD. If you're lucky to get a doctor, you'll find that the doctor is set back in the 1950s in terms of treatment. So good for the heart, good for the kidneys, good for lupus --- but disgustingly horrible for behavioral science.

Many believe that Cleveland Clinic is one of the best medical centers in the world. I couldn't disagree more.. after receiving so much medical care in different states, CC is by far the worst. I moved back to Cleveland About nine months ago after receiving a lot of specialty care in Pennsylvania from (UPMC) and Colorado (Denver Health) both of which i was incredibly happy with and the many doctors that I saw over that time period. I worried about finding new doctors that I liked as much but tried to keep hope that I'd find ones I was just as happy with. Boy was I wrong. I've been to several doctors at Cleveland Clinic for most specialties, and each of them are worse than the last. They don't seem to care at all about their patients, only about prescribing the newest and most expensive non-generic medications for each condition. I had been on most of my medications for years because they actually worked, as well as insurance fully covering them. Now they only care about prescribing what's newest, most expensive, or that they make money off of. Even if it doesn't work or falls out of your price range they continue trying to convince you to take it. None of the work me, or my previous doctors did matters to them. Any meds you were previously on don't matter and will be stopped. I'd look anywhere else before giving Cleveland Clinic your time and your health.
I'm now constantly suffering after being taken off half of my meds. For example with my migraines. They don't even want you taking over-the-counter medications. Probably because they don't make the money from the drug company. I'd do anything to return to my old doctors and the state I was in with my previous treatments. Look elsewhere if you have any choice in the matter.
Its also very difficult to get an appointment for months or even a year+ and if you need help or refills on meds before you can get an appointment you're out of luck. I've pretty much given up on my medical care because of all this.
I hope this advice helps someone. Wish I would have known before trusting my health conditions with them. Take care.
Follow up is next to nothing
Excellent medical care they have to make sure you make it out alive so they can ruin your life financially with their scum bag billing department.

I had a procedure performed on October 18 done by a Dr kaptra and let me say he was great him and his team I felt went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable. Than after the surgery I was sent to the H71 wing for an overnight stay and the hospitality went way above my expectations they not only made me feel comfortable but did they also went way above and beyond for me. You guys rock

This is probably the worst hospital I've ever walked into. They don't care nothing about the people that come in looking for help. Not to mention the food sucks ass,and is outrageously expensive.  My advise go someplace else if you can. You Will definitely be better off.

.My wife has a nutritional deficiency.  We came here in hopes finding a cure. Two days now, seen couple of doctors, was told from beginning that wife would be taken care by nutritional team. Just talked to orderly picking up and asked about tomorrow morning's breakfast. She stated that they don't take orders this late.  She has not left bed. No one has asked anything about orders. Now her pain meds are late again. Every person we talk to has some changing excuse. We told them her meds needed to be given at 4 am & 4 pm. First time was four hours late and was told that it was 8 am and 8 pm per the schedule.  Now tonight's nurse says it's 9 pm. This is not something to mess around with.  STAY AWAY FROM BUILDING H. Well day 2.5. Is off to a bit better start after discussion with supervisor.  Today, med are almost on time. Breakfast is coming about lunch time told by nurse. Wife's blood pressure is low 90/60. Okay now 1:00. No lunch. Wife was given low carb diet this morning. SHE NEEDS TO GAIN WEIGHT. LOOK AT THE CHART. NO ON READS. Asked nutritional nurse that came by. No she shouldn't be on low carb diet. No shit????? She blamed some other department. This Clevand clinic is a Death Trap.  Okay. They got this lunch meal here. There is alot going on badly in Cleveland Clinic Ohio. This place has problems from the kitchen to the pharmacy.  The staff just follows blindly. Just like mice. Dr came and mentioned endoscopy (mouth to My limit is reached. It got worse from here

Seen here by GI and Interventional Radiology. Long wait to get seen but when you do you are seen by the best. Run from them they didn't take care of my Brachial plexus injury  or my radial nerve said they couldn't bullshit thanks to them my shoulder and arm got more paralyzed .

We have been through so many doctors for my husband’s nerve damage which he is in pain 24/7 so we tried the mayo and what a waste of time and money. First of all when the doctor came in the room, he looked at my husband and said what do you want? What are you seeking for? And of course we said we are seeking for help because he is in so much pain due to nerve damage and we need help! My husband has never had a prescription in his life!!  and then when we were being released, they said the pain management and neurologist would get back to us right away that the Mayo is very good at following up. We are now being treated by a doctor in the honor health system and he is finally got some relief thanks  to the honor health system.

Horrendous experience, coming to Mayo Clinic has only hurt my health!

I was expecting the outstanding care that Mayo Clinic plasters all over their advertisements but instead I was insulted, dropped as a patient then punished for raising a complaint. I have a chronic, mysterious condition that causes daily pain and even raised the suspicious of cancer. I waited months for an appointment hoping for answers.

I saw Dr. Lisa Speiser (Mayo Clinic Arizona Infectious Disease Department). During the visit she kept pushing me into a very invasive, dangerous procedure outside of her expertise. I told her that I almost lost my life this year due to procedure complications but it fell on deaf ears. Even worse, she dropped me as a patient after I asked a reasonable medical question through the patient portal. I have a full record of this conversation on file.

In that conversation, I politely asked her a question about new lab results ordered by another doctor. Her response was sarcastic, rude and she locked the message thread to prevent me from responding or continuing care with her! She refused referrals to other specialists when before she was handing them out on a whim (one of the doctors she referred me to told me he didn’t even know why I was sent to him – this visit was $1200).

Furthermore, Dr. Lisa Speiser ordered a service without my authorization or knowledge – I am glad I was sitting down when I saw the $900 claim.

When I complained to Mayo Clinic Patient Relations and requested refunds, they ignored me until I followed up. I then received a call from Melissa (no last name provided); she lied about granting a refund for the visit with Dr. Lisa Speiser and refused a full refund for the unauthorized service. She also lied that letters would be sent to me on this topic, to date I haven’t received anything (2 months after I filed the complaint). Furthermore she stated that the Medical & Administrative Leadership Team at Mayo Clinic reviewed my complaint, fully supported all conduct and would not discuss anything further. Melissa refused to discuss that I was left without care, a diagnosis and a potentially life threatening illness. When I asked for referrals to other specialists, she told me to call scheduling and do it myself. I feel that Mayo Clinic punished me for filing a complaint.

I regret wasting my time, emotions and health on this mess. Waiting for care that never came has only worsened my symptoms and for the “pleasure” of this experience they bill 4 to 6 times more than any other facility.

Completely awful, heartless and cruel way to deal with someone potentially dealing with cancer. Apparently this is the culture at this place since it was very clearly supported up to their Leadership levels.

To say that I will not be coming back would be an understatement. I am still in shock.

The office of patient experience will leave you feeling exhausted and defeated telling you your only recourse is to file a case with the medical board against Dr Green. If you are unfortunate enough to need care from their Neuro team you had better have some amazing luck rolling those dice because if you get stuck with a doctor who will spend months gaslighting patients and staff ultimately calling me a liar that I never asked for an MRI in their 7T MRI machine you are stuck. I have asked to switch to another doctor with more integrity and care for their patients and the hospital refuses. When mistakes are made here they are never owned and the cost in borne by the patients and insurance providers. Never have I experienced such a basic oversight and mistake that is just brushed under the rug like my life doesn’t depend on it. I spent over a decade and millions of dollars in the care of Barrow only to switch over the Mayo as they made significant investment in the states largest MRI machine. Imagine my disappointment after spending an hour filling in the team of my medical history and needs and desire to follow up for imaging and continue my care with their state of the art equipment only to be placed in the wrong machine and then called a liar after months of back and forth and finger pointing between departments. You will cling to Hope waiting for an answer back from the Department of patient care only to receive letters telling you to kick rocks, expressing that your recourse is not them having better customer service or integrity but by you securing legal council and going after their state licenses. I feel like there’s a better way. I know there is, other hospitals are perfectly capable of it, but for some reason, this hospital is so adamant on protecting the lack of integrity of Dr. Green that they want to ride the horse to the glue factory. I am profoundly disappointed in this hospital and the lack of empathy and integrity that it has continually shown. How much state funding went to the building of these new facilities? Was it all private or did the taxpayer contribute to this at all? All I want is the care was promised. And now all I hear from my other professional friends in the medical field was I told you so about Mayo Clinic. I had so much hope for this hospital. So much so that I sent my dad to your main hospital in Minnesota for treatment after sacrificing a lifetime in the US military. I don’t even know what else is left to say, whatever is happening there is broken and I don’t know if anyone cares to fix it. I hope my personal opinion helps you and making a better medical decision and who to put your life in the hands of.

A hospital that you walk into filled with hope and promise that you are in great hands.
I was and you will be too!

Mayo Clinic Hospital PHX-1 delivers world-class care with expert physicians, cutting-edge technology, and a patient-centered approach. Services are efficient, professional, and consistently high-quality.
No one ever wants to end up in the ER but if you ever need to seek emergency help, this IS where you want to go. Above and beyond care.
Wasted time to travel there. No tests. Only read me My original Dr's. report. Very disappointed, and cost a fortune to go there! Wasted trip.

The specialist my family member saw was caring and knowledgeable. Their appointment setters were incredible too. While waiting we overheard some pretty vocal patients angry about wait times(not in that dept.) Then, we heard someone screaming about a doctor not listening to her. She seemed to be articulate and not a weirdo. Our personal experience was great but the atmosphere was uncomfortable.

I have a chronic kidney disease so I’m
here at least a few times a year! The ER docs are so hit and miss. They are either the nicest people you will ever meet or the meanest! I had one doc that didn’t even enter my room, he just stood at my door! I was like what the hell? 😂  I didn’t have anything contagious I just had a kidney stone. The nurses are what make this place! Just about every time  I come here, I have the nicest nurses ever! They always make up for when I have an ER doc that brushes me off! Props to all the nurses!

Stay away from this hospital. They will create problems you did not know you had. They make up issues and concerns. My son went in here after having too much to drink and they still have not released him after they randomly decided he needed a physcholgical evaluation. Everything came back normal except he was intoxicated and they wouldn't even let him have his phone. He has been there since 3 in the afternoon. It is now 1am. The place is ridiculously slow. No one knows what the other person is doing. It's terribly unorganized and they just try to rack up the largest charge possible. Stay away or you may never leave!!!
Great faculty. Professionals, but friendly. Excellent care.

If I could recognize everyone at this hospital I would. These are the kindest most hard working people. You deal with alot of different things that test your strengths and you keep your professionalism and compassion. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for all you do! Nurses on the 4th and 7th floor are outstanding, specialists, MD, GI team, Pharmacy and more. Caferteria to cleaning staff to security.  THANK YOU for all you do!  ❤️

Dr. Michael Hinni and everyone at Mayo Clinic is wonderful and compassionate! My husband & I appreciated Dr. Hinni and the technology used to get rid of his vocal cord cancer!  We are so grateful we did not go the radiation treatment route as suggested by his ENT doctor weeks ago. I wanted to add that the “Courtesy Golf cart” was a blessing when I was stressing over walking in the 113 degree heat from where I parked my car.  Those volunteers deserve alot for helping out many of us!

We recently had a family member  in the MICU, the staff that cared for him deserves recognition. Clinton and Giovanni cared for our loved one with the most compassion  and respect. As a practicing RN of 40yrs, with experience  in the ICU and Operating Room, these men are what nurses represent,  Respect, compassion  and Professionalism.  I can't  say enough to express our thanks during this time of hardship. They helped guide the family through  the process of losing a loved one, making a difficult process, into a positive one. Thank you so much!

Been a Mayo patient for over two decades now and I am seeing just how the process of providing care has deteriorated over the recent past! They flat out tell you to go to urgent care because the primary care providers have no time. The specialists stop providing care saying ‘we don’t treat this condition anymore’ or ‘you don’t meet the criteria for treatment’ it’s all so ridiculous, how do I get a diagnosis if I can’t see the doctor who can order some tests that can provide some insights?
Mayo only seems to want to take on exotic or difficult cases that they can use to further their reputation online and stay relevant in the news! Patient focused care and preventative care is not prioritized at all. The doctors seem to be in a hurry and are more focused on entering data into computers. I was billed for a one hour consultation when the doctor spent twenty minutes talking to me before I was ushered out the door!
I’ve started seeing specialists outside of Mayo now where at least I’m assured of time and attention.
Overall extremely disappointing and frustrating experiences lately. They are remodeling and renovating extensively, of only they would perhaps hire more physicians that would be helpful. I’m not paying as much money as they charge to see a PA most times!
This hospital is one of the better hospital I've ever been in.

Never have I had more attention and care and drs listening to me and how my body has felt and what my hope is, then with my colorectal Dr and GI.  So grateful I was referred here .  Entire staff of both team’s incredible!!!!

This hospital was great. very attentive and helpful. Came in with pain to my upper left quadrant. left with a diagnosis, medication prescribed and a plan of care to decrease the chances of my diagnosis.

Absolutely superb experience today visiting with oncology specialists for a family member. I cannot quite put into words our gratitude and the absolute perfect timing of events that took place to land us here. We could not be more thankful and gracious to receive care for our particularly complex case. Dr.Saab and his associate/fellow Dr.Taylor are above and beyond incredibly patient, empathetic and thorough. Our surgical needs were handled by Dr.Wasif who is an absolute consummate profesional. His bedside manner is equally matched with his skill and expertise. The time, patience and thoroughness he took with us was invaluable and we are forever grateful for the life-saving role he played in our family member's new lease on life. An all around outstanding experience in every area/department at the facility.

I was here as a patient and went to talk to a doctor in the hallway. However, it wasn’t a doctor (he was friendly and helped me find a doctor) it was janitor/housekeeper they have them wearing dress clothes to clean. How absurd, they should be wearing antibacterial scrubs not dress clothes. I can’t imagine they are easy to keep clean. Everything else was nice but maybe don’t have non doctor staff wear dress clothes.

My 85 year old mother was referred here with an episode of congestive heart failure. I work in healthcare and it was against my better judgement that she get referred to Mayo. She required a thoracentesis for hypoxia which she didn’t get until 12 hours after her admission. She was scheduled for an angiogram until they realized she had Medicare. A day after her episode the case manager told her she wasn’t covered and could be transferred. My mother asked that they call her physician son (and they had my number to contact me) but the case manager was ‘too busy’ to call me. The cardiologist also didn’t call me despite meeting me and having my number. My mother was then discharged discharged the next morning with out notifying any family about the discharge.

I know there are realities to health care and compensation for services. A 5 min phone call would’ve been helpful and kind. This was a total bush league experience. I would encourage anyone in Phoenix with healthcare issues to go to HonorHealth.

Went to Mayo for a 2nd opinion for cancer diagnosis.  SO glad I did and very happy they are taking care of me from head to toe.  I drive across town to get care when alternatives are less than 5 min. from my house.  The most impressive thing about Mayo is the "right hand knows what the left had is doing" here.  It is how medical care should be done.  There are plenty of hospitals and practices that should take note of how it's done.
I’m so impressed with this hospital, wonderful nurse and Doctors. Staff are very caring.
The neurosurgeon didn’t want to operate on my wife because there was a chance she would still be in pain after the surgery. That would damage their reputation.

I've been so impressed at the professionalism and compassion of the staff, highly effective infection control practices, patience and amazing care they have provided to my daughter for her rare autoimmune disorder that resulted in myelodysplastic disease. It quickly progressed into Acute Myeloid Leukemia. She is almost 90 post stem cell transplant and we are so pleased with the continued support and expertise.

When I called to make my appointment for an MRI I asked if they had covered parking since I was traveling with my dogs. The woman put me on hold and researched it and came back and said yes they do have covered parking. When I got there after driving 3 1/2 hours I learned the covered parking area was for Doctors only. This was extremely poor communication on Mayo Clinics part and as I've learned the hard way its very typical of them.

Absolutely terrible experience. Mayo Clinic acts like a healthcare factory. They rush you in and out without actually listening or caring about you as a patient. The doctors barely spend time with you, and there’s no depth to the care. It feels transactional and cold. To make things worse, they slap you with outrageous bills for minimal effort. I’ll never go back.

It’s truly mind blowing when u need help and u have the money but Mayo Clinic still won’t see u because your illness is too hard to solve . I’m truly out of words . I have all the money in the world and they said we can’t treat u . I mean what am I supposed to do to get better if doctors won’t treat u . I have a chronic issue the least they could do is have a consult . Maybe it’s who I am as to why . Who knows but this place is broken when it comes to healthcare and has no compassion.

I went in for a TEE, instead of just proceeding with the provider, the provider that was going to complete the procedure took the time to check if it was actually needed. We completed a very thorough echo and got all the information needed. No sedation or procedure needed. I very much appreciate the effort and attention to my health and care. Between Rayon (gentleman that took me back), Leann (the RN that was by my side the whole time), Rachel (the bad*** Sonographer), and Dr. Wilansky, I felt I received the highest level of care. Incredible knowledge and bedside manner from them all!

My other specialists have been incredible as well, Dr. Anvari, Dr. Mitropanopoulos, and Dr. Despradel. As I continue this journey of figuring out my health,  I have full faith and trust in the providers and their teams at Mayo.
They will not see me, they refused me care because I contracted a skin parasite.

Mayo Clinic in Phoenix has a rapidly declining reputation.  The staff, doctors, schedulers and self described helpers in the area are notoriously disappointing.  I gave them a try despite the rumors and got the same results. My doctors were awful, but not as bad as the support staff. Avoid all aspects of neurosurgery here. There is a reason other practices have their patients avoid going. It was a surreal experience for them to be the cause of lost hope. I would give zero stars if I could.

My father had a really bad health condition years ago, where his abdomen was unable to be closed due to several bowel obstructions. Mayo clinic was able to help him and give him back a normal life.

For that, I will always be grateful and I often come by here to drop off donuts for the medical staff and security.

Thanks for all of your hard work!

We are so grateful for the valets at each Mayo Phoenix building!
Today both Wendy and Adrian provided their usual cheerful and speedy assistance, extra impressive in this AZ heat!! THANK YOU! - Holly :)

If you’re coming here for surgery, it’s important to know that they don’t let family members (including spouses) be there for pre-op or post-op recovery. They don’t let you in the room with your family members until they’re admitted to the floor.
We were not told this until the day of, when we travelled 9 hours to get here (despite having 2 days of pre-op appointments, they never mentioned this). We would likely not have done the surgery here if we’d known.
They also expect that you’ll be able to make it a week before for pre-op appointments and they assume you’ll be able to be there a week afterwards, despite knowing that you’re traveling. Not much heads up if any.

Always excellent care provided. My husband has been under the neuro team for 2 years now. Every person we encounter has been wonderful. The advancements we've had with his epilepsy has been tremendous

My experience with the VA for two days now I requested when I got here that the TV doesn’t work. It still doesn’t today.

I requested repair and hasn’t come yet

Very disappointed

Because I suffer from kidney failure I spend too much time at hospitals and it can be incredibly depressing but the people at this Mayo Clinic are fantastic. The rooms are nicer the tv offerings are much better ( more channels, good selection of movies on demand) but I really want to highlight my night nurse Shay. She is a very pleasant, kind, and funny person. Honestly everything you want in a nurse, which is a big deal when you are uncomfortable and missing home. Ohh and the food selection is much better both in room and at the cafeteria.

My friend went to the Mayo Clinic from New Mexico for major surgery. After the first consultation with 2 surgeons the date was set for the end of May.  I will sing the praises of the this place, the staff, the Dr.'s, nurses, volunteers, EVERYONE for a very long time.  People were friendly, knowledgeable, kind, patient, and compassionate. The nurses were right on top of anything that was needed. Even the cleaning staff were happy and friendly. It seemed like everyone really enjoyed their jobs working there.
There was a grand piano in the Angel and Paul Harvey lobby and often times there was a volunteer playing, very professional, calming and soothing. The cafeteria was well let, clean and spacious. The food was not typical "hospital" food and not 5 star but it certainly fill the bill. The art work everywhere we went was diverse and gorgeous. I will be telling everyone I know what a great experience this was. I highly recommend The Mayo clinic, based on my experience. My friend was well taken care of and is recovering nicely!

Mayo charged me over $4,000 just for using Emergency Room services.  That does not include any services, tests, bloodwork or Doctor time.  Dr Gavin Parisi did not clearly understand my explanations and misinterpreted what I told him.  Then blamed an intake person for an error that was really his own.  His fee was $1,300+ for Emergency Department Visit With High Level of Medical Decision Making to tell me I probably had a pulled muscle in my chest and took about 20 minutes of his time. My visit there was 2 hours and they billed me over $6,000.  These excessive billing practices should be be criminal.
Blueberry pancakes and bacon well Done are awesome!

Staff with no empathy. Was told by nurses to look at patient portal for lab results and nothing was explained in person. Doctors quick to discharge patients. Not a good experience for a loved one. - Concerned family member.

A friend of mine has a father in here and they won't send him to another hospital, won't do surgery, requested he do a DNR even though he wants to live and fight and are now recommending he go home even though he needs 2 major surgeries. Worst hospital I have ever seen.
Shari Brand M.D. was rude, short and unhelpful.

On 5 East I had the pleasure of interacting with two of the Marias in housekeeping. Both of them had very pleasant dispositions and made some of my more difficult days easier. It's easy to feel less than human in the hospital, but they worked hard at their tasks and still made me feel like they were listening to me. They truly made a big difference.

I had neck surgery November 2024 by Dr. McClendon and he was amazing, surgical nurses were equally amazing and caring attitude shines throughout the campus.   I’m indebted to the staff for saving my life when other medical facilities & staff didn’t care.   Thank you all from my heart!

I had a wonderful experience in this hospital. The nursing staff were very friendly and helped a lot while I was in that hospital for one month. The rooms are spotless. I get good care from that hospital from PHX 1, 2, 3. The cafeteria staff in the PHX 3 is friendly to me when I tell them how I need the food. The front desk staff was also pleasant to me. I strongly recommend this hospital. This review is from my 2 years of experience, including a month's stay in that hospital.  Also 30 minutes away from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport (Phoenix International Airport ) and Scottsdale airport

Martha the nurse earns -100 points for you guys. Have always had a great experience here, but the nurses really make or break an experience since they are who we see 90% of the time. There is no reason for her to raise her voice to a patient especially one who is in pain and just needs help. She was slamming things around, raising her voice, and truly I don’t think you guys should hire people who have no care for a human because it makes you look bad as a hospital. Could see myself coming back any time Ms Martha isn’t here. Never experienced such a terrible nurse in my life. There are better jobs such as housekeeping in the hospital that she should look into with such a poor attitude.

I traveled from Southern California to Phoenix with a friend to be tested to get on the kidney transplant list. Everyone we encountered was 100% professional, kind and very helpful. In particular I’d like to point out and thank the employees who operate the valet service. I am handicapped and can’t walk long distances. The valet staff are quick!! They take great care with your vehicle when they take it from you. When you are retrieving your vehicle they RUN to retrieve your vehicle. We went in January and the weather was lovely. I can’t them doing this in summer! Everyone of the valets was cheerful, polite and helpful. It is a bonus that Mayo provides this service but to have staff who are above and beyond helpful is definitely a bonus to Mayo.
Lack of concern over patient in high level of pain.  Misinformation,  was told wrong info from triage nurse

I had surgery at Mayo Clinic Hospital in Arizona a year ago. My Surgeon was  caring, patient & so wonderful, "Dr. Robot" was there also.  My Dr. explained everything prior and again right before surgery. The care was great, everything was clean, organized and even the food was good! Mayo Clinic, in my opinion, is a first class, top rated,  professional hospital. It made surgery not as bad as I thought it might be. I was very impressed! 👍🏼🙂

I was working with housekeeping and they left me go ( fired ) i was cleaning and doing discharges and i noticed that the employees of May-O Clinic Hospital are not doing their job by not mopping and wiping down the nurses station and mopping the areas of the nurses station and their other rooms but they fired me cus i was taking to long to perform my job cus their own employees weren't doing their job and some of the employees don't clean toilets or mop the entire room, again i was doing my job and let me go cus i was preforming my job so all of you need to make sure that ur toilets are clean before you sit down on it and the floors are all full of hair and dirty objects on the floor

After two referrals one of which a trauma the 2 weeks later both sent to a neurosurgeon I was actually turned down for an appointment!!!!  I was shocked to say the least.  They will treat anyone else from anyplace elsstill in shock

Called the ER to see if they can do anything for phantom pain because we are an hour away and my mom is screaming in pain. Would not give me an answer over the phone. Phantom pain is one of those things either you help with it or you don't there is no in-between.
Great hospital and clinic
Very poor management of legitimate severe post op pain. I would never recommend this hospital for anyone I care about. Only go here if you want to be tortured.
Worst staff ever, don’t come here arrogant faculty and workers who also like to hire unqualified candidates food sucks as well gave me diarrhea
Kind, caring, and on time everytime.

I came to the Mayo Clinic with high hopes of figuring out what was going on with me. My last endocrinologist was treating me for diabetes but I did not fit the traditional type 1 or type 2 forms.  I was having terrible hypoglycemia as well as hyperglycemia, and severe anxiety and panic at times.  The last endocrinologist advised that I get tested for more rare forms of monogenic diabetes. I went to see Dr. Westphal and she was incredibly dismissive of all my concerns and my symptoms. In her mind it was either an insulinoma or nothing else. She gave me notice that I had to be at the Mayo Clinic hospital in AZ (a different state from me) in one week for a 3-day fast - no food for 3 days while I get my blood taken every hour. My husband and I dropped everything to be there, but the staff seemed to not even know who I was or why I was there. They openly complained about her and that they had no guidance. She never even stopped in to see me except for about 1 minute at the end of the day as she had her purse and was leaving for the day. She ignored all of my diabetes symptoms - I was taking an extreme amount of water and peeing constantly while there. She kept saying that I don't have diabetes and refuse genetic testing. Ultimately during the 3-day fast, they gave me glucagon to bring up my blood sugar level since I was severely hypoglycemic. Since I do not have an insulinoma and she refuse to complete the genetic testing She did not know that I have MODY 12 diabetes -- a rare missense variant/mutation on the ABCC8 gene. This caused me to go into a partial seizure for over 15 minutes while at their hospital. The nursing staff and ER doctor there were amazing in their quick response to help me.
Afterwards the next day, Dr. Westphal came in to see me because she was not even there during the seizure, and she tried to dismiss it all is no big deal.  She tried to say that it was not a low blood sugar induced seizure even though I experienced it and had been repeatedly told it was by the nurses, ER doc and pharmacist there.  It was like she was trying to protect herself.  She told me to carry candy in my pocket when I go places. She kept saying that there's nothing wrong with me and that this is all normal.  I then saw a university researcher and medical doctor who within 5 minutes said she thought I had monogenic diabetes. I ended up getting genetic testing which confirmed this.  I was also diagnosed with celiac disease and moderate-severe systemic lupus, for which I now receive monthly infusions. Eating gluten was also causing my blood sugar levels to go all over the place. I could not believe the lack of empathy and the incompetence of Dr Westphal.  The only saving grace for the Mayo Clinic is the incredible nursing staff there. They were always on my side and had my back, advocating for me as much as possible. I would not advise anyone for care under Dr. Westphal. Perhaps she needs to consider retiring.
Thank you so much this hospital saved my life will always be grateful 🙏

I’m a 70 yr old male who was admitted to the Mayo ER today (1-27-25) for high BP and dizziness and promptly checked in, pre-viewed by staff prior to being sent to an ER room and analyzed, tested and diagnosed by nurses and a doctor (Dr. Judson). My experience was professional in every aspect and I highly recommend this hospital and staff.
had an iud placement and the nurse was extremely kind and helpful. i was extremely anxious and she guided me through the entire process. amazing woman and people here
One of the best Mayo clinic staff are wonderful people feel the love has you walk in..

Mayo is extremley well organized. You can make one visit with tests and scans before noon, grab a bite of lun h and then your visit with your doc in the early afternoon to go over the results.

They have specialists in a wide range of specialities. Local doctors often refer their toughest cases to Mayo. This was the case for my wife's surprise diagnosis of kidney cancer, Within weeks she had the necessary surgery. She just had her 18 month followup with no cancer anywhere.

I had specialized surgery with Dr Zimmerman.  He is a phenomenal Doctor.  I could write a whole seperate review of my Teflon-free MVD.

My experience was each and every staff member has a sense of urgency to your care.  Every interaction from consultation, to testing, surgery, recovery and all the transfers.  There was an introduction, eye contact, inquiries to comfort level and focused attention.  No sidebar distractions or stories with their colleagues.   Mayo is dedicated to high level care on every level, and it shows.
Even the exterior employees, security, or valet staff answered questions, and took time with us.
The campuses of course, are serene and beautiful, my first trip to Phoenix, and the area is so different from anywhere that I’ve been.
It was easy to find a nice, economical vacation rental home for a for recovery in the area before flying home.
The Best Healthcare !
Amazing service and amazing staff and great facility

My Dad went there because we always had heard great things about this hospital. They were made to feel as if they were beneath the other patients. They told them to go to St Joseph’s Hospital instead because it would be very expensive since the Cardiologist Was not able to perform the cardiac catheter procedure in that hospital. They were checked in but not told they couldn’t use the insurance there. Very cold and rude.
The valet service here is amazing especially Michael who always cheerful and has a smile on his face and is likeable, who also spoils me rotten and washing and waxes my car

Dr Henry Clarke did the impossible: he removed the botched knee replacement that quack from California had put in, installed a new implant properly, and in doing so, he restored my alignment and my ability to walk properly in the future. The entire staff at the Phoenix Mayo clinic is to be praised: the level of care I've gotten there in incomparable. It's a painful operation yet everyone there has gone above and beyond the call to inform me of everything, care for me and make sure I was as comfortable as I could be under the circumstances. I spent 2 nights in the hospital, I was discharged yesterday with a bag of meds and clearly defined instructions, and while I do have pain, I also have hope, now: I'm going to do my part in physical therapy and heal, and thanks to Dr Clarke and the Mayo clinic in Phoenix, in the spring, I'll be hiking again, my quality of life will return. Seriously, if you have any orthopedic issues, head straight to the Mayo clinic, you won't be disappointed. Best medical care ever, best staff, and holy footprints do they know their stuff.
EDIT: It's official: Dr Clarke is the botched knee whisperer 😂 I'm 13 days post op, walking without the walker and I started cycling today.  (It took 4.5 weeks with the previous surgeries) Knee bend is at 90 degrees and knee extension is almost at 180 degrees.  Also today I haven't needed painkillers.  Zero back or pelvic pain which had been plaguing me since the original surgery on this left knee. I can't believe my progress already, I am so, s stoked.  And grateful.  Because without Dr Clarke I'd still be in pain on my couch. 🚴‍♀️💃🏽💪🏻🎉🥳 Mayo clinic is the best 😁
Best care, most friendly, positive staff

I had a daily non stop migraine for 8 year. They told me that it's normal and to get out and exercise. If they would have been paying attention, they would have noticed I have Addison's disease that was causing my pain and not have brushed me off.

Today I took my daughter to the ED as she had been in severe abdominal pain. She has several ongoing GI issues. She just turned 18 and we were hoping that the adult ED would help her with the pain. However, this is not what happened. The doctor refused to run any tests other than blood and urine. She refused to give her pain medication, and said she would refers her to a GI “but don’t expect to be seen for several months “.  She was unprofessional and down right rude. Don’t think we will be using Mayo Clinic from now on.

Well. I didn’t know you have to fill out an application to be seen. My wife has seen numerous neurology drs and had multiple nerve tests including Parkinson and MS. Noting found.  We were hoping the Mayo would help her……. They turned her away and told us to keep in touch with our primary dr. Really!

Completely disappointing ER “experience “ nothing but trauma. My daughter a current Mayo patient was urged to go to Mayo ER has she was having heart palpitations, dizzy, faint feeling,severe dehydration, purple nails etc. The nurse was cold. The attending MD under the main Dr was okay and at least listened to us. She said by looking at my daughter she severely dehydrated and to the touch of skin. No IV were given. The Main ER Dr on call was a complete jerk and saw us for less than 1 minute. We were discharged on our way home to Tucson. We saw my daugher’s EKG which was completely abnormal . Yet they let us leave and told us to follow up w PCP . No care , no help , no compassion. Absolutely terrible . I do not understand how Mayo is held in such high regard? I even asked the Dr . You are going to let my daughter leave like this?  To which he said “this is the American health care system today “ so smug . His name was Dr Shaw . No empathy . I imagine if it were his family member or a big donor they would have referenced help . 1 star bc the security guard in front was kind.
Beautiful clinic, very professional workers
Very well organized . Staff friendly and reliable. Punctual for appointments. Good medical support.

Almost died last year from blood clots.  My arm was having issues and my vascular surgeon told me to get to an ER asap.  I went to Mayo, not only was the Dr unremorseful, she claimed she was new and didn’t know the procedures yet and couldn’t write prescriptions.  Not only did they not check for clots but was dismissive of the pain and numbness. I went to a different facility and got proper care.

I would not consider going anywhere else for my medical care. They have successfully treated 3 types of cancer, replaced a hip, so my annual physical exam, have a care plan in place, and communicating with my doctors and their teams is fast and easy.

UPDATE: 11/7/24-After my 3 week Post-OP tests/reviews I realized some things that I forgot to mention initially. First, thanks SO much to the surgeons for doing such a wonderful job, after removing the surgical tape my 5 scars looked better than expected. Second, thanks to the Donation team for the wonderful crystal donation card ornament and all take home gifts. Third, thanks to the IT team for helping to run a wonderful MAYO APP, without that application the entire system would not run as efficiently and flawless as it does, not to mention how well all my appointments were organized per hour and per day. I never had to wait more than 15 minutes for any of my more than 20 scheduled phone, video or in-person appointments over a 7-month period.  The finals words are for the housekeeping, security and landscaping staff personnel that do such an incredible job at both the Scottsdale and Phoenix locations. MAYO is AWESEOME!!!

"MAYO Nurse Fernanda", let us start out with the words compassion and passion. Compassion for your patient, which is well above and beyond what MAYO Nurse Fernanda provided to me. Everyone else that also touched my life during the MAYO Clinic, MAYO Hospital, NLDAC and NKDO (Patty Graham) successful living kidney donation process that we all completed on 10/17/24. The deep personal and job passion that was shown to me, by all, during my visits for what I would have to say is, the most complete physical I will EVER have next to a NASA astronaut candidate, showed how much everyone cared about me and the kidney recipient, so we both come out on top of the world.

Having grown up with 5 nurses in my family and knowing the fact that the entire hospital staff cares for you, is the MOST important factor, the older you get, the more, how much more you realize how precious life is and how much harder goals like this are to accomplish, and it was done flawlessly and with flying colors. I never felt afraid once for my life or my safety during my multiple visits to the MAYO Clinic and MAYO Hospital, it also never would have happened without the help of all the wonderful people from NLDAC and NKDO that provided all the other essential information and guidance needed to make this donation successful.

If I forgot someone, I deeply apologize, but the following professionals, plus many others made it all possible: MAYO Nurse Fernanda, plus Nurses JC, Lacey, Katie, Rogers, ASU nursing students in training "A" squared, Dr. Nguyen, Dr. Cosentino, Dr. Moss, Dr. Beall, Dr. Washington, Dr. Lee, Dr. Khurmi and the entire surgical staff, pharmacists Danielle and Madison, CARE TEAM of Mark, Jeff, David, Nurse Shondra, Nurse Zach, Nurse Mark, Nurse Laura, Nurse Rachel, Nurse Candace, Ruth, Gloria, Tricia, Pamela, Cassie, Jed, Melinda, Sydney, Alba, Dr. Pooja and let us end this with a ROSE, Dr. Rose.

Everyone treated me like I was family, I would recommend with the highest regards, The MAYO Hospital/Clinic to anyone!!!

Thank you all SO much!

Christian "Skye" Walker
They take of their patients very well.  The cafeteria food is always good.

Are you kidding me?  The experience was life chaging - life saving!  The services provided are catered to your every need.  Yes, it is all about you, and that's what makes this place great and you actually end up leaving feeling whole again.  A hospital stay like no other, with excellent intelligence, kindness, compassion, and skill - Mayo Clinic Hospital is my first choice when it comes to ER health care services.  They saved my life nearly a year ago and I'm still grateful to the team that made it all happen.  And I know it wasn't easy nor cheap, but still worth it.
It's top class service and staff

I am so grateful for the love and care provided to my father, Patrick, in the Progressive Care Unit. Fiona, Sammie, Javier, Sydney, Shannon, and many others cared for us like family. My dad spent 3 weeks at the Mayo, unfortunately he passed away. But the nursing staff went above and beyond, daily. I am beyond grateful for them. They are truly angels walking on earth. They are gentle and patient and lead with love. Thank you all so very much for making the most difficult and heartbreaking time in my life a little easier to go through. God bless you❤️

I have been to this hospital numerous times due to a persistent problem that was not checked thoroughly. My body and face was racked with bacteria that showed on my skin. Not one doctor at UCLA performed a skin culture.  So my problem was diagnosed for over year by a deematologist after my PCP advised him to do so.  So after this point, I learned that I had a deadly infection disease.  I went back to UCLA with the diagnosis and requested a drug I saw in a hospital study that was effective for a similar patient like me. The doctor said I could not have this drug as I would have to be hospitalized.  I had to opt for another drug which I reluctantly took home.  This drug did not cure the problem. Later, I received a bill when my insurance has always paid for treatment.  The billing agent texted the bill with no name or billing dept phone no.  Just the amount.  I was being dunned by texts now on this bill currently with no way to communicate.  My opinion of UCLA Medical Center is that the hospital  management leaves much to be desire as it causes the doctors to not be doing their job properly due to cost cutting measures imposed by the hospital.
I had an outpatient surgery here few months ago and everyone was so nice.

I absolutely loved the private labor and postpartum rooms, which featured state-of-the-art facilities. The nurses and staff were always available at the slightest request, making me feel comfortable throughout my entire stay. They consistently checked in every two hours and were on call whenever I needed assistance. I was there for four days--two days for induction and then delivery via a minimally invasive C-section.
The staff was wonderful, especially Nurse Cherry.
She initially handled my admission, cared for me during the following two days, and was also by my side on delivery day. She stayed with me until the very last moment and even helped me with breastfeeding until the end of her shift. Her support and dedication made a huge difference in my experience.
I also want to highlight my OB-GYN, Dr. Megan Bernstein, who provided excellent care throughout my pregnancy and delivery. She was incredibly supportive, always patiently addressing all my questions and concerns, and made sure every issue was fully resolved. Her professionalism and kindness gave me great confidence and peace of mind.
I have been waiting on paperwork from doctor jensens office for a week. I tell them its urgent and my employer needs it.It only takes 5 minutes at most to fill out. its one page.
Nice to me in hospital nurse Paul / Ryan /nikki

My son was brought in by ambulance 🚑 from another hospital and immediately check out! And was placed in the best care of doctors and being treated for his situation everyone as far as staff were very nice and professional! And concerned my son is being watched closely and being accomidated are and watched closely! And the doctor extremely nice! I would recommend this 🏥 hospital
Excellent care and support during and after care.

First of all the Doctors are the BEST part of UCLA SANTA MONICA HOSPITAL system .”. NO DOUBTS, “, but the administration is the WORST they lack of a lot of things and nurses don’t even show what they say “We are here to make sure you are safe and COMFORTABLE????? . I understand the hospital is FULL, but  they need to organize themselves be prepared for busy times, we were 11 hours seating down outside, my husband diagnosed with pneumonia, after they put him on the antibiotics, they took hours to check on his temperature, I asked for a blanket since he had the chilis, and I had to remind the nurse twice.. Since 6pm nurse keto saying they are looking for a room upstairs because he has to be admitted.. she came severas times repeating is almost ready… IT NEVER HAPPENED… at 11pm I went to ask what was going on that it was almost 12 hours in the waiting room with all people yelling and screaming with different problems…His back was killing him due to his spine problem… Finally they said, We have a bed “in the emergency room because we don’t have any rooms now, but when we have one we will change him… they took us to this absolutely messy room, a storage room.. full off cables, computer stations that they don’t even use, and where they leave what they don’t need.. so most of nurses and CNAs will come to look for stuff all day long, turning on the lights, and careless about patients in the room.
It actually looks like a garage!!!!!
At the end we have a couple of nurses that were so rude, and instead of apologyzed they will only cover themselves WE DONT HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH ROOM ASSIGNMENTS.. JUST THE NURSE ON CHARGE????????
So is out of doctors hands.. understandable, but a personas who is diagnosed with PNEUMONIA and is a bacteria, and my husband also has an inmune system disease,  we are local to UCLA HEALTH, PAY FOR 2 PPOs to have coverage, however whe we most needed it we got ZERO confort…we even ask for the TV, nurse said .. OH I DONT KNOW WHERE THE CONTROL IS.. I GUESS SHE STILL LOOKING FOR IT, because we never got it, They left  my husband for 3 days u til he was discharged !!!!!! for 3 days!!!!!!
