I have been a patient of a physician within the CS medical group for about 5 years. I have seen a continuing degradation of service from this physician and across the CS system as I have been referred out for other services. This includes a 3-4 month wait for tests which must be preceded by a consultation that typically takes a few to several weeks to secure. As  result of recent tests, I may require additional care. I had to insist on a referral to a specialist recently. That appointment took several weeks to secure. That specialist, after my urging referred me for an additional test. The results of that require a referral to another specialist and a more sophisticated test. After waiting for 2 weeks for the referral to be approved I called back to find it had not been placed in the system. That is now resolved and it took a week to connect with the specialists office who will perform this more sophisticated test. It is July 1, 2024 and I cannot see this second specialist for the required consultation which must precede the second test until October 22, 2024. None of this would have even been set in motion had I not questioned test results from February 2024. I do not know exactly where all the challenges exist. Perhaps some are staffing but the apathy exhibited by the physicians and the extremely long wait for consultations and tests are frustrating and reflect degraded service. Cedars Sinai is supposed to be one of the best medical systems in the world. Their departments, physicians and medical professionals also among the best. My experience day after day does not reflect that.

My response to CS - You are the problem. This is systemic.

Update: I submitted a comment as suggested in the owner response 6 days ago. No reply yet. It is now July 29 and there has still been no response to my online comments submitted as they suggested.

Update: It is now 8/24 and CS has still never replied to my inquiry. I recently contacted my PCP through CS Link with a question about a health issue. CS is now delighted to introduce me to CS Connect because my PCP is out today. Why does CS think they have a better idea of how a patient wants to receive care. This must be cheaper for them, cheaper for the insurance company or drive profits in some way. I continue to be disappointed and delayed in getting care from CS. They are terrible at service and customer care.

Update 11/18/24: The CS system continues to make it more difficult for patients to see their PCP. Once again I have contact my PCP regarding symptoms I am having and they are referring me to their Cedars Sinai Connect which passes me off to a separate group of service providers. I wonder why CS thinks after developing a relationship with a primary care physician a patient would want to be passed off to other professional that are unknown. They promote this as convenient and providing service...I wonder why they won't simply find a way to provide service through the PCP. I suspect this is about money. CS seems good at making money.

Very bad care on the wards at night. My father was in pain and they did not give him any meds them they left him in a bed that was wet with urine for hours. They pulled on his injured arm to turn him over in bed and it was very uncomfortable after that treatment. Some of the nurses, viviene in particular do not give clear instructions to the patient and speak in unintelligible baby talk that is very unprofessional. More like a bad nursing care home than a first class hospital. The daytime nursing care is superior but the night care is uneven and sometimes quite shoddy.

Horrible place they killed my mother by not reposition her which caused  a wound and sepsis! Nurses don't care about the patients  if someone dies it is just an empty  bed for the next victim! Emergency

If I could give zero stars I would. Had a referral, they kept losing the records sent up. Took a year for an appt. That was supposed to be today. MyChart prompted me to prepay over $1,000. Then, knowing the doctor was leaving the practice for at least a week, they waited till the Friday before a Monday morning appointment to call me and tell me the appointment was not happening. I’m out of state. Had a hotel booked, time blocked off work, and everything. And the other specialist who is familiar with my condition is impossible to book with but I could see a newer doctor in 2026. And now they have to research it to consider refunding the prepayment and no one seems to even know how to do that. Patient relations called back today’s message after not answering to tell me it takes at least typically 7 business days, despite not giving me that courtesy at all during this process. Basically patient beware. I’ll update or change this is the situation is better resolved.

This hospital is a five star hospital. Words cannot express our family's gratitude for the staff, nurses, and doctors who treated our mother with the utmost care and respect. We were greeted with nurses and doctors within MINUTES of arriving to see her- each, and every time. They were beyond communicative when we were present (or not) and it is because of their loving care and professionalism, we believe that our mothers lifted spirits are what healed her so quickly. We will be forever indebted to MGH. Angels work there.
Called early morning and the operator was extremely rude, it was woman. Then she hung up on me blatantly. Completely rude
Made me wait 5 months to get an appointment , then another 5 months to wait, then they cancelled without even alerting me after I showed up! I’d give 0 stars if I could. Very unprofessional staff

Sept 1st 2018, I had a brain aneurysm rupture and was med flighted from Laconia NH. I had collapsed twice walking out of my bathroom so my 12 year old daughter called 911. Thank God she was still awake at 1:30 am or I wouldn't be here. Laconia EMTS treated me terribly and thought I overdosed. The two men kept telling me multiple times that I need to "stand up" as I was crying on my kitchen floor curled up in a ball holding my head. Laconia EMTs kept asking me how much heroin I took and told me we weren't leaving till I told them how much. My son said "My mom doesn't do drugs". The EMTs snickered and said "yeah ok". I knew I was going to die in front of my children so I used every single ounce of strength that I had to get on the gourney. Yes, two men that easily had well over 50 pounds on me if not more, wouldn't place me on the gurney to get moving.
My whole stay at Mass General (all 17 days) was great. I was brought ice cream at 1 am when I couldn't sleep. Since I was bedridden, one nurse "Grace" even washed my hair while I was laying in the bed.
She even tried to get the knots out of my hair. She was incredible and such a sweet, caring girl.
I was moved up from the ICU to the floor above after 15 days, I was told I'd have more freedom without being hooked up to all the machines. I thought that meant I could go get a soda. I was stopped at the elevators and told I couldn't go off the floor. The woman at the desk who stopped me went out of her way and brought a soda to my room. This hospital and its staff are incredible. They saved my life as most people die before reaching the hospital. I'm incredibly grateful to be alive and the hospital staff made my ENTIRE stay more comfortable. I can't thank you all enough for all you have done for me.
Only complaint is one of the social workers. Not the one with the short curly hair..but the other one. She was so rude to my dad.
Dr. Mazwi and Dorothy Booth are the most incredible people out there. Much love to you both! Because of you two...I'm still around for my children who need me.
Fantastic hospital obviously but they "lost" my grandfather's wedding ring which is pretty insane.

The doctors are terrible. I had a brain surgery and it did nothing.  The nurses are rude. I've been stuck in the hospital for 3 days might have to stay longer. Don't waste your time coming to this hospital. Go To a different one this place is a joke.
I was born there. My name is Keith Steven Jameson.

I Needed  at app at wound clinic...
Takes a week to read and evaluate a referral , they don't call you back and 3/5 weeks to see them...if they decide to take you!!!!!

I called twice and they suggested me to go elsewhere if I need services.

Why don't you close the wound clinic.. it's clearly a waste of money to keep so many people employees for no service .

MGH is one of the biggest hospitals in Boston, but it you have minor acute needs or if the nurse staff team deems your illness acute, then they will send you to the “Fast Track” side, completely separate from the ER department and the wait for the Fast Track on most days is about 15-20 mins to be seen by a clinician regardless of your condition.

Also, I talked to a group of dental students about something called the “Molar Study Program” and these people/this dental office has been calling me nonstop with phone calls after I requested them to stop for the past 6 months. So, be a little cautious about what studies you sign up for.

Otherwise, known as one of the best research hospitals in the region. I think they also might be Harvard Medical School doctors affiliated as well.

Mass General Hospital Advocacy is as poor as all the medical services offered at this hospital. When I say run, RUN FAST!  The advocacy group will not assist you in any way. Wokeness has overtaken the office!!  They are more incompetent than the service you are seeking help for. You will accomplish nothing!

A 25-year review demonstrates that with rare exception I sought medical help elsewhere (major issues) after repeated attempts to secure them at MGH or I received sub-par services before seeking care elsewhere. MGH’s decline has become even more serious in basic every-day services as well. They can’t provide basic tests for MONTHS — something other local hospitals are providing in one WEEK!  Add to that construction traffic surrounding the Boston facility that will add 30 minutes travel time - complete gridlock. They no longer treat with doctors, instead with nursing assistants and nurse practitioners. If I wanted a less trained professional, I would go to a minute clinic. But MGH has a recruitment problem and has no doctors to treat its patients. This may sound outrageous, but I’ve heard they offer Teslas as a recruitment tool to attract talent!!!  How bad is that!!!  A total breakdown in care and they are enticing talent with a Tesla. Don’t believe the ratings - foreign countries aren’t even sending their patients to MGH any longer. They go to better foreign facilities at much reduced expense where there are real doctors and not nurse practitioners. Another Harvard-related woke enterprise that bites the dust!  Tragic….

racial discrimination, Racial biased, Unethical behaviors. This hospital has no patience and does not welcome individuals with autism spectrum disorder. This hospital carries a lot of biased towards people with disability, such as autism spectrum as well as mental health issues. My niece was escorted out the property via Boston Police a Administration discharged. The hospital made the police look for other hospitals to help her stating that they will no longer help her and that she is not welcomed inside those doors. Mass General Hospital has no ethical standards and ethical practices towards any individual with autism spectrum disorder. Mass General Hospital discriminate toward patients with autism spectrum disorder. Mass General Hospital carries racial biased and racial discrimination when it comes to their form of practicing and providing medicine to patients, they can deny it or not It’s clear and other providers that left MGH confirm. MGH has a history of not having autism awareness and autism acceptance in their facility and they continuously discharge my family member who is on the spectrum and continuously tells them that they are not welcome in that hospital. Whoever has a family member that has a disability, especially autism spectrum. Be careful with Mgh.

The phone systems that support incoming calls to MGH are a complete travesty.  People's lives are in the balance of this system and it is nearly impossible to obtain accurate information (even recordings have inaccurate fax numbers).  I retrieved 4 different fax numbers for MGH Gastroenterology and 3 of them were inaccurate.  I had to contact Patient Advocacy to get support -- this took 3 phone calls, where with each, I was transferred at least 3 times.  How can anyone, especially someone who works in the business of people's health, think this is efficient or of high care?  I understand this is the responsibility of the Information Technology team at MGH -- I wonder if they realize the gravity of such poor design.  I also wonder if they understand the importance of training the MGH employees who have to deal with this system.  If I was a senior citizen or someone of lesser tenacity, I would never have completed my task with MGH (to get care) because of this confusing, inadequate, error-prone calling system.  Do better, MGH Information Technology. It's a shame that this phone system is the front face of all the good, talented, hardworking people who work for MGH.

May 30, 2025:  As an update, my general practitioner's office (not with the MGH system) followed all the correct procedures, following my instructions provided by MGH's website, automated messages, and even a person, and it was still inaccurate.  When they finally faxed the correct number, the intake people couldn't find the fax!  So, my GP's office sent it again with special attention to a human I finally found willing to watch for the fax. I repeat again without being hyperbolic, this system is a travesty and a risk to people's lives. How can the MGH administration stand by this system?  Do you find it reliable?  Are you proud of it?  If not, are you doing anything about it?

I also tried to use patient advocacy and called them a number of times and they did *not* at all help me achieve an outcome.  In fact, I called several times and I did not receive a reply.

I shared this story with a friend whose wife is a *doctor* at the Children's Hospital and she, too, couldn't get in touch with a specialist!  So, my friend actually showed up in person at MGH to finally close the loop.  This is really sickening for MGH to let this happen.

Massachusetts General Hospital standards have gone way down. I go to the ER for back pain I have had for 6 days. They do a X Ray and send me home with meds. They says they don't do MRI's. I had the privilege of being seen by Dr. Alister Martin in the ER, and I cannot express how grateful I am for his care. From the moment I arrived, I felt heard and understood. He took the time to listen to my concerns and was incredibly patient throughout the entire process.

Dr. Alister Martin answered all of my questions with clarity and compassion, which made me feel more at ease despite being in a vulnerable state. He provided me with a clear plan and, after feeling completely exhausted, I left the hospital with a sense of relief and hope.

The impact of his care was immediate—after days of not being able to eat or sleep, I was able to enjoy a meal as soon as I got home. I truly feel so much better and cannot thank him enough for making such a difference during a difficult time.

We couldn’t be more grateful for the exceptional care my dad, Antonio Silva, received from Dr. Shankar Ganesh during his spinal surgery. From the very beginning, Dr. Ganesh was real and honest while maintaining a sense of optimism that made my dad feel safe and confident. Throughout the entire process, it was clear that my dad was in the best hands possible, and Dr. Ganesh’s calm and caring demeanor gave us all peace of mind.

The surgery and recovery exceeded our expectations. My dad was up and walking the very next day without any pain, which was truly surprising to him. His recovery has continued to be smooth, and two months later, he just keeps getting better and stronger. The day after the surgery, Dr. Ganesh was there to personally check on him, take care of the stitches, and ensure everything was on track.

Dr. Ganesh’s professionalism, skill, and genuine care have been a blessing. My dad was so touched by how Dr. Ganesh looked at him—with a sense of responsibility and empathy, like it was his own result. We’ve been incredibly lucky to have a doctor with such ‘angel hands,’ who truly cares for his patients’ well-being. Thank you, Dr. Ganesh, for everything. We are forever grateful!

I was brought to Mass General Hospital for a sudden urgent procedure. I cannot say enough good things about the doctors, nurses, radiology team, and catering.
I was never worried because I knew I was in great hands.
The nurses on Lunder 8th floor were professional and took great care of me. They explained everything they were about to do.

The doctor did an extremely impressive job with the delicate procedure. I was informed about the procure before hand. I would highly recommend this doctor.

The Anesthesia team explained everything to me before the procedure also. They asked if I had anesthesia before and what side effects I had so they could make this time more comfortable.

I would highly recommend Mass General Hospital without hesitation.

My father stayed here back in 2021. Apparently while he was in the hospital, they found he had issues with a valve in his heart as well as lung damnage - and did not tell him or me. My father died recently due to the valve issue in his heart, which is how I found out about this. If Mass hadn't buried medical information, my father might still be alive. If you value your life, go anywhere else.

Care delayed is care denied….
I wish I could score MGH lower than 1 star but that option is not available.
Last January I had a dermatologist at MGH remove several cancerous lesions on my body. So far so good. I started calling the Dermatology department at MGH in early October to schedule a follow up appointment in December. I was first told that my doctor had left the practice. Starting to go downhill.
I was then informed that MGH Dermatology was all booked out until JULY 2025! Nothing available for 9 months. I then contacted Brigham Hospital as they are a sister hospital and was informed that they too are booked out until July 2025. I offered to go to MGH Danvers and was told that they are also booked out until July 2025! Do you see a pattern here?
Then contacted MGH Patient Support services where a very nice gentleman told me would help. (Great!). Shortly following our conversation/e-mails, he got back with me to inform myself that there was nothing available until July 2025.
Is this any way  to run a hospital? I’m looking for a follow up appointment….not a surgical procedure.
If this doesn’t sound very suspicious I don’t know what does.
P.S. I was told by someone who works at MGH Danvers that they only had 3 doctors for the Dermatology Department and MGH has no money to hire more doctors.

Was transfered to this hospital from another hospital due to an abscess in my neck that had developed. I was very nervous due to the fact that this had been an issue before, but the ENT team and infectious disease team were out of this world. They're ensuring to follow up with me so the issue doesn't come back. I had two RNs during my time that were also incredible - Bao and Gio. I had more, but these two I had for longer and stood out. Bao was so kind and attentive when I first got in. She probably noticed I was extremely nervous, and did her best to get me food once I was given the okay, since I hadn't eaten for over 24 hours. Gio was very attentive to my problems and a very calm presence during my time. A great experience overall.

評論內容: Quality beyond expectations!

Oncology services are average. Nothing special. The oncologists consistently pawn off patients to their NPs or PAs with barely any or even no notice. If I wanted a nurse to provide care, I could go to Walgreens or CVS.

But let's talk about accessibility to the entrances. It's like whoever designed this place gave themselves a challenge: How can I make it as inconvenient, troublesome, and confusing as possible for patients to actually get into the hospital? There are only 3 functional entrances to this complex. Most of the doors are locked off. Who knows if they would even work in case of an emergency. Congratulations, Rush should get an award.

Not my experience but the way they just sent my niece home without oxygen and medications is terrible she was out for 2 days and build up fluid soon she went to dialysis Friday they got rid of 4 liters and sent her back to RUSH if you guys are not going to help her please send her somewhere who will she have the state insurance you guys just sending her home to die you all didn’t make sure she had a place to go or a care giver for her and her kids I wouldn’t recommend RUSH to no one and the nurses/staffs are RUDE and can’t communicate with her love ones I’m in a different city or I would of been out there ASAP to the management of RUSH HOSPITAL please make sure your staff is taking care of there patients and not being mean because OF THEIR SICKNESS I will attempt to continue calling and asking questions and reaching out to the higher people.

My mother had a stroke and was admitted into Rush Hospital. ICU is TERRIBLE. Nurse are in the nurses station running around playing and talking, online shopping, scrolling on social media. My mother called the nurse in a took them over an hour to come to her room. She cried and beg them to put her on the toilet and did not want to. My mother has a catheter in because she is in bed rest when first admitted. She had an accident on herself because the catheter did not catch all the urine. The nurse lied on my mother saying she denied getting a bath. Which was never the case she had urine on her she would never deny a bath. The nurses have been having attitudes for any and all my mother’s requests. It’s ridiculous how these nurses are treating my mother who had a stroke. If you're only employing someone a couple of days a week to manage your phone service, those employees MUST be trained to leave detailed messages, that address the question or concern, or that communicate the phone service hours. Calling someone back three days later and leaving a voicemail that says, "We're returning your call please call us back," will just have you perpetually playing phone tag with people. Patients will give up and move on to providers who have full-time phone service.

This review is for my experience in obtaining medical records... was trying to obtain my immunization records. Im not the most tech savvy person , and just have a smart phone to do this ... an older phone at that, no laptop. Dana Faulkenberry fulfilled my request same day and while having to respond to many emails from me , because like i said, im not very tech savvy!! Her patience with me was truly appreciated and she is a true asset to your facility !! Thank you again, Dana!!

Been coming to rush since I gave birth to my daughter who is now 7. Usually the experience is a good one, people are friendly and usually service is fast. Today however I had to bring my child to get blood work done, been here since 8 am and when the doctor sent us to the lab area I was not aware of the scheduling they are now doing. So, now I have to sit in the lab area for 1 hour before my daughter can even be checked in, I was already losing 3 hours of pay for having to be late for this appointment today and had to call my job and see what can be moved around so I can be EVEN LATER AND LOSE MORE HOURS. I am a certified veterinary technician, I have my own patients that require my attention. This shit would never fly in vet med, do you know how many ANGRY clients there would be if they had to wait longer than what they already do?? It is outrageous the protocol for LABWORK at this giant hospital has changed. I mean its labs people, you get poked you leave end of story.

Review for Rush Hospital – EVS Department

I want to bring attention to a deeply concerning and inappropriate incident involving a member of the EVS crew, Karl Flowers. While at the hospital, this employee made sexual and inappropriate comments toward my underage daughter. This type of behavior is absolutely unacceptable, unprofessional, and predatory—especially in a hospital setting where patients and their families should feel safe.

Hospitals are meant to be places of healing and care, not environments where families have to worry about staff making offensive or harmful remarks. I strongly urge Rush Hospital administration to address this matter immediately, investigate this employee’s conduct, and ensure that appropriate actions are taken so no other patient or visitor has to go through a similar experience.

Patient and visitor safety must remain the top priority, and behavior like this cannot be ignored.
Very bad I had surgery over there 😭 kinda of cosmetic surgery ,please don’t go to this worse hospital

This hospital has a lack of sympathy, poor medical documentation/communication, lack of initiative, many blatantly lie to your face/are careless with important medical information, lack in nursing care, and has some stagnant, prideful doctors.

Where u cannot even ask a simple question without them having a problem. Last time I checked that was part of the medical field...to answer questions, to make sure that families fully understand and to look at care on an individual basis. Meaning that you understand that what may work for one, may not work for all.

I will be filing multiple complaints, but knowing that hospitals keep issues internal and swept under the rug, a complaint within their own hospital is no where near enough. I hope the CEO sees this and knowing them it probably won't be important. But do understand that there are SEVERAL medical personnel (doctors, nurses, and front desk staff) that are not fulfilling the ideal role that you pay them for and there is a lack of consistency. They are nasty, sarcastic, and self rightous. They have to be told how to behave in regards to theraputic communication and doing-their-job, which should be concerning. Don't let that “one of the best hospitals” talk fool you. They have some disgusting behavior.

It's utterly heartbreaking that “professionals” could be that cruel in people's lowest point in life. Please by all means, don't let your loved ones be disregarded and shown a lack of sympathy. You have a right not be told you're “receiving top notch care” to further disrespect and disregard your feelings as well as ignore their concerning behavior. Because guess what, there's always someone better. They are not the number one hospital in Illinois ladies and gentlemen, that place belongs to NORTHWESTERN. I wonder if that secret nasty attitude has something to do with it.

Horrible experience dealing w the reception people for Dr. Rotunno’s office. Complete incompetence and talk themselves in circles. I would rather deal with neck pain than to ever go back and deal with these people. They really take the care out of health care.

My daughter was admitted and stayed 2 days on the Kellogg floor. The nurses and doctors were amazing 👏. They treated my daughter & I very kindly. They responded to call lights promptly. I really appreciate you guys.

My recent experience at the Rush University Medical Center emergency room was an absolute nightmare from start to finish. We waited for almost 12 hours to be seen, a completely unacceptable amount of time, especially in what's supposed to be a top-tier medical facility.
The conditions of the ER were truly appalling. The entire place had a persistent, foul smell of urine that was sickening. The floors and walls were visibly filthy, a shocking and completely unacceptable environment for a hospital. It's hard to believe that a medical center with such a reputation could have such a complete disregard for basic cleanliness and sanitation.
This is not just a complaint about a long wait—it's a serious warning about a facility that seems to have completely let go of basic standards of hygiene and patient care. If you have any other options, I would strongly advise you to go somewhere else.

Best hospital! Neurosurgical team are among the best in the United States.  The expertise, the kindness, and the collaboration with other teams ensure the best patient outcomes. Dr. Bryan Moline and “Team Carmen”
WHAT A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!

RUSH UNIVERSITY MEDICAL
CENTER WAS LOVE AT FIRST SIGHT!

The following information is somewhat personal but I will post it anyway because it may help someone who may need A NEW ATTITUDE about their relationship with a medical professional and practitioner.

MY DOCTOR OF 32 YEARS JUST RETIRED. THE FOLLOWING IS MY LETTER TO MY NEW DOCTOR FOLLOWING MY FIRST EXAMINATION.
****************

Greetings Dr. Moline:

Thank you for taking the time to consider my post examination overview and perspective.

On April 21, 2025, I had one of the best doctor examination and visit since my two day physical at the Great Lakes Medical Center and my physical for admission to the United States Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland.

“Nurse Carmen” and your wonderful staff were the major reasons why.

Dr. Moline, I found your medical practice and my physical examination to exceed my extraordinarily high expectations. Your examination was hospitable, educational, extremely professional and informative.

Your humorous delivery caught me by surprise and was a great addition to the entire experience. “You know, I like you”!

For the Record, I did have a medical interaction and event with my Lipitor Statin medication that I need to bring to your attention for memorialization.

After taking the Lipitor as directed with anticipated as advised side affects [not effects] for the first seven days I experienced mild, then more moderate symptoms of stomach aches and discomfort.

The discomfort level ranged from mild pain and all the way to like a boiler maker pre-stool expected experience.

The medication side affects notice provided adequate warning of what I was to expect!

I did stay away from grape fruit as cautioned, but I did consume an inordinate quantity and unnecessary quantity of Citrus tangerines as usual three times a day each and every day!

My stool felt like it was going to be in the form of diarrhea but to my surprise the firm and fairly normal stool literally had a splash of fresh bright red blood!

Without panic I studied the pharmacy print out for side affects. I also googled the active ingredients in Grapefruit that is found in all other Citrus fruits.

Taking myself off of all Citrus including my favorite Grapefruit flavor soda “Squirt” seemed to help and had the affect of resolving my challenge.

Due to the foregoing circumstance I elected to postpone the ColoGuard screening until later this week for Sunday. I did not want to contaminate any stool samples that would render any negative results.

I have also elected to eliminate carbs from my one meal a day weight management strategy for the next ninety days! I have scheduled my Weight Loss therapy for the first day after my upcoming visit with Carmen and her wonderful Brigade of Medical Professionals and Practitioner.

On the positive side I have an exhilarating feeling of joy and accomplishment in my body. I also believe that my tolerance for inflammation may have improved significantly or have been reduced   or eliminated all together.

Either way I believe that my “perfect ten” objective has been achieved!

Please let me know if there are any measures that I should be aware of.

Dr. Moline, thank you for your time, efforts, and professional support and consideration.

I can hardly wait for my follow up appointment in July.

The Associated Press would be impressed with my word count! HAVE A GREAT DAY!

You may use this information and memorandum in any manner that can benefit you, your staff and medical practice or my fellow patients. No Privacy Rights reserved.

MAY THE PEACE OF THE LORD CONTINUE TO GO WITH YOU!🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

~LCIII
Hinsdale, Illinois

I've used RUSH for decades. It's been going severely downhill the last several years. I am now looking for alternatives. The experiences in past years in RUSH keep confirming the fact that they care only about money and not much else. Multiple times providers do unnecessary procedures, resulting in massive billing later. Most of my interactions there, you feel like a customer and not a patient. And beware - billing at RUSH is times more expensive than anywhere else. MRI here is over $2300 - you can get the same done and read for $300-400. Minor manipulations that your doctor might do to you (seemingly as part of your visit) can result in - $5000-6000 bills. Be really careful at RUSH and best take yourself anywhere else. Majority of the effort at RUSH seems to be going into maximizing how much they can squeeze both from the insurance companies and you. The experience here really is a bright example of everything wrong about the state of Healthcare in the US. Really not something you would expect from a teaching hospital in a democratic city. Sad.

I saw Rush last month and paid my surgery in full.  The insurance company came in under by a lot and I am due the difference.   Rush billing feels they can hold my money for a much smaller amount on a line item on a claim that was denied appropriately and was a duplicate of another from back in Feb.

I have had great care at rush but the billing dept is going to force me to go back to Endeavor Health.

I don’t want a reply here to reach out to your customer service number either.   Have your billing office stop behaving in unscrupulous ways!!

Never Rush!

Predatory billing department. The man that answered the phone gave me an estimate of what I would owe, then bullied me into upfront payment despite the fact that my procedure is covered at 100% by ACA, which my insurance confirmed. The phone rep resorted to the following tactics: insulting me, long silences, using intimidating language. I asked him several yes or no questions and he kept dodging them.

The stars I leave are for the NURSES on the 7th floor atrium. Shout out to the nurse that partied with me all night long after my procedure. I had a rough start after my procedure and was in a lot of pain. She was on top of my Care and checking on me every hour in the middle of the night. Her name is Dominique I believe.  (Dom) is what she wrote on the board. And the male nurse Slav the next day. He saved his patience life two doors away from mine who basically coded. He got me everything I needed to take Care of my procedure wounds upon discharging me and really explained himself thoroughly. As far as my procedure goes and the doctors office public relations will be hearing from me.

Dr.Eggerstedt was AMAZING it’s to bad the billing dept wasn’t the same. I was called the day after surgery for another $2268.51 I had to pay under a no surprise clause the hospital has so I paid it now they can’t find it imagine that!!!! Then I was told they didn’t bill my insurance company so I owe the money well out of the clear blue sky my insurance paid it! Now I’m owed the money one would think with all the computer technology they have they can just click a button to find it, well I clicked a button on my apple phone and was able to find the credit in my account proving they have it. I’m telling you if it was their money tied up for 6 months they wouldn’t like it. Months of them investigating and I still don’t have answers is pathetic. Do better Rush! I will never recommend this hospital to anyone ever!!!! The last thing I want to hear is your sorry. No more BS just a check in the mail ty

Great hospital. The care for my brother after his heart surgery yesterday 4/15, ICU great team thank you doctor and surgery team and nurses. 💙❤️💙❤️
Unfortunately some of the security guards and receptionist on the 4th floor were either rude, unprofessional and or NEED more customer service experience.
Everyone is friendly and goes out of their way to accommodate you. Dr Lubenow is the very best doctor!  He holds his students to high standards.

I came in on a very bad day for them I feel like they were under staffed a sibling of mine ha d a injury on his thumb pretty bad I thought he needed stitches after sitting in the hospital from 7-2  after going  back and forth from rooms to the waiting area they told me he just needed to clean it well and be doesn’t need stitches being told that new at 11 I thought I was gonna leave in the next 30-45 minutes I was left in the room. For 40 minutes they came in and cleaned his  finger and rapped it and provided me with the ointments and wraps he needed after leaving to get his paper worker they didn’t return until  another 30-40  hours later.
The doctors were compassionate smart and truly helpful. Every nurse I had was so nice and helpful. Rush is my new hospital of choice.
They left me 4h waiting with food jammed in my esophagus and puking saliva non stop. I have never experienced worse care

Many things went wrong in my time at rush, my surgeon LEFT OUT the part when he informed me and my family about how he was going to take a piece of my bone, I had been told he was just going to scrape the infected or dead bone away to test it in which I only got informed he took a piece of my bone when I woke up, also I’m a minor but they had me in the adult wing rather than in the children’s wing also my doctor refused to listen to mine and my family’s concerns, when we asked him what to do about my continued pain he just said “we will wait and see in 3 months” so I sat in pain for three months with no relief and no answers about what my condition is, on top of everything a nurse was repeatedly on her phone on call with someone the whole time when I woke up, have to say that both the bedside manners and the medical care was not the best.

What is going on with the doctors and scheduling at Rush? It’s bad enough it takes forever to see a doctor no matter what doctor you want to see. The Video visits aren’t any faster to book. Even to see a nurse practitioner it takes almost as long  to see an actual doctor ( are you short on doctors) ? I made an appointment with A Doctor Salazar months ago and was given appointment date May 1, 2025 only to recently be told that I have to wait till June ( 3 months to see doctor now 4.). Then the end of March I made an appointment for physical  medicine rehab to evaluate, consult and treat a problem (  and I was given appointment for 4/15/2025 ( wow that was quick). Then a couple of days later I received a call stating my appointment was made with the wrong doctor( seriously ) and will have to be canceled.  Now to wait for someone to call me to reschedule with correct doctor & appointment ( the referral is in the system) I feel Rush is failing it’s patients, why is it taking so long to get an appointment with a doctor now a days and the correct one at that. Cancelled appointments that take forever to get or appointments made with wrong doctors, long wait in the ER and some appointments we are seen more than  30 minutes pass scheduled time. How is Rush supposedly one of the top hospital when people have to wait so long and dumb mistakes are made? After more than 20 yrs with Rush   I feel it’s time to start looking for another place for medical care.

I'm happy with my care here but the crooked billing practices are disappointing. Medical billing is separated into physician services and hospital services and Rush will always bill you for both. Even for procedures I've gotten done at their satellite clinics they'll find an excuse to send it to the hospital and bill me  for multiple dubious services. Hospital services are WAY more expensive and getting them tacked on to everything I get done is absolutely wild. From now on I suggest going to freestanding clinics instead of this unless you've got some peak insurance.

I’ve been to the ER twice in one month and was never seen. I stayed for hours and never seen by a physician. I use to love this hospital. Instead it’s turning out as one of the worst places for me to go. Staff are rude and never have an answer for you. I won’t be going back.

Hands down one of the worst hospitals I’ve ever been at. The filthiest hospitals I’ve ever been in. Public restrooms were nasty! I’ve been in cleaner truck stop bathrooms! Even in the rest of the hospital things laying on the floor and employees just walk by it! Very noisy also don’t know how they expect patients to get any rest. The nurses for the most part were excellent the rest of the staff pitiful at best. They spend more time on their phones doing non job related stuff. I even seen one employee operating a ride on floor scrubber while messing around with his phone!! Yes and the food options are terrible! The cafeteria closed at 2:00 pm and is not even open on the weekends! I’ve been at hospitals all over the country and have NEVER been at on like that. The Panera is terrible! Ate there twice and was sick to my stomach. The food and the service are terrible!!

I was there for a doctor's consultation. After speaking with the doctor his nurse came into the office and asked me if I wanted to have my labs at my home town hospital or at RUSH?  I have to admit from the time my daughter and I  walked into the the lobby of RUSH until we left, we felt like we were seen, heard and treated with respect.  We were greeted with smiles and assisted to were we had to go.  I had my EKG and labs at RUSH to avoid rushing home to have them done along with the other pre-op items I had to do.
I appreciate the team making my exams and consultation go so smoothly.
Thank you and GOD bless.

I had a bone scan on 3/26. I’ve had multiple bone scans before, but this experience was different. A gentleman escorted me to the room where my scan would take place, but he did not mention that he was in training. There was also a woman present, but she did introduce herself, but did not explain her role.

Once the scan began, I was placed in the machine. After a few minutes, they took me out and then put me back in. When I asked what had happened, the woman said I had moved my head. However, I take these scans regularly, and I always remain still, my son was there and witnessed the entire process.

The trainee seemed confused while looking at my scan on the computer and she kept asking the other staff member questions, which became frustrating and uncomfortable for me. I wish they had explained what was going on beforehand instead of leaving me in the middle of an unclear situation.

Additionally, when the scan was over, the staff member was supposed to walk me to the exit. However, she stopped midway and just pointed out where the doors were instead. This experience felt unprofessional and left me feeling uneasy. Clear communication and better patient care would have made a big difference.

Careful of billing. Charge "technical" charges to insurance, where other hospitals do not. Usually go to Northwestern, but decided to get a 2nd opinion and was shocked with the "technical" charge to my insurance.

I gave birth here in 2022, it took me this long to finally leave this review. TL;DR - I was ignored and gaslit despite having no pain relief to speak of and had a horrible birth experience.

I went in to be induced (41 weeks), that experience was fine, they were fairly on top of things and I had good nurses.  All of my complaints come into play once I was moved to the active labor room.

They were supposed to help with changing positions and things to keep my labor progressing but really only one nurse said anything about it.  No one really gave consideration to my birth preferences that I shared with multiple people (such as not wanting to labor on my back which I ended up doing).  The contractions from being induced came on very strong so I decided to get an epidural.  The epidural did not work, they tried to “flood the area” to make it work but this was unsuccessful.  Other pain medication interventions that were supposed to be available (nitrous oxide and Fentanyl) were said to be unavailable due to a leak they had in the storage room and a national shortage.  I was not made aware of this until I was asking about them after, so though I was not at all prepared to, I delivered without pain medication and so many people were in and out I had to keep repeating that the epidural wasn’t working and other things like that I could not breastfeed due to my prior BMX.

Despite Rush claiming they were pro movement and pro your preferences, I was kept on my back (didn’t seem like I had a choice) and was argued with by a nurse regarding how long I wanted my son to stay attached to his umbilical cord.

3 other women went into labor at the same time as me.  The resident was very good, I really liked her I wish I remembered her name I just know she was a black woman.  I was progressing through active labor well enough (on my damn back), and then the doctor came in in a huge rush like a drill sergeant, told the resident what she was doing wasn’t helpful (even though it was to me but I was in too much pain to say anything).  She did not listen at all and was just trying to get me to push as fast as possible without listening to my body or limitations and when I was shaking and in a ton of pain she just kept repeating to hit the epidural button more and refused to listen/understand that the epidural was fully worthless to me (no matter what me or my husband or sister were telling her).  To the point where once I had given birth to my son and she was stitching me up, I could feel everything and was telling her that (I don’t believe she used any local because she still thought the epidural was working and I was being dramatic I guess).  So after wincing pretty hard at once of her stitches she said, “It is like a dull pressure?” (what you would feel with a working epidural) and I said, “No, it’s sharp and piercing, like a needle.” She got real quiet and you could just see it FINALLY sink in that I was feeling everything.

I was left with bad postpartum depression and slight panic episodes in those early days thinking back to my birth experience.

I’ve been in the ER with my 85-year-old father-in-law for over five hours. He’s diabetic, in severe pain, and suffering from weeping edema, yet he’s not considered a priority. I had to repeatedly ask the nurse before they finally applied a dry wrap to manage the leaking fluids. In all this time, I haven’t seen a single member of the housekeeping staff clean the waiting area. The garbage cans are overflowing, and the entire ER is disgustingly dirty. This level of neglect—both in patient care and cleanliness—is completely unacceptable.

Insanely hard time to get parking validation. My fiance had surgery  and was later admitted due to pain after. We were never given a validation and by the time we left supposedly everyone that validates was gone. I was sent 3 different places before having to go all the way back to the emergency room.

Wow after all of the reviews I’m glad that I did not decide to go through with my procedure at Rush. My personal experience was bad with the staff the ones who answer and transfer calls… I wish Dr. Shenaq could be seen at another location because I wouldn’t go to rush for ANYTHING. Always check reviews, but I must give flowers when due Dr.D. Shenaq is the truth and she is genuine

Not impressed with oncology dept.
And All Gender bathrooms? Seriously, Rush?  I just love washing my hands and having a big, strange guy come out of the stall next to me.  Is there something wrong with women's and men's bathrooms?  It's worked just fine all these years.

It’s really hard for me to put into words my experience with this hospital, but I’m going to try. My mom who is 70 years old named Tosha Feliciano had two aneurysms in her aorta. So our first experience with Rush was the cardiology department which has an exceptional lineup of doctors and she was able to be paired with Dr. Michele Richard. A truly incredible surgeon that spoke to my mom with such kind love and care. She was able to repair both of those aneurysms flawlessly. To the surgery check-in staff on the fifth floor they are absolutely amazing. Vicki holds it down and absolutely has the best spirit. My mom ended up on the 12th floor and had an amazing nurse named Sara. The occupational therapy staff there is absolutely amazing. They’re on the 12th floor as well. Hospitals can be a really scary place, especially when you’re dealing with the person that you ultimately may love most. They showed her the care and love that. I feel that they would really give their family. I can’t recommend this hospital enough. We even had one of the former cardiology department heads named Anne, that made sure we also had the best care of the entire time. if your family member is having cardiology issues and is looking for a second opinion or you’re looking for a new cardiology department, I can’t recommend these doctors enough there. Stay blessed Rush Staff. The Felicianos. (Also, the first floor by the valet parking has the cutest little floral shop with the nicest girl that works there)

I was in the ED for all of 6 hours, I k kept trying to convince my daughter that I had to get her to a neurologist ASAP, and we were told by the neurologists office that the quickest way to an appointment was through the ED. I had been to this emergency department before, my daughters both told me not to do it because they remembered the past visit. I ALWAYS DO A IN TOLD, so with high hopes, I should usage stayed away from the hospital I vowed NEVER TO GO BACK TO!!! As in a flouting for punishment I listen to a staff member. Our experience was horrific, as they have a track record for, at least they are consistent... I DO WANT TO CALL THE RECEPTIONISTS ATTENDING THE ADMISSIONS AREA, VERY PROFESSIONAL AND VERY SWEET, NO MATTER HOW MANY PEOPLE APPROACHED HER SHE WAS VERY KIND TO THEM. As a side note, one person in that waiting room rubbed me the wrong way! An ER NURSE by the name of Amy, is like to say, it may seem like you are doing some good by educating other people's children by your Snyde comments to the child attitude as a old time old teacher, do not roll your eyes and speak to other people's children the way you think is appropriate! My child has a disability (as a nurse you think your brain would pick up on that), and yes she laughed at something that was inappropriate, but you don't know what her disability brings her to, she is now getting help with her mental health, and it's because of people like YOU!!! Next time speak to other people's children with courtesy, because you took me by storm last night, you remember me, the disabled one with the cane and riding in a Rush wheelchair. Yeah me with the 2 daughters! I would give this rating A zero, but there's no possible way!!!

Thank God for a job well done; Open Heart Cardiac Operation. All of the Doctors preformed their job with excellence; Dr. Frank, Antone Tatooles, MD, Hussam Suradi, MD,  William Stansfield, MD and my favorite, Dr. Lisa Garland . No wonder I healed so quickly! The Nursing Staff was pleasant and met every need, some even before I knew there was a need. Thank God for Cruz, Heedy, Jaci, Kevin, Amy, Mateo, Maria, Ivana, Will, and Daniel, to name a few. I would like each one to receive the Daisy Award. I ask for an exception for the lateness of the request. My hands were not well enough to complete a form at the time.
Now I am functioning much better and continuing to heal. My energy is returning. Thank God the blood is flowing through-out my body.
Sincerely,
Victoria Christmas

I was very happy with the care here with my mother. We were there for consult on a surgery . But as they listen to our concerns and what we needed to help my mother with cancer. They immediately admitted her. Everyone came in, no waiting for room. The doctors came in to see what my mother needed and if she was in pain and how they can help. I was pleased to see this ,coming a long distance. I was good to leave my mother in good care.  From the front end  with valet and to the direction to where i needed to go. To the admission to when i left i was happy. I thank you all . Especially the young lady that said she been there 30 years she was amazing getting us to admission .

This review does not pertain to the medical care I received at rush rather the safety instead. While I was admitted to rush over the last week from the er, on one of the days that I was there when taken down by transport to have an echo done all of my credit cards were stolen from my wallet in my room. Upon realizing my credit cards were stolen in the 1hr I had left the room, I immediately contacting security who tried convincing me not to file a report. Thankfully the nurse repeatedly advised them that I did in fact want to file a report. Upon filing a report both myself as well as my family feared that the suspect would come back in retaliation to my room and I did not sleep well until I was discharged. Earlier While transport was there to pick me up, I stupidly in a conversation stated out loud to my husband as he was leaving with me, “my wallet is in my jacket” informing the transport where my wallet is unknowingly (I was not well and also not in the right state of mind). I did not expect that in a hospital while I’m unwell would someone go into my room steal my credit cards and time it during the 1hr I left the room for the whole day. I’m highly disappointed with this. My medical team was exceptional, and gave me outstanding care. But the ending of my visit left me shaken and afraid. This was completely unacceptable.
This hospital and staff saved my husband's life and the helped us with cancer resources love love this hospital great staff great Drs

I was admitted to the medsurg floor. The nursing staff were amazing. They were kind, patient and there for my needs. The doctors on site were amazing as well. The few transport employees I encountered were very kind and personable. Even the food service employees. The only issue is Case management is a nightmare they sadly are the only negative experience. They dont meet with you even upon requests. They dont keep you informed and updated. 5 days of requesting to see them ( even with nursing staff advising them as well) ... crickets. Only one from Case management that had gave me any acknowledgement was Omar.

From start to finish all I experience was great patient care. I arrived really early for my appointment, but they were even willing to see if I could be seen earlier. It worked out wonderful. Adam was so great and patient and kind and passionate just to type of service you were looking for when you’re a patient in pain, he was even able to show me what he was saying while doing my Echo. Thank you so much for being so kind.
Very kind nice and professional

Dr. Amune is positively the finest pain management doctor! My husband and I are both patients of Dr. Amune. He is amazing and so is everyone on his staff! He is the most compassionate, brilliant doctor we have visited. He finds the best treatment for each problem and his knowledge is unbelievable. He uses the most advanced technology during his procedures to obtain the very best results. He helps so many patients become pain free and avoid surgery.
the entire staff was amazing!!
great experience getting my procedure

It was a joy for me visiting AdventHealth for my medical treatment. It is interesting to note that I actually look forward to going for my medical treatments. The staff all make me feel cared for and that I really matter. They are kind, caring, supportive, polite and professional in their dealings with each patient. They work very well together to care for me and all the other patients.

I just checked in to get seen and Veronica Flores went above and beyond to make sure I’m comfortable and that’s not even her job duties! She even went as far as putting socks on my feet!!! Please tell her thanks again for me 🖤  I hope she gets the recognition she deserves  💐

Best experience. Mom was there for 2 weeks in Orthopedics. Everyone was amazing with her.
Thank you so much

Your scheduling department is perhaps the worst I have ever encountered. It took them a full thirty days to tell me that the procedure I needed could not be done because of a change in policy. Thirty days of being sent from one person to another. Thirty days of clear incompetence and thirty days of people not caring.
Workers very nice and friendly, no waiting for appointments 😍
Friendly fast service questions answered problems solved

My new ER.
The ER at Waterman could not treat me for a blown vein in my chest.
They kept me over night to do nothing.
The ER at South was on top of my pain and operated soon after I drove in from Eustis,  FL.

Adventhealth doctors and nurses as well as all the staff have treated me with dignity and respect
Thanks for all they are doing for me

Always very professional,  and they care so much about your situation!

Thos time however; it took 4. Yes FOUR times poked to get my blood for testing!!

Recently I stayed at Advent Health Orlando for an Ostomy reversal surgery.
The procedure was long and intense and my recovery was painful and slow.
But thanks to the very nice staff at Advent Health I was able to recover and get my strength back. All the doctors, nurses , assistants and other care workers were  so patient and sweet.  And it means a lot when we are treated with respect and understanding.
Thank you all ! ♥️

I noticed there was a lack of effective communication between the doctor's office, the insurance company, and the hospital where the MRI was performed. I had to wait over a month for the prostate exam and another month to see my urologist again.
Dr. Amune is a Godsend to me because not many doctors treat trigeminal neurolgia and he is kind, patient and answers all my questions. I never feel rushed. The stall are amazing as well!

From diagnostics to appointment set up and through discharge from the hospital after surgery the AdventHealth team crushed my expectations.  Service, care, pre and post surgical treatment were well beyond the pale.  Except for the pain (my problem) I couldn't have "enjoyed" a better experience.

AventHealth Orlando Hospital took very good care of my husband who had open heart surgery--they were amazing.  Because my husband has Parkinson's recovery has been very slow.  Care Management dropped the ball for communicating inpatient rehab options.  They are very hard to reach by phone (call not answered by human or voicemail) and slow to meet with me for a final solution.  My poor husband has been waiting in limbo for a week at the hospital awaiting transfer to a rehab facility.  So far, there seemingly is no real help provided and no one to turn to at AdventHealth to get the rehab issue resolved.  BTW ... don't depend on United Health Care for medicare insurance support either when involved in difficult surgeries such as open heart.

Very good experience at Disney Pavilon,
My only complaint is at the lobby there is a beautiful bible scripture and it was hide for a plant, I really apréciate if can move the plant and we can clearly read the Bible scripture about the gift our kids are. I think it is Psalm 127:3

Everyone was awesome!   From the initial scheduling process, to the check in at the office, to the procedure preparation, and finally the discharge everybody went above and beyond!  They were personable, professional, patient, and above all nice!
The only problem I had was finding a parking space. There are no handicap spots near the building entrance. Otherwise, the staff and physicians are pleasant and helpful.
The nurse and staff were very nice
The nurses  were all great I couldn't have asked for better care than what I received thanks for the great care.

Great staff, great service looking forward to my next visit. However, upon checking in I was placed on a hold because administrative documentation was not found in my file. After about an hour of waiting I was called into the office to sign a promise to pay in case Medicare declined payment document. This being the third time I visited AdventHealth for the same procedure I do not understand what caused this new delay. I had pre registered online as before.

My daughter recently relocated to Florida and has sent all her records in to transfer her prenatal care to Advent. I had read that this was a good hospital. Only to find out that my daughter has been calling with nobody helping her get scheduled. Someone names Erica was supposed to reach out to her and the team has confirmed my daughter'a records have been received. Each time my daughter calls the response is "we'll call you back" but nobody ever does. Just today she has called twice. She should not have to deal with this frustration. As a nurse care manager myself, this is completely unacceptable.
Nice staff. It’s a busy hospital but you feel well taken care off
Great people make u feel comfortable.
They would like my family helping me with everything

Oh my goodnees... first impression was overwhelming and confusing from the size of the complex... and where to park?  We happened to park correctly at the end of the day.  We were there to consult about lung transplant and anxious to get all the info.
We had to go over 2 bridges and to last 2 hrs through lung tests... then waiting for transport to take us back over the bridge. I have to say transport was way behind and had us running late to our appts. We were a little stressed over that. But we did finally make it to our consultation with doctor.
All receptionists and staff were as helpful as possible.
Doc was 2 hours worth of the best information  .. she took her time to answer all questions and fill in some we didn't  even ask. One of the best consultations we have ever had medically relating to my COPD. and how it relates to possibly getting a lung transplant.
We left with a great experience .
Awesome Nursing staff at the Florida Hospital outpatient IV infusion unit! Could not have had better care! Thank you, Rob Gaynor D.O.
Every employee is most friendly and caring!

My husband Went to the ER with Afib and they had a doctor and team working on my husband! They made us feel comfortable and they took good care of my husband! Shocked his heart and we headed home an hour or so afterwards! We love the good care and attention that was giving to my husband and I! I always recommend AdventHealth Celebration! We also had good care as well at AdvventHealth Orlando!

I had a natural delivery at this hospital. My doctor, Veronica Flores, CNM, left and went home during the early hours, even though we had previously discussed which hospitals she works at so I could schedule my delivery accordingly. She had told me that at this hospital, she would be my doctor — but during labor, my doctor was changed.

The doctor who administered and inserted the epidural injection didn’t do it correctly. My right leg became numb, but it didn’t have much effect on my left leg, and I could still feel pain during my contractions. Unfortunately, I witnessed a lot of inexperience.

Dr. Deb came into my room only during the final hours of labor and kept saying that everything was going well. I asked for more epidural several times, but the nurses refused to give me any additional doses, and I was in severe pain. After enduring so much pain and difficulty, she finally told me that the baby’s head had not turned properly and that I needed a C-section — even though four hours earlier, she had told me that the baby had turned and everything was going fine.

In the end, I had a C-section, and the nurses and doctors in the C-section ward were very kind, professional, and more experienced. Unfortunately, I had a very traumatic experience with my natural delivery at this hospital.
Advent Hospital is absolutely amazing.  I have never had such a wonderful experience at a hospital in my life.  I would highly recommend it.

The Blue Team was so professional and friendly.  I was so comfortable in asking them questions and they in turn answering.  The Team was so knowledgeable …I would recommend the Blie Team anytime.   Brian

The worst experience ever in Radiology — zero empathy toward children with special needs.

Extremely disappointing experience.
My son, who autism, had an MRI scheduled for 8:30 a.m. and we were told to arrive by 7:00 a.m. We got there early, but the staff was unfriendly, unempathetic, and cold from the beginning.

They chose to isolate us in a room because of his condition, which felt completely wrong. My son was irritable from fasting since the night before, yet we were kept waiting until almost 10:00 a.m. before they even started.

It’s heartbreaking that a hospital like AdventHealth Orlando allows such insensitive treatment toward children with special needs.
I truly hope no other family has to go through what we experienced that day.
For one thing my last name is not Shawn. It Is Shaw. Ok Shaw
This medical team literally saved my life! From ER triage to surgery to follow-ups to on-going appointments, I am CANCER FREE!
Amazing people.  "Except" those people who transport you from the "ER" to a room.

Pre-surgical team and nurses were fantastic.  ALL were friendly, professional, accommodating, etc. Couldn't ask for more.  I'm talking nurses, maintenance, kitchen, it didn't matter what department you interacted with, just super people. Post surgical and ICU unit just as GREAT, but can't say a lot about staff after returning to regular care.  All very young, seemed somewhat inexperienced, and a couple had not the best of attitudes.
I had a very good experience with Advent health.
UPON MY VISIT THE STAFF AT ADVENT HEALTH WERE VERY PROFESSIONAL N VERY HELPFUL
Staff was very friendly, helpful and informative.  They followed up with me after surgery to see how I was doing and answered all my questions. Excellent experience.
Advent is my favorite hospital, I have only ever received the best care there from ER to Admissions to Teledoc. The staff are kind and caring and I have no complaints at all.
Was treated in timely manner the nurse was very nice and asked the correct questions
I always have a good experience.
I could not even get a nurse bring me eyes or a ginger ale. I was tired of hitting the buzzer no one ever came in the room to check.
My experience with AdventhHealth Orlando have always been good, everyone is courteous, friendly and helpful. The staff goes above and beyond.
From the moment you walk in you feel like they care.

Well I went to the emergency room for a servere hs flare up and stomach pain the staff is really nice the hospital is very clean the doctor  was very non hands on he didn't examine me at all he had his nurse do it Jennifer  was very  nice and professional like a little  ninja  but these doctors now and days are not like  they use to be they don't  want to touch  and examine you. He did not  give me my results properly  Jennifer did other than that care was good  that's  the reason  for the the 4 stars instead of 5
I like  AdventHealth because  they very  understanding  people

Amazingly they were super accommodating s as to when i could be seen. It helped out tremendously for my schedule. The technicians there were two Sade and i think Jennifer. They both must be extremely experienced as they had incredible bedside manner and made me feel comfortable despite being cramped in a machine that is whirring around me quite quickly.  The reception was also incredibly nice thoughtful and helpful.  Overall a wonderful experience for imaging.
Just had a kidney transplant at Advent Health Orlando . The Drs and staff were outstanding , I couldn’t be more pleased

The majority of the staff were great and caring.  I was in severe pain dealing with a gallbladder attack, pancreatitis and an inflamed liver. Once a was stable two nights later I was able to have surgery. After surgery and and ercp, I was left with an incapable nurse Nordica who read my chart to say I had a procedure in the morning so I couldn’t have any more pain meds because all the orders were for pills and the procedure required me to have nothing by mouth. I screamed in pain most of the night begging for help. My husband tried to advocate for me. Other staff came to check on me telling me to make sure I told my morning nurse my issue. Thankfully by 7am the surgical team came to check in me and were confused I was in so much pain, Thankfullu, by then I had a new nurse. Kristina came to check on me about every 45 minutes, trying to help me improve my level of pain. By noon I was finally able to eat and able to move without being so miserable. Next thing I know a nurse lead is coming to tell me I’m being discharged. I begged for the ability to stay. Asked my surgeon, ask the PT, and asks my nurse for advice.  all who recommended I stay. I cried to the nurse lead stating I just now felt stable and was afraid to go home with less meds than were available at the hospital. The Lead never gave her name and was very dismissing of my concern. My sister tried to help advocate, and then my husband. Eventually I was getting worked up and it was increasing my pain more. Thankfully another nurse came to try and help. However, a couple hours later I was told that a Dr.Dobson who I have no recollection of meeting was in charge and I had to go home, and we better hurry to the pharmacy before they close. When my husband picked up the meds I realized that the dosage was half the amount I car been given over the last couple hours. In a panic I asked again for help and was denied and further treatment. I’m a usually healthy person. I’ve only been in the hospital last to deliver my baby 21 years ago. I do my best to see my primary regularly, have labs and ensure I am taking care of myself.  Additionally , I have decent insurance.  I have no idea why I was denied care and treated in such a way.  Advent would usually be my preferred hospital. They have sent emails and asked for my review, the even sent me this Google link asking for my opinion. Sadly no one has reached out to check and see what was the issue.  Not apology was made for an inept nurse and Doctor who apparently doesn’t have bedside manner or the ability to check on his patient but can make choices for people or deny healthcare to people.
Everyone was efficient, professional, personable, and accommodating!
Highly organized and very communicative
The nurse was very nice and so was dotcors if I have to go to hospital  it will advent health and my family
Woundcare they're all very friendly goo pinkyeam

This was my second time here at the hospital I was here in May for left hip replacement and everyone was excellent people I came in October for my second hip replacement on the right side at the same hospital and am very excited everything was great and the nurses all was wonderful people and good food too.
Great care, outstanding healthcare professionals.

This was a fine hospital , everyone was very professional and courteous. Had a nice room with view of the area. Being an older  man, first time stay in a hospital.  Would given 5 stars , but felt totally too much blood work taken for my liking.

The entire experience is amazing. May sound crazy, but I’ve been battling with cancer for 3 years (ALL), and from the first step into the doors of AdventHealth Orlando, everyone treats me with care, respect, and kindness. They make me feel important. The care is always amazing. If you’re battling with cancer, I recommend AH Orlando. I’m living proof.
Everybody was very polite, Helpful, Courteous, anything I needed.They helped me with we've been going here for 10 years.I've loved it every since the day I walked in the door.

I didn't feel as welcomed this time. I had to be stuck 3 times, although I know that happens sometimes even with  good veins. The Graham crackers were stale. However the infusion went well without difficulty.
Appointment rescheduled

While nobody enjoys a visit to the ER, our experience today was truly amazing.  Everyone we met from Our EMT -Rebecca, nurse - Christina, and Dr. Matto were all so kind and so caring.  We feel so thankful to have met them and to be under their care at a scary time.   Many,  many thanks!
They are the best customers service, and the doctor Ruben is the best.

I appreciate the care that I've received so far. The only issue I had was the nurse in the recovery room after my procedure who seem to be trying to rush me to get up and go home. When it was clear that I was not feeling well at all that I needed a little bit more time to recover from my anesthesia
All of the staff exhibit genuine care for the patients and are willing to go out of their way to make sure that all of your needs are met.

I usually love my experience at Advent Health but every time I call, the operator always has a HUGE attitude before I even say anything. And when I have a question, they cut you off and give you the wrong answer. I was very nice and pleasant to the representative and they just hung up on me.
the place was amazing. clean , professional . i have gone for pt a lot but never advent health. i will never change. its shocking the difference in pt at other places. i give it more then 5 stars.

I had a hemmoroidectomy under general anesthesia.  Before I woke up, a numbing medicine was administered.  It lasted 4 days and so I was only mildly uncomfortable!!!  Dr.  Matthew Albert is the surgeon you want!  I highly recommend him (and then you can disregard the horror stories you read on the internet)!  The entire staff at Advent Heslth was excellent - that includes the pre and post surgery nurses, the anesthesiologist, and of course Dr Albert.  I was told what to expect every step of the way.  And then when I got home, they check on you via an app where you can address any concerns.  I believe my recovery was so speedy (about 3 days) because I had a great surgeon!!!!  I didn’t even need to take any pain meds.  Great job Advent Health and Dr Albert!!!
So far I taking Nutrition Classes and I learned a lot,  every body in the Staff  Nurses has been very supportive and helpful.
Everything was perfect and I really appreciate
Dr Walsh went over all of my recent test results and history and provided recommendations for my care going forward.
I had a small tumor removed from my Kidney and had a great experience.  Dr Russell and his team were exceptional.

My treatment at Advent Orlando has been nothing short of 100% perfection.
Each nurse that took care of me showed unrivaled compassion and care.

Thank you Advent Health for Dominic Yu!!!
I am nominating Outstanding Registered Nurse Dominic Yu for the Daisy Award because he not only meets ALL the criteria for nomination, but I am also nominating him for his commendable work with my son, from Oct 7  to Oct 8.
Dominic exceeds the standards of professional excellence in his work, leaving no detail undone, with a loving passion and total dedication to his work, always going the extra mile. Advent Health has well-experienced RNs, but Dominic exceeds all expectations and represents Advent Health as an Institution of High Excellence. HR should include the specific model of the work he did with my son in the ICU in special training seminars for other professionals! Thank you, Dominic! You are a star! I treasure your outstanding service and love! Thank you Advent Health!
Everyone I encountered were extremely supportive and nice.
Reliable, nurses and staff members always kind and caring.

Great Healthcare, saved my life life twice, and with the exception of one nasty nurse the most caring Healthcare workers I've ever had the pleasure 🙏  of having met. Wonderful place for sick people who actually care about you living or dying and really will work with you when it comes to bill time as well, can't say enough about how helpful they are
It was terrific. Great staff.
Advent health hospital tavares is wonderful place to be when u are at ur worst.

DO NOT GO HERE!!! My father in law had to go here for open heart surgery & they kicked him out after 5 day’s to go to a nursing home. We specifically said over & over that we wanted him at an inpatient cardiovascular rehab. Instead of them saying “Hey, you know what? Everyday someone was in the room asking him for a survey instead of focusing on his care. As a nurse I’m truly disgusted & wouldn’t put my worst enemy here. I would’ve taken him to Orlando Health which is a teaching hospital with a level I trauma center, they also have an inpatient rehab. Please do not go here they are awful & all they care about is money.

The staff at AdventHealth Orlando are truly exceptional, from pre-op registration to the surgical team on the 3rd floor. Dr. Chohan, my former pulmonologist, also demonstrates outstanding knowledge and bedside manner, and both doctors receive my highest praise.
My primary care physician, Dr. Luis Barba in Orange City, is exceptional—his knowledge, skill, and genuine compassion set him apart. Dr. Bennett my pulmonologist at Fish Memorial is also fantastic, combining professional excellence with empathy for her patients. Dr. Hall, who performed my oral surgery, was communicative and caring, and his team ensured I was well-supported after the procedure.
The pulmonary rehabilitation team at AdventHealth Orlando provides thorough and encouraging support, equipping patients with tools to succeed while making everyone feel welcome.
I cannot recommend AdventHealth Orlando and these dedicated providers highly enough.

I have congestive heart failure and I am here in this hospital with pain in my chest for 3 days . Because the nurses can't get in touch with a doctor . They are even giving me medication that I am allergic to. To try to help with the pain . And nothing is happening.  Its really sad to see and hear that doctors that are in a high position not doing there jobs.  So please do your job or advent health needs to hold you responsible for what happens to a patient.  This place is the 2nd worst hospital I've been in.

I LOVE ❤️ Dr. Gordon and his staff. A great staff is the reflection of a GREAT Leader. I will be his patient until GOD says differently. Advent Health is Blessed to have him as a member on their Team.
