I had a great appointment. Friendly and informative. It didn’t hurt that I was given good news.

I literally ran away from AdventHealth after what I can only describe as the worst hospital experience of my life.

I drove myself to the ER after having a really high heart rate for the past two days following a Seizure I had five days prior. I parked on the sixth floor of the parking garage and made my way down to the ER.

I arrived in the lobby for the ER at about 2:45pm, checked in and waited. The hospital was busy, but nothing crazy. I told the nurse at check in I had a high heart rate that would not go down and was recently told I have SIRS, a deadly condition if left untreated and that I recently had a seizure. They said someone would be with me. I waited for 30 minutes to be called to triage where I sat, alone, for another 45 minutes. Just as I was about to leave, the ER Dr. Donald T, comes and ask me what's the issue. I explain I have a brain stent and recently had a seizure and my heart rate will not go down.

He proceeds to tell me, "you sure it's not a shunt". I said, no it's a STENT, It was placed at that hospital and all of my records are with AdventHealth. His scribe points to her screen to show I have a stent. He then ask if I had been drinking or doing cocaine because that can raise your heart rate.

I did not find that funny as I don't drink because my sister died an alcoholic, he would know that if he read my chart.

He says he will run some test. He then tested me for ethanol & drugs.

I wait another 20 minutes and the nurse comes to take blood. I tell her I just was in the hospital and to avoid specific areas and that my veins are small. She makes two attempts and got a vein on the second, but blew a vein the first time.

She draws blood, & I'm told to go wait on the lobby for a room. I waited for three hours and within that time they had to redraw blood because it kept hemolyzing. By the time I'm called to the back I had been waiting for 5 hours.

I get to the back room and I'm in ER room 41. The nurse says she has to try to draw blood again because it wasn't a good draw the other times. No biggie. She draws, and it's a little uncomfortable. But she left and went on her way. As I'm sitting in the room my respiratory rate is dropping - remember I have a documented case of SIRS and it could lead to organ failure if not treated.

My respiratory monitor goes off for five minutes and no one came in.  I forgot to mention I have asthma and they know that because it's in my chart.

I'm frustrated at this point at the lack of care. But then I feel my IV starts to have a sudden pain. It hurts to touch, which can be a sign of a blood clot. I call for the nurse she comes about 20 minutes later and says, "oh yea I'll have to leave it in and get someone to give you a new IV."

She walks out and in that moment I made the decision to disconnect myself and leave. I left with IV in arm, my aunts a nurse my mom's a CNA, and I have plenty of friends who work on the medical field who can help me take it out.
I grab my backpack, overnight bag, and put on my sweater. I walk out the door and pass a nurse who said, "are you leaving?" And I say, "I'm not staying somewhere that treats me like an after thought".

I continue my walk from the ER room, through the lobby, passed cops and security, up two flights of stairs, though the conference area, to the elevator, get off at the 3rd floor to take the bridge to the garage, and from there get on the next elevator to the 6th floor of the parking garage. I passed hundreds of cameras, several staff members and that was it. If it weren't for my insurance restricting me to AdventHealth I would go anywhere else.

After three years of countless stays, they still don't know what's killing me. I've told them it's the brain stent they insisted on. Three years of just straight incompetence. I have given them so much grace. I've never insulted or cursed at anyone, yelled or mistreated anyone, but this was my final straw. As soon as I can I'm changing my insurance because AdventHealth, does not care about your health. They'll keep you for days with no care plan just to bill your insurance.
The staff were very kind and caring. The whole process was fully explained and they did everything possible to make it comfortable.

I was diagnosed with Basal Cell Carcinoma on my face.  I researched several options, and chose Dr. James Mayo Plastic Surgeon with Advent Health. The minute he walked into the exam room, I just knew immediately that I had made the right decision. He was so friendly, nice, caring and answered all my questions. His office was absolutely beautiful and his staff was so nice.I only waited in the lobby less than 5 minutes.  My surgery was performed Friday August 8th. At the Advent Women's Tower. The building at 5 am was breathtaking with the blue lights. Everyone was so helpful guiding us to the Surgery center on 2nd floor. The receptionist, security ,the nurses, the anesthesiologist "3 of them" calmed me and helped me to relax before my surgery. Dr. James Mayo came in and marked my face for the correct side and asked if I had any questions. Surgery went great, even though knowing my face might have scars, I felt Blessed. Dr. James Mayo got all the Skin Cancer and Although it was very close to my eye, I could see. That was my main concern of losing my eyesight. I lost my left eye to Melanoma in 1998.  I was very self conscious of how my face looked being rolled through the hospital lobby. The kind Gentleman pushing my wheelchair gave me a towel to cover my face. He kept telling me that I was beautiful and not to let the scars on my face define me. God Bless this man. Wish i I knew his name. It's been 4 days and my face has healed very nicely. Dr James Mayo did an excellent job. I highly recommend him to anyone needing plastic Surgery. In a month or so I don't think the scars will hardly be noticeable. I am very pleased with everyone I made contact with on this Journey. God Bless All of You and Thank You for your professionalism. Patricia "Pattie" LHeureux and Jim LHeureux.

The technician that set me up for the MRI was beyond pleasant. My issue was the radiologist that read my MRI results. While I was getting set up for my MRI the technician told me they’ll look at my nerves, my organs, bones etc to hopefully get some answers after getting 4 ultrasounds, an X-ray and CT scan and not getting any results and being in tremendous pain but upon the results all he looked at was my soft tissue and another organ. Nothing about my nerves, bones or anything. It’s clear he just rushed through my MRI results. So still no answers and might have to fight for another MRI where the radiologist will actually do his job! Never been a fan of advent health physicians, radiologist for this exact reason. When I use to be in the field I would hear nothing but horrible experiences and now I see it for myself. It’s all about money!!!

You will be put through a million test, draw blood so many times it starts blowing veins out, all for what!? Take two of these and call me in the morning!?...
What happened to doctors doing more then letting techs run a gauntlet of test all to not fix the problem, they are not trained to heal, only to treat with Synthetic drugs, this system will only keep you sick.
If you value your time, your health, and sanity, avoid at all cost.

And lastly, if you get admitted into the "Emergency Room", that should warrant an emergency response.
Waiting two days to see a doctor and being starved the entire time to run test is more of a torture tactic than it Is a way to treat someone who is sick (and pregnant I might add).

Do yourself a favor, change your diet, pay attention to what you put into your body, don't leave your health and condition in the hands of anyone, especially this hospital.

I don’t normally leave reviews, but I feel like everyone deserves to know. This hospital was extremely disappointing and honestly heartbreaking to deal with. A family member was admitted here in a life-threatening state, and the care he received was far below what any patient deserves.

The staff were either inattentive or outright dismissive, and communication with the family was nearly nonexistent. There was a clear lack of urgency and compassion, which is unacceptable in any healthcare setting especially when someone’s life is on the line.

It felt like no one truly cared. We were left feeling helpless, frustrated, and deeply disappointed. I hope no one else has to experience what we did here. Patients deserve better. If you ever tbink about coming to this hospital and u are near death please find another one this one is horrible.

Unfortunately horrible. My mother was wrongfully discharged twice. The first time on 7/20/2025 PT said she needed a rehab or 24/he home care. I am from New Jersey so it was a little more challenging for the case manager, so they discharged her without approving the rehab or services and told me I could go back to Jersey and they’d give me the referral. Well, she had another seizure and was admitted again 2 days later on 7/22/2025. She was discharged yesterday 8/1/2025. I found her a rehab in New Jersey that accepted her and was going to take her to all her chemo and radiation treatments, all they needed was the hospital (Adment Health Orlando) to get the approvals. Well they called me and said that I had been discharged without the case manager knowing and that they could now not give any approvals because she is not a patient. They discharged her without approving rehab or home care with her answering cognitive questions wrong, calling her hand a foot,obviously not ok to be alone, as ok to be alone and washed there hands two time and when I told the case manager that was patient neglegiance she said she was sorry and for me to go back to the ER to have her readmitted and charge the insurance even more money after hour 14 day stay to get the paperwork so she could be safely getting the nessary treatment! Isn’t that insurance fraud! She needs an approval for the rehab not to be seen again in ER, they had  “medically cleared her” the day prior. The reason we were still there was because the case manager was working with New Jersey rehab so I could take her right after the flight. I am going straight to a lawyer when we get home! Patient negligence, discharging my mom as if she could function by herself, when she can’t even talk and nothing for me to even be able to get her help, the paperwork doesn’t even provide anything for my job to even give me FMLA to be with my mom. Our experience was complete horrible on the Neuro floor. The ICU, 11th floor was very attentive and informative. The Woman’s side 10th floor also very nice and attentive. Ginsberg floor 1-th neuro, horrible! My mom was vomitting all over, I was freaking out calling the nurse, I hit the button  three times and they would say ok someone’s coming and no one would come. Shannon was very overwhelmed and I guess I experienced, I felt like I couldn’t leave the room. One specific nurse Katie was amazing! She most be from a different area! She was attentive, checked on my mom regularly even with my presence and would update me and reassure me! The case managers when the my were absolutely useless and should be in another business not with as assistance to patients because they were worthless with discharge planning both times she was discharged!!!!!! I will be seeking legal assistance, because I don’t want them to do these to anyone else and god forgive someone dies for there negligence!!!!!

(EXCEPT THE PA OR CNP, MARIA-- who was positively EXCELLENT--She receives the 5-Stars that she deserves, which compensates to some measure, to bring this Adventhealth score UP to 1-star!), The other ER staff of the nurses and especially the Orthopedic "Surgeon" who was consulted for my fractures, were the WORST I have encountered in 41 years of being a physician.  Florida Hospital Orlando should be ashamed of posting so many billboards, touting itself the best of everything when they cannot even demonstrate in an acute setting, more than a token or modicum of compassion, much less, skill in the health sciences. Once, when I aspirated a large dry Tylenol pill, which miraculously I was able to expel [eventually] by self Heimlich while my friend, the wife of another physician, made a scene at the nurses station, or in some measure, INSISTED on your personnel coming to tend me or a need of mine.  Horrible.  But, by Yirmayahu's (the navi, the prophet, Jeremiah's) words, you have forgotten how to blush." However, it is probable that you never knew how.
By the way, adopting "Advent Health" instead of your real name, Florida Hospital, does NOT bring you into ANY valid simile of "Like the Mayo Clinic." I trained as a surgeon at The Mayo Clinic in the 1980's into the early 1990's-- you will NEVER be ANYthing like the precious Mayo Clinic.  As is the case of your innumerable Orlando area billboards, JUST because you profess something on a billboard, does NOT mean you will ever be what you declare. Until YOU understand that action, behavior, moral principle, consistency, and RESOLVE TO DO what is upright, not what LOOKS or SOUNDS upright, you cannot change or improve. Action and behavior is what defines how and what you are.  Advent Health just cannot understand this.

I’ve been a patient of AdventHealth for close to 5 years (endocrinology, urgent care visits, labor & delivery, postpartum care) and I have never been more disappointed or disgusted in a hospital experience. I arrived via ambulance around 3am with what I thought was extreme and concerning chest pains. After 3 hours, my husband was able to finally convince a nurse to come check on me. She claimed that no one knew I was in the room (even though bloodwork had already been drawn and an IV placed) because I didn’t check in at the front desk. We explained I got there by an ambulance and her response was “oh, well this is embarrassing”. She continued to have zero sense of interest or urgency. By this time, day shift arrived and took over - thank God.

Flash forward I had to get emergency surgery to have my gallbladder removed. Up until I spoke with the head surgeon after surgery, every doctor/surgeon had the same story - as long as I reacted well after surgery, I’d be discharged by the evening. However that’s not what happened. The head surgeon refused to discharge me because he was afraid I would try taking care of my child because, as he said to my husband, “you know how woman are”. In my opinion, that’s such a lame, lazy and unprofessional excuse to keep someone so you can charge them an overnight hospital fee - which we all know isn’t even close to cheap! I absolutely respect and understand having the appropriate rest after a surgery, and that was the only thing on my agenda. Between his tone and side comments, it was clear this surgeon was only interested in the profit he could benefit from. Multiple nurses expressed they didn’t understand why I was being told I needed to stay because there was nothing indicating I needed to.

It was described to me that this was a serious and emergency situation and I got surgery took just in time. How anyone in a professional setting, especially a hospital, is so comfortable treating and speaking to their patient this way is beyond alarming. This experience completely changed my perception of AdventHealth, specifically the downtown Orlando location.
The care was excellent and the service was execellent. I will recomend AdventHealth.

In my opinion I do not recommend coming to this hospital at all. I was in pain, the pain that feels like you’re going to pass out. No nurse or doctor seemed to care. They came in almost a two hours later to give me a pain med. They took me to do a procedure and I’m not sure what they gave me but my heart went down to 20 which is very bad. Almost like a heart attack. They left my daughter in there and didn’t let her know exactly what was happening in which they should’ve done that.After the procedure they took me to do a catscan in which they took me to a room to wait with four other people. Everyone was gone, my family was worried on where I was and why I was taking long. 2 hours passed and I was still in that room with no one . All the nurses and doctors walked passed me as if I wasn’t there nor I existed. The surgeon I had was for orthopedic surgery his name is Seth and he was very racist and very rude to me and my family. He grabbed a pen and marked my leg where they were going to do the surgery and he never asked if he could. He just grabbed and marked it very rough. After surgery all the nurses I had only came in to check on me once rarely twice everyday. In which that should never be especially since the doctors said I was pre diabetic. Almost all the nurses I had were very rude and very grumpy. I had a terrible experience there. I called them so they can come help me use the restroom. Called again no one came. My sick self after surgery had to get up myself and use the restroom. The cleaners didn’t even come and clean the room. They only grabbed and changed the trash. They seat in the shower was old and rusty. The bed sheets were stained and had a very nasty odor. They didn’t give me my meds every 4 hours. The nurses were very unprofessional and unorganized. I hope you don’t go through the same thing I did.

We received excellent service. From the moment we arrived, we were treated by a very professional staff, always smiling and very kind. We appreciate their attention, their professionalism, and, above all, their compassionate care. Thank you very much.

I would leave no stars on this location. I came to the ER presenting with stomach related issues while I was on vacation. I ended up running for my life away from this place after they drugged me with a droperidol, a drug that has been banned from most hospitals across the country for its side effects. They didn’t tell me what they were giving me, or the risks or side effects. Nothing! I’ve since learned that they gave me a medication used for combative patients or for sedating just before a operation.
I was in and out of consciousness and when I would wake up, I would tell the next hospital worker that I didn’t like the medication and that I was afraid and I didn’t know how I would manage to get to my hotel. They didn’t help me or care no matter how much I tried to advocate for myself. I self checked out because I was afraid for my life and had to leave in a uber in the middle of the night, as a woman in an unfamiliar state and in and out of consciousness. I kept praying for God to help me to get to my hotel safely and I kept thinking about my family as I was in and out of consciousness from my uber. With Gods grace I made it to my hotel safely.
I then spent more than 12 hours with severe side affects from this medication that drove me to medical attention for my heart racing. Needing to throw ice water on my back, chest face to avoid passing out. Keeping my feet on the floor and needing to move from avoiding passing out. I’ve traveled back to my home state and now meeting with doctors and therapist because of what’s happened at this hospital. Please do not come to this hospital. Please do not come to this hospital. Please go anywhere else but this one. Please go somewhere else. I beg of you to go anywhere but here.

The hospital was clean beautiful and had amazing staff! I being a nurse have a standard of care that not every healthcare provider has. I can see the need for more staff and the fact that not everyone has the ability to make judgments on a patient to patient basis. My pain was not managed well. My care was provided by resident physicians in the ER. I unfortunately had to take what I could get. I would have preferred more senior doctors. I was given no choice because it was an emergency.
The entire staff including Doctors and Nurses took excellent care of me during my night at the hospital

Went to have a simple procedure EGD to determine what was causing pain in throat. Admitted into hospital. Second day their hospitalist visited and she ordered morphine and other drugs. By 5:00 pm my face was as red as a strawberry. Thank goodness my wife went to get help. Long story nursr had no luck getting a Dr to respond to her textes or calls. She then called rapid response team. I was immediately taken to ICU. After a day in ICU was taken back to hospital. Upon getting ready for procedure it’s been 5 days and no food. Procedure completed and a feeding tube was placed in nose and returned to room. No Dr. even spoke to me or wife what results were! Then after Xray in rom they realized tube was NOT placed correctly and was of NO USE.  Day 6 no food. Next morning swallow xray test and it was determined I could have food and oral meds, therefore tube was useless. Att this point I asked again to speak to GI Dr. who was in charge of my case.
No luck. Finally after contacting legal they sent a young lady to try and contact a GI Dr. After 9 hours they sent an ARNP who said she was on GI team.  I find it interesting that after 7 days in hospital I never saw or spoke to a GI Dr. All I can saw is this hospital has INVISIBLE DRS. After being in the medical field for 38 years this is no way to treat a patient.
Came in with a severe case of dehydration and they treated me like a addict. My blood was completely clean .

I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Justin Beyer. From the moment he walked into the ER room, he was professional, compassionate, and incredibly knowledgeable. My daughter was feeling scared and unwell, but Dr. Beyer’s calm and welcoming demeanor immediately helped put both of us at ease.

He took the time to truly listen—not just to my daughter’s symptoms, but to our concerns as parents—and he explained everything in a way that was clear and reassuring. It was evident that he genuinely cared about her well-being, going above and beyond to ensure we felt heard and supported every step of the way.

It’s rare to find a physician who combines medical expertise with such empathy and kindness. Dr. Beyer is an outstanding doctor and a true asset to the ER. We are so grateful for the care he provided and won’t forget how he made a stressful situation so much more manageable. Thank you, Dr. Beyer!
It had very good service. Thank Advent Health nurses.

Please take a second to read if you are considering going here. I went here for an emergency room visit and the workers were very unprofessional. It took over four tries to even get the IV into my arm which then the medical staff failed to even attach the IV fluids to the needle in my arm. They even left the IV fluid bag on the FLOOR, absolute incompetence and unacceptable. The amount of times I was stabbed with a needle and the level of poor quality left me with a bruise that has lasted up to three weeks and I’m still waiting for it to fade. Before even treating me, they asked for my citizenship status which I have never dealt with in a hospital before as I was born in America. I went into the emergency room for a severe deathly allergic reaction and I felt as though the professionals lacked a level of cognitive function or empathy in general, and they acted as if my situation were casual. The nurse who was unsuccessful with placing my IV postponed my treatment to talk to a coworker who was leaving about her lunch… seriously? Thank God I had used my epipen on myself beforehand because I could not imagine my life being in the hands of the so-called “professionals” in the AdventHealth emergency room of Orlando, FL. I wondered why the ER was so empty, but it makes sense as that ER facility would hardly fall as people’s choice. Interesting to see where the priorities of these “professionals” lie. Unfortunately the American healthcare system is broken, but I believe AdventHealth does not try their hardest to give patients proper care and treatment. Avoid this hospital if you can. Do better, take your job seriously… you work in a hospital… the emergency room.

I have been going  to theirs two Hospital  for a long time i think about 30 plus year at that time it was call Florida  Hospital  and i hve never had a problem  from the ER to to the room ans staff all the staff are very helping  and kind at this time i had two hip replacement  and once again no problem  well traine and right  to the point and understand i give Adment Health  a 10 God Bless  them all

Having lived in Central Florida over 35 years, I have been a patient in both AdventHealth and Orlando Health facilities. In the last 7 years, Orlando Health has improved in so many ways after implementing their LEAN management approach. AdventHealth has gone the other direction. Recently my cardiologist scheduled me to have a calcium score CT scan. I specifically asked for the earliest appointment which was 730am, and arrived 30 minutes early as they requested, then the tech couldn't start on time. When she did start placing the monitor s on my chest, she did not do it right and had to subject me to a second radiation exposure due to her ineptness. Additionally, she was terse and had a very bad attitude. I'm finished with AdventHealth. No wonder they have to have so many billboards advertising for new patients, they don't treat the ones they have very well.
The nurses at Cardiac Rehab are all so caring and patient. They consistently provide genuine concern for our wellbeing.

The entire Nurses, PAs, Physicians and Admin are focus on delivering the best medical care possible by:
1) highly trained and experienced in field of expertise
2) probing communication style to address all issues and changes in health status
3) interpretation of blood work and other medical exams
4) accommodating scheduling
5) strict sanitary guidelines such as hand washing, face masks, gloves and inquiring about symptoms indicating infections

Absolutely unacceptable care from Advent Health’s Pediatric Oncology team.

My daughter’s port infiltrated badly under their watch.  something that could and should have been prevented. The nurses had just changed shifts, which is exactly when extra attention should be given, especially with a vulnerable pediatric cancer patient. But somehow, no one noticed the infiltration, and no one took accountability.

Because of their negligence, my daughter ended up being hospitalized again, this time with an infection from the port. She had to suffer more pain, more fear, and more procedures all because the staff failed to do their job.

What’s worse? There was no apology, no explanation, and no disciplinary action toward the nurses who overlooked the issue. It’s clear that patient safety is not their top priority, and that the team is either too overworked, poorly trained, or dangerously careless.

This experience has destroyed any trust we had in Advent Health’s oncology care. We put our daughter’s life in their hands, and they failed her.

I hope no other family has to experience this kind of avoidable trauma. Do better.
Excellent care with both a personal and professional touch

I never had a bad experience at Advent Health Orlando. I was operating on there for lung cancer back in 2002 and I cannot tell you how wonderful I was treated and cared for and this time I went for an endoscopy off of my pancreas and everyone was just 100%. I have nothing bad to say.

What a fantastic team!  Everyone in CIE  made sure from the moment I walked in the door till I was helped into my vehicle that my needs were taken care of and any questions or concerns were addressed. I felt that I was in very competent hands with both Drs Kadkhodayan and Dr Shari. The nursing teams (Sarah, Christine, Julie and Mariel) were awesome and I can’t thank you all enough.  I have spoken so highly of this team to all my family and friends about the great work that is being done at CIE. I wish that more doctors would learn about it and refer any of their patients that could benefit.  I am so thankful that I found Dr Justin Kelly who referred me.
Great people and service.
Very clean and organized.  It's like a city within a city.  Everyone is friendly and helpful and want to make sure you are taken care of.
Very friendly and attentive
Everyone involved in my care was kind, professional, and competent. They all helped to make a difficult situation for me much easier. I am so happy that I was referred to Advent Health in Orlando.
Very professional and caring staff.  Felt very comfortable.

I would like to share that the professionals who take care of me while undergoing my paracentesis are not just professionals, they are caring and compassionate care givers! In fact everyone in the unit (Imaging and ultrasound) have  been very supportive, understanding and informative about my condition and treatments! After being diagnosed with end stage liver disease as a result of “MASH”, I was left with little hope as to my condition and future prognosis. However, after being cared for and treated by these caregivers my outlook has improved greatly! I look forward to my weekly visits and treatments now! To inspire someone to want to live the best life they can with the medical condition/s they are experiencing is no small feat. But these earth Angels have found away to inspire me and I am sure others to fight on! This unit really gets it!!! They put the human touch back in care giving! Often over looked or worried about litigation some care givers refrain from giving the patient a reassuring touch to the shoulder, foot, forearm or even top of the head saying “we are taking care of you”!  Thus establishing the human connection not just a clinical approach. I want to  recognize just some of the outstanding and professionals caregivers I have been fortunate enough to come in contact with: Angie, Ana, Brooke, Debra, Hannah, Jordan, Kristiana, Megan, Rebecca, Sade and Nancy. These are just a few I remember off the top of my head. Please include and Recognize the entire unit as they are true caregivers and Angels Among us! ❤️🙏🏻. Ron and Toni Howard
Mostly good experience. Waiting time was good and efficient.

I was transferred to this hospital due to a complicated injury — 10/10 Star Treatment!

The hospital campus is beautiful, and the staff is incredible.

The transportation team was so friendly, and the food services team came every day to make sure I got the kind of food I wanted.

Dianni and the rest of the nursing staff were so nice — and, even more importantly, great advocates for me with the doctors. This was huge for me, as I was loopy, tired, and hurting after surgery.

Melissa from the physical therapy team should get a raise and a half. She was so kind and helpful. She gave great advice and helped me start moving on my own very quickly!

The physician team was incredible! I had a doctor in every day to update me on my progress and answer my questions. They actually spent time listening and thoroughly explaining my condition — I was blown away. I’ve never had another experience like that before.

Dr. Sookhoo and Nurse Practitioner Guambo deserve special mention. Each took time to explain the procedure and the recovery process going forward. I received a nerve block that meant my post-operative pain was essentially zero. The procedure seems to have gone well, and I am very appreciative of Dr. Sookhoo for putting in the extra work needed to ensure a good recovery. They went above and beyond, spending extra time to make sure the job was done right.

The entire team at AdventHealth Orlando has my gratitude!
Staff always attentive, helpful and friendly even in bad situations.
Outstanding physicians!  Good hospital.
I’m a huge fan of AdventHealth. Care, compassion, experience, and expertise are readily available. They make you feel like family.

Doctor Mendia from urology team at Florida south. He lack of listen to his patients. On my hospitalization on June. Doctor Mendia took my case. It happen on June 17 I caught a high fever of 102.09 Farenheit. I was having severe pain in my left ureteral stent. I requested 6 times to urology to exchange my left stent. On behalf of doctor Mendia he said ain't gonna happen on this admission so you may have to wait till the middle of July to have your stent exchange. The medical internist said I am sorry there's nothing I can do because it depends on urology. I was discharged on June 28. 3 days later the pain was worsening I returned to Altamonte Advent health hospital because I don't trust Dr. Mendia anymore. On my current admission the CT scan says there's a critical swelling of the left ureter and it had displaced. Due to Doctor Mendia's fault I have a painful nephrosis tube. If he would have consideration to listen and do what was need it. Right now I wouldn't be on the mess and setback that my left kidney is. Dr. Mendia has failed me as a doctor.
Great medical providers.
Nice clean spacious private room the staff and nurses are amazing!!

I hate to leave a negative review like this, because the ER attending and nursing staff and patient coordinator really did do their jobs and put in all of the arrangements to have me taken care of in admission, but everything really fell apart once a bed was secured for me. If I was rating my experience based solely on the ER treatment, it would have been 5 stars. Likewise, the inpatient stoma nurse is amazing and very detail-oriented and attentive. The two stars for this review are each for the ER team combined and the stoma nurse.

But without getting too personal on a public forum: the floor I was admitted to took my trust and my vulnerable state and absolutely failed me by way of deception and coercion. I have voiced my concerns to the appropriate channels and can only hope that this Advent location treats future patients better than the shameful way that I was mistreated and discharged.
Takes more than 1 visit to find my way around.  A very big place.  Seems nice

I had an MRI. I only waited about 15 minutes in the waiting room. Then they took me back, got me dressed, Started my IV, then I sat. waiting for the MRI machine to be ready. The entire process was quick and painless, no hours of Waiting! I was completely satisfied with the entire procedure!
I stayed at AdventHealth Orlando, for three days. From the time I got there till the time I left everyone was truly amazing super sweet, caring, helpful very friendly. Thank you
Staff is always helpful and friendly. Doctor doesn't say much but I like him.Always friendly.

I am a patient of Dr. Kim and he is professional and thorough. Everyone I came into contact with at Advent Health were friendly, professional, and courteous.
I will stay with Advent Health!

I love my doctor
Dr.Halloway he has been a blessing in my life and his amazing staff
even susan from billing has been very very sweet and helpful through this journey
If this has to do with rehab I was disappointed that they waited until my insurance ran out to schedule me
Service was ss good as it could have been.
Everyone was kind, and loving. I felt like they were family.

I walked into surgery lied to about the amount of care snd support I would recieve. Im 5 days post op of a major surgery and in extreme pain. Im not being listened to or helped by my surgeon or his team. DR. Richard Klien- Oncologist Reconstruction. Women are still being asked to tolerare ungodly amounts of pain with little to no support and ignored or treated like drug seekers when we ask for proper pain management that is individualulaized and not cookie cutter protocol that ends up traumatizing the indivdual person.
I left my first post op check up trembling in pain with zero information about how my surgery went and any further post op instructions.
This office looks and feels nice on the outside pre- surgery, but when your trapped after a double masectomy and expanders in your chest and no proper support for pain management you start to see the truth that this place is truly just one more nightmare Healthcare practice apart of the system that continues to ignore patients.
Im in bed trembling to write this cause pain is severe and I have nothing that actually helps me.
I made it clear along the whole pre surgery process that ive been traumatized by the medical community my whole life and they proceeded to be one more trauma for me to endure.
Even my back is in allot of pain where they did the nerve block. I shouldn't of felt any of that before or after the going out for the surgery.
Im told by Dr. Kliens staff that if its that bad, go to the ER as if I havent been through enough.
Im just here at home lost on what to do, in ungodly pain, avoiding the ER cause they'll just make it worse. They always do. And I get the stressful task of looking for a oncologist reconstruction surgeon who can better support me through my expansion process and implant surgery so Im not suffering in pain or stress or distrust at any time. Wish me luck cause I seem to be asking too much even though Im lying here chest looking crazy and I cant move cause pain is searing when I do and jist ungodly when Im still.
Great staff! Everyone is very friendly!
Everyone at AdventHealth was Great including Billy and David were great. They were my nurses in my room 12828 from 17 June thru 26 June 2025.All have 5 stars even the Doctors.

Dr. Arora showed us videos from my recent heart catherization and discussed a clinical trial for a newer aorta valve replacement.  His explanations were clear and he answered all our questions.   He made us feel confident about the TAVR procedure.

I was admitted at the Advent Health stood for a week and they treated me great. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star is because the showers didn't have hot water,  only one bathroom I used when I was in observation  I can say that I was able to take a nice shower otherwise is was a cat bath. But overall my stay was good.
All the staff  is very caring and professional.
The staff nurses were professional, caring and proved excellent care for me.

Excellent protocol and care for a recent out-patient surgical procedure.  All staff from Registration to Prep to Surgery and Post Op went above and beyond to ensure we understood each step in the process. Advent is highly focused on safety, cleanliness and comfort.

I just want to take a moment to express my deepest gratitude to my specialist, Dr. Robert Holloway, and to every single nurse and staff member in RIO who took care of me during my hospital stay.

To my pre-op nurses Aurelia R. Joe B. Melody A. William Bristol thank you for being incredibly kind, patient, and compassionate. You didn’t just care for me medically, you also comforted me emotionally. You understood my fears, especially when I was overwhelmed and in tears. Your gentle words reminding me that I was in good hands with one of the best doctors meant more than you know. No matter how many times I asked questions or needed help, you never once made me feel like a burden. Your patience and attentiveness truly stood out.

To Dr. Robert Holloway thank you, sir, from the bottom of my heart. I’m so grateful that Dr. Gyang referred me to you. Your calm presence, kindness, and compassion gave me so much peace. You took the time to listen and never made me feel rushed or intimidated to speak up about my concerns. You gave me hope when I needed it most, and your reassurance helped ease my worried heart.

And to all the staff, my surgical team, and my anesthesiologist, thank you for taking such good care of me. You made me feel safe, supported, and truly cared for. I knew I was in good hands with an exceptional team.

May you all continue to bless others the way you’ve blessed me. Thank you again, from the bottom of my heart.

I am deeply disappointed and heartbroken by the level of care my grandmother has received during her extended stay at this hospital. She was admitted back in December for swelling in her ankles—a condition that should have been treated with urgency, compassion, and appropriate medical attention. Instead, she has been shuffled around the hospital from room to room, treated more like a case number than a human being.
Over the months, her condition has dramatically worsened. She has developed several wounds during her stay, one of which was caused directly by the hospital staff. Shockingly, instead of addressing the wound with proper medical treatment, it was covered up with a bag—a clear act of neglect and an attempt to hide the injury rather than heal it. This is not just unprofessional—it’s inhumane.
What’s even more upsetting is that my grandmother walked into the hospital on her own, able to move and advocate for herself. Now, after months in their care, she is suffering not only from her original condition but also from new complications that could have been prevented. The lack of proper wound care, delays in treatment, and overall disregard for her well-being are unacceptable.
Our family trusted this facility to care for someone we love dearly, and they have failed her at every turn. No patient—especially an elderly woman—should be subjected to such prolonged mistreatment and neglect. We are now forced to explore further options, including filing a formal complaint and seeking legal counsel if necessary.
To any family considering this hospital for your loved one’s care: Please think twice. We are sharing our experience in the hope that no other family has to go through this painful ordeal.

Office staff consistently gets it wrong. Polite, but useless. Worst office personnel in the industry. No one has the same information and frequently the wrong information. They don't work as a team at all.
The people were very nice but, it was super cold.

supervisor about
ruff treatment to a patient and a combative disposition regarding or from Nicole Red a nurse of the woman's unit, and some very unclean unsafe medical procedures done by

The experience was really good, the people treated me well and the baby was treated well, I feel happy, may God always protect the doctors

Nurses  were Amazing.  The bathroom was disgusting,  I'm a kidney transplant patient & must wash everyday & can't due to the nasty bathroom. The 2nd room my husband chased a cockroach in the bathroom. I love this hospital,  but can't stand the rooms not being cleaned.
Punctual, easy, very professional

I had two toes amputated and had multiple infections. I was well on my way to further amputation. I started coming to physical therapy and woundcare several times a week. The staff never gave up on me and continued to use different treatment modalities until they found one that worked. My original wound was 11 1/2 inches long and now it's a little larger than a dime. If you are having some issues pray first and then go in. The staff is kind and caring.

For any elite organization as this, not sure why they can’t keep up with equipment.
Why is this Advent ??

From start to finish, my experience was truly outstanding! Every single staff member was warm, welcoming, and incredibly professional. The nurses and physicians were phenomenal … kind, attentive, and made sure  I understood everything. Highly recommend!
Always receive great care from professional people.

I can't say I fully enjoyed my stay at Princeton. The nurses were not very attentive, who did not call out from work, seemed to not want to be at work. I felt my care was rushed because I expressed I wanted to travel, and that trip ended up being cancelled!
Secondly, I will never use the call button if I "ever"go back.  The nurses made me fee like I was aggravating them when I used it, and half of the time they never showed up.  Only 1 nurse went ABOVE AND BEYOND, EMILY TORREDA, and she was not even assigned to that area she was helping out from the 10th floor.
Even a few Doctors made me uncomfortable. One in particular and I forgot her name. I asked her if she could talk to my sister, she literally SIGHED and said sure. Adventhealth at Millenia was where I started, they were nice there especially the Chaplain that stopped by.
I don't have anything more to say other than, more care and real concerned is needed at Princeton. Lack of communication was also an issue.
Emily Torreda, Kudos to you for helping out in the Neurology ICU floor where I was, or whatever the 11th floor was called.
Wow, not only did I cancel a trip to visit my elderly parents, both of them at that, but to stay here and be treated the way I was really made me wish I had never went to the hospital and had taken that flight. It may have been my last with 3 Aneurysm, but anything would have made me feel better than my visit to AdventHealth on Rollins St.

My surgery was a great experience here at AdventHealth Orlando, all staff nurses, doctors, anesthesiologist were absolutely amazing they kept me calm & aware of everything at all times, they took very good care of me to make sure my surgery was a great success. Thank You AdventHealth Orlando

Great hospital and amazing providers and awesome nursing staff at the Adventhealth orlando i just wish there was adventhealth hospital in north brevard county because the location in titusville parrish medical center needs help and the emergency room also we need a new state of art hospital

Everyone is very knowledgeable & professional, but you have a big problem regarding your parking. In my case on my last visit I arrived hours before my scheduled appointment & spent 45 minutes trying to find parking. This was very inconvenient for me. In my time prior to this I've found that the security in the parking lot, the security was minimal at best. In the last months I have found that I don't feel safe traveling to this location & have expressed my feelings about this place. I believe that your facility would benefit tremendously if you could improve this situation.

Just had knee replacement thru Rothman Orthopedics/ Advent Health. Two years ago, Dr. Jeffrey Petrie also replaced my hip. Excellent surgeon and Advent Health has Provided superb home health Care thru Pinnacle. Nurses come to the home and physical therapy is 3 times a week. They are kind, considerate of my every need and really helpful in my ability to move forward with my recuperation.

Unfortunately I have a few medical issues.  All my doctors are affiliated with Adventhealth.  I have always received the best of care.  I only see Adventhealth doctors.  They are the best!  I highly recommend Adventhealth!

My mother stated that she will never return to your Hospital ever again.  Once the staff realize that my mother had a DNR pretty much the care and the testing stopped and they said it was time for her to leave.

I am very grateful to God that I am being treated at this Hospital in the oncology clinic. I feel comfortable with the patient portal, where they send me a reminder of my appointments, I can see my blood results and all the tests that I have done. Every call from the hospital, the staff is very kind and caring, with passion for the pain that the patient is suffering, etc. May God continue to bless every DR, nurse, laboratory technician, MRI, CT scan, in short, every person who works at the hospital. The ER and 9th floor inpatient room and care was very good. Only complaint I have is we’ve been told that we can be discharged @9:30 but didn’t get to leave until 4:30. Floor nurse tried to communicate but the discharge dept had too many steps.

I had a Botched Pancreatotomy  with Mr Rosales team in January. Since then it never stopped leaking into my body causing  severe pain.  Had to bet drained for 7 days.
The Entire Endoscopy team was Fantastic and placed stints in my Pancreas  so it finally stopped. They  get 6 STARS

As far as all the nurses, the text the people that did the scans the MRI everybody did their job very well. They came in every hour to check on me but the whole time I was in both hospitals, not one doctor not one nurse not one tech ever looked at my leg And told me that it was bruised as bad as it is after I’ve seen how bad my leg looked. I thought maybe something should’ve been done in the hospital as far as icing it down taking some ibuprofen for inflammation. as long as I was laying in bed, I had zero pain if I tried to get out of bed and go to the bathroom I had quite a bit of pain that being that I wasn’t allowed out of bed every time they come in and asked me what my pain level was I would tell him zero so I guess they figured there was nothing wrong down there other than I fractured one bone and tore the muscle away from the bone other than that I stay at the hospital was very very good, but I am disappointed in the hospital doctor and the ER doctor that never looked at my leg

My 95-year-old mother and I were very impressed with how quickly and efficiently the ED took care of her, getting her to x-ray, then immediately in to test for COVID, flu, Strep, RSV. I know the ED gets busy, but it was the quickest turnover we have seen! And kudos to Dr. Rosaro for his wonderful bedside manner, and thorough explanations!

I had a great experience at your orthopedic clinic but the experience at the hospital was horrible.  Please note your nurses and staff that I interacted with were fine.  The main issue is I was kept in the ER overflow for more than 3 days the air condition was broken and I kept being told I was admitted but they were waiting for a space.  Well my issue was urgent it was not life threatening and you should have closed your emergency room if your hospital had no space.  I was unable to see a specialist from my back injury until the very last day and feel my treatment was extremely subpar.  I'm also confident that it has prolonged my recovery process.  I will be using Orlando regional from here on out.

I went to the ER at the advisement of my specialist. I visited the Rollins location and my concern seemed laughable to the treating provider who also deemed it necessary to treat me like a person who has no knowledge of their own body, care and medical history. I left feeling I wasted my time and that more should have been done. I am still struggling with my medical concern.

Arrive at least an HOUR BEFORE your outpatient appointment because the unclear signage & insufficient customer service is truly problematic! This facility lacks clear instructions upon scheduling. They lack sufficient people to provide guidance outside & inside. When employees see customers looking lost (I work at a medical center so I know the look.) offer assistance! I  don’t know & walking away is NEVER an appropriate response! There is no reason TWO employees at the desk on the children’s side should be helping ONE family while their line grows longer. Divide & conquer! I gave 3 stars for the person at the registration desk in the main hospital & the employees in the X-ray suite that were actually helpful. Kudos to them for exemplifying good customer service!

Everyone from admissions to the procedure conclusion was exceptional patient care. Communications were thorough and understandable. Dr
Hassan and everyone involved were professional, pleasant. Dr. Abassi(?) explained everything to my wife and me.

Daytime nursing care was extraordinary.. night nurses were fairly abysmal. Two nights in a row my daughter got out of surgery on late afternoon. Night nurse also kept patient waiting over 45 minutes for pain meds.. nurse told us she was “ busy”

April was for a diagnosis of Afib-Arrythymia; May was for Severe Anemia issues; early Sept. has been for Laproscopic Gallbladder Surgery! Each visit has brought a new appreciation for the awesome medical/nursing staffs at Advent Health and the confidence to place myself in their care. Kudo’s to all, but a special thanks to the Liver Transplant Group at AdventHealth Orlando… you all are amazing!!! DRBuck

I was vacationing in Orlando , when all of a sudden I experienced shortness of breath. Went AdventHealth Emergency Department. Directly admitted to downtown hospital. From the ER to my hospital stay, all nurses, CT techs, ultrasound techs and especially the doctors were so attentive and knowledgeable. I felt like I was the only patient in ICU. Thanks again too all

We were referred to AdventHealth for an ultrasound on our 6-week-old son’s head. We were told this was the only location that could perform pediatric head ultrasounds. After our experience, I genuinely don’t understand why. Nothing about this facility or staff was prepared for an infant.

We waited over 30 minutes past our scheduled time, which is hard enough with a newborn. The moment we were brought back, the situation became unacceptable. The ultrasound tech was rude, cold, and clearly irritated by our son’s cries. There was no pediatric bed or support. Just an adult table where we were told we could not hold him. Instead, we had to restrain his arms and hold his head straight while she slowly and forcefully pressed the probe against his soft skull.

Our baby was screaming in distress, and rather than show any empathy, the tech became more frustrated. When we explained that he doesn’t take to a pacifier, she offered to go find a hospital one anyway. Not to comfort him, just to silence him.

By the end of the procedure, our son was drenched in sweat, his face was beet red, and his screams had become so intense that no sound was even coming out. Not once did the tech pause to check on him or us. She didn’t even offer a towel to clean the gel off his head afterwards.

This was a traumatizing experience for our baby and for us as first-time parents. I cannot believe we were directed here under the assumption this was a pediatric-appropriate radiology facility. It was anything but.

Was there for posterior neck surgery on June 10th. Let me tell you- the folks on the third floor rocked! Sometimes it’s a mix of different experiences, But in this case, I could not have asked for a better team of people. Everyone was competent and seemed caring and genuine . I feel like the staff all got along really well and worked great as a team. The went above and beyond to make sure I was feeling OK. The food was actually very decent compared to other hospitals. The room had a really nice view. I really appreciated how well I was taken care of And. I wish I could thank everyone by name! Admittedly, the care was so good that I almost didn’t want to go home. 😂

If u have to have a procedure.....and its one of those embarassing ones(colonoscopy) I have to say my mind, feelings, embarrassment, and privacy were relieved with the professionalism,  kindness, and a bit of humor with the staff at CIE....and the main campus of Advent Health....thx all for making this procedure bearable....Dr. Hasan was understanding and extremely competent and caring..
Everything went well. Nurses and other staff were great.
BEST SWR OF ANGLES IN RIWN👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽
Well intended care. Generally attentive but the staff size guarantees a spectrum of services when measuring by hospital scale. Some very high quality effective doctors on the team!

Great experience with the doctor and his team who performed the circumcision surgery for my son. Although after the procedure the nurse was giving my 8 month old son Similac Glucose Water that had an expiration day of 04/01/2025 and he had a surgery end of May 2025. He drank 4oz and she gave us 4oz more to go just in case. And when we were discharged and went outside I looked at the package and found out the expiration date. I should’ve gone back and showed them and talked to a supervisor, but I didn’t because I was so stressed and overtired that day. And I really regretted it!
So to all the moms out there, please! Please always check what they give you to your children, ask for expiration dates of all the medicine the nurses bring if it’s out of the package! They apparently don’t care! You are the only one who is responsible for your children safety!!!

Terrible Experience – Would Not Recommend This Hospital

I have a family member who was originally admitted to the 10th floor (Orthopedic Unit). According to a nurse from that floor, her blood pressure went up, so they decided to move her to the ICU. Once she arrived at the ICU, they stabilized her within 30 minutes and told us there was no longer any need for ICU-level care. We requested that she be moved back to the 10th floor, especially since the care she received there was excellent.

We were told there were no available beds on that floor, but that she would be moved back as soon as one opened up. It’s now Monday—three days later—and she’s still stuck in the ICU unnecessarily.

The care in the ICU has been absolutely unacceptable. We’ve had to be there constantly because the staff has been so incompetent. One night, no one even brought her dinner. We had to look for a nurse ourselves and even help change her because she had been left in a soiled diaper. This morning, we arrived early and found her awake, without a diaper, and she hadn’t eaten. They had left breakfast at her bedside, even though she can’t get up on her own.

Her heart rate was at 200, and there was no staff anywhere nearby. We had to call a nurse from another hallway to get help.

This experience has been truly horrible. I would strongly advise against bringing your loved ones to this hospital. They are not attentive, and the level of care is completely unacceptable.

My wife has been to this hospital 4 times and this Sunday we arrived in the emergency room with a huge scare and been waiting since 9pm and now it’s 9am a whole 12 hours  the nurses stated that she will be getting admitted and she still waiting on a room so I don’t know what else to do or who else can I speak to this is a very serious matter and it’s being overlooked over and over again like does anyone know what’s going on at this hospital nothing is being done we are in the in room 64 and no one has been around for hours why is this occurring please help us

A heart procedure should be taken with care,   if there's an emergency someone needs to immediately come out to talk, it was already a stressful day for me. Except the first 10 hours when someone dropped the ball and failed to follow up with my daily meds Morphine) post surgery. I felt bad for that poor recovery room nurse, trying to ‘play catch up with my pain armed only with three shots of dilaudid. If he had been told that one shot and my morphine would have worked perfectly. I was coming out of the anesthesia and was in no shape to communicate much that was coherent except for my pain. Once I was aware enough and communicated what needed to be to be done and a head nurse heard me things started to turn around. They did finally get ahead of my pain and for the rest of the stay I could tell what an outstanding facility this is. The staff must be hand picked and extremely well trained. The nurses that provided for my care were nothing short of incredible. Each one a consummate professional and seriously caring individuals. It’s as though their work is a calling rather than just a paycheck. I always felt safe and well cared for for from the time I was greeted at the check-in counter, to surgical prep and my post operative care. Yea, except for that one thing. My recovery at home over a week later and I’m recovering nicely. Thank you everyone at Advent Health for my outstanding and exemplary care.

Not impressed by being told to be there so early for surgery then had to wait 3 hours but once I got going I was happy with things just frustrated in the beginning especially since I am a coffee person and hadn't drank anything all night so without water or coffee I wound up with a migraine so waiting mad me not so happy but other than that things went well. Very happy with my anesthesiologist and surgeon though...

She was treated so badly by one nurse that even now she is still affected..I beg her to call for help because she can’t find her veins she was angry that she didn’t want her to use the bed pan neither did she gave the iv the doctor ordered.. why why and hurry her out the hospital her facial expression is as if it was her home .they said all results were ok and that not true any small abnormal things is still cause for concern.But one doctor was so professional God bless him
Very nice and efficient staff. Quick medical care. Good food.

Our experience with my daughter, getting her endoscopy went very well. We’re able to check in at the front desk at the facility and the staff within the endoscopy center was very pleasant. They did accommodate her needs as she is a minor and utilize their child life services, which were very helpful. The nursing staff, as well as a physician was very helpful and addressed her appropriately being aware of her stress and fear of the procedure. The only complaint and concern that I did have was it on arrival while checking in I was informed that I had an almost $1000 balance for the procedure. . The nursing staff, as well as a physician was very helpful and addressed her appropriately being aware of her stress and fear of the procedure.
The only complaint and concern that I did have was it on arrival while checking in I was informed that I had a almost $1000 balance for the procedure. I was not informed of this prior to arriving at the facility. I was informed the day prior by the doctors office that I had a balance with them however, this was just for the position Fee and not for use of the hospital and any additional services necessary for the procedure. The amount of money is pretty significant and to not be made aware of this prior to going to the appointment was pretty significant and feel that this is something that definitely should be addressed ahead of time as not everybody is able to agree to this type of commitment and may have declined the procedure after already taking time off of work and school to have it done.
They took care of me.

ER staff are terrible. However once your admitted the nurses and doctors are wonderful. When needing assistance the staff that answers the call button does not get the info to a nurses. This happened to many time I would have to call the lead nurse or a supervisor to deal with the situation.

My husband and I LOVE this hospital the nursing staff is FANTASTIC and CARING and very concern to provide medical assistance but also comfort  Always asking are you okay can I get you anything.
Even when you walk in the building and you seem lost a staff member will ask "can I help you with anything" and direct  you. In the cafeteria I couldn't find the butter and a staff member showed me where it was.
I would give the hospital not a "10" but a "Trillion precent".
Thank you and blessings to all
My visit was fantastic. The team was great and always checking on me. I knew I was in good hands.

I have never experience a medical facility with such warmth and care EVERY nurse and nurses aid was so nice and caring I met an overnight aid by the name of Jessica who tended to me with so much care. I couldn’t believe the care that I received  by such young staff it was God that chose this hospital for me and I’m soooooo grateful. Dr Robert Holloway is truly  one of a kind. Thank you Advent Health for the great work and care that you do.

Dr. Chin is a great Doctor and Surgeon.  He real know his business.  He is so knowledgeable in many different areas.  Mine was the liver.  I had many visits and surgery with him.  I trust his opinions.  I wish all doctors were like him. His nurses and staff are very efficient and kind.
Med care good  wait time for pain meds too long. And food not good

I came to the Advent Health Hospital ED on Rollins St. in Orlando on 4 separate occasions over a period of 7 months. I have been suffering from dizziness, tinnitus in both ears, ear pressure, head pressure, pain on the top of my head, and visual disturbances. I stayed in the hospital observation floor twice. I had tests but no one could tell me what was wrong. They sent me home just as sick as I was when I came in. No answers, no treatment. I came to the ED the third time. I had the same symptoms yet they didn't even put me in a room where I could lie down. I sat in a chair in a tiny room. The doctor gave me an EKG and sent me home with a prescription for a very low dose of Valium. It didn't work. I just came back to the ED for the 4th time last week. In addition to all of the dizziness and other symptoms, I had Sepsis, severe dehydration, and an asthma attack so bad I couldn't breathe. They admitted me but the hospital was full so I had to stay overnight in the ED to wait for a room. They finally got a room so I was waiting to go upstairs. A doctor suddenly came in my room and told me I was being discharged! They never even waited a few days until my blood cultures came back! I had more tests done for the dizziness but still they had no answers for me. I needed to see a neurologist. I was told one would come see me. Instead they sent me internal medicine doctors. I never got to see a neurologist. So again I was sent home sick with no answers. I have to wait another 3 weeks to see a neurologist in Ocoee. I think it sucks that no one would take more time to give me a diagnosis. Instead they sent me home time and time again. I'm never going to go back to that hospital again.

Adventhealth hospital is by far the best in Orlando..the doctors (Dr Seifein and Dr Amauwi)the nurses (Jason, Maggie, Lynn and Michael) are way above any we've seen before! And at the reception desk in the cardiology unit Murlynn is awesome as well!! Everyone is just so engaging and professional!! Thank you all so much!!
Drs are Amazing & very Caring
What a dedicated team of compassionate folks who take care of your every need and are responsive to all your ask. Best experience ever.
Attentive, Caring, Compassionate Professional Staff......I thank you all!

I’ve been using Advent Health for all of my scans since I was diagnosed with Stage 4 Metastic Breast Cancer in 2017. I’ve earned a lot about being my own advocate over these eight years and I choose Advent Health for all of my many scans. Winter Park is close to my house and very manageable due to the size. However, the downtown location is wonderful for any scans that are not available in WP. The staff is caring and attentive and the time waiting in the lobby is very short in both locations. My elderly father has had many stays in the downtown ICU and we have been very pleased with the technology and the knowledgeable staff. I highly recommend Advent Health and their affiliates. Also, their patient portal is efficient and easy to use

Advent Health is caring with perfessional team members.
I received a call from Terica today. She actively listened to what I said.
Thank you for your kindness and knowledge the questions asked.
Marilyn B Hicks
Surgery twice on two weeks. Outstanding care from top to bottom.
Everyone was very nice and professional.

My surgery at Advent health went very well. Dr. Neychev did an outstanding job. Before and after surgery the nurses did well prepping me and giving me what I needed. My night nurse that attended to me directly after my surgery was amazing. She made sure I had the medicine I needed, ice and anything else I needed. It was a very good experience
I received excellent care from start to finish.
The Dr is so great.  And the staff mist especially Franklin and Kayla and Joy, are so nice and remarkable at their jobs
Everything went well. The nurses were awesome, so were the doctors.

I had pleasure of meeting Dr Avandstooat. She was an awesome young lady . She gave me a through exam . She gave me several options for my situation. She was the most gentle Ob/GYN I HAVE EVER HAD.. She and her staff are professional and kind. I will be seeing her again. No complaints.Thank You Dr A for seeing me. .5 stars easy for the whole team!
best hospital with well-experienced staff

Good morning, I had a wonderful stay at AdventHealth Orlando. All I mean all employees from the surgical team, and the housekeeping of an ounce when they came who they were when they came in my room. The food was excellent. The daily bath was really great. My overall experience was just wonderful.

I am not happy. I had full-body PET scan on May 6. I have called repeatedly and they will not give me results until May 29. I find this intolerable and unacceptable. I have melanoma. Much can happen during that time period. I am not difficult. I am a patient who wants to stay alive and care about my health. No apologies from me, respect is due and missing.
I don’t have any complaints. I’ve always been treated with a lot of compassion by the nurses and doctors. The staff has always  been very helpful I’m very satisfied with their care. It’s Excellent.
Amazing doctors and nurses that truly care about the patients.
Very good experience with the Pediatric ENT department.
Dr Ranson takes his time answers all my questions and I have a lot.

I'd like to give 5 stars to the person who touched my heart early this morning. The employee at the hospital entrance that leads you to the bridge, I think her name is Marcia. It was my first visit to the hospital, and when I arrived, I could barely walk from the pain. She didn't hesitate to quickly help me and take me to the emergency room. She was very kind and understanding at all times. She, like the emergency room staff who treated me, was attentive at all times. Excellent service!

My nurse, Ronnie, was very helpful, quick, and patient during my renal biopsy. Every staff member we encountered was professional and courteous and made my first ever hospital experience and good one. Thank you!

No one talked to my daughter after my surgery  from the gyn team. Appointments are made without talking to me first. I rely on transportation so I have to see when my ride is available.  I don't appreciate this kind of treatment & finding out by reading my  portal. I could go on but won't  because this would be to long. I come from Brevard County which i an hour away. I don't like not having personal contact & so many numbers to call just so I can leave a message for someone to call me back with questions & concerns.

I was brought in by ambulance while visiting my son in Orlando where I had an emergency medical condition one night. I just started throwing up to the point I almost lost consciousness and so dizzy I couldn’t move.  Well I was admitted to the hospital for almost three days before released. During my stay I couldn’t have had any better service than I received from all the nurses and staff. I was diagnosed with vestibular neuritis which is a viral upper ear infection but I was being treated for a stroke while in the hospital until all the test they ran was completed that’s when I was diagnosed with vestibular neuritis and not a stroke which the two have similar symptoms to you body. The only complaint I have is with the doctor that was treating me would not give me the medication that treats this condition and I honestly believe it was due to the physical therapy person first checked me out and told me exactly what I had and recommended me to take the drug Prednisone and I ask the nurse if she would ask the doctor if he would prescribe me that drug.  Well the doctor refused to prescribe me the Prednisone and I honestly believe it was due to the physical therapist was the one that first diagnosed me having vestibular neuritis and recommended the drug and the doctor felt like his toes was being stepped on so he refused me this drug.  Well I’m back in my home town and seen my regular doctor which did prescribed me the medication I needed just started taking it so I don’t know if it will clear me up or not, I’m still having dizziness problems.
The entire experience was good from a pleasant person at check-in, to wonderful nurses during prep and post op.
We have had a wonderful experience at this hospital. There is always room for improvement anywhere you go but highly recommend

The staff on GT 12 were exceptional especially the RN day and night shifts
Caring, knowledgeable ,informative with plan of care
My family members were very impress with the nurses

No complaints what so ever
Would return to AdventHealth  Orlando for myself and will recommend to family and friends
The benefits staff Wendy was very happy to explain everything.
The level of service is above and beyond,  The staff demostrates a very passionate,  professional, caring atmosphere.

Most dishonest misleading hospital I’ve ever dealt with. Been fighting with them over billing and coding issues, gotten the run around regarding my claims. Unwilling to help resolve issue. Dr Kushnir’s office deals with deceptive coding practices. Will never use Advent Health for anything. Told them to close my account with office that I’d find another PC.

The purpose of my visit was for surgery.  I felt the staff was very caring and compassionate. The facility is relaxing and we were visited by Rufus the dog. Favorite hospital by far the staff is great the food is great the food is great the nurses are super nice the doctors that come in out are really good best hospital in Orlando
Great doctors, staff who provide exceptional  and personalized services.

Beautiful clean hospital. Housekeeping even turned in a lost credit card after. Some amazing new trials they seem to be up on latest stuff. Nursing care was pretty good. It's tough to find people nowadays and it's a big big hospital. Definitely recommend it
Couldn't get better care. I can't pick out one negative .these doctors and nurses are awesome!

I did not want to be here and had extreme anxiety about having to be admitted. The nurses and staff made the experience quite tolerable. Josh in the ER was amazing. Thank you all for making my stay as pleasant as possible. There are many options to go for care in Orlando and I’m glad I made the choice to go to Advent Orlando.

terrible service i walked in and it was nothing put attitude would never recommend anesia or however you spell her name was SUPER RUDEEEEEEEEEE

I have a great experience staying in the hospital everyone in the 6 floor was very helpful and nice I have some great nurses my room was 6824 I have to thank everyone nurses that take care of me I am still trying to get through this but I never forget you girls and guys if I have to go back I will always choose this hospital great nurses and staff members from the emergency room to the cafeteria my love goes out to all of you always

I want to give the valet driver Tyler a huge shout out for taking a few minutes out of his time to explain the process of how they keep track of the cars and who they belong to, to my 7 year old autistic. The excitement of learning about valet became the topic of subject all the way home. Thank you Tyler for leaving a positive impact on my son during a rough time.

I have had two surgeries at AdventHealth in the last three months. Everyone was so caring and patient. It’s never easy to be hurting. But I couldn’t ask for better support from the people at AdventHealth.
A little trouble finding a parking spot but other than that it was an excellent visit.
Thank you for your help

Very unsafe environment for your loved ones!! Do not I repeat do not leave them unattended if they can not speak for them selves

My daughter suffered an aneurysm and was heavily sedated on a vent so far  for 3+weeks

They are severely understaffed and have one nurse for 2 patients
But being neuro icu the patients are very high maintenance and many times if I need the nurse they are away from the station with the other patient.  Many times the situation is urgent i.e. the ventilator is alarming. The patient is agitated and needing assistance, keeping her from jumping out of the bed or pulling her tubes.

The fix to a lot of these nurses is to medicate or splint  their hands and add mittens

Why there is not patient care tech  assigned to this floor is beyond me. These nurses are very, very stretched and facing very severe burnout, which I’m sure leads to judgment issues.

Advent
health really needs to get their act together

The sink in the bathroom leaks and does not work properly. The guest bathroom next to the waiting room has mold in the toilet. The guest waiting area is ice machine and water machine does not work.

The first week I was here I had two issues with two separate nurses and they were actually infection risk issues and after having to make several phone calls, we were told that they wanted to earn our trust back and would only give us the best nursing care and that lasted for about three days then we got reassigned a nurse we had a concern about.  Every time my daughter makes progress we have a bad staffing day where she is not tended to appropriately and she suffers some sort of set back

She has pneumonia for the 3rd time since admission

The doctors change weekly and they all have a different approach and differences in focus of importance

Their lack of compassion for family members is shameful

There is no way I could ever leave my daughter alone and be safe from falling out of bed or extubations ( which has already happened) so as a result I have been essentially living here

I was told it was against policy for me to get a guest tray so I have even gone days without eating because it was unsafe for me to leave her side.  I have taken several photos of her hanging off the bed and no one is around.  I will be reporting this to cms as well

Do not leave your loved one there if they can not advocate for themselves
The nurses and care team at AdventHealth are the best- on-point in every regard. They made my surgery a successful experience!
Excellent service. Friendly, helpful group of professionals.
The staff was very kind and courteous. and answered all the questions I had.

Cardio rehab was really good program.  Staff excellent.  Unfortunately your location was really inconvenient.  It was 45 min drive each way and a long trek from parking. Ended up being a four hour trip.  Wish you had something in Dr Phillips.
Advent Health East is the greatest Hospital in the Greater Orlando area

Advent Health Orl. Hospital is the best one I've been in years. Employees give their 100%effort to the clients. They carry their hearts up their sleeve. Doctors are dedicated, knowledgeable and very prepared on their individual specialties. Special thanks to the cleaning crew, they do an awesome job. All my morning and night nurses,( you all know who) and I would highly recommend Dr. Hartman if you ever need a back surgery. Watch out his cowboy boots!!!!

All employees at Advent Health are soooo wonderful. We would not have been able to survive a heart transplant without them. They helped the whole family, not just the patient. They are beautiful and they serve with true care. Thank you!
