Did not get to speak with surgeon or clinical care team prior to operation. First time in hospital intake was not very welcoming or informative. Procedure was conducted as VA community care process but After operation I was left to fend for myself, after release while medicated there was no wheel chair and I had to walk to unknown pharmacy location for medications and then to wait for transportation area. I'm in need of AFLAC documents for work and have not received them. Dr wanted me to get Post Op home care and Physical Training and VA has not received instructions or request. I messaged VA primary care and was told request needs to be submitted by surgeons staff through community care contract POC.
The best hospital system I have ever been to.
Excellent experience! Staff so very caring!!!

From day 1 I stand by Advent Health.. The staff is ALWAYS very professional the treatment and care from the staff is always immaculate. I admire the togetherness and team work with the nurse staff in the infusion department especially when it comes to the Nurse staff Ann, Deshia, and Julie they make you feel at home, comfortable and relaxed.. They go above and beyond to see that everything goes well they are patient staff oriennted as well.. I admire their professionalism... We need more nurses like them in today's world.. ADVENT HEALTH NEVER FAILS..
Advent Hospital borland takes great care of me whenever I'm there.

I’d rather go to the big hospital for my MRI.  I went in a Saturday and had a hard time finding the department.  There was no one at the guest desk.  I was so annoyed and wandering around looking for anyone.  We finally found it.  I was the only patient there. They took me back and changed into scrubs.  The nurse started my IV.  So I waited to be called right away.  I was the only one there.  I waited about 15 minutes and stood outside of the room and asked loudly when will I be seen?  The tech came and apologized and said he was making sure the dye that he was going to use was ok.  Made sure I wasn’t allergic to it.  What???  Why couldn’t he find that out before I got there.  And he was on the phone too.  I was called back in 3 minutes.  I won’t go back on a Saturday.

It is obvious that AdventHealth Orlando has a culture of healing and caring. Every person we encountered - from surgical staff to nurses to the transport team - was kind, professional and deliberate in telling you who they were and how they contributed to your care. Dr. Fields was exceptional! He was confident in his plan, precise in his explanations and genuinely compassionate. His surgical team was also stellar and clearly very qualified. I felt seen, cared for and relaxed in what could have otherwise been a very scary situation.
Great experience with Debbie!

Absolutely love the team at Advent health. The nurse team and doctor were all so personable and kind during my entire procedure, making the process much easier. I always felt comfortable and well taken care of and truly appreciate the staffs kindness. You can tell each and every one of them loves what they do and it shows with care they give their patients. Thank you!

My dialysis catheter fell out of my chest 5 days after I had it "retunneled". I sat up to eat breakfast and found the catheter in my hands with the two pins that enter the heart right there. My undershirt was blotcjed with blood. I called the ambulance and realized my cough the night befire was probably from the catheter dislodging. There was blood in my lungs and I had to have a new catheter placed.
I was pleased with the service I received at Advent Health this time. The medicine doctor was exceptional. He had the bedside manner of an era long forgotten. There's hope in the darkness of the kiling fields of iotrophic medicine. As a Dialysis patient i watch and sometimes hear people die in hospital, including twice at Advent Health. Once in the basement during dialysis and once inbrhe ICU. I've been close ( to dying) myself, About 5 times. There has to be a better way.
Transplants with bone marrow are the best surgical solution. That way you don't need toxic antirejection meds. I got a transplant at Florida Hospital aka Advent Health in 2015 after 4 years on peritoneal Dialysis.  In 30 days the Tacrolymus levels never rose to the level they wanted. Instead of realizing I needed an alternative, doctor Cyril Kouriakus raised the prescription until I was taking 12 in the morning and 12 in the evening.  Keep in mind that the side effect of Tacrolimus is kidney damage.
That's right.  You get a kidney transplant, and the medicine destroys what little function you have left. Yeah. I was able to pee before the transplant, but not afterwards. That means swolen legs, edema, including pulmonary aka potentially drowning in my fluids in my sleep. Pericarditis. Several liters of fluid in the sack around my heart was drained over the course of three days. The procedure looked like a coffee strw sticking out of my chest.  I lost 45 pounds in 45 days in the process. Like I said, I have faced death several times over the years as a victim of the system.
To prevent the pericarditis from returning, I was prescribed Colchicine. Yeah. Bad idea. Colchicine caused splenomegaly and low platelets in my blood. The result was a bout with death,  closer than ever before in June and July of 2024. The Colchicine was stopped and I started taking B12 in high doses. It was a Naturalpathic healer that gave the knowledge for me to heal. My loving wife found her. Keep in mind, I had 7 blood and platelet transfusions first.  All while bleeding from the sinuses and several small wounds including acne on my face and a scratch on my leg from my new puppy. I was Neutropenic. That hospital stay was at ORMC.
Great experience from start to finish with caring and attentive staff
Great place to go. I love them all.
Excellent service provided by the company and their team

The care i received was first class.  Every staff member from orderly to admin, nurses and specialists and doctors gave care and expert experience in my stay!

I am grateful for the quality of service provided and feel confident that if I ever needed medical attention, I would be in the safest of hands with Advent. Thank you!
The best, professional, and kind people around. Without a doubt, my life was saved from a stroke. Iam Forever greatful!

There are some great employees in this practice like any medical provider but you have to search really hard to find them. Go with a health care provider where all the doctors are amazing!! You will win every time.
The nurse was real nice to me and explain everything about the surgery and what time to get there.
Adventhealth customer service is the best, the empathy and  compassion specially in difficult moments is exceptional. 100% recommended

Always have the best care! I am a senior, and Advent Health is the best hospital I have ever been to. Their transplant Clinic is number one, and their Intensive Care nurses are the most knowledgeable I have ever seen. Cardiac Rehab takes care of you with caring and knowledge. They are the best of the best!

Other than the last day they were wonderful. No complaints. They were efficient and helpful. Since I was confined to a bed, they responded immediately whenever needed. Unfortunately, the last day it took over 30 min to get to me. Finally, I asked them to disarm the bed.
Great care, testing & follow up.
They were very professional at there job and took excellent care of me thanks
Had a stroke and was there for 4 days. Marangela(?) and Lauren took awesome care of me. They deserve a raise and a promotion

All of the facilitators were excellent I've been having diabetes for over 10 years now and I didn't know how much I didn't know about diabetes it was a very enlightening month for me and informative about the different medicines I had no clue I just did what my doctor told me and kept it moving. However, the breakdown was so much information and the fact that they simplify it I was able to comprehend and retain the knowledge I learned about diabetes. I am so grateful and humble for all the classes especially Ashley she was amazing I'm so grateful and humble that I had this experience it was very positive I would say 10 out of 10. Thank you, Ivellisse
The Orthopedic unit, was excellent treating me. I felt secure with the decisions made to care for my broken bones. They were a great team.

This was one of the worst experiences of my life and has seriously delayed my ongoing recovery. The nursing  and medical staff as a whole, was rude, unprofessional, and never bothered to read my chart or check allergies, or answer a call bell (there were 1 or 2 nurses throughout my stay, that were awesome, but it absolutely was NOT the norm!)I had a medical procedure that I require somewhat “regularly” and know what to expect….this was nothing short of torture. The care was worse than any third world country. I had been on a clear liquid diet and fasting for a couple days prior, and was also vomiting…it took them until the day after the procedure, to even start me on IV fluids which is standard of care, and similar amount of time to get orders for nausea and pain meds (never even given in recovery) I lost 12 lbs in a week and now having issues with my blood pressure, all related to this. For clarification, usually I’m in the hospital two-three days post op, and basically back to 💯.
I’m not fond of ORMC, as their misdiagnosis led to death of my son, from renal cell carcinoma, but after my recent experience with Advent Health, I’ll be giving them another try. (Seriously felt I had woken up in an alternate reality, it was so BAD)
Rush you out of hospital to fast with having a resolution for your case
Staff is very attentive and caring to your needs and comfort.
I went through a life changing experience, having AdventHealth Orlando as my partner allowed me to survive and continue a normal life. Thank you AdventHealth for saving my life.

Visit was great.  Everyone was attentive and there was little waiting.  However, I have called multiple times trying.to get questions answered about the test results.  The clinical team is not returning those calls.

Normally I have nothing but great things to say about this hospital. Unfortunately, this review will not be great. I understand the hospital is busy and everyone needs their nurses attention, but I would NEVER treat a patient or their family members like that. I survived this because someone paid attention. I don’t know who it was but I owe my life to that person and other members of the hospital staff. Thank you for giving a few more days in my life

I usually have a wonderful experience, considering I’ve visited so many times. This time, this room, not good at all. I’m convinced the 3rd & 8th floors are HAUNTED & broke down where they send patients they don’t really want to deal with.
My room, 8225, was filthy. The toilet seat was broken off. Every time I had to go a had to balance my sick self so I wouldn’t fall off, there was a full container of OLD urine that has been left in a suction container, there was a SPRAY of BLOOD 🩸 OR FECES 💩 across ALL the ceiling tiles from one wall to the other. I had SEVERAL nurses who mishandled my IVs & the night nurse wouldn’t report it or do anything with it when I asked & passed it off to the day nurse who ALSO ignored it then left for 5 HOURS before I saw her again once THREE other nurses came in to place a new IV. I went through five IVs in 10 days. I was stuck 27 times not including daily blood draws. I have been in other areas of the hospital, whether there is not a breath of problem from the rooms or the staff or the nurses. I felt very neglected and even improperly medicated. When I was given my pain medication, I was given another medication that knocked me out and I was unresponsive and the nurses told me they were going to have to do a “sternum rub “ on me to try to get me to be responsive. I ended up leaving sooner than I should have because I felt scared after all of that had happened to me, and I feel like I am still recuperating at home when I should still be in the hospital. My doctors were amazing as always, but everything else was a great big giant awful experience that I’ve never experienced there before. I was shocked and very disappointed.

Don’t let the glowing reviews fool you - this hospital is rife with incompetence. I went here while I was on vacation and having difficulty swallowing. I went in around 5 pm the first evening, they said in order to do a scope, I would have to stay overnight to “hold my place in line”. The ER doctor - Dr. Jerry - said they would “definitely” get me in the next day. They couldn’t give me a quote on how much it would cost because “Blue Cross Blue Shield (who I am insured under) always gives them fits on Sundays” for estimates. I decided to stay because it had been two days since I’d eaten solid food and I was struggling even with liquids, which was more concerning, otherwise I wouldn’t have gone at all.

They finally got me into a room, and my night nurse told me they would get me in first thing in the morning for a scope. Apparently, she was mistaken. The day nurse informed me that the doctors had 24 hours to respond to an order. Once again - I don’t live there, and I also didn’t want to stay two nights in a hospital because it’s going to be ridiculously expensive.

In the morning, someone brings me food - juice and jello. I didn’t touch it because even with my limited medical knowledge, I know that the usual protocol is no food and drink for 8ish hours before anesthesia. The nurse came in and asked if I’d been able to eat AND gave me a stool softener in juice (that I did not express a need for). It felt like a prompt, so I tried. I stupidly trusted that they knew what was best as it is their literal job. I didn’t have much (obviously, as I was struggling with swallowing) - a few sips of apple juice and probably less than a teaspoon of jello. I figured maybe since it was clear liquids it must be okay, and they wouldn’t be offering it to me if I wasn’t supposed to have it, right?

My grandmother called the charge nurse to check in on things because she was concerned for me being there all by myself, and after that, THEN they told me not to take anything else by mouth. EVERYONE that interacted with my care verbally acknowledged & knew that the plan was for me to be scoped from the minute I got there, and yet they allowed food to be delivered to me. They said they couldn’t scope me after that as I was an aspiration risk. My GI doctor when I got back home said for clear liquids, they only would’ve had to wait 4 hours, and I’d stopped ingesting anything around noon.

And on top of that, the day nurse almost gave me blood thinners because a vial had been left on his cart before he asked where they usually give it to me and I said they didn’t. He said “oh, they must have just ordered it”, (for an ENDOSCOPY? And when all my blood work looked normal?) and then looked at my profile and realized it wasn’t for me. He also advised that I shouldn’t take so many tums because it would give me osteoporosis, which is wild, considering a) I wasn’t taking them and hadn’t indicated such, and b) even if I had been, I was now here for the reason that I COULDN’T SWALLOW WELL. I think I would take my chances with osteoporosis over being unable to swallow.

I consider myself a pretty reasonable person - I do understand that hospitals are busy, and more severe situations take precedence. I wasn’t asking to be treated like a priority, just simply for clearer, more honest communication, so that I could have measured expectations and made decisions accordingly. I wasted time there that I could have been spending with the people I was on vacation with, or simply gotten an earlier flight home to be seen, which is what I ended up doing after it was all said and done.

Every single person that interacted with my care failed miserably at their jobs, but a special shoutout to Nurse Jan Michael, and the nurse over the observation unit whose name I didn’t catch (a white woman with cornrows) for being extra terrible.
Very nice people. Thorough. Experienced some waiting for doctor but to be expected

Take a look at at this bill I received for a three hour emergency room visit after a bad case of food poisoning.  How in the world can a hospital justify almost $25k for a three hour visit? I get that I had a CTScan but to charge $15k for that, $6k for three hours in a room, etc? A single Azithromycin pill for $33? What a complete joke.

Did I mention that they insisted on doing the CTScan because I was out of the country about a month before and they thought maybe I could have been infected by something there.  Interesting… despite me telling them that both my dog and I got sick right after eating a specific chicken, they still insisted.  It makes sense since they can bill those ridiculous amounts.

Wait, I didn’t mention that a cash visit for the same thing would have been under $5k, according to them.

I think about all the people that don’t have the money to pay, don’t have the same insurance, have far worse situations, etc.  #AdventHealth, #adventhealthorlando  should be totally ashamed of how they are robbing people.  #BrokenSystem, #AbuseOfPower, #customerlast, #takewhatyoucan

Sadly I have to write bad review for my last experience at the ED and after being admitted. The ED admitted me after reviewing the care plan for my condition, we were all on the same page, be admitted, get pain management and wait for further poc from specialist. After 24 hours of my admission no specialists came to see me, nurses, attending physician, everyone knew we were waiting for the specialist. Attending even notated, saw patient, waiting for specialist.. after eagerly encouraging my nurse team to reach out to the specialist the specialist informed them that they signed off on me in the ED and that they weren’t coming for a consult. So now we are furious bc why are we here? So I demanded to be discharged, it takes nearly another 24 hours before I am seen by attending and we agree that bc of this mess I should go. Well Insurance denied all inpatient stay, providers and inpatient notes have been altered. This is a mess! I will not be on the hook for two nights at the hospital when everyone knew there was a mistake on their end! I’m beyond furious and still dealing with my severe condition. If you are reading this review, you are deciding if Advent Health will care properly for you, a family member, or a friend.  My words help as you ponder your decision.

I was admitted to Advent Health Orlando, 601 E Rollins St, on April 2nd, 2025, to have a Spinal laminectomy and fusion procedure.  L3, L4, L5, and S1, a three-layer.  Dr. Baker and his team performed my surgery as planned.  From my arrival, preparation for surgery, during and after surgery were excellent.  This surgery is my seventh major surgery, which includes a total knee and shoulder replacement.  With this surgery, I had the best after-surgery experience.  I was elated with the nurses' concern for managing my pain with top-level care.  The room tech also checked on me to make sure things were in order.  I had follow-ups with the lead nurses.

Yesterday, Saturday, April 5th, was my last day at Advent Health.  Rhea was assigned to care for me.  When Rhea entered my room and spoke to me, I knew I would be in great hands.  Rhea was exceptional.  Her demeanor, willingness to care for a patient, and organizational skills are exemplary.  I never felt my pain more significant than a three while cared for by Rhea.  When Rhea arrived, my wife was also in the room and concurred with my sentiments.   After a few minutes, Michelle visited me.  WOW!  After meeting Michelle, I understood why the nursing team was so strong.  They are God sent.

Nothing is perfect.  I try hard to contain my emotions.  Unfortunately, my pain intensified to a level that my emotions overtook my logic, and for that, I am sorry.

I want to give much kudos to the following nurses, the nurse supervisor, and the nurse manager:

Shae, Alissa, Yaoska, Ivette, and Rhae - THANK YOU!

Reena - Lead Nurse - She tried her utmost best.  I felt that if she could physically have a way to remove my pain and discomfort, she would have.  Unfortunately, I just had to wait for the pain medication to kick in.  THANK YOU, Rheena!

Michelle, you are EXCEPTIONAL.  Your strength in the nurse team is demonstrated by how you carry yourself, work with the nurses, and care for patients.  I saw it firsthand.  THANK YOU!!!!

I have only positive things to say about my stay at Advent Health of Orlando, and I will highly recommend it to my family and friends.

Heartfelt expressed.

Parking is terrible every time I attend anywhere at Advent Orlando. You treat your income stream like cattle & I will try my hardest to find other accommodations with your competitors. I will recommend an alternative to your services to everyone I know. I pray to Jesus my 45+ years as an RN will sway enough of your clients to alternate sources of care to rid the Community of grubby businesses such as yours.

I have never visited this doctor Before. I have visited this hospital and I know I know everything is clean and wonderful. I must admit I found a doctor that I really really really like he explains things well he’s encouraging clarifies so that you understand he’s just playing a good doctor. The whole experience was a good one.

I never write negative reviews for anything, but I am so disgusted by how I was treated while in the psychiatric unit involuntarily. The majority of the nurse techs were loud all night long, patronizing, and unprofessional. Y'all need to realize how vulnerable these patients are and that they have needs that you should be prioritizing over talking about work drama. If you can't treat patients with compassion, this isn't the career path for you. I was told I could "absolutely not" wear my chest binder, something that alleviates my formally diagnosed body dysmorphia. They couldn't tell me why, so how am I not supposed to feel like this was plainly to discriminate against me? I wasn't given food until the second full day I was there. I asked for tylenol six times before I actually got it. I wasn't allowed to get phone numbers out of my phone to talk to my family and friends. I wasn't given my medication at first and it made my anxiety go through the roof. I never miss my meds. I didn't even get to talk to the psychiatrist until the day I was discharged.
Not once did I feel like I was receiving the help I needed at the time. I needed care, support, encouragement to get myself back on the right track. I just felt even more frustrated.
everything went as schesuled and planned
Great medical group very friendly and knowledgeable along with being caring and professional
Unfortunately, we had to visit a loved one at this hospital, but we were very pleased with the atmosphere.  We are so grateful for the  hard work that the doctors and nurse do for our loved ones.
Very attentive staff.
Pre op Nurse was amazing. Post op nurse was  very thorough.

Everyone was attentive and truly seemed to care. From checking in, through pre-op, surgery and post-op, I felt heard and taken care of. When I brought up different concerns, they listened and made the experience as comfortable as possible. I felt everyone knew what they were doing which made me more calm.
Competent. Friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Everyone was very helpful and nice too me and my mom Dr Hoffman and all the staff was super understanding with me I strongly recommend this’s hospital for your surgery and Dr Hoffman and like I say all the staff will welcome you with a smile 🥰

I always feel like I'm getting the best care available at Advent. In addition, the care givers are kind and knowledgeable and most go out of their way to demonstrate their knowledge and put my fears at rest. How lucky can someone be?!!! They have my heartfelt appreciation and respect.

Hope one of the doctors will not be as concerned to do surgery "on a 75 year old woman" soon after another surgery. I've had 16 surgeries without ever having a problem. I hate having to wait so long for a subsequent surgery....it just keeps me inactive for so much longer and it affects my other body parts. Besides I won't have anyone to help me out if I have to wait - I live alone and my son came here from TX to help me out but can't stay for an extended period.

Doctors and nurses very professional, helpful and kind.
The medical care was excellent and very thorough. The feedback from every specialist was both informed and knowledgeable.
First walking to the lobby, was impressed, made me feel, I'm not another number, in file
From pre-surgery and registration through to the surgery and aftercare, everyone was caring, friendly, and helpful. It made the experience much less stressful. Nice and modern facilities.
Really nice service from the emergency room all the way to when my child had surgery. Thank you DR. O

My father passed away on January 20th and was brought to the hospital on South street by ambulance. I waited there for little while and talked to some people. Long story short it's been 2 1/2 months nobody knows where his wallet is identification or any of his debit cards ,credit cards are at. Luckily I canceled everything but hopefully somebody doesn't try to steal his identities since they have his driver's license social security cardinal that goods.

Although being at the hospital isn't very pleasant in the first place, I was absolutely surprised at the level of service and care that I received. From the moment I pulled up to the emergency room, the valet not only opened the door but offered to grab some of my things and made sure I had everything I needed from my car. The weight in the emergency room for them to see me wasn't very long probably about 10 minutes I was quickly seen and diagnosed with pancreatitis. Everything that's explained to me very clearly of what had happened and what the next steps would be. It was made out to me that I would be admitted and would have to wait for a room in the hospital. Every step from the testing x-rays blood work etc was absolutely flawless. Everyone took their time to explain everything to me and both medical and layman's terms. It was truly under the circumstances of very good experience and I felt I was cared for above and beyond till the time I was discharged.
Great place for healthcare with awesome people that really do care.

My experience here is been wonderful. There's no words to describe the excellent job of everyone in this hospital. Everything went well. Great communication all the times.These are really professional and they really love what they do. This time when I  went to this hospital it wasn't the best experience.  From the tech forgetting constantly to get me ice l, towels l, and jello.  Dept from ultrasound had me fasting with no water tlfor 7 hours to then cancel my appointment.  My lung doctor never showed and lastly the last nurse assigned to me was rude.  However, I did have a wonderful experience with nurse "Luis" he was amazing..

I have to agree with a lot of negative comments about this hospital. My mother was in ICU for heart failure and the ICU room was extremely small even for the equipment to help her breathe. The baseboards were unraveling from the wall exposing clue and dried clue and the room still look under construction. One cleaning staff took notice and said she will report it. However, she eventually  was moved to a private room for recovery with the hammering and drilling and very loud banging going on for several days. My mother experienced some delusional episodes after ICU and the staff called to wake me up 4am in the morning just to calm her down. As we all know a call like that usually means life or death. I strongly feel they could have control that situation differently instead of the family thinking the worse has happen. Some of the medical staff that come and go each day and night were very kind. Upon discharge my mother needed oxygen and could not walk without support and yet she was sent home with no medical equipment not even a walker.  This hospital will drop the ball and will not correct their errors until you force their hands. This is totally unacceptable for Advent Health hospital.
Excellent doctors, negligent nurses and techs. I’ve never been so completely impressed and unimpressed all at the same time.

Hello, I would like to share that prior to going I was unsure  what to expect, which was discomforting. However, once my nurse came in and introduced herself i felt much better. She was absolutely amazing from start to finish. I’m so grateful to God for placing me with the right people during this period of my life.

But the shower was horrible!  With a partial cover over my IV and unable to get my face wet due to my condition, I thought I could hold the shower hose with one hand and wash with the other.  But the nozzle just sprayed out at the bottom even though I tried to tighten it to the hose.  Another disaster was shower was about 2 ft to cover a 2.5 ft opening!  Needless to say, the entire bathroom was flooded.  I almost slipped on the wet floor.  It was awful trying to get dried off and out of the wet room.  What a liability!!

Even with the bathroom disaster, I cannot say enough good things about the nurses, techs, housekeeping, etc.  All were axcellent.

Got there in time for my patient’s appointment. We left my car with the valet parking. I payed $5. I AM GLAD I DIDNT TIP THEM!!!! THEY STOLE ALL THE CHANGE I HAD!!! I had over 20 quarters. Beware the Ides of March!!! Next time… DONT LEAVE ANYTHING INSIDE THE CAR.

First of all the GT7 nurses rock! Thank you for taking care of me from the nutrition staff to the emergency room nurses and doctors to the techs to the house keeping crew the charge nurses, phlebotomist and the nurses that took care of me even the student thank you all! You guys are all awesome!

Excellent service, efficient,  and very caring.

My experience involved attempting to schedule an appointment with a neurologist. I prefer not to mention the doctor's name, as the issue is not with the doctor but rather with the appointment restrictions imposed by the Epilepsy Center, if we can call it that.
After multiple attempts to secure an initial appointment—due to AdventHealth repeatedly losing faxed documents—we eventually went in person to hand-deliver the paperwork. A week later, after numerous follow-ups and voicemails, we finally received a call to schedule the appointment. However, the AdventHealth representative informed us that if we visited their Epilepsy Center to see Dr. X, he would only address my daughter’s epilepsy and not her sleep issues or the anxiety caused by her seizures.
When I questioned this restriction, pointing out that all these issues were interconnected, the representative insisted that the appointment would be strictly for epilepsy treatment. Given this limitation, I had no choice but to decline the appointment, as our primary concern is treating my daughter’s overall condition, including the sleep disorder caused by it. I also reminded the representative that Dr. X specializes in sleep disorders, yet she reiterated that he would not address them.
I find it frustrating and disappointing that AdventHealth places such restrictions on doctors, preventing them from providing comprehensive care to their patients. When a condition like epilepsy affects an entire family’s well-being, it is disheartening to encounter barriers that limit access to holistic treatment options.
Amazing place to receive treatment. Everyone is kind and I was treated with a lot of compassion.

Everyone was extremely nice and calming during my visit. They understood what I was concerned with and also went above and beyond helping to figure out other possible underlying reasons for my symptoms. Even while doing this I was there for far less time than I dreaded (no one wants to sit in a hospital bed). I actually had to go back to the er for similar symptoms a few days later and found out that waterman in Tavares is now also advent health so I went there being it was closer to me. Same experience. My only complaint with waterman was one person attending the er waiting room who ran an EKG on me hit the foot which was what I was I was being admitted for and hurt tremendously and then acting like I was over reacting and slightly shaming me. She didn’t know I was there for that and I do not fault her but my only complaint would be better communication when you walk In the door. My entire rest of the visit was very nice and I very much enjoyed the way the doctors spoke to me in ways I was able to understand not being from a medical background and always asked what else they could answer or if I had questions. I love advent and will go to them as long as they are here. I’m even switching my primary doctor and specialists to advent from Orlando health so it is easier to see the records and communicate with one another which I find her beneficial

Dr. Agrawal is amazing. I have never experienced such a thorough explanation of my heart condition and what to expect for treatment.
She is a brilliant specialist with a terrific, caring bedside manner.

The surgery was great. However it took one nurse 5 jabs before she turned it over to someone else to insert an IV. Unacceptable.  It took a nurse 5 tries to insert a catheter before turning it over to someone else. Unacceptable. Was almost given statins several times when they are clearly on my allergy list. When I was in for a Cardiac cath everything went great. Don't know what happened
Professional and friendly staff. Highly recommend.
Love all of Advent Health
Wonderful cardiac unit.
9 HRS IN ER NO HELP NO ROOMS AVAILABLE SAD SAD DAY

My husband came in for his first surgery in his life at 76. Every nurse we had, every doctor, every anesthesiologist, and every staff member was professional, friendly, helpful, thorough, and kind the whole time! My husband was very apprehensive, but each person that worked with him was very reassuring and supportive.
Great staff they will always make you smile
My nurse Monica (pre-op) and Nurse Amber (recovery) were absolutely excellent. Thank you 🙏 ladies.

I have received the worst treatment that a person can receive in a health center, I arrived with pain from kidney stones at 10 am, a doctor saw me an hour later, I informed him that I had kidney stones and that the results were in the advent health application, he said he could not find anything, my wife showed him all the analysis and results from her phone, he said he would return and never appeared, several nurses were asked what was happening, that there was no attention, receiving zero information at 9 PM at night, the disgust was greater than the pain that I left that inadequate health care center, a week later they performed the pulverization of the stones. If anyone asks me, the recommendation is to go to any other care center not related to Advent Health.
I thought I was going to die but I didn’t. 10 out of 10. Would recommend

Our recent experience with the Advent Hospital system was extremely frustrating due to poor communication, unnecessary delays, and a general lack of urgency from the staff.
I am a retired general surgeon.  My mother is 98 and fell and broke her wrist.  She was seen at an Advent urgent care and we were told she needed to be admitted to the hospital to be seen by an orthopedic surgeon, where she would be evaluated for surgery.  I asked for her to be sent to the Rollins campus but was told no, she had to go to the Altamonte facility, where she was admitted later that evening but not seen by anyone until an occupational and physical therapist “evaluated” her the next day.  Apparently, the orthopedic team was not interested in seeing a 98 year old woman themselves.
Following OT and PT evaluation we waited to speak to someone from the orthopedic team.  We were told by the nurse that he had been texting them and someone would see her soon.   That nurse would not call them directly.  After multiple requests, that nurse finally called a supervisor who, late in the afternoon, was able to put me on the phone with an orthopedic PA.   Once I was able to speak explain that my mother was living independently and had not major medical problems, he agreed that she might benefit from surgery.  Unfortunately, they only do that surgery at the Rollins campus so she would have to be transferred there for further evaluation.
After finally being transferred to Rollins for surgery, we experienced more delays. The hospitalist, who had to ”clear” her for surgery informed us that he was  at the Altamonte facility and it would be awhile before he could see her.  He did, however, without even evaluating her himself, insist that she needed to be seen by a cardiologist.  He proudly told us that he had put the consult in but also informed us that they had 24 hours to respond to this electronic request.  All this time she was kept in bed, without food or water (based on decades old medical guidelines), waiting for decisions that should have been made much sooner.

I asked the nurses if I could talk with an anesthesia provider or the orthopedic team, someone who could actually make a decision.   They said they would send a message.  When we asked if we could talk to someone who would actually call these people, we were visited by the charge nurse who said that she was not paid enough to call the doctor’s directly.  We never heard from the orthopedic team but the anesthesiologist said they could not see the patient until she was cleared by the hospitalist.
Cardiology nurse practitioner finally came by, asked the same basic questions that anyone with one day of surgical/anesthesia experience would ask and said that she was OK for surgery.  15 minutes later, the cardiologist came by and said the same thing.  The hospitalist came in around the same time, stood at the entrance to the room, never examining my mother and only entering the room when we told him my mother was hard of hearing.  It was only in the operating room when my mother was actually evaluated by the orthopedic surgeon.
The only bright spot in this experience was the surgical and anesthesia teams, who were excellent once she finally reached the OR. Unfortunately, everything leading up to that point was an exercise in frustration.
Main Issues We Experienced:
•	Poor communication among staff – Messages were "sent" instead of direct calls, leading to long delays.
•	Unacceptable delays in specialist evaluation – It took nearly two days for my mother to be seen by the right people.
•	Lack of urgency from the hospitalist – Decisions were made without evaluating the patient in person.
•	Unprofessional behavior from some staff members – Particularly the charge nurse, who refused to escalate concerns.
I would not recommend this hospital for anyone needing timely or well-coordinated care. The system seems broken, and the culture among some staff members does not prioritize the well-being of patients.
Excellent work by everyone!
Everything went were well except x rays had to be called several times. They missed both there scheduled  appointments.  That ran us an hour or two behind.
They were absolutely great at this hospital during my surgery. Highly recommend to anyone needing anything to use them.

I couldn't find the building so I called the office. The person who answered the phone failed to give good directions and was kinda rude. I got the impression she was suggesting I was stupid for being lost.

The prep and procedure were efficiently performed.  But, what was really appreciated was that my galaxy phone was not set up for calling a cab.  The techs and nurses stepped in and called Mears; it was an effort above and beyond what I expected.  One of the nurses said "we have to make sure you have transportation home."  They spent a great amount of time, more than I could possibly have expected in setting me up with transportation home.  One of the staff even offered to drive me home (Clermont); I couldn't believe someone would extend caring so far.  Thank you very much -- Art Stoudt

I was a orthopedic surgery outpatient at Advent Hospital on Rollins Street in Orlando. Every employee I interacted with was very patient and kind. I cannot remember all the names but my nurses Dominique and Laura very especially nice. Thank you.

My Granddaughter had a kidney scan today
The Imaging team was great. Love me,keep me safe,own it ,make it easy all done..God Bless this great team. You are doing God's work.
Thank you soooo much Dr. Arain! Dr. Arain is literally the best!!! I can’t say enough great things about Dr. Arain and his team. Thank you to all the nurses too

Overall AdventHeath Orlando in my opinion
is number one

I will not go into detail about my private healthcare, but I will say that my recent outpatient surgery treatment was very thoroughly supported by a number of medical professionals and staff at AdventHealth Orlando during my scheduled intervention. All of the staff were so personable, kind and considerate to my individualized needs. The schedule ran smoothly, the anesthesiologist was helpful and informative, and the surgeon was patient to answer questions and provide clarification about my after care. I will also add that I am very happy with my recovery, so far, knowing that the team is available to support me along the way.

I had a terrible experience at this hospital. During my entire ER visit, I spoke with the doctor once. He did not bother to physically examine me, which is unacceptable to me. I got an x-ray done and a CT scan. After these scans were completed I didn't get to speak with the doctor and was told by the nurse everything was normal and I was ready to be discharged. While the nurse was explaining this to me, I mentioned that I had seen on my patient portal on my phone that I had a cyst that was discovered on my CT scan, which nobody bothered to tell me about. If I had not asked "what about the cyst?" nobody would have mentioned it to me at all! I've had this before years ago so it didn't worry me but I would have appreciated some type of transparency of my results. The bloodwork came back, with a bunch of levels abnormal and I had to ask the nurse my questions, which she answered "yeah everything's normal, things can sometimes be off but that doesn't mean anything." I honestly think this hospital is headed on its way for a huge incident in regards to liability and malpractice. They were extremely busy, I could tell, but the type of service I received here was unacceptable. I was reading my after care summary online just now and it says "The plan has been discussed with the Patient. All questions have been answered at this time and they are agreeable with the plan of care for discharge." NO QUESTIONS WERE ANSWERED. Its insane to me that they are writing things on official documents as if it happened, when it in fact did not. No plan of care was discussed and I didn't even see the doctor before getting discharged or after the results of any of my scans came out. If I did not have access to my patient portal where I can personally view the results of my tests, I would be unaware of my ongoing health. Shame on you guys that is absolutely unacceptable. I can't imagine the amount of patients who currently have conditions that should have been caught by ER doctor's here if they actually took the time to assess each patient's health as they should. So many patients most likely go home with conditions they have no idea about it because the doctors don't bother to mention it. Its so sad because it is clear to me that eventually they will neglect a patient and there will be consequences.
Minimal waiting, friendly staff. Physician was straight talker, friendly, good people person.
It was pretty good experience, nice staff good Drs and Nurses I am glad to be in their hands

I 87 years old entered the opposite main building  entrance without and I could not find the radiology imaging room because it is NOT Listed on  the directory posted on the wall I thought I was in the wrong building had. The directory should have included both sides North’s and  South’s

Wow, I thank you all of you for what you did, from cleaning my room, to taking my vitals, to administer medication, to the anesthesia and operations team. You are all awesome and delivered on an excellent experience. I thank the my lord Jesus for your lives and send you all blessings from above. ❤️❤️❤️

Amazing hospital ! Will take care of you if you are sick or not! Had baby with them and got big infection from other hospital that they take care of! All nurses is above and beyond , everyone is very kind. Food is great! And if you stay in Orlando downtown you’ll get better view then 500$ a night hotel!
They messed up my schedule today and then when i complain they magically said they could not do that test.

I just came from the women’s hospital at Adventhealth on East Rollins and the midwife named Tonya works there and she was super sweet and very outgoing and helpful with my situation. She really is for her patients. Very kind soul

My seven days was great, thanks to all my Doctor's and Nurses for their expertise and knowledge. To help me get my blood pressure and everything back to normal. Thanks for the great room and all of the cleaning and safety..love to for
everyone. Bonnie Monson back home and feeling a lot better.

Ordered salads with dressing on side and one cookie. Salads were fresh. Two dressings were included, which was perfect! The cookie was missing so we had to circle back and ask for that. Overall, good experience ordering on line and picking up at a very busy medical facility.
One year check up after open heart surgery. The doctors and nurses here are first rate!  Would not go anywhere else!

The Akron location I wouldn't take my dog to it. 6 hours wait to be seen with 5 other people waiting. On my way to a CT scan I was asked my name or date of birth. My doctor sent me there to rule our pancreatic. The doctor put on my release papers I was there for vomiting and diarrhea which was a lie. Had severe pain in my stomach and legs. I also have MS and was not checked if I was having a flare. My triglycerides were in the 1600s . Doctor advised me to take fish oil pills while never offered anything for my pain.

10 Stars!  I wish I could rate this review higher.  Our experience with the clinic has been fabulous.  The pre-intake staff helped advocate to get our family member accepted as a patient.  They helped convince the less experienced staff at our local hospital to make the timely transfer.  Our family member got the care needed and the health management throughout the stay was excellent - Doctors, nurses, cleaning staff, and everyone.  Highly recommend starting here or transferring here.
Cleveland Clinic is overrated and now requires upfront co-pays for tests. And their use of CNPs are a danger to your health !

What a joke. I ran out of my fycompa for seizure on a weekend the on call doctor was saying it need to be authorized by the insurance...excuse me? I need those. It wasnt like a new "med" it's been a med I've been on for months. What a joke. I suggest a different hospital.
When you order something online that’s unavailable; you come to pick up nd standing waiting for nothing. No one deems it fit to let you know they don’t have the item. Makes no sense.

Majority of the doctors and nurses are great. It is the billing department that is the failure. You are not allowed to pay what you can afford. The billing department dictates the set amount. The only explanation their employee gives you is that, this is all our system allows to give you and they cannot give you lower payment. When you ask to speak or ask a supervisor for assistance, nothing changes. Why do other hospitals give you BETTER pay options and the Cleveland Clinic does not?  Payment plans must be negotiable. Hospitals are expected to work with patients to establish a manageable payment plan. If it was not for their billing department I would give a better rating.

They told me to come from Texas to see them because they had a new life changing surgery available for me. I am cash pay, and living in Texas. I flew out and all together spent over $2000 to see their specialist who told me in fact there were no new surgeries that could help me. Total waste of time, and then they gave me some terrible advice that caused me even more physical pain than what I was experiencing. What a joke.
This place is such a wonderful hospital.  I had the joy and honor of experiencing a worker there name Holden that was diligent in his work and had a great deal of compassion for patients.
Best spinal surgery and aftercare.

My wife spent six weeks as a patient in need of a serious life threatening condition.  We are forever grateful for the treatment and professional care given to Sherri.  She is on the mend now.  140 days of constant treatment in the hospital.  I believe the science approach combined with the practice of medicine made it possible

they took good care of me here during my procedure and my overnight stay. made sure i was comfortable and got enough food to eat. surgery went great and i've ran into no problems recovery wise so far. highly recommend

Just waited over a month for an appointment to get an EMG they called me today then say of my appointment to tell me that my Dr rampazzo put the order in wrong and I'd have to wait at least a month and a half for a new appointment like my life and my well-being don't matter it's been nothing but problems with Cleveland clinic since my injury including doctors treating me like shit if you can help it go somewhere else

My review is based simply on the fact that no matter how hard I try and who I contact, I am constantly bombarded with Cleveland Clinic advertisements in my email feed. Three times now I have gone through considerable effort to find a live person and request that the incessant messages stop. Three times I have been told they would and three times I have been lied to. Absolutely no interest in Cleveland Clinic and now that I know they are such a nuisance to the unwary public I wouldn't go there even if I did think I needed their services. Please go away!!!!

I cannot say enough positive about Cleveland Clinic. I have been taking my sister there for over five years for cancer treatment, and I receive services for heart issues. Our doctors are excellent! The other professionals and support staff are typically very good at what they do. The organization is run like well-oiled machine. I stayed recently in the heart step down unit and my stay was excellent. They also have helped my sister afford her treatment for multipe myeloma which is extremely expensive and not fully covered by her private insurance. We feel so blessed to live in the area of Cleveland clinic. Both of us highly recommend Cleveland clinic to anyone needed excellent medical care.

It is not possible to make appointments. I was on the phone for 30 minutes and the call was transferred between many offices which I did not have any idea who they were. I just tried to make appointments with my family physician's PA. I called the number they gave to me on MyChart. This kind of service is not acceptable.
They have become one of the worst hospitals in the Cleveland area.

I just want to take a moment to thank the entire Cleveland Clinic team. From the security staff to the valet, to those in the halls helping with directions, the ladies at the check-in desk, and especially the pediatric PACU staff and Dr. Ernest Young in orthopedics—every single person was amazing. My son had surgery, and the whole experience was prompt, smooth, and compassionate. No long waits, just kindness, professionalism, and clear communication at every step. We truly appreciate the care you gave our family.

The level of care at Cleveland Clinic facilities in Akron Ohio has deteriorated! I waited 4 months for much needed colon surgery at Akron General which my primary care doctor said caused me to get a life threatening blood clot. I was told they had a shortage of doctors and I would just have to wait. In my opinion, the CEO is more concerned with profits and purchasing more and more hospitals and private physician practices. As a result, the quality of care is suffering. Supposedly, it’s a nonprofit organization, yet the CEO is paid over $4 million annually. Again, my opinion, but Cleveland Clinic is now just all about the $$$. There was a time when it was a patient first organization. Very unfortunate…

Mind boggling.  I've been to a few hospitals in my time but nothing like this.  Cleveland Clinic saves and transforms lives as a matter of routine, with the best physicians in the world collaborating for optimal patient outcomes..

The cardiologist is wonderful! He takes the time needed to evaluate you as an individual patient. The billing here is a damn mess and you are doubled billed for everything. One bill from the doctor and one bill for use of the facility. This makes no sense. Even after your copays your account sits dormant for weeks then the billing department calls to get authorization to apply those funds to something else after the fact. It takes about 2 months to get all of your final bills before you know what you really owe or are even paying for. Pay attention to your billing too because doctors you never saw or were treated by are adding bills and you have to call to have it removed. It's a shame that a great facility has to do things this way.

Best experience with taking care of my wife. They treated her with the best care. Traveled from Michigan because we were told there wasn't anything they could do a the first large hospital we went too. From the staff in maintenance, food staff, nurses, aids doctors, surgeons. Everyone was wonderful. Sincerely thank you for everything.

I just want to say what a fantastic experience I had with my mom in the ER yesterday at Cleveland Clinic. As usual, everyone was beyond nice but Dr. Steven Dorsey went over and above. My mom is 84 years old and has a complex medical history. He addressed all of our questions and took amazing care of her. He even brought a computer in and showed us the CT pictures after getting us coffee! I’ve never had a doctor be so kind. We will never go to another hospital. Thank you so very much Dr. Dorsey.

I recently had a kidney stone which was one of the most painful experiences of my life and resulted in me having to call an ambulance to the emergency room. The very kind nurses and doctors at Cleveland Clinic took wonderful care of me and treated me with nothing but compassion and understanding. I feel like my pain was taken seriously and treated adequately and the doctor who was assigned to me was very informative when explaining the results of my testing/images. I cannot recommend Cleveland Clinic enough for anyone who is looking for good, quality care! God bless our healthcare workers!
Valet absolutely sucks. The wait is ridiculous

This is the worst hospital I have ever gone to.  They don't tell the family the honest truth.  Then after the patient is brain dead.  The hospital keeps the patient on life support for day's.  It's inhumane how my niece has been treated. I wouldn't take my dogs to this hospital.  Best hospital in the United States. That's a joke!!

The Cleveland Clinic is posh digs for sick people. They have pretty much the best of everything for your health and well-being. Kudos to the workers at Cleveland Clinic, who make it what it is to patients, family members, and the greater Cleveland area.

I want to take a moment to sincerely thank the Cleveland Clinic pediatric staff for their outstanding care during our recent visit. Every single time we come, the experience is nothing but amazing — the staff is always so helpful, caring, and compassionate.

From the doctors to the nurses and sitters, each person has been a true blessing. If there’s any way for them to be recognized for their dedication, it would be well-deserved. Over the years, our visits to the hospital have consistently been positive, and it’s clear that management prioritizes patients and families, creating an uplifting environment that makes a real difference.

As a care giver to an autistic brother you guys have done everything to help us thank you for making a difference in our lives.
Very well thought out

I damaged my thumb and went in for X-rays early Monday morning, it’s now midday Thursday and they have not been processed.

Always check your bill!!!! I had Summacare but they entered the WRONG insurance because I DONT have Medicare but yet that’s what’s listed on the bill that I shouldn’t have gotten had they billed it correctly.

Best Cardiac Care Ever! Love Cleveland Clinic! Also The Miller Pavilion is Stunning

So far my attempt at getting a sleep study kit, a follow up and the actual CPAP machine has been a horrendous experience. I’ve been at this since April. Maia was our sonographer and she did an amazing job and was patient with my husband and I. She also followed and complied with all HIPPA regulations. I felt supported, secure and happy that I could enjoy my positive news in peace and safety!

I want to say this was by far the worst hospital the worst experience with lies and  fabrications I woke up with a head concussion a skull that was cracked 3 width apart and now and no consideration all your people just lying like seriously

If you're going here, I suspect you have an apoointment.  The goid news - The Clinic positions numerous red coated personnel to provide information and assistance.

I took my son in 2023 for motility issue doctors didn’t know what to do told has to go back to New York  doctor with no compassion they treat you as a  number.

I have driven from my home near Philadelphia 5 times over the last year to be evaluated and treated for tricuspid regurgitation. 2 of those times, I spent days in the hospital and ended up being discharged with nothing being done because of mixups in scheduling within the cardiology/cath lab/OR departments. I don’t understand what changes once they actually admit you. 11 days in the hospital waiting for a procedure that gets cancelled at the last minute because it was scheduled for the cath lab and not the OR is just not acceptable. Please and I mean please don’t admit your child in this hospital if you’re not looking to get any help with your child. I admitted my daughter to get help with her feeding intolerance instead of getting help I was racially profiled as well as my daughter and our family and has cps called for false allegations please please do not have your children or child admitted here

As a long-time resident of Cleveland, I find it disheartening to witness how Cleveland Clinic has increasingly shifted its focus away from accessible care toward luxury services for the privileged few. While VIP suites and Premier Care packages are heavily advertised, regular patients and working-class families are often left waiting in overcrowded lobbies, facing long delays and limited resources.

This hospital was once seen as a cornerstone of community health, yet now it seems more interested in catering to high-income patients than serving the people who actually live here. The imbalance is glaring: fancy executive wings sit nearly empty while understaffed emergency departments struggle to meet basic needs.

It’s a clear signal that profit has overtaken purpose. Hospitals should prioritize equitable care, not exclusive services for the wealthy. This community deserves better, and CC should be providing more for the community of Cleveland. I've taken my primary care to Metro and I couldn't be more pleased and impressed.

STRANGLED HERNIA IN MY STOMACH AND THEY DO NOT CARE! EITHER THEY HV NO DOCTORS OR NO BEDS!! SAT IN THE WAITING ROOM FOR OVWR 2 HRS WITH NOTHING! TOLD THEM, THEY DIDNT CATE, CUT OFF MY BRACELETT AND THAT WAS THAT!

All the folks working the G20 unit Neuro ICU were great especially Steve my mom's nurse. I would also like to thank all the staff in the neuro step down unit for the great care my mother received

Services. Missed a lunch for my brother in midst of room transitions. Dressing to be chaged every 12 hrs and we asked for it to be changed after 2 days. Valet service took me 60 mons to get my car. Know as a great institution as I felt service could have been better

I am going to switch doctors and will not ever go anywhere that's affiliated with  Cleveland Clinic!

So, It's been 7 Months since my Open Heart Surgery. I MUST say, that I was treated Wonderfully During My 2 month stay. The main campus on Euclid is a lot of walking with a bad hip. My sister was diagnosed with a glioblastoma and she was on the tumor ward. The added photo sums up what is lacking in housekeeping. Also the vents in the ceiling are very dirty in the er in Fairview hospital. They're caked with dust. The place needs a thorough scrubbing from top to bottom.

1. Missed diagnosis of my mom; which has lead us to an outside Functional medicine doctor.

I see the cardiology special and was told my echo was diagnosed wrong, I do not have Atrial Fibrillation, oops, sorry the wrong diagnosis button was pushed AND I still got billed.

4. Medicine has definitely changed in the last 40 years!
Everything good but allow yourself plenty of time for valet parking and lot. It gets pretty busy. I had a half hour wait for valet service.

I would not recommend Dr. Jaime Ann Vondenberg. My experience with her at Cleveland Clinic was deeply disappointing and felt like a complete waste of time, energy, and money.

I drove all the way from North Carolina to Ohio to see her in November, hoping to finally get clarity and support for my ongoing health concerns. At the initial appointment, I shared that I had been treated for years as a child for autoimmune encephalitis, that I’ve had a positive ANA multiple times, and that I was experiencing symptoms like chronic fatigue and a red rash across my cheeks. I told her I suspected lupus, and she ran tests—eventually ruling it out. That was fine, but what followed was incredibly frustrating.

We scheduled a Zoom follow-up for February so I wouldn’t have to drive back, and during that appointment, she told me she didn’t believe I had any autoimmune issue at all—despite my medical history and repeated positive ANA tests. She also told me I should see an immunologist, even though she is double board-certified in both rheumatology and immunology herself.

When I asked about the facial rash—after a dermatologist specifically said it was not rosacea and told me to talk to my rheumatologist—Dr. Vondenberg brushed it off and said we should just try a cream because she thought it looked like rosacea. This felt dismissive and unscientific.

Later, I contacted her again after another doctor found elevated thyroid antibodies and wanted more testing done. I reminded her again of my history with encephalitis, and she told me to schedule another appointment. I did—even though it was over a month out—and when I finally saw her again, she was late and completely dismissed everything I had to say. She refused to run any more tests, and repeated the same opinions from our earlier conversations as if nothing new had been presented.

I don’t understand why she had me book and pay for another appointment if she had no interest in revisiting the situation or digging deeper—even when new labs were available and there was a clear history of autoimmune disease.

If you’re looking for a rheumatologist/immunologist who will actually listen, consider your full medical history, and take your concerns seriously, I strongly recommend looking elsewhere. This felt more like a routine dismissal than real care, and I left with more questions than answers.

They seem to have good doctors, but the overall organization and place is too massive and disorganized. We went for a one hour appt and it took 2 hours between waiting in the waiting room for almost 1/2 hour and then waking to and from the parking garage.

Slow to respond, staff doesn't care if it's an emergency they will still book you out a minimum of two months. Unless your dirt poor finical assistance is a joke and they force you to pay up front before even seeing the doctor. Then if additional things were done that was not included in the first payment they will bill you again. Not sure how that is not fraud especially if your using health insurance. I have to go here due to my illness since they specialize in what I have. If I had the option I would go else where.

Scheduling is a nightmare. My mom was given a 7am appointment and was told they couldn't schedule any later....only for them to be 90 minutes late for her biopsy. How do you start the day 90 mins behind?????
Correction, 90 minutes late just to get a room. The procedure started 2.5 hours late.....

Pain in the butt to get around if you’re not familiar with it and the attendants won’t give you the time of day to answer a question without a long “Ughhh” before they reluctantly answer. Do better CCC. This is one reason why we use University generally.
Cleveland clinic gets the job done
I have my surgery there. It was just the best surgery place ever they’re so nice and they just help you out a lot.

I am writing this post with 100% accuracy from my perspective and my experience here. I did not get an easy diagnosis, I’ll keep it short on that piece. What I will elaborate on is the care and intelligence I received from the NP on staff Sam in the emergency room department was the best doctor I have met in life. He sat down with me, became a human, and walked me through everything. Like intelligent, kind, genuine, authentic, and didn’t show a single desire to rush away from me, he saw I was anxious and he took time to explain to me everything. He did not owe me that level of one to one care but he stepped up and went above and beyond. I was worried about my kids and he did all he could to reassure me about the facts so far. Some people are meant to be doctors and Cleveland clinic seems to attract that top talent: shout out to Emergency room NP Sam who was on staff May 8th night shift  at this location. Anyway, it was evident in the speed in which I was taken care of, the kindness, literally having a doctor sit with you and walk you through scenarios if we do xyz. This is unheard of and why people travel from all around the world to come to this hospital to meet these doctors . They threw the book to figure out what was going on with me and figured it out within hours.

Literally I couldn’t make it up if I tried. I am extremely impressed!
Dr's dont listen to patients. They wait roo long to make a decision.

Really concerning 2 Behavioral health appointments were canceled last minute / 1 not even booked- both on hospitals end!! What the heck is going on w this place. I really don't get it. Regular visit screw up s too!!!

Their appointment intake employee told me that they have a doctor who specializes in what I was looking for. I wait 2 months for the appointment. The day of my appointment comes. They tell me that actually, there is no one at Cleveland Clinic who specializes in what I am looking for in the state of FL. I tell them I want to cancel my appointment then because it's pointless. They apologize and say they will give me a refund. I get a call back an hour later (this person was very kind when I burst into tears) and they tell me that I'm the one who has to call billing department to get a refund on my copay. This whole time I could have been looking for a specialist/getting on the waitlist somewhere else and now I'm stuck on hold with the billing department, STILL SICK, while I could be calling other specialists (where I will probably have to wait months to see).

My visit was because of an outreach event. The grounds have a lot of beauty and art. I really appreciate the prayer room space, and the care and resources it requires to maintain. I love everything about this place especially my kidney transplant team,endocrinologist and the infusion center staff, nurses and doctors

I am absolutely disheartened by cleveland clinic. The recent policy changes have further shown that their stance is primarily focused on money not health. They have horrible billing practices as well. Their bills fluctuate, their staffers are subpar, and even worse they over bill basic medicine like ibuprofen. I have had an incredible experience at the Cleveland Clinic. It is known to be one of the best heart hospitals in the world. My surgeon is top notch. The people that have cared for me after my surgery have been phenomenal: Ashlyn, my day nurse, Toni, my night nurse, Lucretia, my PCNA, Jay, my PCNA, Latisha, my housekeeper, and all of the people that have brought my food to my room - they all go above and beyond the call. You can tell there is a caring atmosphere here. This hospital works hard to hire the right kind of person for your care. If you have to have heart surgery, come here if your health insurance allows. You won't be disappointed.

Valet parking was a mess with long waits, and the Panera Bread on-site had poor service and very dirty restrooms. These may seem like small things, but they add up and affect the experience, especially for patients who are alone. I hope Cleveland Clinic addresses these issues soon.

Hello-We consulted with the Cleveland Clinic regarding my Wife's chronic Lyme infection after searching for help locally in WV. After two rounds of doxycycline, we started thinking that we needed to look outside of the area. She received her first Lyme diagnoses from a rheumatologist along with a couple others on this visit including ankylosing spondylitis. She tested positive for Lyme and was prescribed two weeks of doxycycline. She continued to decline, saw many physicians, and was ultimately misdiagnosed with MS as well as fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome. This same neurologist who diagnosed her with MS later agreed that she did indeed have Lyme, and it had triggered her "MS" after a spinal tap, serology testing and MRI's that revealed Lyme and the Epstein Barr virus. We then decided to consult with the big guns in Ohio since now she had two diagnoses of Lyme and had tried two weeks of doxycycline but was still in rapid decline. We were being told if she was still having symptoms after two weeks of antibiotics, then it couldn't be Lyme. Growing desperate we called and spoke with a very nice lady at the Cleveland Clinic and were surprised to find out they would "treat" my Wife. I cannot tell you how excited we were to finally get some help with this terribly common, but seemingly invisible disease. We made the appointment with the infectious disease doctor Chris Kovacs Jr., drove to Cleveland, booked a room and tried to sleep anticipating that everything was finally going to "be OK". The next morning, we arrived for the appointment at 7:45 and were impressed with the Clinic's "Operation" until we got in front of their doctor Chris Kovacs Jr. who broke our hearts and wasted our time and money. After listening to her case for approximately five-six minutes, he informed us that "We don't have Lyme in WV and if she hadn't traveled to the northeast of the US then she hadn't been exposed to Lyme" as to which I replied, "I don't mean to be rude but, where do our dogs get it?" he then said that my Wife "definitely did NOT have Lyme" and suggested that maybe she needed more attention at home after asking my profession, which is sales. Chris Kovacs Jr. then refused any testing for Lyme or co-infections and we left his office in tears wondering what just happened. We traveled back to WV and by luck ran into someone whose Mother had Lyme but was misdiagnosed with ALS. She was treated by a local doctor and her "ALS" went into remission. I couldn't believe what I was hearing and we got in touch with that physician who is now semi-retired and after proper testing, she finally got a more appropriate treatment for Lyme. This brave doctor reported the positive serology results to the Kanawha County Health Department. Now she is "on file" as having positive Lyme serology results and we have received Lyme Brochures from the Health Department published by the CDC, Lyme book markers, and vinyl yard signs that read with the warning "Lyme lives here”. These were nice quality signs btw, if you are reading, please send more. I tacked ours up around the neighborhood. Apparently they track this sort of thing IF your doctor reports it through the proper non-insurance channels. She ended up getting treated with antibiotics including a PICC line with ceftriaxone. We are both very much still affected by Lyme today and if only our family physician had given my Wife $40-$50 dollars worth of antibiotics when she first presented, then maybe, just maybe I wouldn't be typing this at work right now. Any physician who denies Lyme can be a chronic infection should be ashamed of themselves for their lack of courage to help. They know the truth and Lyme needs to be given the credence that people deserve. It's a sad day when the insurance "front" tells you that "You don't have Lyme in WV". I'm surprised he didn't call it "Lymes". I would clearly give "0" stars if that was possible. Thank you for reading, I hope that this can help in some way as I've been meaning to write this for over a decade.

Don’t believe the hype! Very good ancillary services/support staff, less than effective and relatively average to low skilled physicians with way below average investigative skills and diagnosis acumen! For an institution that is supposed to be amongst the best in the country, and best in cardiac care for several years in a row, I was sorely disappointed. Either they are buying their rankings or the ranking publications are simply skipping over the EP section… Once you get past the bells and whistles, e.g. massive state of the heart facility, concierge like service for foreign patients, etc… you quickly realize that this hospital system is mostly like any other, except it does an incredible job at marketing both its past and current exceptional achievements. These achievements  are carried out by a very limited few. In other words exceptional/thorough docs are in short supply in this hospital, like in any other. They just do a great job of marketing and advertising the accomplishments of a very select few physicians, who are the exception and not the norm. Note, you will likely not have access to these exceptional physicians as they are in high demand. Instead You will be farmed out to much less proficient physicians who are no different than your average local specialist… I dealt with the cardiology department, specifically its electrophysiology section… The staff/ancillary medical team were awesome; however the Electrophysiologist I dealt with, was poorly organized, not thorough and contrary to what their cardiac appointment staff advertised, did not deal with highly complex arrhythmia diagnosis and curative treatment… His approach did not entail any in depth investigative processes, e.g. review of prior incident QRS morphology, review of clues provided by prior and current imagery, etc… He did exactly what the avg to below avg EPs I’ve seen so far, have all done: (1) Focused on the primary symptoms that suited his skill set and (2) ignored any acute symptoms that fell beyond his expertise, while heavily relying on the medications vs. investigating the root cause(s)… (3) failed to enlist the help of more experienced colleagues. He did not address the root causes of the disease regardless of its progression and instead preferred to settle on highly curated symptoms’ treatment, while hoping that acuity or worsening would not be immediate… This of course nearly ensures that down the line, once the disease process has worsened, I will be back for more acute and expansive services… What a revenue model… I strongly recommend that (A) you do extensive research and identify which physician(s) has the skillset that is required, to not just “treat” you but to actually cure you/find and tackle root cause(s) of your ailment before going to this hospital. And (B) ensure that this physician can actually see you/is available. (C) most important: Ensure that they are thorough, which is largely the exception. WHY? It takes time and work, for which they may not get a financial return. Otherwise, you are wasting your time and money. Just stick to your local specialist. Do not let the appointment staff randomly select a physician/specialist for you, based on availability. The physicians who have high availability generally tend to be the least effective/least thorough ones; hence their open schedules… Oh and their patient complaint process does not entail a conclusive resolution mechanism, as the clinical teams are not obliged to take corrective measures or communicate those measures to the patient… which leaves you wondering why come back to this hospital… Bottom line: Don’t believe the hype. Do your homework. If you are not getting satisfactory answers, e.g. booking agents tell you that “all EPs treat complex arrhythmias” and the one they suggest is really good, don’t believe them… Insist on the one whose name you found through research or who was recommended by another patient with ailments similar to yours and who’s received treatment here recently. If this is not a possibility, go somewhere else/don’t waste your time and money.
Having been to Johns Hopkins, Mayo, NYU, and the Cleveland Clinic, the Cleveland Clinic is far better than the others. My neurologist, brain surgeon, PAs, and nurses are incredible.

Well reading these reviews, it mirrors my experience. If I could leave a zero, I would. I fell for the thought this place was the best of the best. That I thought included quality care with good communication. I paid a premium price for trash services. Please do not waste your time, money or energy with this business. That is what it really is. Not a medical facility that actually cares about their patients.
