For the procedure, I was forgotten about twice, delaying this procedure over 2 hours and they even reset my locker code so I could not get my cloths to change and leave. The worker literally said, "Oh your still here? I thought you were long gone and reset the lockers". Once I got my cloths on, I came out to find my boyfriend in a dark waiting room; tv's were turned off (he had not idea where I was), all staff was gone and the janitor was cleaning the space. They closed that area down with not only a patient in the back, but a guest waiting with NO communication what's so ever. I did fill out their survey, hoping they'd reach back considering the situation. I have yet to get a response back from Cleveland about how they "forget about" patients.
I wish my experience ended there...it doesn't. Shortly after my first apt, I started a new medicine regiment this doctor prescribed. A couple days into this,  I received a very scary phone call from my pharmacy. He proceed to ask me how I was doing and specifically my heart/vascular system regarding the meds I was prescribed. Which was concerning as I am being seen for vascular issues causing GI issues post chemo treatment. I was given an anti-depressant that was suppose to "help my stomach muscles to stop over working" that has MAJOR side effects for vascular issues, including heart attacks. Which I was on the brink of going to the ER for chest pain. I have never had that kind of pain before. I also was informed that the "high cholesterol" meds he gave for helping bind food in my stomach do not play well together with the anti-depressant, causing further discomfort and issues to my GI system. The pharmacist was EXTREMELY confused and concerned what drugs I was prescribed and why I was given them. There are plenty of other options that could have been discussed prior to that combo (per pharmacists words). He then advised that I stop both meds right away and consultant a different medical professional.

Then to add more injury to insult, an MRA was ordered that ended up sharing exact opposite of what the doctor told me it would provide. Surprise surprise, it showed vascular problems, causing GI issues. The doctor then thought it was appropriate to send me a one line message on mychart. Completely ignoring these results went against what he previously said. I asked for a 5 minute phone chat right away as I can not get back into him in person till end of March to discuss meds and the results. I messaged Wednesday 2/26 morning and its now Monday 3/3 in the afternoon. No point of contact has been made besides some nurse Friday right before closing saying my message was received and the doctor would get back to me. I guess I am finally in line for a point of contact? There was no time frame or idea when any point of contact would be made. Wednesday 3/5 will be a week from my initial message. This doesn't even include any follow up on said meds are doing from initial apt over 2 weeks ago. Which is VERY concerning, considering what I learned from my pharmacist.
If I had that kind of fail/error/mess up/issue rate at my job, I would be FIRED! Why is is okay for these doctors to make choices on ones life with no consequences?!

Hospital is ran like a machine...albeit a well oiled one. Hospital fails in things that may fall outside of the purview of the machine's programming. For instance, a lot of the staff may seem attentive and responsive, but are prone to giving canned, rehearsed, or "safe" answers. Cleveland Clinic Hospitals seem to be turning more into a massive money churn, bed-turn philosophy recently which is sad because at its peak, (before they decided to buy up every failing hospital in the city) about a decade and a half ago, it was truly a great hospital. There's no other place I'd rather go to get heart surgery done (or a lot of other surgeries for that matter), but if you're dealing with something that they don't specialize in, or need a little bit more personalized care, I would look elsewhere.
Best treatment all the way around..caring and understanding.
The staff here is AMAZING. Everyone was super friendly and PROACTIVE. Dr. Wallace and her team are outstanding.

Except for the Neurosurgeon who saved my life, the Cleveland Clinic hospital is just for research. I was treated as a lab guinea pig! I was dismissed by their Abudsmen after raising any sort of major complaints. Then it became clear: A physical therapist quipped, "after working here for at least ten years my student loans would be paid off!" That could explain their conterminous. The Cleveland Clinic pays off the student loan debts for the clinical staff, after time of just "fair" or worst just poor & dismissive treatment of patients. Because I was often mistreated by physical therapists, nurses, or, doctors. Who acted like drones. [Cleveland Clinic has several campuses throughout Ohio. Pick one.]

The bone and soft tissue pathology group have had my mom's sample since January 31st to give her Oncologist the report on her cancer. It is now FEBRUARY 26th and that report still has not come back. Each day counts toward her treatment, and they have forgotten a human being is attached to that biopsy.

If I could give 0 stars I would.  The medical malpractice of this place truly does show, they did not care about our situation and made my fiance feel extremely suffocated in that hospital.  Was restricted visitors, gave him medication after being told not to by his Power of Attorney, kicked the power of attorney out of the entire hospital, horrible, horrible experience at this place.  DO NOT GO HERE!

The best when it comes to saving a life BUT TRY GETTING A SIMPLE BILL IN THE FORMAT ON THEIR WEBSITE. LOL GOOD LUCK. I have had to contact them 3 TIMES to request a bill in the format they have on their website and I just can't get it. It would be absolutely hilarious if I wasn't the one that needed it.

Since when does a medical facility make political statements? This is sick! The picture is a little hard to read but what it says is “stop injecting woke politics into patient care” so I guess if your a liberal or ‘woke’ they don’t really want to take care of you. Nothing says you don’t care for patients as people if they voted against the current administration! Sick sick sick!!!!!
The staff and Doctor Neka are amazing.  I was very happy with the result 😀.  I didn't have a appointment i walked in.  I did what for 5 hours but it clearly states that you my wait up to 8 hours..
Amazing staff. Clean, accommodating, and welcoming environment.
Rather suffer at home then, be told 45mins to sit and wait for 2 hours

What a joke of a hospital. The parking situation is awful. My experience every time has been: pay for parking, walk 10 minutes, to wait an hour for an appointment where you will have the most below average care. You will be treated as a dollar sign and you will not get your moneys worth. Don’t waste your time. The 1 star goes to the Starbucks.

The main Clinic in Cleveland is awesome. The doctors are great ! The care they gave me was great too ! Those other Cleveland Clinic branches are nothing like the real Cleveland Clinic.  The people who work at these other little branches are not friendly at all. They lie and are terrible to patient's. I would give these generic places 2 stars. But the main Cleveland Clinic 5+ stars.
I love Cleveland Clinic for listening, and thoroughness, when doctors in my local area wouldn't. It has always been worth the 3 hour drive when I need answers or a second opinion. Please never change
Great in pacemaker replacement surgery.
Never been to an (emergency) room that made emergencies wait 3 hours…. 0 stars

I would not recommend Dr. Truong to anyone nor would I recommend Cleveland Clinic.  Her delay in care caused direct harm to a patient. My parents put their trust and my father’s life in her hands and with her negligent care she caused harm. My father has metastatic melanoma and had been referred to the Cleveland Clinic to Dr Truong in November 2024. He was supposed to start treatment in which the office failed to schedule. So we started to call the office and ask what the hold up was. By the time Dr Truong set up a telehealth appointment with my father it was in January. Keep in mind from November to January he had no treatment at all in which this allowed the cancer to spread.  Fast forward 2 weeks and still nothing had been ordered. My father was in a lot of pain so my mom took him to U of M ER in which they did CT scans and the cancer had spread significantly throughout his body since November. And I 100% blame Dr Truong for this. Her delay in care caused direct patient harm.  I do not recommend Dr Truong to anyone as she took an oath to care for her patients and failed miserably to do so. Now he will be getting his treatment at U of M and Columbus Ohio and all we can do is pray that her negligence doesn’t cost my father his life.

I used a wheelchair to get up to my family members room and parked it outside the room because the rooms were too small to wheel it in. Apparently “transport” took it thinking it wasn’t in use. It took an hour to get a new one up there and that was only after I asked to talk to the nurse manager. My family’s room was freezing with the air coming out of the vent by the window very cold. 🥶 Felt like the AC was on, not the heat. This was January 24th. When we asked the care staff in the room about it
they said, “Yeah, it’s always too cold or too hot.” BTW this was in the H building. Plus there were no blankets available! My family member was freezing. Finally, when it came time to leave we had used valet parking and when we went to leave they had misplaced my car. Somehow the wrong ticket got placed on my car because the stub I had did not match. It took an hour. This was my first time visiting anybody at the Cleveland clinic and thank goodness most of my friends and family go to MetroHealth.

Sandra in Administrative Services put a smile on my face by just being friendly and helpful- it just goes to show me the trademarked “World Class Care” doesn’t just pertain to the medical providers at the Cleveland Clinic.  Sandra, your parents should be proud because your kind heartedness is inspiring.  God bless you
-Mike Czup
I've been in  emergency for over 8 hours, The police officer was mean and rude to a young lady, the officer was very unprofessional

After wasting months of my sister's and her family's time; and, $$$ with another,inferior Cardiac group in WNY-(feeling like we were   going in "CIRCLES" with her care) -- WE decided to schedule an appointment for her at Cleveland Clinic- Cardiology. THIS appointment  was accomplished very quickly. I can't speak highly enough about their concern and caring attitudes; from the first PHONE contact with them; then at CC information desk, to radiology testing, to staff encounters, to etc, to Dr's visit! Very impressed with: the Dr's concern, the hour appointment, their careplan review and, agreed initiation of 2 new meds to strengthen the heart; AND, with their follow through appointment scheduling. The follow up list of next scheduled appointments at CC are: prebloodwork results will be done in NYS and faxed, then at CC: EKG at 10:30, Echo at 11:00, then Cardiology heart failure team appointment at 12:45pm, then appointment with EP team at 2:45 and, then lastly- follow up with 'her'Dr. at 4:00 to dicuss plan of care going forward. That's how it's done! Cleveland Clinic cares for: THEIR patient's, THEIR health issues and THEIR timely, appointment scheduling- 100%. They are 'an Advocate for the Patient'. Thank you for being a ROLE MODEL IN HEALTH CARE ❤️ Take notice of this CARING TEAM of health professionals.

My mother is a patient in building G. On the 8th floor. She’s killed several of these, and missed several more. They are running on the floor and going into the baseboards. A nurse was made aware. Nurse said “it is a part of nature, we’re aware”. My mom repeatedly stated how uncomfortable and nervous she was. Nothing was done. Absolutely disgusting. The lack of attention to this matter is horrid. What is this? How do you know it’s not spreading disease? If you don’t listen to patients concerns how the heck are you one of the best hospitals?
Erroneous information on website related to health.  Doesn't provide accurate information.

The emergency room has great doctors and medical staff. Once patients are moved to their floor, nursing assistants do not care for the patients as they should. If they don't see family members coming in to visit, they do the bare minimum. Absolutely no family should have to change beds, conduct patient care, etc. when their loved one is in the place that is staffed with medical personnel to do that and the hospital still bill the patient. You call to check on your loved ones, some nurses just hang up the phone. There's alot of medical personnel who Does Not have a passion for working in Healthcare and only present for a check.

Absolutely massive hospital! They have care for everything. I am so glad there are many maps and directions throughout this hospital because it would be so easy to get lost if not. The doctors and nurses are super helpful and they seem to really care about what you have to say and how you feel. The wait for bloodwork was super quick, about 3 minutes total. Unfortunately I need to come back from another state in a couple weeks for more tests because of how booked they are that is the only downside of the whole Clinic but overall. They found that I have a rare condition that my local hospital should have found with all the tests they ran, but somehow they didn't. It took the Cleveland Clinic ONE TEST, JUST ONE to diagnose and find my problem. Now I am able to get surgery to help. I am so thankful for the doctors and nurses at this clinic. It has been a fantastic experience going here and I am so glad I walked away with answers because of them. 11/0 experience so far at the Cleveland Clinic! If you need care, I recommend them!

World class medical, circus class parking and access.  Had a 11:45 appointment, arrived at the building at 11:00, at 11:45 cancelled appointment because we were still sitting in the circle of hell to get to the door. It should not take over an hour to get in the front door.  When canceling I told the person we were still trying to get in, she just said fine and hung up.  Absolutely ridiculous, but it’s Cleveland so ……..

Can be overwhelming because the campus is so large, but if you have something serious going on, this is the place to be. Both myself and my father have had serious health issues that were misdiagnosed at other hospitals, and the Cleveland clinic corrected us both.
Saved my life. Best hospital around. Dr. Prendes is the best head and neck surgeon around.

I was dropped off for a medical appointment by a vendor (not Cleveland clinc related) I was done with my appointment then a security person yelled even though she was 10 feet away from me  and asked what If I was waiting for a ride and before I could answer she said the person who dropped me off was mad at me for “ride hopping”. She was trying to start drama with something that was none of her business or even accurate. I just told her I didn’t know what to tell her and while I was waiting for my ride home she kept staring at me and whispering to other security guards. She was a teenage high-school girl in a late middle aged poorly and over applied wearing makeup and bright fire engine red hair that was awful  body. Thank god I live an hour and 25 minutes away. And will never have to go to Cleveland clinic main campus again because that was my last appointment there anyway because I used to live in that area before moving. But the other security guards were nice and let me wait inside for my ride to get there so I didn’t have to wait in the cold and had a good friendly attitude. They earned the extra star.

I have been using the Cleveland clinic for two decades the one in Wooster, Ohio never had a problem whatsoever right now. I do not have insurance. My nine-year-old needs a vaccine. They will not let me schedule an appointment until I call a financial advisor. set up three different appointments with one they never called me like they said they were going to and then sent me a message saying I missed my appointment which is a lie so I called the financial advisor phone number. Talk to somebody that was real nice. They were trying to get me all figured out to get an appointment for my son since it won’t let me even schedule him appointment until I talk to these people first and then I get hung up on. They never call me back and no one‘s answering my phone call when I try to call back it should not be this hard to make an appointment for a child.

We are so grateful for the overall level of care provided to my father.
A reminder to everyone to never leave cash in your wallet, as almost all of his money was stolen while he was at his procedure out of his room.  How disappointing...but could have been prevented .  What a sad but perfect scheme to prey on patients when wheeled off to a procedure 👎

One of the best hospitals I've stayed at by far. The staff was super friendly, I was not only well taken care of but all my needs were met and I couldn't ask for a better support team and doctors. They treated me like I was their family. My actual family were met with the upmost respect and they didn't barge in when they visited me either. All the things I asked for I was able to have and need. The food was fantastic and always cooked just right and hot. Every nurse was a total sweetheart and I even made one of them laugh and gave them a new joke to use.

Worst hospital system in America.  I recently moved my father down to TN.  Have tried to get his records from this egregious establishment for weeks.  Have faxed requests TWICE with them then saying they didn't get the fax.......a fax.....like maybe join the 21st century Cleveland Clinic!!!!  I would not allow them to treat my dog......world renowned.......maybe in bureaucracy.......If I could give a negative star I would.
They starve you here I’ve been waitn for hours my stomach is hurting sooo bad🥺😔
Excellent sevice....would visit again lol

The Cleveland clinic Corp. Is unresponsive to patient needs. Central scheduling is a nightmare with out of touch staff, with frequent errors and ridiculous amount of prompts. Billing is repetitive. I pay at Dr for co pay but it never is credited. I am billed although I've payed and must call each time to have it "assigned" to my account. The only positive is the quality of my Dr's who are excellent. I've tried calling ombudsman but no one answers. Try calling back, I miss call

and again no answer. No one is listening or doing anything to resolve these issues. Unfortunately like all corp's we are victims to greed and they then ask me for donations!

When you recognize #1 in Cleveland, it's not not Brown's, Cavs, Guardians, or the Rock and Roll museum; it's the CLEVELAND CLINIC. Established in 1921, the CLINIC has broaden beyond Euclid Avenue, beyond Greater Cleveland, Ohio, the United States. I have been a patient there for nearly 40 years. No matter where I reside, I'll make sure a Cleveland CLINIC is near me.

Professional transplant teams pre and post transplant. Knowledgeable, professional, friendly, clean from surgical staff to the janitorial staff they are all top notch employees that deserve our respect. Amazing facility.

This review isn’t regarding the care of the doctors, nurses, or other staff here at Cleveland Clinic. They are all excellent. This review is mainly about the accommodations for the families of pediatric patients here. My child had surgery that required a one-night stay for monitoring. We drove over an hour to be here at the Cleveland Clinic for this procedure and stay. They put us in a “room” that looks like an ER triage or quick care room. There is no pull out couch for parent(s) to sleep on. What is given was a small, torn up couch with zero space to accommodate one individual let alone two parents for an overnight stay. I’ve been to and stayed at many hospitals in the NE Ohio area with family members, and I’ve never seen anything like this before. This is supposed to be one of the world’s best hospitals. I am beginning to think that they purposely do this so patients’ families will purchase one of their overpriced hotel rooms for the night. I would have no issue with this if the patient wasn’t a 6 year old who needs her parents by her side.

They need to rethink how and where they situate families of pediatric patients. My daughter’s surgery and stay here will cost as much as a luxury vehicle. They need to do better than this.

These people think that pea protein does not contain essential amino acids:

The only real drawback is that because it’s a plant-based protein, it’s not as “bioavailable” as other proteins. “In other words,” he continues, “our bodies can’t readily use them. They don’t have essential amino acids. If you’re using pea protein, you’re still getting protein but be sure your diet includes foods that possess the necessary amino acids that help your body absorb the pea protein.”

Copy pasted from their website.
Be careful when dealing with these people. Such a level of knowledge may threaten lives

Nurse practitioner Rachel and night nurse practitioner ary on the 6th floor neurology stepdown were the best nurses that gave me special care for my blood clot on my heart by helping me get back on my feet again

Big shout out to Anthony Woodson (?) who wheeled me down from M63 to lobby.  He left me in the lobby where I wanted to go.  Then about 15 minutes later he passed me as I was struggling with wheel chair and helped me to find where the shuttle would be and then dropped me off.  What a sweetheart!  Thank you, Anthony!
I am grateful that Cleveland Clinic is the best and has my best team of medical providers

Cleveland clinic is supposed to be the best of the best. I went here when I was younger and switched elsewhere because of how rude the doctors were and because they made us get bloodwork at the appointment instead of getting it beforehand to then discuss at the appointment. I came back for a second opinion this year and saw Dr Karen Murray. I brought up a rare condition I wanted to be tested for because doctors just could not figure out what was wrong with me. My mom had printed over 1,000 pages of my medical records and she didn't even glance at them and she didn't do an exam. She laughed at me and said I do not have said condition. She recommended a follow up with psychiatry. A few months later and I have a feeding tube due to her negligence. I saw another specialist who ordered more testing and the rare condition I couldn't possibly have was plain as day positive and requires surgery. My condition is complicated due to her unwillingness to listen. I would be embarrassed to be associated with her and would not recommend this doctor if my life depended on it.

The doctors passed my husband from department to department. They would run tests then state "we don't know why...." then instead of trying to figure it out just pass him along. His home RA doctor did attempt to message the doctors about the biopsies that should be done and all her messages went unanswered. For almost 2yrs we traveled, no real work up, no answers, unfilled promises, and being passed to other doctors all for nothing.

Our home doctors finally gave up on Cleveland and followed through with the biopsies and going to see a doctor at Northwestern to finally be properly treated. Thank you Northwestern for admitting him and finally doing what Cleveland Clinic lazily refused to follow through with. Do NOT come here if your home doctors are stumped on your mysterious illness.

My son has been in their care for THREE MONTHS and I'm very satisfied on how they been giving my son ALL THE TREATMENT that he NEEDS !!!! It's only so much that they can do , and they been giving their ALL to get my son back BETTER 🥺🥹 .... MAIN CAMPUS are the one's who truly SAVED MY SON LIFE ... THANK YOU
Beautiful, High Quality, Exceptional Medical Campus! Leading Experts in ALL healthcare conditions.  Would not go anywhere else.

I’ve had so many appointments rescheduled 2 hours before appt time for my OB. I recently switched jobs and had a lapse in coverage and had to pay in full for my ultrasound and appt which I was fine with and completed before appt however, they kept sending me new invoices for crazy high amounts. Definitely not the greatest patient care I’ve experienced in the past.

I gave 1 star instead of zero because the nurse who checked me in, took my bp, etc, was exceptional and very compassionate. There needs to be more people in this world like her, especially in the healthcare system. I travelled 3 hours for a 10 minute appointment with "Dr" Jamie Von Venberg. I was referred by my trusted family physician, and rightfully so. Her exact words were "I don't understand why you're here and why he referred you to us." She was very insulting toward my doctor and physical therapists calling them "incompetent" in so many words. The only incompetent care giver is "Dr." Von Venberg. I was in tears when I left her office after a visit that she clearly needed to rush through to move on to bigger and more important things and I will seek answers elsewhere.

I would like to extend a "sincere thank you" to  Aydah Jaber ,ARPN.Cardiology for her care and guidace in my visit to the Clinic on November 1.
My wife/Joanie and I are recently married despite being in our eighties.Aydah immediately sensed our concern with a cardiology issue and answered all of our questions in a comprehensive manner.
We left the meeting with a plan and positive reassurance.
Aydah is a real asset to care offered by the Cleveland Clinic.

Joanie Wright
Wesley G. Johnston,Jr

Cleveland Clinic is good for many specialties but behavioral sciences is not one of them. They are vastly inept. They don't have the staffing, and the staff they do have is extremely archaic. They are not for mental health, especially those suffering from ADHD. If you're lucky to get a doctor, you'll find that the doctor is set back in the 1950s in terms of treatment. So good for the heart, good for the kidneys, good for lupus --- but disgustingly horrible for behavioral science.

Many believe that Cleveland Clinic is one of the best medical centers in the world. I couldn't disagree more.. after receiving so much medical care in different states, CC is by far the worst. I moved back to Cleveland About nine months ago after receiving a lot of specialty care in Pennsylvania from (UPMC) and Colorado (Denver Health) both of which i was incredibly happy with and the many doctors that I saw over that time period. I worried about finding new doctors that I liked as much but tried to keep hope that I'd find ones I was just as happy with. Boy was I wrong. I've been to several doctors at Cleveland Clinic for most specialties, and each of them are worse than the last. They don't seem to care at all about their patients, only about prescribing the newest and most expensive non-generic medications for each condition. I had been on most of my medications for years because they actually worked, as well as insurance fully covering them. Now they only care about prescribing what's newest, most expensive, or that they make money off of. Even if it doesn't work or falls out of your price range they continue trying to convince you to take it. None of the work me, or my previous doctors did matters to them. Any meds you were previously on don't matter and will be stopped. I'd look anywhere else before giving Cleveland Clinic your time and your health.
I'm now constantly suffering after being taken off half of my meds. For example with my migraines. They don't even want you taking over-the-counter medications. Probably because they don't make the money from the drug company. I'd do anything to return to my old doctors and the state I was in with my previous treatments. Look elsewhere if you have any choice in the matter.
Its also very difficult to get an appointment for months or even a year+ and if you need help or refills on meds before you can get an appointment you're out of luck. I've pretty much given up on my medical care because of all this.
I hope this advice helps someone. Wish I would have known before trusting my health conditions with them. Take care.

Great doctors and nurses. I have been a patient at most hospitals in the City and the doctors at UCSF are by far the best, showing a genuine interest in your well-being. Highly recommend UCSF to anyone needing medical care.

Hopeless bureaucracy.    I am trying to schedule an appointment, and get transferred from department to department.   One department said they need more information, but did not even know what other information was needed, referring me back to my primary provider, who did not even know what this was about.   I have today already spoken to 4 people, and still am not at the right person.   The last call I was told to hold a moment, but then was transferred to someone's (I don't know who) voicemail.   I've had problems with them almost every time.  Much of my time and energy has been lost...to the detriment of my health and well being.   The whole customer service should be replaced by AI.   The heads of this thing should be fired and replaced by competent people.

They put me in a "hot room" and tried to cook me for 3 days knowing I was complaining of being drenched in sweat and overheated. They didnt order the proper imaging to be able to diagnose my injury.  They assigned me to the wrong department.  They didnt coordinate with the VA. They falsified my medical records in several clear instances.  They lied to me about what procedure I was being given.  They just used me to pad their wallets and provided no treatment for my injury.
Watch your loved one if admitted to the ICU ward. Do not leave your loved one alone with the drs. stay with them 24/7 especially if they are hospice classified

NEVER COME HERE FOR AN ER!
5 hours and had to leave eventually.
They are horrible. Dont go here if you are a women. Ucsf staff are horrible and wont care  about you they will send you away stating you have an ed or drug seeking.
They hung up on me twice after 'sending me to scheduling'
I was here for neurosurgery last week. In recovery nurses are great. Appreciate it.
Devaki Patel has demonstrated a lack of professionalism and competence.

Very disappointed my frist review was not posted
So I dropped it a star, had med to poor care after hip replacement.
1 I was released to soon while still vomiting and diarrhea.
Was transferred to a rest home,while sedated and didn't remember tell I was there. Two days later sent to wonderful hospital in Berlingame.
I ALMOST DIED!!!
2.WHILE IM A VERY LIBERAL PERSON AND A, NOT MEAN.
I WAS VERY DISRESPECTED BY A FEMALE BLACK DR. WISH I COULD HAVE RECORDED IT.
3. MY SURGERY WENT BADLY AND AM SORRY I HAD IT.
4 MY SHOULDER WAS DAMAGED SOMETIME WHILE SEDATED,SO NOW I NEED A SHOULDER REPLACEMENT!!
SORRY I HAD THIS SURGERY, DON'T IF YOU CAN.

The hospital and staff from MD’s To caregivers to non pro crew are excellent. The only reason I didn’t give five stars is the food Prep and packaging. It troubles me to have healthy food wrapped in skin tight plastic, covering full of micro plastics, and forever chemicals that cancel out any benefits from healthy food

SO MY BROTHER OUT OF.NOWHERE WEN TO HIGHLAND HOSPITAL HE SAID WEN HE CAUFGHT OR TRY TO SWALLO HIS HEAD WOULD HURT SO MUCH LIKE SO MUCH HE WAS.GONE FAINT SO HE JUST WENT AND NOW HIS HERE UCSF HE GOING TO HAVE SURGERY CAUSE HIS BRAIN WAS BLEEDING A LITTLE BIT INSIDE WE DONT KNOW WHY HE JUST SAID OUT OF NOWERE IM SORRY IF I DIDNT SPELL SOME RIGHT WE JUST CURIOUS GOD BLESS EVERYONE... FLORES GIL FAMILY MATALOTE CHAVINDA MICH

I have went here for a couple years now to only be strung along by one of their neurologists. UCSF are OBSESSED with Lumbar punctures and think it's the answer to EVERYTHING. They refuse to tell you what they're testing for and the tests get more painful/invasive/expensive everytime. I have not been given an answer other than, "FND functional neurological disorder" and that he refuses to treat it until I do more and more tests for a POTENTIAL neurological problem.

This center will do nothing but waste your time, energy, and money. Do not take your loved ones here. UCSF is NOT what it used to be. They do not take your medical issues into accountance and will continue to do the testing that suits them. We are humans, not guinea pigs. When someone states and has medical proof they can't be shocked. That's means THEY CANT BE SHOCKED. No dose not mean, "no" at UCSF it means, "wait till the patient is ready to say yes to whatever we want"

Thanks to UCSF neurology and Dr Pierre Martin I no longer trust ANY doctors  and I'm not even 30. Please stay away from him and all UCSF doctors if you or your family ACTUALLY want help.

First time coming here for endoscopy. Waiting an hour an 20 minutes to be called in. Absolutely unacceptable. I usually go to PAMP in Palo Alto for this type of procedure. Never waited more than 10 minutes. I'd heard so much good things about UCSF and wanted to give it a try. Never again
Waited 6 hours in the ER with my friend and was still told the hospital was backed up and so was the ER, went to the nearby St Mary branch instead. Disappointing
everyone on the 10th floor is amazing took care of my grandpa amazingly ,staff is so friendly and caring best care  I have ever seen
Good care which speaks to the patient rather than arbitarily administering care.

This hospital was pivotal in saving my ability to walk and was amazing with the care and understanding I was allowed.  Being a visitor on vacation that became paralyzed from the shoulders down on my vacation was very intimidating.
The nurses and doctors were very helpful in teaching me how to walk again and educating me about my condition.
I truly believe my paralysis would have been permanent if it had happened at home in Kansas.
The longest waiting time I've ever experienced 😪. 5 plus hours in the er waiting room.crazy slow

My family is very grateful and thankful with the entire Liver Transplant team at UCSF. Brother Jose Jauregui [receiver) sister Margarita Jauregui [doner] had major liver transplant on April 12, 2024 and the Dr's and entire team did an amazing Job. Dr. Robert's (husband and wife both performed the surgery along with Dr. Cortes and other drs). Unbelievable, just one day after surgery, they are both up and walking. In ICU floor 13, they were under the care of amazing nurses. One, in particular that we are amazed with was Alexandra Adel, she is very dedicated and attentive. Her love and care makes every patients stay in ICU less painful and difficult. Want everyone to know that we notice and appreciate everything you guys have done for our family. God is great and Miracles do happen. This was his 2nd liver transplant for my brother. 1st one was 18 yrs ago. Thank you UCSF 🙏 they are expected to be here for 2 to 3 weeks. I feel at ease, since I know they will be in great hands.

UPDATE... Brother pasted away weeks after being released from UCSF.. 😢😢😢😢💔💔💔💔 advised to anyone getting transplants: please stay there as long as possible. He was told he was going to be there for 2 weeks and was dismissed 5 days after surgery.
Julie Aguillar is a wonderful nurse,  attentive, knowledgeable,  kind, patient,  through, attentive, and just darn good!!!! 1000 stars!!!

My mother was admitted for over a week and her bathroom was hardly cleaned. Light bulbs blew out and requested the nurse to speak to facilities - it never happened. My mom was at fall risk and although her room was right across the nurse’s desk it took over 10 mins for someone to assist her to the bathroom she almost pissed herself!

Once she was discharged I reviewed her AVS and we were unable to locate her oncologist information. Called the general hospital phone number and was greeted by a rude lady on the phone. How could we possibly remember all the doctor’s name?! After leaving a voicemail I did not receive a call back until 4 days later which my mom was already admitted back into Stanford Hospital.

Radiation wait time was over an hour of our scheduled appointment.

They sent me home with a needle in my arm and still taped tightly.

They drugged my dad and pushed him in to comfort care and tried to make him die alone I got lucky I caught him in time before he left. They did not respect my dad's wishes and now I'm gonna go the rest of my life wondering what he would have said to us on his last day that they stole from us.

They ghosted me. I had a workers comp incident, inhaled some particles at work and have had a cough ever since. I came to them and Rabeea Khan basically brushed me off when I said my issue was caused from work, saying she can't confirm that for sure, even though my life was different clear as day before that incident. And it actually happened twice, inhaled the same thing months later for it to mess me up again. and we did a small test of me exhaling hard into a small machine and the person conducting the test said I was doing great, then Rabeea comes back into the room saying the test was done incorrectly and we got nothing. So theres miscommunication there

I communicated to them I'd be leaving the state in a month. I know that's asking a time restriction on them for their already busy schedule but that doesn't justify ghosting me. She said i'll do 2 tests then well have a followup visit. I did those 2 tests and never heard back. Even 2 hours after the first visit I call and email her assistant Saenz and got a message saying she wont be in office for like a week.

No followup visit was ever scheduled. And im still here coughing. I had one shot at getting treatment and having it taken care of by workers comp before I had to move, and I wasted it on these people. Now i have to start from scratch out of pocket in a new state

but everything besides being ghosted, the attitude of the staff everyone i met in the hospital was great and very warm.

I had the best experience at Mount Sinai during my time there. My situation was a rare condition and I traveled from Texas for the best doctors. Dr. Sylla and Dr. Greenwald were not only very personable, they were extremely knowledgeable and I knew that would be in the best hands. I had 100 percent confidence in both of them.  Everyone from pre-op to post- op were seamless in my care. The hospital was very well laid out and admissions were extremely helpful.  Overall, it is a beautiful place and doesn’t feel like a hospital at all. Everyone was amazing and a special shout out to one of my nurses, Chevette.  Not only is she an amazing nurse, she has so much compassion that is truly a gift.  She along with my care team deserves recognition for giving such excellent care.  Thank you all for your hard work and dedication in what you do. I will always be so grateful for all of you.
Grateful for Dr Lynne Glasser and Dr Mohit Turagam and their amazing staff. Professional, attentive, supportive, and caring team we thank you so much.

I been to this hospital a couple of times due to a groin injury that I had doing physical therapy the first time I came with this injury they didn’t take me serious until the second time where they did a cat scan and seen a partial tear on my hamstring/groin (high grade) and they admitted me and once I got admitted they treated me so well and help me manage my pain and made me recover pretty fast I really appreciated it a lot and made me stay out the hospital for a month and some change. now when I went back to pt I suffered the same injury which was my groin and this time when I went back a month later being discharged from here I told them I  had the same injury,me expecting the same treatment/regimen it was totally different this time they did a cat scan seem that it was inflamed and admitted to the observation area of the hospital and one thing I noticed they kept trying new medications for my injury and it wasn’t working so instead of them staying with the original regimen they wanted to experiment new medications for my injury in a sense made me feel like a product to them and I stay in the observation area for only one day and I completely felt I  was rushed out of there and they discharged me. this going to be  Long  if your willing to read but although I didn’t feel pain at the time of my discharge the pain persisted the next day it was so bad I had to go elsewhere because I didn’t want to overwhelm them with the same issue so what I’m trying to say is they should treat patients as humans instead of experiment/product  so my last time being here I hated it but I also won’t give up on them pretty easily because of the way they treated me when I had this issue and helped me recover pretty fast I just wish they would of treated the same way instead doing it differently the last time I came with my groin injury.

The reason I gave mount sinai a five 5 star is because how well the staff treated me and how thoughtful they were in helping me manage my pain. I suffered a groin injury they’ve been doing very good on getting me right and I really appreciate it.
The reception at Mt. Sainia location at 5 E. 98th St. on the phone is very bad manners, I try to call to cancel appoitment she just hang up on the phone.

Used to be excellent but they cut out most services now. Things have changed. And specialty surgeons are branching out to more extensive, money making procedure of which they may not be qualified. Staff is all over the place, rude, and do not seem to know anything.

the 1176 OBGYN is honesty the absolute WORST SERVICE that I’ve encountered as a patient.

Firstly, for my appointment on 7/24 I arrived on time and still had to wait 2 hours so be seen by the mid-wife because they were “running behind“. On 8/8 an appointment for an ultrasound & mid- wife I arrived at 10/10:15 am for a 12:30 scheduled appointment, an oversight on my end. However with less than 10 people in the practice, they ENSURED to have me wait till my scheduled time while people were sitting and standing around conversing about non work related topics. On this day I didn’t finish everything till after 3pm, causing me to miss an appointment I had scheduled for 2:30 elsewhere, all I received was apologies
Today on 8/24, the final straw, I arrived at 8:46 when I had an 8:30am scheduled appointment and was instructed to use the kiosk which didn’t work for SEVERAL people who stepped off the line. One lady stepped off and jumped back in front of me, causing me to now check in later & be late for my appointment. The ultra sound techs then decided to call individuals who check in after me and have me wait almost TWO HOURS just for my name to be called for an hour ultrasound.……… I do not feel advocated for at this facility, they are scheduling more individuals than they can handle and they are excessively short staffed!!!!
Oh, and let me add, while I was late for the 8:30am appointment I have an 11am same day with the mid wife again and it’s currently 11:30am and I’ve not been called yet!
This place is full of B.S! The care quality is HORRIBLE!

At the end my friend went up to the nursing station and asked. But things happen and I understood. I was really impressed one of the nurse from the surgery called to ask how I was doing next day. So thank you to that nurse.
Bring back Claire Raizen, she was a great employee. Why is a hospital not ok with "must live"? Do you want your patients not to live?

Im here bc I have lymphoma cancer and they have treated me very well. The support is amazing..My doc his name is Dr. Body is an amazing g oncologist.

I scheduled an appointment with a urologist who came highly recommended to me and weeks later – I received a notice on the portal that my appointment was canceled and rescheduled with someone else. There were no credentials listed for the someone else person. As it turns out, after another couple of wasted week, this person turned out to be a nurse-NOT A doctor.  Why in the world would I pay to see a nurse instead of one of the 1500+ Licensed and Board Certified urologist? It’s unconscionable, inconsiderate, and insulting that this would be done without my permission, without my input, without my coordination… Further, why would I want to speak to anyone else about my symptoms – is the doctor deaf? Is this just a scam to get more money from potential patients and their insurance?  This is a heinously arrogant attitude of this hospital…. Has anyone else encountered this with This or any other hospital?

I Helen Rodriguez was on the 7th floor for 2 weeks I had the best care there anyone could have¡!! I want to thank all of them! So patient and considerate just ❤️ love them! Been here twice to see specialist and care has always been very fast, professional, and friendly. Highly recommend.

Very nice hospital.
Visiting our aunt

One of the workers walked into my grandmothers room and said a disgusting statement which was “she’s expired? What do you guys need” referring to my aunts when she said guys, they js lost their mother, I just lost my grandmother. You will pay for that.

I’ve lived in the U.S. for 23 years — 20 of them in New York — and I never thought I’d come back here and feel this unwelcome in the city I once called home. I currently live in Colorado, and I came back to New York on vacation with my daughter to visit my mother. On the night of June 24, 2025, I started having discomfort and tightness on the left side of my chest, so I went to this hospital hoping for care and safety. Instead, I felt invisible.

No one really acknowledged me. I was left sitting there in pain, feeling worse by the minute. I get that ERs are busy — I truly do — but the lack of basic human decency was shocking. I kept waiting and waiting, barely getting checked. And when they finally discharged me, I was still feeling awful.

Before leaving, I asked my nurse — a woman covered in tattoos — if I could please stay just 30 more minutes to feel stable before stepping out. I wasn’t drunk or high, I was just feeling physically unwell. But instead of any empathy, she coldly told me I could only stay for 15 minutes, and if I didn’t leave, she’d call security. Really? That’s how you treat someone who’s asking for help?

When I stood up to leave, she gave me the fakest “Feel better” I’ve ever heard. It was like mockery. I looked at her and thought — one day, you’ll get sick too. One day, you’ll be scared and vulnerable. And maybe someone will treat you the way you just treated me.

I don’t like to say this, but as an Asian man, I couldn’t help but wonder — would I have been treated differently if I looked or spoke differently? Was it bias? Was it just cruelty? I don’t know. But the whole experience left me feeling humiliated and heartbroken. I came seeking care, and I left feeling worse than when I walked in.

This city used to feel like home. Now it just feels cold.

This hospital is the worst place to deliver a baby! Rooms are disgusting and gross.

The nurses are super rude, but they have some very good OB doctors so i had no choice but to use them.

My wife left the hospital the second she was able to walk, otherwise she would go out of her mind, and we had to hire help at home to recover from this nightmare.

This hospital killed my dad. He was refused any scans to see if his cancer came back. The doctors exact words “you look like a boxer” to then when he finally got a scan done two weeks after that it was stage 4 cancer and he was told he had two weeks to live. This was almost 10 years ago.
Garbage hospital garbage staff. A few good ones rest are horrible.
My mother told me I was born in this hospital on July 18 1981 🫡
Mom came in today to get a procedure done. Procedure is suppose to be done at 11 its now 1:23 and she is still in the triage/ in take area

My daughter had surgery three days ago at the hospital. After being discharged, she got some symptoms and had to return to the emergency room. She was admitted again, but there were no available beds in the appropriate ward, so she has remained in the emergency room for two days now! There is no hope to transfer from the emergency room! The Doctors, nurses, and other staff are good and trying to help, but this is a real mismanagement of the president of the hospital. That's awful!

The staff are amazing
I came here the staff worked on me to get me back to myself and feel at my top health. They worked effortlessly to find and target the problem. I needed  a Iv and I need medicine they provided the care a I needed. Highly intelligent on their care. Professionalism is great actually it’s amazing. I felt very sick now I feel better and I appreciate and thank the staff. The doctor was highly intelligent and make swift decisions on how to provide top notch care to his patients. Still amazed bc I really didn’t think I would recover back to my normal self o was thinking I might be like this the rest of my life god forbid. It was a scare and I won’t be into anything that will get me this sick again . However if you start to have a health scare or an emergency Mount Sinai is the place to go. Thank you Mount Sinai health team

Great hospital...I had a surgery on my testicular all the nurses it was great very helpful...and the doctors they were very helpful and friendly...they did a great job...I want to thank them all...God bless you...

Had major surgery for Crohn's disease (again). First time at this hospital and with this surgeon. Things went exceedingly well!  I am feeling so much better after years of being told at other hospitals in other states that nothing could be done: Or, the doctors' were asking me what to do!  Here at Mt. Sinai, they took charge and told me what I needed, did the surgery, and helped me heal. I couldn't ask for more.

I’ve been dealing with this hospital for over 10 years, and I’m really disappointed with how things have gone recently. I went to the emergency room with a swollen foot and ended up waiting over 2 hours without being seen. I don’t understand how it’s called an “emergency” room when there’s such a long wait, especially when you’re in pain and unsure of what’s going on. I finally gave up and asked the front desk to cancel my visit. I expected better after all these years, but unfortunately, the service seems to be getting worse instead of improving.

Frustrating Experience – Mount Sinai Only Cares About Money

I had surgery at Mount Sinai in September, and between insurance and myself, paid around $120,000. The procedure was fine, but their customer service is terrible. I accidentally selected virtual billing and missed a $95 charge. After six months—with no call—they sent it to collections.

When I called, they told me it’s their policy not to contact patients via phone only written. That’s incredibly disappointing especially since I’ve always paid on time. It’s clear they care more about money than people. I won’t be going back.
Staff are lovely but wait times are egregious. Mt. Sinai should be embarrassed by this level of care and the negligence of its patients. I plan on switching doctors as soon as I get home.

To whom it may concern, from Mount Sinai Hospital. I Parbhu sharing my experiences starting from the registration dest to the surgery room. Dr Andrew Hecht and his colleagues did a remarkable job on me god bless all of you . it was unbelievable to see everyone doing what they trained to do. And from my recovery room the nurses was in hand to hand with my wife help taking care of me .I am so thankful 🙏 for their extraordinary jobs they have performed. You have to see it for your self, I am speechless.
Special are here. Crowded parking space

A pathetic place.. please do not go there.. I am here in New York for just 4 nights and unexpectedly my 10 year old daughter started vomiting yesterday. Since I am on travel I thought of getting some medication to settle her. It was nothing but vomiting without any other symptoms and since I knew nothing about New York on the way to St. John’s Cathedral I asked my taxi driver to take me to a place to see a doctor. My goodness I ended up in this place and they took her in and put a canula right away saying she has symptoms of appendicitis and has high BP. They did blood test and took a urine sample and was about to do an ultrasound scan. I got the smell of the thing right away and I know what’s about to happen. I somehow stopped them doing the ultrasound and even having the urine sample in hand they decided to discharge my daughter after I explained them that I’m here for something for nausea that might be obvious after 15 hours of flight two days before or worst case scenario a mild viral infection. So they came up with a bill of 1350 USD. Fortunately I had money to settle that and came running away. They prescribed her a single medication initially I thought something for nausea or stomach issues but at the pharmacy I found it’s just paracetamol. It ruined my entire day and the travel too. I know I did a terrible mistake to go there without any search. They started giving her saline and stopped that right away and discharged. When I asked them to at least finish the saline they told that amount they have given is enough.. pls guys beware of them. Hope this won’t happen to anyone else again.. thanks.
It’s really bad I really need to speak with the owners so they can know how there employees are reacting

One of the main reasons my sister is dead at 20 is the malpractice of this hospital, immunocompromised from multiple BMT’s and sticking her in a room with another patient while their family members came in and out of the room without masks on, threatened by the other lady in her room to hurt her while the staff did nothing, she was supposed to go down for a day or two for a procedure from Rochester NY, but the drs from MT Sinai and Strong Memorial hospital in Rochester left her down there for months until i finally drove the 6 hours AMA’d her and drove her back to Rochester after she caught covid from being immunocompromised and sharing a room with someone, was on a ventilator for almost a month and that started the cycle of multiple hospital long stays and her body deteriorating and finally passing this past February with her lungs being the main culprit all because this hospital and Strong in Rochester dropped the ball killed my sister, don’t ever bring anyone here for anything, they will put you or your family at risk

Had my father in the ER for 3days due no room available.  Ordered a CT scan for my father who is a diabetic  who had morning breakfast. The nurse kept stating he's next for the CT scan, but keeps being pushed back.  I ask the nurse if he eat an perform the CT scan 2hrs later. Again, she stated they're coming to get him. Now it's 9:45pm from the time he had breakfast and still no CT done.  My father has spinal stenosis that's causing leg pain  and the Dr. Stated he may need surgery to allev the pain. Mind you my father is 82yrs old.  Why would they even  suggest surgery for a patient of his age. So many tests being done and they can't find the cause. Too many young nurses and doctors that seem like they're fresh out of school and using the patients to get their training.  I want to have confidence with the care my father is rec,  but don't.  Today's type of care in hospitals are scary.  I feel bad for elderly patents who don't have family to ask questions on their care. It's sad 😔

We took our dad who is 75 years old to the ER back  in August 2024 after we had no success in getting him help from the hospital he was regularly treated at (Kings County). He was diagnosed with stage 4 lymphoma by Mount Sinai and they immediately jumped into action. The care and urgency they gave my dads situation is something me and my family will forever be grateful for as his regular hospital did not show nearly enough concern on getting him treated as soon as possible.  The staff treated my dad like a person not just a number. We were referred to Dr Sundaram and her team at the Ruttenberg Treatment center and after six months of treatment our dad’s cancer is in remission. We can’t thank the staff of Mount Sinai enough for the level of care and expertise they showed in treating my dads complex condition. If you have family or friends who need that extra level of care and attention don’t ever assume they can’t be helped. I would definitely recommend this hospital for anyone in a similar circumstance.

My father was brought here from his nursing facility on Friday.  It is now Sunday 11:53am and he is still waiting in the ER. I'm not sure what is happening with this hospital but it is not good. The patients are brought in evaluated and then they are left unattended until rounds are needed to be done.  If you need assistance there could be 12 doctors or  nurses at the nurses station but no one will even acknowledge that someone needs help. The young lady next to my dad asked to be changed for an hour. No one came until her daughter came in and started to change her herself.  I had to change my fathers bedding after the aide told me she would be back and never returned, although she was tending both bed A&B she clearly forgot I asked for assistance (smh).With my father being 79 yrs old. He should not be subjected to all the different ailments coming into the ER. They had him on a gurney with his feet hanging out for two days until my mother insisted they give him a proper bed. If there is no place to put the clients why keep accepting clients? There are people here that have been here for 2-3 days. Overall the doctors have been communicating with me. But they lack in bedside manners and just being human and showing compassion. There was a man who's wife had a xray of her pancreas. She received the results of pancreatic cancer through my chart while she was here waiting for the doctor to return to her to let her know the results. They were an elderly couple who was clearly upset that his wife had to see this before speaking with a doctor.  And the fact that I heard the whole conversation in the ER by the desk was a lack of privacy or concern. Im totally disappointed with the service. I have been a patient of Mt. Sinai for over over 20yrs and I have had bad experiences but nothing that made me end my relationship with my doctors. I was truly surprised by their practices as of today in 2025.
Amazing food, actual competent doctors and nurses genuinely care. Properly tapered off benzodiazepines here.

I do not know why people are hating. Most of these reviews are fake. You should go if u have asthma. Anyways, I had something in me that can not be pushed out (it was poop) it was hard as a rock. Shout out to  dr quiros, the docters can figure out in a quick second what’s wrong. I had a enclosy. GO HERE NOW IF YOU HAVE A CONDITION

We regret the day we made the decision to Come to this Hospital.I will have more detailed UPDATES soon about the ordeal that we have been experiencing in this hospital.The lack of effective communication and apparent disregard for our concerns has left us feeling helpless and ignored. Our attempts to advocate for better care seem to be met with indifference, creating an environment where we fear for my son’s wellbeing It’s the Worst hospital my 27year old son with no medical history , he walked in Mount Sina hospital and is now fighting for his life. He was in neuro critical care unit someone transferred him to not even step down unit but to medical care without letting us know even the nurses said he needs constant monitoring I told the doctors repeatedly but they didn’t listen the third day he had a respiratory failure and his oxygen level dropped to 70 and his heart stopped he coded then they said we are sorry he needs constant monitoring and transferred him to ICU there’s no accountability who made the assessment and transferred him to a medical unit in three months of his stay at MSH not even once they put him in neuro unit even though he is a neuro patient with brain and spinal cord issues now once again they transferred him down the first day he had fever of 104 he needed a cooling blanket when I got to him l saw a thermal blanket instead of cooking blanket the nurse said it’s a cooling blanket and that’s what we use here I called the supervisor she saw the blanket and said someone made a mistake . In mount Sinai hospital the step down unit nurses don’t even know the difference between cooling and thermal a patient next door just went brain dead infront of us her daughter was telling the nurse that her mother is having hard time breathing the nurse told her don’t look at the monitor it’s not working correctly and minutes later she was brain dead horrible plz keep your loved ones away from this nightmare hospital even the patient representative do not answer your calls I have first hand experience. I will have updates soo..((01/12/23))update his oxygen level dropped again multiple requests to the patient representative and to the doctors that we want him to be transferred to another hospital but they don’t care we are not satisfied with the care he is receiving in this hospital l am literally begging them to transfer my son for days he’s getting worst...H E L P…it’s been more than a week I am requesting to transfer my son out of mount Sinai hospital system but nothing is being done How corrupt New York Medical system is update ((2/12/23))today my sons coded again his heart
stopped and they had to do CPR I know they will kill my son because of their negligence patient advocate or social worker nobody is helping me save my sons life it’s happening infront of my eyes and I am so helpless please someone HELP even now the doctors are not willing to move him back to critical care he needs constant monitoring but human life has no value after repeatedly making mistakes and later on admitting it but still don’t want to listen ((12/4/23)) update someone pulled his breathing tube while changing him he was in such a bad pain that his heart rate went up to 153 and oxygen dropped into 70’s they didn’t know how to fix it gave him pain meds l don’t know how long he will be able to take this abuse I know that the hospital representative read this review and still doesn’t care it’s been two months and they don’t have any diagnosis I want him transferred to another hospital…12/04/2023 update Today the social worker told me that she started the transfer procedure let’s see I am hopeful she will help me save my sons life from this horrible and inhumane place..((12/05/23)) update Today once again they told me that the transfer is denied I don’t know how many people lost there lives because of this and how many more lives will be lost before the healthcare officials will wake up another sad day hopefully my son will survive another day.😢😢

The neglect their patients. They don’t take their jobs as serious as they can they worry more about how many family members come see their patients. I ask for a supervisor and get different people coming up to me saying they are a supervisor and they are not. They take their time with going to attend the patients and leave them there until they feel they are ready to attend the patient. The called the cops on my family because it’s was a lot of them trying to visit my grandmother and they banned us saying we were be a big distraction on the floor and said they can arrest us for precaution. They are unacceptable. The head of nurses is very rude and do not know how to communicate. My grandmother been there for 1month and they have been running tests and telling her family she is fine. My father was in Mount Sinai in Maddison Avenue for two weeks. The Doctors and nurses took good care of him. There were no bed sore on his feet nor the rest of his body. They kept me informed of his condition and made sure he had everything he needed when he was discharged yestetday. The only complaint I have is that I brought two bags of clothes for him to go home in and left it in the hospital room closet. The bags had his name on it. These bags contained his heavy dark colored Jacket, royal blue sweater ,under shirt and sneakers . When I asked about the clothes they said they could not find his bags. I told them how could it be lost when his name is on both bags of clothes. I feel that since the clothes are lost my father should have been compensated for the clothes.

If I could leave zero stars I would. I gave birth last week at their fifth ave location and I received and episiotomy. My episiotomy was performed by what I believe to be a resident and my stitches became undone and I had an open wound down there. After calling labor and delivery they told me to come to the emergency department. While in the ER a doctor analyzed my wound and confirmed my stitches were open and dripping blood. After this I had a nurse try to incorrectly insert an IV into my hand which was the worst pain ever then he attempted to gaslight me into believing IV’s are supposed to hurt when going in which I know is false, his hands were shaking while inserting the IV and I had to demand he remove the IV. I sat in a room for one hour after sitting on a chair in front of triage for two just for my boyfriend and I to finally get fed up that no one came to assist me. I will be going to a different medical facility for them to close my open wound. Shame on you mount Sinai
Slow service today, veryyyyyy long wait to see an eye doctor

This review is about my brief Birth experience at the Main Mount Sinai Hospital at Klingstein Pavillion.  I was scheduled for inductions/ TOLAC on December 8th 2024.

The process of my inductions was pretty standard, I got IV, I hooked up to EFM machine, and sonogram to confirm baby was head down. For pregnant people who cervix are long and high and previous csection, my options are few: Cook Cathether ( mechanical dilated cervix) in combination with pitocin. I agreed to only a cook catheter before starting pitocin.

From Dec 8th 1120pm to Dec 9th approximately 411am-418am, Hospital Resident MD Cersonky removed it and informed me that my cervix was 4cm dilated/ 70% effaced/ -4 station. I was so excited because that meant I had few centimeters to go and baby will be here.

But...After third cervical exam performed by Dr. Warner MFM fellow stated " Your external os is 4cm/ but your internal os is 2cm" my mood immediately deflated. The nail in the coffin was when MFM Attending Dr. ONA provided the most unsafe options, 2 options specifically: Break my water even though my baby head was not engaged or re-insert cook catheter with pitocin remaining at 10. I declined both options. However, I opted to stop Pitocin and continued use of movement in labor with my doula.

After that encountered, I lost trust in the medical team. There no apologize at that time. I was pissed-- I was mislead to believe something that wasn't true. As a Labor & Delivery nurse it made see how patients who aren't aware or even had birth education courses could get taken advantage of. Seeing this all proved me, that moment, I needed to advocate myself, the same way I do for my pregnant patients.

That's what I did!

After discussion with my husband and doula, I decided to stop my induction at Mount Hospital and leave an environment where my Birth Plan wasn't considered.

I'm grateful, I went to another facility to restart my induction.
There are some awful nurses working here.

Horrible horrible horrible! I give it nothing but 0 stars. They will milk your insurance in every way possible. One of the ICU doctors said in front of my mother & the staff that my lungs were very “Marketable” red flag number one.  I was discharged on Sunday by one of the doctors & they kept me there for several more days with no real reason. When I asked why am I still here they first stated I needed to see the social worker. When I finally saw the useless social worker they then started diagnosing me with other issues that I never had. Let’s also talk about how nobody in this place knows how to draw blood. The Nurses can’t draw blood, a few of the medical assistants knew how to draw blood better than the Nurses. I have great veins by the which they blew all my veins out. I had about 8-10 bruises all over my body, bruises were so big you would have thought I was in a DV situation. They have nothing but residents working on you who think they know it all and don’t listen to you. Had 2 residents tell me that my oxygen levels were low… my oxygen level was sitting at 96 which is normal. Had another resident tell me I had kidney failure when I never had kidney failure. Blood work came back & showed my kidneys were just fine. That same resident who put in my chart & kept saying that I had kidney failure told the nurse to give me a “IV bag”. When I asked her what was it she was giving me she stated “I don’t know”. I refused. The same nurse comes back in again & said “it’s for your heart”. I told her there’s nothing wrong with my heart. She then comes back in again and she says “well the doctor (the same resident) said if you take this medication he’ll let you go home”. When I refused again I told her to bring me the resident who was telling her these things. She went & got another resident & that’s resident implied that I was lying & making it up…MY TWO family members who were sitting there the entire time even said the nurse said those things & all the resident could say was “OH” & left. I never been more disgust by a so call hospital.
Overall great experience staff was very nice and helpful. Doctors were very attentive and helpful. Thank you guys for being so empathetic, understanding and caring.
Extremely abusive, rude and dismissive!

A handful of staff can ruin the reputation of a good hospital. Healthcare should be based on excellent care and treatment, but the patient care technicians, phlebotomists, and my mother’s horrible male oncologist all treated her in the most unprofessional way possible in January- February, 2018. The experience was shocking and appalling. I don’t recommend them for anyone looking for a hospital that takes the health and experience of their patients seriously. They are only about the money that comes into their coffers rather than ensuring their patients get the best care. Don’t use them if you can, it will only end in unsavoury stories that might have devastating consequences for you or your family.

-Shenita Etwaroo

Hello world,

Within Mount Sinai Hospital ER by far, I have experienced the worst service of all times, I would not classify it as "care" at all. The ER was absolutely understaffed with nurses who were overstacked with workload, to the point where nurses were 2-3 hours late to their commitments.

Judging by the juggling that the nurses had to do to cope with the understaffing, I would not blame them for constantly being distracted by conversations about nails or bitching about a certain someone they commonly hate. If only we saw more work out of care rather than hear random gibberish about random people from the employees' end, our time at the ER probably would have been more fruitful.

For a night-long session that costs over $500 dollars, we do expect some service other than see what's your style or lingo. We want service in exchange for money. The second you are clocked in, you gotta work.

Now I see that things I have heard about health care are basically right. I was too optimistic to think ER care would be far better than care at home.

Bumped my dad’s surgery by 4 hours, wasn’t taken in until 10pm. Unacceptable. Get your shit together. I don’t care about other patients. Fix your bumping system. An ablation is not an emergency and should not have bumped my dad.

Justice-Keith Little, Care Coordinator for the Mt. Sinai ALS Center at Union Square has been the most compassionate, knowledgeable and helpful staff member I have encountered among the ALS Centers in the City.

I always had a great experience from Mt. Sinai (in the ER Department).  However I had surgery in the GP-2 at 1468 Madison, and the aftercare was not well.  They also do not give enough information on the plan beforehand for you to know what to expect.  So in periOperative care department/area, I got out at 4:20 PM on November 3rd.  I was trying to close the curtain, but barely had the energy to walk or get up.  The small drop-down table on the chair flipped down, and the 4 ounce apple juice fell on the floor.  The male, older nurse got angry and irate.  Then told me I need leave.  He actually had the audacity to later come and pick a fight (high tone and quick words) with me (very poor bedside manner); he could have just easily said ‘sorry there was a misunderstanding.’  I told him we were probably having a cultural difference, and I told him he was being unprofessional.  He kept trying to argue with me, but I asked him to stop.  I wanted to get out of there so fast, I didn’t brush my teeth and put my used robe, sheets, and cover in the soiled laundry hamper (I didn’t want anybody complaining about any of my mess).  I haven’t eaten since yesterday, but my appetite is gone for today (that was enough argument to last me for the week).  The other fifty nurses were kind and nice.

I was back to the hospital for emergency again and I understand how hard is the work for employees.
They receive more and more clients to take care.
The Doctors and staff are very professional
Let’s face it, all ER’s drink but this one is far better than the worst, my 96 year old father got excellent care for an emergency clown surgery.  The nurses were caring and doctors excellent.

Methodist was once the best of the best but over the course of the past year I've had nothing but issues. I've been through three doors leaving and then Methodist did not verify my insurance correctly when placing me with a new physician. Every other physician in the office was covered under my insurance but the new one was not. They assigned me to the new physician after canceling my appointment because they physician I selected had their panel closed but no one bothered to look at that until two hours before my appointment that had been scheduled for a month. So now I'm on the hook for out of network charges. No need for Methodist to respond with their generic "here's our patient line call this number and let us know" because I've done that now twice, once with a call back that didn't really fix the situation and once with no call back to me. ICARE values are a thing of the past I guess.

As a physician who works in the medical center, I am appalled at how poorly the doctors and providers communicate with the patient and family. My husband was admitted with encephalopathy and it’s documented in the HPI that history was obtained from his wife at bedside, which was false. I was not there and received no updates from the ED provider after arriving to the hospital- we weren’t even informed he was being admitted until the escort showed up saying the room was ready. On the floor, scans were ordered and cancelled without discussing care plan/rationale with the patient and certainly not the family. Abnormal lab results were not reviewed with the patient. If this is the best hospital in Texas, then we are screwed.
This means that LTC holder can not enter this facility. For Constitutional Carry, the sign does not apply. The security staff and the cops did not know the difference at all.

My family member is currently in Houston Methodist and our experience had been very good until he left the IMU and came to the main hospital room. He has Parkinsons and came in for a UTI that turned septic, and has been here 10 days so far, but since he left IMU they have not changed his old IV lines that have been in more than a week and look dirty, he has not been bathed and his care giver who comes daily said the techs are rude when asked to empty the urine container which is almost always full. Methodist has the reputation as the Best hospital in Houston, but we must remember the little things count.

Worst experience ever here the nurses or Doctors don't communicate with you as they should. My mom was there for about two weeks for not eating and psychological issue. I'm her medical power of attorney if you're there to catch them they speak to you but if not nothing even when you leave messages no. Lack of communication has put my mom in an uncomfortable position concerning her care. Due to lack of communication my mom went in being able to walk but now being sent home unable to walk. Which means needing bed services. Was trying to get her into a nursing facility from the hospital no proper help from them they just wanted her out. Then they set up her transportation to her home which she lives alone and didn't inform me. I happened to call the hospital around 8:30 am to find that it was set for 9am. Very Bad situation so  I guess they were just going to take her home and then what?

I was extremely disappointed with my experience at the Methodist Hospital OBGYN in Cypress. I had been in pain and bleeding since May and came in hoping for answers. I explained all my symptoms to the doctor and even brought the MRI disk and ultrasound results from another hospital. Despite this, the doctor didn’t perform a pelvic or uterine exam—she only pressed on my stomach and lower abdomen. After briefly reviewing my MRI, she told me I needed emergency surgery and scheduled it for the earliest available date, which was two weeks later.

The day before my scheduled surgery, I received multiple calls from the billing department demanding $4,000 upfront or my procedure would be canceled. I was devastated. I had been suffering for months, and the doctor herself had stressed how urgent the surgery was. I tried to set up a payment plan and explained how unreasonable it was to call someone one day before such a major procedure demanding that kind of money. They did not care and ultimately canceled my surgery.

To make matters worse, when I asked for my MRI disk back to show my next doctor, the nurse told me it was lost and suggested I go back to the imaging center to request another one from the hospital I got it from. Mind you, they were aware I got this done in Lagos, Nigeria. This was careless and deeply frustrating. Meanwhile, my mom was flying in the next morning to support me, unaware that the surgery had already been canceled.

The whole experience was stressful, devastating, and revealed how little compassion the hospital showed. The staff came across as more concerned with money than patient care. I would not recommend Methodist Hospital OBGYN in Cypress, especially if you are facing a real emergency. The lack of empathy and professionalism was shocking.
I was well taken care of.

The facility is new and very attractive. Additionally, each and every person I encountered — from the person who helped me with admissions to the orderly who wheeled me out the door — were very professional, courteous, and empathetic.
