Worst experiences here. I am traumatized at how my mother was treated while on hospice. One example is the hospital “ran” out of tissues and told us to go get our own from the store.

My sister also had a horrible birth experience here which resulted in a 48 hour labor turned into a c-section. I would avoid this hospital at all costs.

Worst ER experience I’ve ever had and it was my first time at Hackensack. I tried explaining symptoms to main nurse and she was dismissive, rude, and wouldn’t let me talk. She diagnosed me by just looking at me vs. letting me share all of my concerns. She told me there are no organs on the left side of the body as well when I told her where my pain was. It made me feel stupid and small when in fact there are several organs on the left side (heart, spleen, pancreas, left kidney, left lung, etc). I was ushered to several waiting areas / rooms which was fine but the main nurse yelled at me for sitting in a room that I was TOLD to sit in by another nurse. They also botched my IV catheter as I have a blown vein for the first time in my life and it hurt the entire time it was in. I was too afraid to speak up because the main nurse scared me. My arm is now bruised and swollen. I am still in shock by the whole experience and will never step foot here again.
Lousy experience. No rooms available and the wait is like visiting your doctor. It's ridiculous

I do not know what happened to this Hospital but it certainly deserves nothing higher than a 1 rating.. Staff is inattentive and detached.. You have to track someone down to try and I get some answers and then you get no answers just excuses..

My mom 81 had a stroke Memorial Day ICU floor awesome explained everything.  Then she was moved to the 3rd floor first night was fine and the 2 day I started exercising her right side and tried to get her to talk she was on a bed pan for over 2-3 hours. Her albuterol mask was on her bed laying there.  Which should be changed.  I sterilized instruments so I know about this stuff.  I let the nurse know hey my mom is sitting in urine and diarrhea she had another nurse come in and change her I helped her clean my mother. Then her oxygen dropped and I’m sitting waiting nobody came so I put her oxygen on and suctioned her mouth because I’m a dental assistant I don’t mind helping.  My neighbor went up and noticed nobody was turning her.  ICU was great always on time.  So I ended up staying everyday for hours to see what was happening again left in diarrhea.   I started to clean it cause every nurse was in a room nobody was around.  This is not okay.  I told the charge nurse and she was very sorry.  I can tell these nurses are extremely exhausted and frustrated some nice some tired get them help.  Also some guy dropped his glove on the floor and then proceeded to put it on to check my mother down there.  Like my life is in shambles.  I sit in her room from 12pm to midnight and I barely see the nurses I have to grab them and I feel so bad cause there is not enough nurses 5 pt’s to 1 nurse??? That’s insane.  Also some rooms don’t have cameras some rooms do.  Then you get the case managers or social workers whatever telling you oh we don’t help you with insurance information but if you need anything let us know seriously?? We had them set us up with a insurance guy like what?  I’m sure if it was their own family member they would be on top of it.  This is why the world is so messed up.  Like advocating is what ppl need the hospital to do fighting the insurance.  I see all these reviews and apologies but the thing is get your staff extra help.  That’s why they get upset or mad they are over worked and some just don’t care cause they are so tired.  Like why do ppl have to pay thousands of dollars to stay at the hospital???   Also if I don’t leave after 10:30pm I have to pay the parking so I decided to stay after I stayed hours nobody checking on my mother.  I don’t want these nurses to get in trouble but get them help these are ppls families.

I honestly can’t think of a single negative thing to say about this hospital. I’m incredibly thankful to every staff member who made me feel safe, calm, and prepared for my emergency surgery. They didn’t just take great care of me—they also showed the same compassion to my loved ones, who were understandably very worried. I walked into the ER and was treated immediately—perhaps due to the severity of my condition—but wow, I’ve never experienced such a warm and welcoming environment in a hospital. Every staff member I encountered was amazing, even after long shifts and demanding workloads
was giving birth there they don't respect your privacy at one point my room was full of people without reason or explanation I thought there was a problem just come and watch crossing arms.

Im so tired of the attitudes. Someone very close and important to me was rushed to the ER. I called the main number who by the way was very pleasant however that changed when I spoke to his nurse. From the moment he picked up he sounded like he was being bothered but I just put it aside. I asked him how my loved one was doing and he the audacity to say “he’s very capable of talking so you can ask him yourself” just wow. The attitude was absolutely uncalled for. Do better.

I took my boyfriend here and we spent over 13 hours at the emergency room, we arrived there around 9:30 am and did not leave until 10:40 pm. The nurse made a rude comment when my boyfriend was groaning from the IV in his hand, she said he shouldn't be in pain since it's already in. Extremely uncalled for and should not telling a patient that. We were barely checked up and eventually I had to go ask for an update. They also collected his blood sample, but it was left in our room and never got tested until after he was moved. That's when he was moved to the dialysis center, when we got there they said they had been waiting for us. Showing a lack of communication in the ER department.  Afterwards we went back to the ER, where again after an hour a doctor was like oh I've been waiting for you to come back. It's like nobody informed her we were back. Afterwards another hour passes by and no one has come to check up on us again. Finally around 10pm, I told the nurses station that we've been here for almost 13 hours and have no idea what's going. That's when a nurse said she'll give him the last medication and discharge papers. Thankfully, she finished all of that within 15 minutes. I tried my bad to understand them since I'm sure there's more serious cases they have to deal with, but only to a certain extent. 13 hours and we were only 5 times in that time is absolutely ridiculous. Even the dialysis center was shocked at how little attention we were getting from the ER department. If you do come here, be prepared to spend hours here.

I wish I could say my experience with the cardiology department at Hackensack University Medical Center was positive, but unfortunately, the billing and coding department has turned a challenging time into an absolute nightmare.
My husband underwent a heart catheterization on February 20/2025, that was preauthorized by our cardiologist, covering all expected procedures. However, during the procedure, a clot was discovered, and a stent was necessary. I promptly requested post-authorization for this additional procedure, which was granted a month later.
Instead of accurately processing the necessary claims with the correctly authorized CPT codes, the billing/coding team submitted completely different codes for the same procedures, resulting in a denied claim from our insurance. Even after the doctor submitted a request to correct the CPT codes, it feels like they were met with a wall of indifference. To make matters worse, we have now received a statement demanding an outrageous $17,490! This overwhelming amount for a procedure that was supposed to be covered has caused us immense stress during an already difficult time. I understand that billing can sometimes be complicated, but the apparent lack of communication and disregard from the billing department is unacceptable.
It feels like dealing with anarchists; there's no way to resolve this situation without endless back-and-forth. I strongly urge anyone considering services here to be prepared for a potential battle with their billing department.

I went to NICU to check for a measles exposure in my first trimester. THEY REFUSED  they told me I had to have a procedure of chemical Abortion I refused and ILLEGALLY detained me for monitoring.

released next day spent over 24 hours there being BERATED and all but forced into killing the fetus

Staff is so unprofessional
From the Emergency Room leaving patients tonight 5/21 and stand in the front of the tv to Watch New York and Indiana basket ball game
All they do is just collect information
Waiting for over 45 minutes for transportation to the CT department .
Then the tech at CT stopped taking patients in from 10:50pm till the new shift started at 11:08 pm
When I asked to speak to the patient experience team they ignored me and said they will be in at 8:00 am.
Super rude.
No communication whatsoever so ever .
This is how they leave the patients waiting.
All they do is just giving pain relief to kill some time till other people take over the shift.
And this is one of the slowest days in ER.

This was by far the most disorganized ER experience I’ve encountered. Things actually started off smoothly—my dad is an active patient here, so his records were ready, and he was taken in right away without waiting. But after he was seen by a group of doctors, nurses, and technicians, the professionalism quickly deteriorated.

The environment felt chaotic. While no one was overtly rude, the nurses and techs were speaking loudly, cracking jokes, and laughing—even as patients around them were dealing with serious, urgent situations. At one point, the doctor openly admitted to forgetting to discharge us on time. The nursing staff, unfortunately, seemed even more careless.

I usually have a high opinion of HUMC, but this ER does not reflect the standards I’ve come to expect. I wouldn’t recommend it. If you’re in need of serious or urgent care, I suggest looking elsewhere. The lack of professionalism here undermines the reputation of the entire medical center.
Understaffed. Do not go here. The baby  or you will not get the attention you need. They will direct you from here to there and nothing is taken care of. One of the worst hospitals I have seen ever.

I was on the fourth floor on Friday, May 16th visiting a dear friend of mine who broke his wrist.  A very kind woman, "Joan" or "Joannie" assisted without hesitation when we asked her to transfer my friend from the chair to the bed.  She was very professional  and courteous.  She deserves a raise.  I think she is a PCT.

There’s a receptionist @ #60 at Hackensack Medical Center who needs to be replaced or retrained for her lack of common courtesy, and her demeanor. She’s insulting and offers nothing constructive. She’s a liability to the Hospital. Nicolas Ortiz. 5/15/2025

While I appreciate the care to my nephew, I must challenge the two in a room rule. There is no bases for this requirement.  It is not conditioned on safety, as told to us, because no one is tested and no one is required to wear a mask. Based on no testing and no masks requirement, it almost doesn't matter how many are allowed to visit as long as the occupancy of the room, or the challenge of patient care is not distrupted. We witnessed an exception last evening across the hall with 6 people in the room. We are 3 family members to a kidney transplant. The room is very large with no other patients, and we are not disruptive. We should all be allowed to sit in the room together.  Please revisit your rules, especially when the current are not based on safety considerations. EDIT...Thank you to the hospital staff for making a concession for us, even for a short time.

My daughter had her appendix removed from the best doctors team you can imagine,from the check in to all the doctors and nurses a big thank you for taking care of my daughter.
I’m lucky enough to live very close to this hospital and had family members visit for different medical conditions.
Thank you katja dalling and  the entire medical team for taking great care of the patients.

I came here last night with my daughter and we didn't last not even two hours at the hospital. We were taken in super fast and as soon as the doctor saw my daughter he said that she looked ok and that she might have an upper respiratory infection. They did x rays which supposedly came back good and my daughter was sent home with no medication to treat her. The doctor did not prescribe her anything for Asthma treatment, no antibiotics, no prednisone and today my daughter is worst than yesterday. She can not breathe, her phlegm is dark green and yellow, her shoulder hurst and I specifically told the doctor that last time we were there that my daughter was diagnosed with pneumonia.  All he said to her was drink honey....like, are you kidding me? Worst service ever!

My mom went to the ER on Sunday. They lost her belongings. They admit her to the hospital and she was discharged Wednesday without shoes. By Thursday evening she was feeling ill again. She went back to the ER on Friday. She was finally moved into a room Saturday. The doctor never visited her in person. She called to talk to my mom on the phone around 6:30 PM Saturday evening. The hospital unit where my mom is looks like a ghost town. Social workers have not followed through on what they’re supposed to do and some are impossible to reach. Some have also been quite terse and annoyed that both my sister and myself want to speak with them. Do better Hackensack.

I want to sincerely thank you Katja Dalling for the exceptional care and dedication you’ve shown to my mother and all the patients at the 4th Floor Infusion Cancer Center. Your intelligence, skill, and talent shine through in everything you do, from providing compassionate care to preventing falls and ensuring the safety of so many patients. It’s clear that your hard work and expertise make a profound difference in the lives of everyone you care for. We are truly grateful for your kindness, professionalism, and tireless efforts. You are an incredible blessing to our family and to so many others.
Someone please share this with her.
Charged my insurance $10,000 for an ambulance ride and charged me $10,000 for the same ride when they were paid off... bunch of scammers

Had an issue and had to go to the emergency room yesterday 4/28/25. They rushed me into the trauma wing. Everyone in there was absolutely amazing. They are definitely the best. If they see this I appreciate you. Thank you.
Terrible I was going through really bad stomach ache and they didn’t assist me for 2 hours I asked them for medicine they didn’t even gave me that very terry disappointed with the service
One of the best hospitals I’ve ever been!!!!! They saved my baby brother just out the womb !!! An I’m so Greatful. He is 18 years old now and just a living testimony. Thank yall so much !!!!!

I am writing this review due to a deeply disappointing experience. If I could rate lower than 1 star, I would. When my dad and I brought my unconscious mom to the emergency drop-off area seeking urgent medical attention, we were met with hostility and disbelief. The security guards and ambulance staff screamed at us, saying we couldn't park there, despite the critical situation we were facing.

For 3 to 5 agonizing minutes, we pleaded for help until some nurses finally came out to assist. This unacceptable response from the security and ambulance personnel highlights the need for better training and awareness in handling emergencies with compassion and urgency. Their behavior was not only unprofessional but distressing during an already stressful moment.

That being said, I must express my gratitude to the nurses and doctors who eventually stepped in to provide care for my mom. Their kindness and professionalism deserve 5 stars, and I thank them sincerely for their dedication.
Wonderful hospital and the most kind people

Absolutely the WORST ER experience ever! Staff completely rude, harsh & uneducated.  I left with bruises up and down my right arm from the incapable nurse drawing blood.
Yelling at Patients down the hall!
My bill for the horrible care is going to be outrageous for the harsh care.
Tried to trick my husband into signing papers to hold me overnight.
Ridiculous excuse for a healthier institution.
The er doctor was completely sadistic and beyond incapable.

CANDACE……I don’t know if you were going through something but hanging up on people asking for help was not okay. Beware of Candace the phone representative …she will hang up on you for no reason cause I know for a fact I was being nice and respectful. I needed to vent. Two stars because someone else ended up helping me. He was very helpful.

On February 14, 2025, I visited the Emergency Room at Hackensack Meridian Health Pascack Valley Medical Center for high blood pressure. The staff performed an electrocardiogram (ECG), a flu test, and checked my blood pressure. My visit lasted just one hour.

A month later, I received a bill for $3,066.81, which was shocking given the minimal services provided. When I called for clarification, a representative named Kevin simply stated that it was "the law" and that I had to pay—without offering any explanation. I later spoke with a supervisor, Stephanie, who provided no real assistance beyond sending an itemized bill. To my disbelief, an additional charge of $1,166.00 was added shortly after, bringing the total to $4,232.81 for a one-hour visit.

Nearly two months later, the hospital administration has done nothing to address this issue. Instead, they continue to send payment reminders, ignoring any concerns about the outrageous charges. The lack of transparency and accountability is alarming.

I strongly urge others to think twice before choosing this hospital. If fair billing and responsive customer service matter to you, avoid Hackensack Meridian Health Pascack Valley Medical Center at all costs.

The best hospital in the area. Today my 11-month-old son had to have a CT scan with anesthesia, but I wanted to try it without it first, and they did it successfully. The technician and nurse were very kind and helpful. Thank you, HUMC!
This place is a mess!

I recently was a patient at Hackensack Meridian Hospital on February 3, 2025. I had a heart surgery two days after being admitted. Dr. Spallone was my cardiac surgeon. She is absolutely a lovely, caring, compassionate, and extremely skilled surgeon. She and the entire surgical team were phenomenal, and I am so thankful to everyone for the successful outcome of my surgery. I especially appreciated the doctors who answered my questions and explained in detail so clearly about the surgery to me and my family, thank you. I was well-informed, and confident that I was in good hands. And, to the wonderful nurses for their incredible knowledge, compassion, and attentive care they have provided me, thank you. I am beyond grateful to everyone who truly made a difference in my life for the better and made a difficult time much easier. You all are my heroes!
Dr. Spallone, Dr. Kim, Dr. Mohammed, Dr. Hunter, Dr. Syed
Nurse Nicole, Joy, Julie, Adrianne, Luz, Chaniah, Kaydine, Richanel, Keven, Torese, Kaylee, Sossi, Catherine, and Elsa, Sirajuddin
Deidre Williams, APN

I don't see a lot of post of colonoscopy experience. I want to thank Joanna, Dr Lippe, and the staffs in 8th floor. The experiences from check in to discharge is very smooth and fast. The accommodation is like a 5-star hotel. Highly recommended.

Just an overall bad experience with my Dad.  This is supposed to be one of the best hospitals. What a joke.  The ER is like a 3rd world country.  Just shameful to see people in the hallway in beds with zero privacy because rooms are all taken up. The floors are filthy.  I'm surprised with all the money this hospital has that they can't provide a bigger ER to accommodate the population. The care he received in the ER wasn't great. Seems like you have to beg to be admitted for workup. My Dad first presented with abdominal pain (very bad) and CT showed hydronephrosis and he has an extensive history of cancer. They sent him home with Opioids! That's their answer.  He came back a week later with same pain - told him he had to follow-up with urologist and gave him antibiotics for a UTI.  3rd time's a charm with these guys - finally admitted him!!  Turns out he had stage IV colon cancer to his urinary tract!!!!  Time was precious here and they ignored him.  He should have went for cystoscopy IN HOUSE the first time and this would have been discovered sooner. Doctor's don't care here. They walk in all high and mighty in their white coats to make a buck.  Dr. Guterriez's oncology team doesn't have great bedside manner. His nurse called me to discuss his care and I got yes/no answers - seemed like she didn't even want to be on the phone - not a good vibe at all. I also witnessed an asian doctor who saw my Dad on the weekend while I was visiting.  He was just the fill-in doc for the weekend and knew NOTHING about my Dads case!!! Don't you review the record before entering a patient's room?!?!  He started asking questions about what's going on, are you on chemotherapy?, etc.  So unprofessional and not prepared.  The one day my day had to go to radiation, he was wheeled to the elevator and could not get on for 45 minutes because construction workers were moving things from different floors. Aren't patient's the priority here?!  Just awful.  The nursing staff for the most part was great - these professionals deserve so much more. Overall, I would never recommend this place to anyone. Can't wait for the generic response to my post from HUMC - not personable at all. They just don't care.  It's all about $$$$$

The emergency room dept of hackensack hospital is the worst .The nurses and staff in ER did not have any consideration for my wellbeing .
i was ambulanced to ER dept after injury to foot and leg and they put me in a wheelchair next to where nurses kept coming to grab the medication , they kept knocking into me and causing me furthur pain to my injury . I was in excruciating pain and they left me just sitting there with my leg dangling , refused to give me anything for pain not even a advil or a Tylenol .and after waiting several hours not even being seen .I was in so much immense pain and scared with anxiety that stems from my autism  , my care person who was listed to help with my medical care wasn't allowed to even sit with me or given access to where I was  , The nurse was rude when my mom simply inquired about getting my pain managed and my foot was swellon so much and my mom stated it should be elevated and the nurse just gave us a attitude rolled her eyes and walked away and then they once again continue to just ignore me leaving me there for yet a few more additional hours .
then my mother asked for help to wheel me to the car so i could go to another hospital for better care and the nurse again was rude and said no
I'll need to walk out on my own .
I didn't have to sign anything
to leave cause after all that time and all those hours of just sitting there i never once saw a doctor , the nurse was cold hearted and uncaring and extremely rude and told us they would not help me to the car
i ended up walking out crying and screaming .my mom drove up to the er entrance so i could leave hackensack where she was yelled at by yet another staff member for simply trying and not given any assistance to help me . and when I arrived at valley hospital  a staff member came right to the car and helped me get into a wheelchair and i was seem by a doctor within minutes,  given pain management and had a MRI within the hour of my arrival
valley doctor informed me I had a fracture of the ankle and torn ligaments .the nurses at valley were kind and caring and I was discharged with pain meds , a orthopedic referral and my ankle leg in a temporary cast
and given crutches .
the doctor explained things and had great bedside manner and stated that walking on it after this type of injury may have caused furthur damage not to mention the excruciating pain of sitting in hackensack for several hours , nothing to reduce swelling and with no consideration to my wellbeing or medical needs
do yourself a favor and don't go to hackensack hospital, drive to Valley or chilton or any other hospital but there . I definitely won't ever go back to that

The absolute worst experience I’ve ever had. It took them 3 hours to tell me I had a virus because they are all so busy being on their phones. Never going back there again I still am having breathing problems and they can’t even send a prescription into the pharmacy and I gotta do it myself. I don’t recommend this place to anyone.

I’ve had 50% good reviews. And 50% bad out of the 10+ times I’ve been there in the past there need to be senior doctors and diagnosticians of possible problems. Bring the silver haired white lab coat shirt and tie doctors back please!!!!

I came to this hospital emergency room because I fell on my face. I also had stomach pain. I always wait hours for the doctors to give you an answer and sometimes they have no clue what is going on. The nurses are great but don't be in pain. You will not get a doctor when you really need them. Go to any other E.R. if you can.

Absolutely trash facility. Individual departments do not communicate with each other at all causing an insurance nightmare as billing from a half dozen different departments tried to chase down information I already gave multiple times again and again. An absolute waste of time. Avoid this hospital if you can, it has been months of them ignoring the problem and trying to get me to fix their issue when it should've never existed. Nobody deserves happiness here for what they've inflicted on me.

The worst ER ever 👎
I checked in with excruciating pain on my back hoping they will look into what’s causing this pain & I begged for a cat scan but they refused to do anything but painkillers 😡 they didn’t even do a urine test, they drugged me up with morfine an released me 😭 although I have good insurance they left me in hallway bed for 7 hours with all the noise and traffic, in & out patients, it felt like market 🤦🏻‍♀️ horrible experience 👎
The next day I was in same pain & someone recommended Hidson Regional Hospital where I was treated & diagnosed with kidney infection because they took the right steps….they found blood & white cell in my urine than they did cat scan looking for kidney stones, I was treated with Antibiotics instead of morfine at Hackensack Hospital…..I am very disappointed how careless and incompetent HUM doctors in ER appeared compared to to small hospital like Hudson regional hospital in Secaucus to whom i highly recommend with 5⭐️

A month ago my mom had a surgical procedure.  The new surgical wing is gorgeous. Staff, nurses and doctors went above and beyond.  The rooms are beautiful, big and clean.  It was for sure a positive experience.  We knew we were in good hands.  Just recently my mom had to go back to the Hospital and from the emergency room to recovery floor……everything was amazing.  Our tech Rosa, Violet and our nurse ( we were lucky to get the same nurse twice) were just amazing. After that we were offered hospital from home, which is amazing.  We went home but my mom was still a patient.  They delivered all the equipment to the house, nurses visits twice a day, video calls from staff.  It was amazing.  Maya was the one that entered us into the program.  All the nurses are amazing.  My mom even got food delivered.  Hackensack hospital, thank you for doing such a great job, what an improvement from a few years ago.  Hospital from home was a genius idea!  We absolutely thank u for allowing us to experience it.  Thank u to all the nurses, Doctors and techs, that made our stay extremely pleasant!

Well, in a few words, the best hospital I have visited in my 24 years in NJ. The quality of care is perfect, especially in the emergency room for children where I have taken my daughters since they were born.  and on the breast care on the 5 floor, where they make me feel cared for, and the treatment is wonderful.  For more than 11 years, I have been in check on my breast in Hackensack. They have made me feel super cared for. Thank you
Dr Brittany Francisco, DO , she is the worth at the children department,  you completely risk your child with her. Not highly recommended,  she discriminated me and my child
They left my 67yro mom in the hallway for 3 days, there’s blood, needles and urine samples just randomly on the floor.
Cardiac Care team. NP Kristina Schmidt, super duper. Very empathetic of my mental state after CABG3 while answering everything I  threw at her.💯
Terrible!  i got an x ray, a tetanus shot and a  splint.  Got a bill for almost 4k.  WTH is going on and how are hospitals allowed to get away with this.  I did not even see a doctor.

My son was in ICU for a week, and the experience was more than satisfied. All the doctors and nurses were friendly and professional.  He was moved to 4th floor, the less intensive unit, today, and everything changed. Only one nurse takes care many patients. So, there are nurse assistants helping the nurse which makes sense. Problem is that they are neither friendly nor professional. They show up after minimum 30 minutes after call, and not kind at all.

I was so impressed with ICU unit staffs whom I would give 5 times 5 stars, but the current experience is very disappointing.

came to this hospital to get seen, was in the ER for hours and hours after getting tests done to find out my diagnosis. The only thing I would say about this ER is very chaotic between patients and coming in to get seen the nurses, and doctors don’t check on you but what ER is not like this. They have you sit in the fastrack area with so many other sick patients next to you for hours until they have a room for you… overall, I was admitted in this hospital for 4 days after finding out my diagnosis but I would say after I was transferred to the ICU then the neurology floor the service and treatment between, the doctors and nurses was amazing. So grateful with the treatment, nurses were caring, and sweet, Thank you ❤️❤️‍🩹🙏🏻

AVOID THIS PLACE! USED to be the gold standard. Now you WILL leave worse than you came in. If you get lucky you will get someone the knows what they are doing or that cares. Those people are getting harder & harder to find. What is wrong with you? Depending on who you talk to you get get a different answer. Then when you see your regular Dr. you will hear something else they never told you. They do not want you to see your medical file at all. They LIE about the privacy policy because they do NOT want you to read it. They will tell you that the acknowledgement of Privacy practices they want signed IS the privacy policy which is a total LIE. I could go on & on. Even nasty cashers at times in the cafe. The bigger they got the worse their  treatment  of patients has become.   ADDENDA - They did that form letter PHONY Follow up reply. I ALREADY TALKED TO PATIENT EXPERIENCE & THEY DIDNT CARE! That is why I left the review in the first place!

I have an ekg that’s two years old that they never explained to me. A possible enlarged heart .. post stroke .. they never told me about it when I recently ask about reading the ekg I was told it was out of date .. no big deal just hypertensive crisis if you’ve see one you’ve seen em all I guess . My heart couldn’t possibly that important . Charts charged 2 years after birthing my son here. I’m terrified of hospitals & nurses now .. not to mention I had Covid for a month which I picked up from working here yet they can’t seem to find me in their system. The systemic racism is strong here … HMUC was so much better .

If you'd like to wait for hours to be admitted as well as never see a doctor once you're admitted, I definitely recommend Hackensack Hospital. I'm sure there are obvious reasons why they were negligent toward me and my grandmother, but we will not be back to find those reasons out.

I have to say i was quite impressed with this hospital. I have been going to Valley for 22 years. I was not happy with Valley hospital in Paramus  after my last visit 2 weeks ago at there brand new hospital. I was laterally assaulted by a doctor in the emergency room after i just had abdominal surgy by an excellent doctor who dose perform all his surgeries at valley hospital. The doctor who addressed me was a delight. I asked her how long she was a doctor because i needed someone who was extremely seasoned in the art of medicine. Dr. Hephziba Yohannan is a true gem. She literally held my hand the entire time and reassured me that everything was going to be ok. She ordered a number of tests and found out what was wrong with me with out causing more harm to me. The only thing I wish Hackensack had was more rooms to put patients as i did have to wait by the nurses station the entire time. Who know maybe they wanted me there so that they could watch me at all time. I also have to say the nurse that helped me knew her stuff. she explained to me that the veins roll and it can be hard to get a good one. On her second try she captured one. My nurse was also very attentive and was always available when i needed her. I was very impressed with the staff from check in to check out. thank you so much. If defiantly recommend this hospital. They care and listen to the patients and that caught my attention.

My mother went in for a Watchman operation and they lost her dentures. I notified them before her discharge and promptly contacted security/lost n found within days. After 2 1/2 months of  non contact unless iniated by me, i finally got something in writing stating they're not responsible.They misplaced her dentures,  put the onus on us to prove it and the final insult was to deny compensation and force the expense of new dentures.  Truly a class act.Patient Experience leaves a lot to be desired. I'd recommend another hospital.
