I was born in Hackensack hospital & so were my kids. This WAS one of the best hospitals. However they are absolutely horrible. I went to the ER room because I had a very infected lump. I got there at 11am and left two days later with no answers. I was left in the hall way for an entire day and at one point the pain got so bad that I was almost screaming. They saw me and didnt do NOTHING! Im not a dramatic person especially in hospitals because I know how busy it can get and the pressure these doctors deal with must be intense. But wow this really gave me PTSD. On day one after making a laceration on the lump to see what came out they said a surgeon will come and see me. Two days passed and I kept asking and they kept just giving me strong pain meds and taking my vitals. The last day I was there a male nurse came into my room and was staring at me and he said “im sorry you are so beautiful” and made me feel super awkward because at this point I was in the observation room and I was kinda questioning if he was even a doctor. Then the next doctor came and did an MRI for NOTHING!!!! Still no answers. At the end that same doctor came back and said that a surgeon hasnt seen me because my case isnt priority. I was so disappointed in the time I had spent here for them to tell me my case isnt priority. I asked to be discharged immediately. It was a HORRIBLE HORRIBLE experience. Im so disappointed in the decline of this hospital. Really gave me PTSD. Never again will I come here. Its really sad. I rather go to palisades hospital mind you they are a much smaller. Im really not one to write bad reviews. They need to do better.

One of the best hospitals around if not the best. Excellent staff very willing to help in any matter any time definitely recommend this hospital. In my opinion this is the number one hospital in North Jersey.

I decided to have my third child at this hospital. My nurse was amazing, but I have to express my disappointment with the treatment I received from the anesthesiologist. I have had an epidural before, and during this experience, someone was supposed to help me but was inexperienced and took longer than usual. When I asked if I could move, the anesthesiologist responded rudely, asking if I needed to go somewhere. They then adjusted my back in a very uncomfortable way, which made the experience quite traumatic. Additionally, I noticed that they are charging me for two nights even though I only spent 24 hours here.

Humc used to be a top notch hospital but this place has severely gone downhill. My husband is very sick. He has very painful mouth and throat ulcers. We finally convinced him to go the emergency room because he cannot eat due to the pain. It turns out he also has the flu and pneumonia in his right lung. He has been in the hallway of the ER since 10:30am yesterday. We have the pharmacist a list of his medications and the nurse came back with all wrong meds. We waited for a EMT consult for over a day and the doctor said he would be right back to examine him left and never came back. They refuse to give him pain medication, even though he is screaming in pain. I feel like we made a huge mistake bringing him to this hospital because I only feel like this is totally for him. He is in constant pain, can’t eat and not a single thing they are doing is making him feel better. The nurses are doing the best they can so I don’t blame them. But this is just an awful way to treat a sick person. I will think twice before ever returning for an emergency situation.
Hackensack hospitals  are not in-network for the blue cross blue shield NJ medical insurance anymore.
We took my mother here after a fall.  The staff was on top of everything and all tests and scans were done quickly. Dr met with us and explained everything they were seeing.   Top notch ER!

Got taken here after getting rear ended by another car while being 6.5 months pregnant. I will say they got me into a trauma area and hooked up very quickly and made sure my vitals were okay and the baby heart beat was there and strong   That’s the only reason to give them 2 stars as to two nurses who worked with me were great. Alexa and Penny introduced themselves and kept me informed. But this hospital is way understaffed. A lot of the nurses are really rude and talk about patients as if they aren’t right in front of them. They fought for my monitor and argued if I should even be on one. Mind you I’m pregnant. I’m guessing one of the senior nurses Josephine walked around here talking about her co workers and patients. With a terrible attitude. Kept referring to me as the lady in the corner and why am I still there to move me so she can have the monitor. It wasn’t a great experience at all. I’m happy they took care of me quickly to get me on a monitor but then they all forgot about me. Honestly besides RN Alexa, my experience would have been hell on earth. No one communicates with you here and I just felt a lot of their conversations were completely unprofessional. After hours not anyone from the OB department coming down to see me. I chose to discharge myself and head to my hospital back in New York to be seen there.

Horrible experience at this hospital. I waited patiently for 18 hours while the doctors had no idea what to diagnose my daughter with. They mentioned it could possibly be appendicitis but didn’t seem too concerned, even though her appendix was enlarged and borderline concerning. As a parent, I needed answers and reassurance about my daughter’s health, but after all those hours, I left without either.

We didn’t complain despite not having food or drinks for hours. After being told my daughter could eat, the nurses promised to bring something but never did. It took hours just to get approval for a CT scan, and even after that, we waited by the CT room door for hours without being seen. The lack of communication and compassion was appalling.

To make matters worse, the nurses were changed repeatedly—far more than what shift rotations would normally require. I had no idea who was responsible for my daughter’s care, and when I asked, no one gave me a clear answer. Instead, they claimed they were “helping each other,” which clearly wasn’t the case. When I voiced my frustration about being left in a hallway with my daughter in pain, I was met with nasty attitudes, backlash, and no accountability.

I understand there are more severe cases, but at what point does my daughter’s pain and health become a priority? The lack of organization, professionalism, and basic patient care was evident. I’ve worked in the medical field for many years, and it’s heartbreaking to see how unorganized and dismissive this hospital has become. It felt more like a fast-food chain than a medical facility.

While I searched for help, I saw nurses laughing, chatting, and some on their phones, completely ignoring patients in need. Where is the patient care? Where is the compassion?

I am praying for my daughter’s health and that she recovers without complications. If anything happens to her, it will be due to the negligence of this hospital’s pediatric ER. This was a total disgrace, and I will never return.

Hackensack was the WORST experience I ever had at a hospital … I won’t take away from the few nurses who were kind and helpful …..

I had gotten there at 2:30 in the afternoon with my sister from a car accident we were just in .. ambulance took us there to there “fast track “ area which was not that at all !!!

After waiting in “fast track “ waiting area we saw a DR. Scheduled some tests ….. shift changed happened and a nurse practitioner had taken over …remained in the hallway for hrs …. With promise of an observation room that was ready …. Never went into an observation room at all .. had to go to the front a numerous amount of times to ask for the results to be told each and every time they were not ready. At one point, a nurse came to administer meds. I had asked that nurse in regards to the test results. He then stated that he saw in the computer, they were ready and the doctor would come and speak to us ..(this point it is 10 pm) two hours later nobody came by yet again. Went to the front again to ask more questions and to remind them that we have been here since 2:30 in the afternoon and as of right now, it was 11:30 PM still waiting for  results. Went to the front again stating to be discharged then at 12:30 am a physicians assistant said all was good pretty much . Discharge paperwork stated I was in an observation room which I never was in . I was in the fast track “ hallway the entire time …and after the pa said all was good … my discharge paperwork stated otherwise

I do not recommend Hackensack hospital to anyone !!!!!! Worst experience ever !!!!!

I am in the emergency room can't move my legs had a few seizures talked to a psychiatrist they never told hom I had a small tumor I'm my brain they are discharging me I can't walk how do I get home and walk I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

I usually don't post negative reviews, but when it comes to my family, I am pissed off. Hackensack Hospital has great treatment and services, as long as you are gonna stay alive because you are a cash cow for the health industry, but as soon as you are a hospice care patient and they can't take any more money out of your insurance, they throw to a corner like a garbage.

My mother in law is a cancer patient, and she had great care in a great and nice part of the hospital, but as soon as we were told that she had to have her breathing tube removed, not even 12 hrs later, she was thrown out and transfered to the most depressing room/area in the hospital to spend the last few hrs or days of her life and that is bs. No family should have to see their loved ones die in a depressing room like if they are in a basement with trash.
I took my aunt there I have no complaints excellent Doctors nurses and staff

Maternal Fetal Medicine department

I am giving a one star because of the unprofessionalism of one of their recepcionist (Katherine) she was very rude and not welcoming at all!! She's the one who answers the phone and is the first face you see, you would expect better customer service especially when you are paying for the service. Unfortunately she gives the department a bad look and it's unfair to the rest specially in a place that isn't cheap and you spend a LOT OF MONEY!!!!
Everyone is so friendly

I had an excellent experience at the Hackensack Meridian emergency room thanks to Dr Ullo and Dr Lee. I was in unbearable pain due to what I later discovered was a very large kidney stone. Dr. Lee took excellent care of me, diagnosed me quickly, and I had treatment the next day. The nurse staff, including Nicole and Renee, were incredibly thorough and supportive as well!!
Perfect service very professional people

My grandmother had to visit the emergency room recently, and we were fortunate to be cared for by nurse Evelina. She was incredibly kind, patient, and attentive throughout our time there. Evelina took the time to explain everything clearly, making sure my grandmother was comfortable and understood what was happening. Her compassion and professionalism truly stood out, and we’re so grateful for her care during a stressful time. Thank you nurse Evelina for being so caring and compassionate!!!

I Recently visited this hospital due to my partner being in a car accident and being rushed to the emergency room by ambulance. Visiting this emergency room (Morning Shift) was one of the WORST experiences I ever had in my life. Once I arrived at the hospital I gave the (Emergency room, front desk) the patient name and told them I was their partner and here to pick them up. I further more told them who my employer was and that I need a letter stating I was there to pick them up. They denied my request and I asked to speak to a Manager in charger. The two ladies at the front desk gave two different names and when one of the ladies was about to call someone she knew could help me. The other lady with blonde hair told her no and to call someone else (I believe she was the desk supervisor in charge). Michelle D (The person in charge) approach me and said “What’s the Problem”. I explained the situation and told her how I had to leave work to come pick up my partner and if she need proof I can call I just need a letter stating I was present and she stated she’s not putting my name on a letter to use the patient discharge papers. I told her my job won’t accept that because it doesn’t have my name on it. I asked her why and stated I wasn’t violating any hippa laws, rules or regulations, or any work Laws she then told me she’s not putting my name on a letter and then proceeded to call security, Michelle D. Was very aggressive and dismissing. She told security she wasn’t providing any information and that they can escort me out. (MICHELLE D. The supervisor in charge) and when I asked to speak to somebody above her she said there is nobody. I would never visit or recommend any person of color to visit this hospital.

Furthermore As I read the discharge papers, my partner informed them of multiple body parts that hurt and from the looks of it they only inspected one part of their body nothing else.
This is completely unacceptable and i am very disappointed and the service this hospital provided us.

To me it seems as though they do what they want to do with the patients that’s being rushed to the emergency room and when family members come they don’t accommodate work information. This was my first and my last time ever visiting this hospital and my person opinion this is not an African American friendly Emergency Room.

In the ER. Nurse Sophia comes in at 8:45 pm. Oders my meds for me. Supervisor winter's... is I'm guessing the floor dr. I'm wating 2 hrs for someone too attend too me. So I had to get up myself to empty my urinal cause I had to go. Again being ignored.  So I fell to the floor. They come and pick me up put me back in the bed. There excuse was someone was dying. Ok I get it but it takes THE WHOLE ER FOR 1 PERSON?. 1 PERSON. May that person R.I.P. But what about the rest of the people in the ER??? Dam shame.

Don’t bother making an appointment here as they do not answer the phone or check their voicemail. They canceled my appointment after calling me and I returned their calls and left voicemails and received no response. When I showed up my appointment was canceled despite receiving automated emails. Their policies are ineffective and inconvenient.

This hospital could have gone 5 stars if it wasn’t for my mother’s missing rope and slippers ( soft beige fluffy robe) and beige tan (animal print non skid slippers).  I called patient experience and no reply back on reimbursement.  The hospital on 3 link North is dirty I had to clean the walls, some of the nurses don’t clean after themselves.   My mom even received a bed sore.  I seen the nurses just sit around and talking and loud.  The medical assistant Jenna was great!!!
The social worker Mark was excellent because of him I got my mom out of there.
Dr. Elmann is the Best surgeon! The Nurses in ICU were great Especially Salma and Daniel and keep up the good work!👍👍

I arrived to the emergency room yesterday, January 4th at approximately 4:00 pm.. the emergency room was super packed when I came in with severe abdominal pain. They took my vitals right away and asked me to go sit and wait.. I was crying from severe pain and they took me into the ER after about 20 minutes.. inside the ER there were beds all over the hallways and I was placed in section D on a bed in the hallway myself. I was evaluated by a doctor and they sent me for a CAT Scan, blood work and urine test.. they were very busy so this didn’t happen right away.. the nurse assigned to me came and put a port in my left arm by the bend of the elbow and from there she withdrew the blood and they game me Tylenol for the pain.. that didn’t help at all.. my husband had to wheel me around in a wheelchair to go to the restroom which was in a different section from where I was, because the pain is much more severe when I get up and I can’t walk. Every time a room became available it was given to someone else. After a few hours in the ER they finally took me to get my CAT scan. After the shift change a new doctor came and he prescribed Morphine for the pain and that helped me immediately..night fall came and patients came and left. Some were discharged and others were placed in a room but not me.. I spent the entire night between patients screaming, machines beeping, people talking and all kinds of noises, my pain, my anxiety and frustration.. a group of surgeons came to see me and they told me they couldn’t see anything wrong with me in the CAT scan but that they would continue to look and see what could be causing such excruciating pain. Early in the morning the nurse came and told me I was going to be transported to the “holding section A” to be monitored. Someone from that section came to tell me that they were going transferred me to the “holding section to be monitored. After a couple of hours I was finally transported to section A where I have been in a bed in the hallway ever since. It’s been over 24 hours since I came to the emergency room.. I still feel exactly as I did when I came in except when I get the pain meds the pain is minimal as long as I don’t stand up to go to the bathroom., many rooms have become available but they tell me they are not for me. They leave them available in case a patient sicker than me comes in.. as a matter of fact I am the only one left in the hallway because my illness is not considered “severe or serious enough” to merit a room.. I have never felt so discriminated, hurt, frustrated and as a second class citizen on top of feeling extremely vulnerable, scared, frustrated and in so much pain… why don’t I leave and or request a transfer to another hospital?? Because I’m in so much pain I can’t handle moving and starting from scratch in another hospital where I don’t know how I’m going to be treated. But rest assured I will call my insurance company and I will make sure they know not to pay for a room I never got and I will never come back to this hospital if I can help it!!!! DO NOT COME TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM IN THIS HOSPITAL!!!!!!!!!

The front desk woman was rude (as I'm terrified out of my mind btw, has the nerve to cop an attitude). Then my doctor (Megan Winters) actually suggests I have ADHD. I'm crying, heart rate sky high, telling her my symptoms and this is her response. They wouldn't let me keep my mask on in a crowded room, Absolutely disgusting, if you can go anywhere else, please do.
My daughter was born here and me to i love the decor
It’s sad to be here with my 93 year old dad sitting for 8 hours and still waiting for ultra sound of his ankle for blood clot.  Then they tell us cat scan needed in addition!    Such BS.

Absolutely the worst experience in my life I literally left this hospital in tears. I came into the hospital PREGNANT, bleeding through my clothes with cramping they left me in the waiting room, NO SENSE OF URGENCY WHAT SO EVER. They check my vitals nurse tells me my blood pressure is extremely high again no urgency they move me to a hallway area with multiple people tell me I have to be alone my sister couldn’t come in with me, I’m sitting there for an hour and half crying scared in pain and bleeding so much, I get up and find A WOMAN doctor and explain what is happening this woman looks me in my eyes with no empathy at all and says “oh sorry your gonna have to wait “ and leaves me standing there. Literally going through one of the most traumatic experiences of my life and not one person cared that I was sitting there crying the entire time. I took my stuff and left as i’m walking out the SECURITY GUARD has the audacity to tell me that how i could i leave without telling anyone my name because “its the professional thing to do” I left and went to another hospital where thank god they helped me and my baby. DO NOT GO HERE. BIGGEST MISTAKE OF MY LIFE.

This is the worst medical service i have ever witnessed across 4 continents. Even in 3rd world countries healtcare is way better.

Firstly, appointments are a nightmare. Secondly, the physician downplayed my severe condition seriously affecting my quality of life and compromising my job as a healthcare professional myself.

Thirdly, I have been waiting for more than 2 weeks to receive an endoscopy appointment to no avail eventhough i complained to him that i came to this hospital only because the first Gastro i met with in November scheduled my Endoscopy in February hoping that in Hackensack i would receive faster service.

2/10 rating would be fair from a healthcare professional. But the problem is not you, it's the complacent voters and politicians accepting such indignity and unaccountability.
I was born here like numerous other people, and I can happily say that I’ve always loved this specific hospital, it brings back many memories.
This is an amazing place. It is overcrowded and you can’t get a room for the ER, but they are SO thorough. They treat you like a real patient. It took 7.5 hours, but it was amazing treatment.

If you don’t lose your life or a loved one due to the lack of urgency; you will definitely lose your hope for human kind. I was sent by my doctor a few months ago with high blood pressure- which in the eyes of many is cause to be immediately registered and at minimum connected to machines to ensure your ok; but no - after waiting hours - they connected me to an IV - handed my the IV bag - and told me to go back to the waiting room - I had to ask for a covid test after they didn’t initiate the procedure themselves and having high risk family members it’s something that is important to me - they asked for a urine  sample and after navigating to the bathroom with patients sitting along the entire hallways - I was into a bathroom that was a risk within itself - I don’t blame whoever decided to take their own IV out in the bathroom - because the lack of care and simple human softness causes desperation….but the wall and light switch  was splattered  with blood and blood all over the floor…….. after that I’ve decided to not go back there……. Unfortunately my mother was sent there a few months later - (not knowing better) her doctor was going to call the ambulance due to pre-stroke symptoms …….. she was left in the waiting  room because according to the very insensitive cold blooded registration nurse who said to me “she’s sitting there because she isn’t having a stroke right now” …….. after seeing her cold blooded response and body language which was completely unprofessional I asked her “if this was your mom what would you do” she continued to make it worse by saying “she isn’t having one”……. Yet 2 ekgs were done at her general doctor that were shown to them showing irregularities……… a simple “I understand “  would’ve made things much better ———- but looking at her so insensitivity managing our families situation I couldn’t even look at her …….. blonde -glasses - registration nurse in Emergency room triage 12/27 -5pm ———— I hope you never feel so helpless and I hope no loved one of yours or even you get treated this way. I hope God touches you and softens that marbled heart. I understand it’s the holidays and everyone is sick -and you might have worked 50 hours the last two days but - you signed up for this !! Not me !! but bed side manner and compassion should be the first thing you serve. Unless I am completely unconscious and am driven there involuntarily I pray to never have to be in the hospital or any of my loved one’s again …… we will deter and choose to drive out further for some human compassion - a sense of urgency ; and look for a hospital and people that will be more compassionate when your having a love threatening episode. My mother did not go in there with Viral symptoms or Covid symptoms - she was there with stroke symptoms and ekgs from her general doctor that was going to call the ambulance for her. So nurse - to you —- “do better” and to the Hackensack University Medical Center - credentials shouldn’t be the only thing you hire by -bed side manner, compassion and empathy should be included. If there was a zero start I would give that- Love, light and health to you all . And happy new year.

I went to visit my aunt at Hackensack hospital.  Some receptionist have name tags , some don't. So I don't know her name.  The person who helped us ,was in a bad mood . Snooty , mean looking.  I am there to visit a sick person . I don't need to have someone with bad attitude.  The hospital should training them  better.

Today, December 25, 2024, I took my wife to the emergency room at Hackensack University Hospital, in Hackensack New Jersey, it is a shame that this renowned hospital has personnel working with such a low level of patient treatment, they had my wife for 3 hours 30 min. to give him a pill ordered by the doctor, for a fever and severe headache, terrible treatment from the nurse, Mary S. and Kayla Hunans, terrible treatment of the patient and inhumane pushiness, my 5-year-old son, sick with the flu I had to expose him to the cold, because I had no one to leave him with, he saw when the security man asked me if I had a weapon and my son stood in front so they could also search him, for one pill three hours and a half and they still didn't know where the medicine was, I have had experiences in hospitals but this was the worst of all, never again to this so-called "hospital"

Went for CT scan this week at HUMC Hackensack ground floor office.
Nurse Amanda G. communicated & explained in details each steps very well about the procedure/ med being taken. She was friendly & full of confidence about her work involved. Good IV skills & good reports with patients.Good job.
Technician Joe, was professional, polite, friendly & explained each stage of scan very well. Joe make sure that  I am  at ease & comfortable during scanning period.
Good job.

By far the worse hospital, I would have preferred to go to Clara mass! DO NOT RECOMMEND! Please find a better hospital you’ll probably die in the hallway waiting to get treated before you even get treated, sad to say! I had to sign myself out before I ended up being one of those people!

Absolutely garbage customer service from secretaries that work the phones for pain management. They were disrespectful on the phone. Then, they have the audacity to not even listen to my point of view when I attempted to explain what they did. I would rather die of not getting care than to deal with the staff on the phones.

This Hospital is so terrible , my sister got treated and she literally got hurt in their care after they “discharged her” causing her to get injured even more . I asked for a medical excuse for her work and they put on the medical excuse that she was able to return to work the NEXT day . WHEN THE DOCTOR SPECIFICALLY SAID THAT IN HER SITUATION SHE WAS GOING TO NEED TIL MONDAY TO GO BACK TO WORK. I tried calling to see if we can get the medical excuse note right fully FIXED and they denied it and would not let me get the doctors medical excuse thru VIA email . This whole experience  was extremely unprofessional and there is no help involved when u actually need it . I NEEED THAT MEDICAL EXCUSE for her own SAFETY AND THEY DENIED IT !!!! I will be taking further actions if this isn’t resolved soon.

I will be pressing charges... i came to tye emergency room not being able to breath.... i tested positive for covid at home. Came to tye emergency toom vitals showed oxygen in tye high 80s to low 90s..... i asked the lady when i can come in she said she didnt know... ajd i asked a second time she disrespectfully told me i gopd to leave ig i wanted... the walk back to my car was horrible i almost passed out... on my way yo saint joseph hospital will never come back here and im getting q lawyer
The care in the Emergency Room is terrible.

Dr Zimmer and his staff at the wound care center there are very unfriendly. His secretary is a name I’m not allowed to use and they will cancel if you’re 15 minutes late but make sure you wait 40 minutes. Aside they won’t give you painkillers for painful procedures. This department is a joke in the making

My son was denied entry because I transported him in my van instead of an ambulance, which would have frightened him. He had a dental appointment.  I called ahead and spoke to 2 people to see if it was permitted    They said yes.   Very dissatisfied

My sister was treated for cancer in this terrible please, they removed the tumor which and left cancerous cells inside and they don’t use radiation, the cancer got agresive and my sister today is in the cemetery. Wrong treatment. The nurses were not compassionate, they want to give medicine to my sister that she didn’t need just to make money.I wander who give 5 stars to this place. I wander how much they pay to have the award  for be best hospital in NJ.when my sister passed, my nephew screamed for help, he was desperate seeing his mother passing, in Steve of came for help they called the security to my nephew , ( not compassion ) I compare with Moffitt cancer Center in Tampa Fl HACKENSACK Hospital is no good.Be vary careful what cain of treatment they will perform to you and have a second opinion in some place else. In that hospital you go in walking and you come out dead and  broke.
Believe me St. Joseph is much better in some areas, Nurses were great specially SYDNEY KOBB in women maternity dept. She did awesome job with my wife

They take over 4+ hours so clear your schedule even if you’re experiencing something so small they will take forever even getting a note took over 10 mins ! Ridiculous!! I came here multiple times for the same problem and no one can tell me what’s going on. Not very sanitary at all and I watched a nurse through away used needles etc in a bag strictly for clothing. Will not be back here at all.

First and last time I visited this hospital my son had a surgery and we stayed 1 night enough not to want to return, I had to be looking for the nurse to give my son the medicines if not they brought it when they could not count that I was waiting more than 2 hours from the moment they tell me that we are going home for the papers because the doctor had not signed.
Doctors and nurses are excellent!

This place is absolutely terrible bad staff absolutely unprofessional staff, my mother went there stayed in the hospital for 5 hours and them Dumb little staff didn’t do anything to help my mother with my poor sick baby sister. Yes I am this mad cause this is outrageous, because instead of helping my mother with my sick baby sister staff argue instead like do better!!!!

Horrible experience while in the hospital and then once discharged the billing and the rude people that won't try to help you but write absolute lies in the notes of what was discussed during the conversation to cover their asses for not doing their job. To top it off they put people in collections for a copay while people try to recover from serious injuries and unable to work for months but still making large monthly payments. That is after the insurance paid 100% for the services. Won't even describe the entire process cause it's pointless to stress over it. Will never EVER  again receive services from this hospital...Being there once was more than enough for me!!!!! Unfortunately the ambulance took me there, had no choice. This hospital does not care about the quality care a patient deserves. It's more about profit.
The CT staff is the WORST Waited outside the CT staff for my mom for over 3 hours while the whole staff inside was talking and laughing (could hear them in the hallway). Ridiculous.

I have nothing but good things to say about Hackensack University. My daughter Ashlee was in the hospital for 70 days. 50 of them she was in a Coma on the Critical Care floor. My daughter wasn't expected to live she was very very ill, she's 22 with terminal cancer and she was admitted with a pneumonia and septic. These doctors didn't ever give up on my daughter. She fought so hard and they got her though 60 days. My daughter's body shut down for 3 months straight these people keep her alive. This isn't a act of god these doctors are AMAZING they gave her and me more time with together. I'll never forget the staff. They became friends in my head during this hard time. They are very caring. 60+ days I've meet about 100+ workers and never really had an issue with anyone. They helped me get though this also, if it wasn't for some of the staff I don't know if I would be OK today. The case management on the CCU and ICU floor are very very nice people they are very caring women. Thank you for saving my daughters life.

9 out of 10. Medical professionals are engaged with patients and their care givers. Nursing staff is patient, caring, professional. Support teams- custodial, cafeteria, reception, valet are all courteous, friendly, very professional.

**Absolutely Horrendous Experience!**

I can’t stress this enough: avoid this hospital if you value your sanity! They treat patients like they’re an afterthought, cramming them into hallways on stretchers—something you wouldn’t even see in the worst third-world facilities.

The staff is shockingly incompetent and utterly disorganized. They reserved a room for my mother, only to forget about it and hand it off to someone else. When we arrived for her gland stone issue, it took an excruciating **three hours** for them to administer pain relief. The suffering she endured was unbearable.

After spending **six long hours** in the ER hallway, she was finally moved to an observation area—guess what? Another hallway! The only change was being transferred from a stretcher to a so-called hospital bed. It feels like a scheme to inflate charges to insurance companies.

This place is a nightmare. We will never return, and I urge everyone to think twice before coming here!

I had to go to the emergency room on Monday night
Pros - doctors and nurses were very nice, respectful, listened and was very thorough and friendly. The hospital was clean.
Con - Short staff. I was there at around 8:15pm and didn’t leave until after 2am. there was a lot of waiting especially when you are not feeling well it’s not an ideal situation to have to wait long hours and wait alone.
Overall besides the wait times i would recommend coming here if you have an emergency due to the care I received.

I had a difficult experience at Hackensack hospital while my mom was there for a month. The stress of her illness was worsened by the attitude of some nurses, who were not as compassionate as we hoped. It's crucial for caregivers to show empathy, especially during such tough times. I hope they can improve in this area for future patients.
A lot of unprofessional people

The hospital itself is very clean and the doctor we visit is one of the best, every time we have to see the doctor we need to do X-ray first, very simple X-ray of the arm, 2 images max., the hospital charges the insurance $523 for the service, it has been 3 times as yet doing the X-ray at the hospital till I noticed how much they charge the insurance for the service, called the hospital and they confirmed that is how they charge for the X-ray and nothing wrong about the bill, I decided to do the X-ray a lot cheaper somewhere else next time.
I received  great.care at Hackensack  Medical center. The staff are professional, kind and prompt. It made my hospital stay more comfortable.
I thought that things would be different. Different Staff and All and Yet, Guest Services Is Once Again.. Outstanding and Professional.Dera and Josie, are too Niiice.

This Hospital Is Awesome !! This Is The 1st Hospital That I've come To That Has Employees All Over That's Very Hospitable !! From The Valet To Guest Services !! Thank You All For Being Professional and Patient With Us, Although some of us are NOT as nice to you All. Thanks Again !! You Guy's Rock !!
From Provider to provider, our experience was very unpleasant ; spoke to one of the medical staff Rep. and he was so rude. Unbelievable.

I recently had an experience at Hackensack University Medical Center pulmonary, and I feel compelled to share my thoughts.

While the facility itself is clean and well-maintained, my concerns primarily revolve around the quality of care my mother received during her stay. Unfortunately, we felt that the staff was not as attentive or compassionate as we had hoped. There were instances where communication was lacking, and it took longer than expected to address our questions and concerns.

On a positive note, some nurses did show genuine care and went above and beyond to assist us. However, this inconsistency made the overall experience quite stressful during an already challenging time.

I hope that the management takes steps to improve staff training and communication, as I believe that with some adjustments, Hackensack medical Center could provide a much better experience for patients and their families.

Thank you for considering my feedback.

---

If I could give Hackensack University Medical Center zero stars, I would! The staff is horrible I literally catch one of the nurses yelling at my mother while she is in horrible situation already.
And when I went to talk to them and ask what’s going on they ended up kicking me out like what they said ohh your too emotional right now and we think you should go home instead fixing the problem and looking into it no the rather to keep what there doing I don’t think this is not okay at all and it’s horrible place.
Once again horrible experience. Book an appointment and and hour and half later still waiting.... it's all about let's get the money
Staff, surgeons, nurses, and Valet attendants , excellent service from each and every one
A Shout out to michelle" Megan, gina kidney transplant department"👍

I didn’t feel the need to write a review until today. I didn’t realize what a great hospital it  was until I was forced to go to another hospital. My father was taken by ambulance to John Hopkins Bayview despite us asking for him to be transported to Orleans street for care. At the Orleans street hospital the nurses and doctors were constantly in the room explaining what was going on with my father’s care. My father is bedridden and needs to be cleaned regularly and repositioned regularly. He was always clean and never once got a sore or even any redness after his two week stay. The hospital allows for a family member to stay the night with the patient and even has a family room with a refrigerator, ice machine and vending. The nurses are so friendly and always willing to help. Fast forward to his stay at Bayview. The complete opposite. He sat 32 hours in the ER waiting to get a bed to be admitted. He has a terrible pressure wound and another wound on his inside thigh from them putting an adult diaper on too tight. The nurses are rude. Every morning this week he has been soiled through the pads, all the bed sheets and covers and his gown. I asked to speak to the charge nurse, she never came. His room is full of medical trash laying on the floor. No where for a family member to sleep. My father has called us in the middle of the night to tell us he is soaked and he’s been pushing the call button for an hour and no one is coming. We have called and no one answered or they answer and say they will have the nurse call and then never return the call. I can go on and on.
Thank you Hopkins Orleans for providing exceptional care to your patients   But don’t ever go to the Bayview campus!
Is there a way to give more than five stars ? This hospital deserves it! This is the absolute best hospital in the whole United States!

I stayed with my sister at the Hospital following neurological brain surgery.  I couldn’t have been more impressed with the staff at the Hospital.  They were attentive, caring and thorough.   As a “guest” of the patient they were helpful and friendly and made sure that we were both as comfortable as possible.  I would always recommend having an advocate stay with a patient, and yet with this team it didn’t feel quite as necessary as other experiences.

My wife had a fever at 2am and called the doctor on call at JH. His suggestion was to go to the emergency room. We arrived at Johns Hopkins at 3am and sat in the waiting room until 7:30am. It is now 1pm and she is being discharged with no treatment.

My wife and I just had our baby here 2 weeks ago and the staff was so awesome. She had some complications during her c section and Dr. Vaught walked in like a dang superhero. The nurses, especially Nurse Aubrey, was so kind she even stopped by to visit us even though we weren't on her shift. Excellent staff. Thank you all!

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. I was treated with respect from the moment I walked through the door. I needed surgery in the Neuro department and spent a little over a week in the hospital. Every single staff member was caring, kind, compassionate, and professional. From the doctors all the way down to the janitors. If I need hospital care in the future I will definitely be returning to Hopkins. Seriously, I can’t say enough about how incredible the employees were.

They call and say my dad needs to come up here and be admitted for the 2nd time -because they can't figure out the correct meds after a liver transplant- they called at 11am, we arrived at 4:30 (We are long distance from thus hospital) they dont have a room ready.....seriously?!?! 5 and a half hours and yall couldnt get a room ready knowing you had an admission???? And then when I said something about why we have already waited the better part of an hour the clerk at admissions wanna get smart out of his mouth "it takes as long as it takes". When you come in off the bridge connected to the garage, the ladies at the info desk just keep talking amongst themselves and blatantly ignoring people who need to check in. This hospital is supposed to be of the best- IT IS NOT. They claim they try to make it as easy as possible and I claim thats a complete lie.

We had a wonderful surgeon, Dr Yang. His entire staff was most supportive and professional. Indeed everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. My biggest criticism is the PARKING, a real nightmare. After driving hours to receive excellent care the last thing you want to face is “black hole of Calcutta “ parking garage.
The staff is rude and don’t know how to speak to people. Not only that I sat in a waiting room from 11-6 in the morning and wasn’t seen.

Saved my brothers life. Top notch medical center for cutting edge research and medicine.  Cannot say enough positive things about all your organization does to improve the life of all by also training expert world renowned physicians.
Worst hospital ever worst dialysis clinic in the country

recently spent eight days at Johns Hopkins Hospital, and I can honestly say it was the most exceptional hospital experience I’ve ever had. From the moment I arrived until the day I was discharged, every single person I encountered—nurses, technicians, and all staff—treated me with the utmost respect, compassion, and professionalism.

What stood out the most was how attentive and caring the entire team was. They consistently checked in on me, explained everything thoroughly, and made sure I was comfortable and informed every step of the way. It didn’t matter what department they were from—every staff member carried the same positive energy and commitment to patient care.

I’ve had experiences at other hospitals, including Meritus and Mercy, and there is truly no comparison. Johns Hopkins goes above and beyond. They set the gold standard in healthcare, and I would highly recommend them to anyone in need of serious medical care.

Great Motility specialist. Great nurses. Very unsafe and crowded ERs. Doctors do not listen to patients. Be wary of dog whistle words and possible bias. Bring an advocate.

Make sure the staff reads all allergies. I was given a chemical burn/rash reaction in June’25 bc ED staff failed to do so.
ERRORS CAUSING HEALTH-RELATED HARM. Misdiagnosis, incorrect treatment, surgical errors. Negligent doctors!

Incompetent and Negligent care at MICU and NCCU. NEGLIGENCE DURING TREATMENT. LACK OF QUALITY CARE AND ATTENTION. GIVING UNNECESSARY MEDICATIONS. POORLY EXECUTED SURGICAL PROCEDURES. DENYING PATIENTS NECESSARY TREATMENT

I am complaining about the nurse supervisor on Myah 9 floor. I called concerned about a friend of mines that called me crying and complaining that he had not received dinner or breakfast. He also complained that he could not get anyone to give him a blanket. He told me that the nurse constantly threating him that she was going to call security. I was on the phone with him and I heard her myself. She was very rude and condescending. The hospital is known for being very prestigious around the world and they definitely don't need staff like that to make people think otherwise. I will definitely be writing a complaint to the president of the hospital.

Recently I was in the emergency room with my son dealing with Crohn’s disease pain for 8 hours, they told me they were waiting to put him in a room and around 10 pm they called him in just to leave him in the hallway. In that same hallway I saw that they had room’s available still leaving my son in pain in a hallway like nothing. I then still waited 3 more hours in that hallway with my son with no one paying attention or even glancing his way to help in till I started complaining to the staff that they then wanted to show interest in him for just a bit then 6 more hours in the same hallway they send him home without sending his pain medication to our pharmacy just letting him leave in pain. Overall the worst experience I had!

Years ago I saw a doctor at John Hopkins.  He was rude and arrogant, but he also didn't get the diagnosis correct. This happens and he was a sample of 1.  Doctor's are human - medicine isn't perfect, and so I didn't hold it against the hospital.  About 4-5 years ago, I went to a different department.  Over the doctor's objection, the scheduler's sent me to Bayview, which cost significantly more and delayed the procedure.  They did not inform me of the extra time or cost.  My doctor even asked why I went to Bayview when she saw me.

When I challenged the extra cost and explained that my doctor wanted me to go to Howard county, which would have been cheaper and faster, they refused to take the "facility fee" off my bill.  I had an attorney argue the case for me and finally the bill appeared to be settled to my satisfaction.  Four years later (today), they sent me to collections.  Even now, if I go to JHU's billing, I don't see the offending fee and my bill looks zero'd out as it has for the last four years.  I don't know if they are incompetent or malicious.

For me the critical thing is that they delayed my care over my doctor's order and then attempted to charge me more for their role in the delay in providing me treatment.  The fact that they appear to have sent me to collections 4 years later for a zero balance bill is just the icing on the cake.

Edit: I have called this number three times.  I end up in a voicemail box that is not set up.  I've called what I thought was the main patient relations number and they informed me that there is no way to talk to patient relations for the entire John Hopkins network unless you go through the individual Bayview patient relations first.  So, because Bayview patient relations doesn't have a voicemail box, you can't get to anyone higher up that has any authority to fix these issues.  Very convenient.
I am very impressed with the people I encountered today at the hospital Everyone is polite and willing to help. Thank you!
Awesome so cool 😎 thank you for sharing and caring

I’m pregnant and told them there’s a possibility that I’m having a miscarriage. They had me in the emergency room for hours. I went to the 8th floor where the pregnant woman go and they denied me. I went to my gynecologist on the 6th floor and they denied me again. They said no walk-ins. I asked the lady at the desk if I can get prenatal care, and she gave me a card in my hand instead of making me an appointment. I’m sitting here crying.

They have the best Maternity and postpartum services. The staff is very nice with a good smile on their face. They will answer all your questions and the Nurses are too kind. We have delivered baby here and we are v satisfied with the hospitality, housekeeping, staff behavior and administration. Specially nurse Tia ( I hope I wrote her name right). 99% postpartum staff is excellent

Today was my first time in this hospital. My friends just had a baby girl and I was in a panic when I parked because I knew it would be a maze.  I walk it and I’m immediately greeted and given directions to the gift shop and Bloomberg. On the way, with my map in hand, I get lost. I was lost for 30 seconds before Paula asked me if I needed assistance. Paula walked me To the gift shop. The first one was closed so we walked To the other gift shop. I have anxiety issues and really didn’t need to be lost today.  To say I was grateful is an understatement. She explained that she was a doctor In the kids ER and she was on her break and needed to walk.  For her to walk me to where I needed to go…I’m forever grateful. I give 100% At work and it’s nice to see that John Hopkins’ employees do same. The security guard in Zayed prior to getting to the rooms.. she was kind and wonderful as well. 10/10 experience.
Liver Transplant Medication.

John hopkins is a horrible hospital.  I will never go back here to Do Anything... Theyre all about money and not actually helping paitents.. imgaine losing your job right after a procedure  and trying to get financial assistance only to be told you can't get help because your taking care of yourself?! All the while they send the bill to collections while your in the process of get the financial assistance.. Nothing in life is guaranteed but John hopkins Financial assistance is a SCAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sadly I've had to be here to visit many times, but not sadly because of the hospital though that's for sure. Their staff is so tactful and kind its unreal. They are good at handling sensitive experiences and seem to love involving family with their treatment. The nurses and doctors offer their compassion when they can and will go out of their way for you whenever possible. Understand that sometimes they have a lot to deal with at the time and physically can't do everything for you at the drop of a hat but they sure try and whenever they have an opportunity they are sure to make sure you are being cared for. Thank-you for everything you do.

I would like to sincerely thank Dr. Emily Li, our Anesthesiologist, and the entire Oculoplastic Surgery and Nursing Team at Johns Hopkins Hospital for the exceptional care they provided during my father's eyelid surgery.

From the surgery preparation to post-operative recovery, every member of the team demonstrated outstanding professionalism, compassion, and attention to detail.

Special thanks to our anesthesiologist, whose care and reassurance brought great peace of mind during a very sensitive time for our family.

We are deeply grateful for the expertise and kindness shown throughout this experience.

Thank you for your incredible work and dedication!

I loved this hospital back in 2006 , my son was a patient here and passed , they treated him very good. Now here it is 2025 i come here for prenatal care,/ delivered my son here by c-section. OB team is great loved them all they did great by me . But my over all experience with some of the staff mainly dietary , which is a reason i will never come back nor recommend this hospital to anyone. The lady who answers the phone is very nasty and rude to patients who call to order their food like us patients need any type of negative attitude when we dealing and focusing on the health issues we got going on already. She’s mean for no reason and to have someone like that representing your dietary team speaks a lot about the hospital it self . I was known as Mrs pittman when i use to come here with my son Rashad Pittman before he passed. I will never come back here after my son is well enough to go home. Let’s talk about postpartum unit 8th floor. I was treated horribly, i had a c- section done and gotten staples, you talking about pain, when i bath no one helped me dry my feet or put socks on, it hurt me so bad to try and bend over i had to moan and groan and cry while doing it, i had to change my own bed , they never changed my linen i had to call for sheets to change my own. my trash and linen bin was full. I complained to the nurses to everyone to the point they actually got a attitude with me because i was not letting their neglect slide. I was not getting my pressure meds when i was supposed to be getting them , they would skip a day at times. I praised this hospital to everyone, i was so happy to be at the hospital who took great care of my 1 year old son , i am so embarrassed to praise them and having to walk out in pain because i couldn’t take no more, i didn’t sign myself out i just called my fiancé and said i had enough, i was in tears in pain and they didn’t care all they wanted from me was the key that gets me on to other units smh never again. Nicu is alright with me ,

We are from Knoxville, TN and my wife had a stroke 2 years ago.  We came to Johns Hopkins last year for my wife to receive Non-Invasive Brain Stimulation (NIBS) from the Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R) center at Johns Hopkins.  The therapy worked well so we decided to come back this year.  Tomorrow is our last day of therapy.  We have been living in a hotel for the last three weeks.  Although it is very difficult to be away from home, our two visits to Johns Hopkins have been amazing!  First, I would like to recognize the ladies at the front desk when you check in.  They are always helpful and cheerful.  Millie, who does all the NIBS scheduling, is always there to help.  Next is Dr. Chao and Dr. Krasna.  They really care about my wife's condition and are always trying to help.  Last is the therapy staff.  They are amazing!! Daniel, Aara, Meredith, Nicole, Kristian, Erin, Leyna, Jacqueline, Megan, Elena and all the others who work in PM&R.  They are top notch!  Although it has been a difficult 2 years, Johns Hopkins will have a special place in our hearts.

Roland (Debbie's Husband)

don’t go here unless u want to wait hours for results on an xray. my friend has been admitted into the hospital after a fall which resulted in two broken fingers and every time there were any sort of update on the next steps, we would have to wait hours for a doctor to speak to us. we were admitted at 2ish in the morning, and it’s currently 8:44 am as i am writing this review.

Where to begin. From nurses and doctors having bad attitudes, being unfriendly, and telling you one thing then doing something completely different. Laziness.Nurses found it impossible to get medications on time or within a reasonable time. Not listening to my concerns. I was moved to 3 different rooms within the same unit. 2 rooms I did not have a bedside phone making food orders difficult as well as outside calls. One room was cockroach infested putting myself and my personal properties at risk. As well as the nurses refusing to enter my room due to fear of insects. Causing me to miss doses of medication all together or receiving medication as much as 1.5 hours late. I strongly recommend calling for medication early in attempt to receive it anywhere close to on time. Ask the cafe to read back your meal orders to have a better chance of accurately receiving what you ordered. I also strongly suggest taking notes including staff members names, detailed descriptions of interactions, and times and dates. I would not waste your time talking to senior patient experience representatives as they are rude and seem unbothered about patient concerns. While I was hospitalized I witnessed 3 separate patients leave against doctor's orders due to the disrespect and treatment from hospital staff. If possible do not come to john hopkins. Try Union Memorial or GBMC who both in my experience deserve a 5/5 for exceptionally friendly to patients. To be willing to listen and go above and beyond to make you comfortable and do there job properly. Also the hygiene and cleanliness of john hopkins is poor at best. Good luck to anyone who has no choice but to come to john hopkins bay view hospital.

A simple procedure felt like torture because they found it fit to have students operate on me without my consent. Don’t bother filing a complaint , they’ll make a ton of excuses and still send you a thousand dollar bill

This is a hostage service. My daughter has been stuck in this ER for 10 hours when it should have taken 1, disengaged drain from post surgery.  2 blood samples, two "triages".  I've observed other patients with much worse,  sitting in pain for 12 hours +.   It's been like this over a decade.  Wait indefinitely for merely adequate care or seek service elsewhere and risk exacerbated results.  And if that's not insulting enough,  the bill.  There are smaller less notable hospitals running circles HCJHH that clearly signify this place is broken, except to its stockholders.

If I could give a negative score, I would! I went here for 2 different surgeries and the first one they did something without my permission and the second one they caused a infection that could've been fatal! Think twice before coming here!

I had a procedure done that had to have samples sent to John Hopkins. I was told I would have results in 7-10 business days. I had an appointment with my doctor scheduled to go over these results. Well, my results did not come in 7-10 business days, so I had to cancel and reschedule my appointment with my provider so that I’d be able to discuss the results. I finally got a hold of the right department at John Hopkins after being given three different numbers. One person said it would take 14 days. So, I waited the 14 days and still no results. I called again and now they are saying it takes 4-5 weeks! Three different time frames given by the SAME department. I took days off work for my appointments with my provider that all were wasted due to not having results when I was told I would have them. Every staff member I spoke to at John Hopkins was short, rude, and hostile with me. This has been a huge disruption to my life and I am very disappointed by the lack of professionalism, the conflicting information, and inconsistency.

I had a wonderful experience, I was hospitalized for days and everyone was so nice and explaining everything so well. The nurses and doctors took very good care of me and made sure I was comfortable all the way through

My loved one is currently in the ER and has been there for over 28 hours without seeing a doctor orbeing admitted. I went to this hospital January 2,2025 and I was there with my mother for 8 hours in those 8 hours there were no results the doctor didn’t do a scan that should have been done and because they didn’t do it my mother the next day went to a different hospital and she went into an emergency surgery because turn out her appendix was about to explode and could have exploded inside of her if you hadn't gone to another hospital so this hospital isn’t that trust worthy
My grandson and I went and they kept him calm and they are very nice.
Avoid at all costs. Used to be one of the best in the nation. It has gone way downhill.

this hospital is beyond disgusting and disappointing, the women doing triage and blood work were the only respectful and quick ones. on top of that the emergency waiting room smells like a mix of urine and cigarettes. the security are all extremely rude and disrespectful except maybe one or two. there was patients in the waiting room saying they’ve been waiting 10-15 hours which is BEYOND me. this hospital needs a lot of work and new staff that actually seem
to enjoy their jobs and not make people more miserable and sick than they already are. extremely disappointed.

went in for heart attack symptoms. night shift nurse and doctor had to be called over during a cardiovascular episode where my hands and jaw both locked up completely and the doctor made eye contact with me and walked away, before sending me back out to the waiting room immediately after for 6 hours to wait for my results, instead of monitoring me. wasn't a particularly busy night in their own words, they just suck at their jobs.

After four long and frustrating months of trying to secure an appointment for my son with Hopkins, I am compelled to express my extreme disappointment with the process and lack of communication.

Today, after speaking with a Concierge leader, I was informed that all the labs, patient charts, and medical records I submitted need to be translated into English. Why was this not communicated from the beginning? This critical information should have been made clear at the start of the process, not after months of back-and-forth.

To make matters worse, I was told that even if I provide the translated documents, it will take another 10 days to review them, followed by a six-month wait for an appointment. This is absolutely unacceptable, especially considering that my son is in pain and urgently needs medical attention.

What part of “my son is in pain” is not understood? At no point has there been any consideration for the patient’s suffering or urgency of care.

This experience has left me deeply disheartened and questioning the commitment of your institution to patient care. I urge you to reflect on this process and prioritize the needs of patients, especially those in pain, rather than subjecting families to unnecessary delays and poor communication.

Worst ever!! They need to clean house and bring new staff this includes the phone operators also, nurses and doctors who truly cares about there patients. How do you have people waiting in the ER for over 24 hours waiting on beds!!
What about Hippocratic Oath?!A solemn promise that doctors make to uphold the highest standards of care and integrity while serving their patients! I guess that went out the window. I'm only given a 1 star because it wouldn't allow me to post.

If I could give -0 I would people just don’t go there you better off staying home and die because just waiting you going to die anyway 4 hours with eye problem can’t see out my eye and still waiting I just left the whole hospital and staff needs a makeover with caring staff and compassionate workers  and not just ones that’s there for the money.

They removed my review so I am reposting. Disgusted at how I was treated, they treat you with no kindness or compassion. I was suffering severely for over 10 years and they told me I was one of the worst cases they had ever seen, they don’t know the cause and recommended me a very controversial and experimental surgery to my brain which they said could result in deafness, death, or other complications. I had to figure out on my own that I was deficient in vitamin D, potassium and magnesium and learned how to manage my stress levels and I cured myself 100%. So grateful I didn’t listen to them. Because of my experience with Mayo, I no longer trust doctors or nurses. I have ptsd honestly from them and feel let down, and sad for all of the other people they treat this way.

WHAT AN ABSOLUTE WASTE OF MONEY. My lady is 22 with arthritis. She has tried several different meds which have not worked at all or caused severe side affects. On top of that they refuse to do anything for her pain. She is in college student teaching and has to deal with kids all day long and be active. The arthritis is in her knees. They have her a brace and said she needs an mri. Shocker she’s had multiple. And if he is sitting there bawling her eyes out don’t you think you would want to get someone in sooner? Or when she is already in crutches with a brace and she comes in maybe a Cortisone shot. But no. They care more about the money of seeing you multiple times and bleeding you dry over getting you taken care of. One to two visits turns into hundreds of thousands in the past few years because the “doctors” don’t give a care in the world they just collect the checks. This is why no one trusts the American health system. What a disappoint to a once great heath system.
The surgeons here saved my life and also made it possible to where I could have children some day. Forever Grateful

Went here about a year ago for numerous issues I was dealing with, there was Zero empathy as soon as they saw I had an anxiety diagnosis, they pushed me out as fast as they could and didn't help me whatsoever went to a small Hospital in my area instead apparently I was severely anemic and they were shocked they didn't have a cardiac situation because of it talk about incompetent.... truly embarrassing

I was being seen until Dec 2024 in the Women’s Health dept since 2000 for peri-menopause. They told me today I’m no longer going to be seen since they aren’t providing on-going care to me since “I’m fine now” and there are too many on the wait list. Wouldn’t refer me to anyone else on campus and told me to visit the Menopause Society website to find a Dr. in my area. My opinion of this place just did a complete 360 as they had no reason to dump me as a patient that still having issues. Even after pleading this… I was told to refer to the website. But let’s go back to seeing someone in my area that REFERRED ME TO THEM. So to Dr Kuhle and her team - BRAVO for being such “fantastic” people - I hope all those wait-listers feel you’re worth it.
Great experience there so far working with the doctors to deal with all of my health issues!

I’ve been going to Mayo Clinic since I was about 4 months old and I’m now 24 years old. They’ve been helping me treat and manage my congenital heart disease specifically called Tricuspid Atresia for all these years and the experience is absolutely incredible….understanding and accommodating…..however it’s quite big and there’s often tons of construction so you often have to rush especially if your hotel is not close by to make sure you’re not late for appointments. I’ve also had issues with my IV placed into me every so often, but it’s not a common issue….just here and there. Anyways for what I need I couldn’t ask for any better, they saved my life and I’m so grateful for the staff there who have helped me for over 2 decades.

I cannot say enough good things about my experience at Mayo Clinic. Every staff member, nurse, and physician I’ve interacted with truly cares about the patients - it’s something I’ve never experienced anywhere else. It’s by far the largest medical facility I’ve ever been treated at, yet it’s the place where I’ve experienced the most individualized care and personal attention. The place is huge and yet they do a great job providing resources and directions to make it an easy to understand process from start to finish.

I was advised by my HR manager at work to get a second opinion for a nodule found in my lung. The first provider wanted to rip out a portion of my lung. But the Mayo Clinic did more thorough examinations. Extraction was not necessary. I see why people around the World choose Mayo.
I will be suing don't think I'm going to let it slide

My son had a condition where his skull plates fused together too early. We decided to give Mayo Clinic a try and we met with a pediatric neurosurgeon Dr. Ahn. The very first visit I knew I could trust him! He had a slideshow he put together and explained everything very very well. He was very sweet and knowledgeable. The day of my son’s surgery he came to the pre op room and talked to us then asked if he could pray over us and the surgical team and we said of course! He walked over and put his hand in my son’s head and prayed! You don’t see that much anymore! This doctor is one amazing man! I would not trust my son with anyone else! And of course the surgery went great and he even got done before he told us it would be done! My son was in some pain that night which is expected! He got to come home the next day! The next day he woke up and was 100% himself! If your child has this condition I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Ahn!

Thank you Dr. Hegleson for saving my dads spine.  He’s been up to the clinic a handful of times for other unrelated things, and it seems to be the best option for him.  He has always wanted the best of the best, so that’s what he got.  I’m not sure if you read these reviews, but thank you for helping  my father.  It means a lot.  Rachel From Illinois.  💜

I went to Mayo clinic in La Crosse, Wisconsin and asked for a bee allergy test. They advised they would not test me. I had several prescriptions for epinephrine pens because of a diagnosed bee allergy that I asked to be tested for, but they would not test me. I found out years later, after paying for multiple epinephrine pens, that I did not have a bee allergy. I do not recommend Mayo Clinic.

The medical team at Mayo was caring, but my experience has been overshadowed by billing issues. I was charged $240 for part of a routine blood test without being told it wouldn’t be covered. Despite spending thousands to travel and stay in Rochester, the billing team has been relentless in chasing me. As a patient with complex needs, it’s exhausting to have to scrutinize billing codes just to avoid surprise charges. This has really soured what could have been a positive experience.

It is so big it's kinda confusing to know where to go.  But staff is so helpful in every aspect.  Very clean and organized.  After the first visit, not so bad to know where to go, park, etc.  road construction is terrible right now in the area , but can't really help that.  I can really see where the doctors truly are top notch, and whole staff really down to the greeters.  Even the local businesses are very supportive and most hotels will offer a shuttle ride to the front door if needed.  Amazing place!
A place of refuge and solace within the clinic.

Mayo Clinic and Dr. Shawki office has been a lifesaver for me! We’ve been nine months trying to heal what was caused by a regular G.I. doctor in Oklahoma City, performed needle injection going through my intestinal wall. Dr. Shawki is very confident, knowledgeable and patient. Jenna and his entire office has been nothing but 100% efficient and very helpful! I don’t think I would’ve been here. Had I not came to Mayo Clinic at the advice of another colorectal surgeon in Oklahoma City.

This place is amazing! Staff was professional, friendly, and very attentive to my needs. I was shocked that I got so many appointments so quickly with specialists and immediate test results on the portal with follow up calls. I highly recommend this facility!
Had a Horrible experuence with CRNA, Viqar Mohammed, he was very vulgar and disrespectful to me.

Such a wonderful clinic! Very loving and caring! They provide the best team and care for my mother. Amazing facility!! State of the art care & attention to detail. The ENT department; specifically Dr. Hamilton & his team, have been everything I could have asked for. They have been more than patient & understanding with my questions and concerns. I can’t say it enough 10/10 recommend!!

I've gone here around 30 times but my sister has to go here 4 times a year, she got her heart transplant here and I saw how kind and supportive the staff was. It’s really distasteful when im waiting in the CVICU 7B in Nasseff tower because of my mother’s heart failure and AFib, and I catch two of the nurses having sex in the shower bathroom next to WAITING ROOM. BAD LOOK MAYO!!!
Easy to find get in and personal are awesome
Best place in the world .

Many new practices at Mayo Clinic are terrible. Dehumanizing and automating everything. Sad
